top_10.name: The Coffee Berry SF
top_10.address: 1410 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very cute lil spot. I can't speak on the beverages, my goal was the pastries ($6.50) 🤭 but they use Sight Glass beans, so I'm sure the coffee is fantastic.

I did takeaway, the seating spots are minimal, most patrons were sitting outside.
I've been wanting to try the Ube croissant so I could compare it to Neighborhood Bakehouse. I am pleasantly surprised, the Ube is a winner. TCB gets the pastries fresh baked daily from Sunday Bakery. I'm pretty sure its the bakery that used to be located in Oakland, but the menu states the Bakery is in Sausalito  (which makes more sense considering TCB's location 🤷🏼‍♀️)
I wouldn't say their UBE croissant is comparable to Neighborhood Bakehouse, but it is very good. Not overly sweet and a good amount of filling.
I also sampled the almond croissant. Its a solid tasty option as well. Next visit I'll definitely try a savory treat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My wife and I have been coming here with our boy Jaxx since they opened so this review is long overdue. The coffee, the team, the hospitality is all off the charts. We always buy our beans from them and they always give our pup treats. We love you guys and will always be regulars!

Sincerely, Jaxx’s Parents

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’ve been stopping by The Coffee Berry SF while staying nearby in SF, and it’s quickly become my go-to. The coffee is excellent—rich, smooth, and consistently well made. The pastries and food options are just as good, fresh and not overly sweet. The staff are friendly and efficient, which makes the place feel welcoming without being over the top.

It’s also dog-friendly, which is a big plus if you’re out for a walk with your pup. I like that it feels like a neighborhood spot rather than a touristy one. After seeing it has hundreds of reviews with a perfect rating, I wasn’t sure what to expect—but the quality really does live up to it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Worthy of all the 5 stars. It is a small coffee shop right at the bottom of Lombard street. We really enjoyed our Nutella latte and lavender latte. The ube croissant was our favorite. The savory pull apart was ok. They have indoor seating for like 8 and a couple small tables outside.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I will honestly take another trip to San Francisco JUST so I can make it back to The Coffee Berry. The employees were kind and calm, even with a steady line all morning long. Their smiles were sincere and that makes a big difference from a guest perspective.

The FIKA buns were so so delicious. Thank you Coffee Berry for such a warm and lovely experience!

top_10.name: The Coffee Movement
top_10.address: 1737 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Here’s a polished and natural rewrite of your review:

---

A nice coffee shop in the Richmond District. It’s usually busy, and the space isn’t very large, though there is some seating available. What they’re best known for, as far as I know, is the tasting flight — three featured coffees of the day served either as different pours or prepared in different ways. They also offer several types of coffee beans.

There are three workers behind the counter preparing drinks, and they work very efficiently. Orders come out quickly.

We ordered the tasting flight, a cocoa cappuccino, a latte, and some pastries. I really enjoyed the tasting flight — it’s a unique way to sample three different coffees or brewing styles. It was a great experience. We usually stop by whenever we’re in the area. The prices are reasonable and affordable. I also really like their espresso machine. ☕
Parking is on the street and could be challenging near the shop.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The chai latte is well-spiced and creamy—easily one of the better ones around. Espresso drinks are good too, made with quality beans, and the espresso tonic is nicely balanced with lime/orange twist. Friendly spot with decent pastries and outdoor seating. Worth checking out. Close to golden gate park and de young museum.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Really excellent coffee experience here, especially if you enjoy specialty coffee. Far and away my favorite spot in SF.

Would recommend giving the coffee flight a shot if you’re interested in a little variety. Baristas are super friendly and knowledgeable about the rotating list of coffees.

As far as location, this spot on Balboa was my favorite. Give it a shot!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: TCM did not disappoint. The almond croissant has just enough jam in it. The service was streamlined with 3 people all doing different task in making the coffee to make the line move quickly. The space was minimalistic and have seats outside as well. Coffee was point in. Will come back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Coffee movement always has amazing service and iced lattes; I go to both locations in Richmond and Upper Nob Hill/Chinatown. Most recently I tried the vanilla spice latte, and at first I wasn’t too sure about it since I’m not a fan of ginger. But it wasn’t bitter or spiced at all, and almost tasted like cinnamon! One of my favorite coffee places for friendliness and reasonable pricing.

top_10.name: Third Wheel Coffee
top_10.address: 535 Scott St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wonderful coffee. Hidden but definitely worth the find. Warm and quick service. Coffee was the right temperature, smooth consistency, and beautiful flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Coffee bar that shares the same space as a sandwich shop. Stopped by here for brunch with my boyfriend and it was a delicious spot. They had matcha and coffee options (in addition to affogato). Both our lattes were incredibly smooth and tasty. We grabbed a chocolate mochi muffin as well as a ham and cheese croissant. There wasn’t any seating so we went to the park nearby to eat on the grass. You pay first before receiving your order on the right hand side of the counter. Highly recommend this spot for grabbing takeout caffeine in the morning.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: For our honeymoon, my wife and I road tripped down to California. On the way, we stopped at many coffee shops, in search of the perfect espresso. And here, at third wheel coffee, we found exactly that. I ordered a flat white, and thoroughly enjoyed it. My wife's vanilla latte was also amazing, and so was the pastry that we had. (We also ordered a matcha for the road which was quite good as well.) The shop is located in a cool urban San Francisco location. The barista was kind and friendly, as well as very knowledgeable. You can tell coffee is his passion! Would definitely recommend going out of your way for if you're in the San Francisco area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: New favorite coffee spot! The vanilla pine latte was divine, excited to try more seasonal drinks. Also, the baristas are super kind :-)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The best coffee shop we went to in San Fran by far! Their gingerbread lattes are so delicious!!! have all the warm spices and none of the overt sweetness. It’s like a Christmas in a cup. We went back there three days in a row. The staff are also very friendly and efficient!

top_10.name: Delah Coffee
top_10.address: 370 4th St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Delay Coffee is such a cozy and refreshing spot! Their pistachio latte is absolutely delicious — creamy, perfectly sweet, and full of real pistachio flavor. The tea is smooth and comforting, and they offer an amazing variety of snacks and desserts that taste as good as they look. Everything feels fresh and handmade.

It’s the perfect place to relax, grab a warm drink, and enjoy some treats. Highly recommended if you want something yummy and comforting!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It's always bustling with people and for good reason. This cozy, vibrant café has earned a loyal following thanks to its exceptional drinks and authentic Middle Eastern treats. It’s my go-to spot, especially for their 🌟pistachio latte ⭐️, which is rich, creamy and perfectly balanced with just the right amount of nutty flavor without being overly sweet . Trust me, one sip and you'll understand the hype.
They also have a variety of traditional Turkish desserts and savory pies that are delicious. And if you're a tea lover, don’t miss their Adeni chai - it's fragrant, spiced, and deeply satisfying. I recommend ordering it without sugar so you can sweeten it to your taste.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wonderful atmosphere, delicious, strong coffee, expertly created, lovely service... The staff is a riot 😂 they always make me laugh or have something to say.. especially the manager, I dont know her name but she always has such a great attitude and makes me feel better. I come in here all the time to order the Rose Latte, and work on some stuff on my laptop.. great to bring a friend

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was the only coffee place open early in the morning so I popped in based on its reviews.  I walked in and I was greeted with smiles.  I was unfamiliar with many of the pastries, and the young lady was happy to answer my questions as well as provide suggestions based on information I shared with her.  The Yemeni coffee and the Bee Bite Zataar were delicious.  The rose pomegranate honey bites were a treat meant to be enjoyed over time so I carried it with me to nibble on through the day.  There were so many items and lattes I wanted to try, but being on such a short trip I’ll walk away with this one pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve had Delah on my to-visit list for a while now, and I regret that I didn’t make it in sooner! Great atmosphere, amazing coffee, and helpful, friendly staff. The Turkish delight was incredible, as well. Hot tip: Have them put a little cardamom in the Turkish coffee. Sooo good!

top_10.name: The Coffee Movement
top_10.address: 1030 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visited The Coffee Movement yesterday. It’s a very small spot with no indoor seating or restroom—just an outdoor standing area and a small bench. I ordered an anericano which is roasted at Sint Frank Coffee as their house blend, and it was incredibly smooth and delicious. They offer oat milk only as non dairy option. The only downside was that I wish the coffee had been a bit hotter. That said, the staff were absolutely wonderful—so kind and welcoming. If I’m ever in the area again, I’d definitely stop by.

CC accepted

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The Coffee Movement in San Francisco is such a gem. The coffee is the perfect blend — not too sweet, not too bitter, just incredibly smooth. I got the ginger latte and it tasted amazing. They were also able to accommodate dietary restrictions and made mine with almond milk, which I really appreciated.

My partner got a cappuccino with a sprinkle of chocolate on top, and it was really nice as well. Cozy spot, great service, and genuinely delicious drinks. Highly recommend stopping by!also there not a lot of indoor seating spot so if you’re cold dress warm you seat outside

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The best cappuccino I’ve had in SF. Incredibly smooth with zero bitterness or harsh acidity. Super fragrant and well balanced. They use Straus barista milk, which micro-foams beautifully and adds a natural sweetness that really shines. The beans they use are excellent and clearly high quality.

Bonus points for the cable cars rolling by out front. Makes for genuinely epic photos while you sip.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The Coffee Movement in Chinatown is such a gem. It’s a tiny spot but the baristas make every drink with so much care, and you can really taste the difference. I tried their latte and it was smooth, rich, and beautifully balanced. The vibe is friendly and relaxed, with outdoor seating that makes it a nice place to hang out for a bit. It feels more like an experience than just grabbing a quick coffee. Definitely one of the best stops in SF for coffee lovers.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: ☕️♥️ There’s a coffee shop I always go to whenever I’m in San Francisco, but this time I stayed longer, so I tried Movement Coffee, which someone recommended to me! I decided to get their special latte, and it was so good! Even on a weekday morning, there was a line of people waiting. I also bought some coffee beans ☺️ I’ll definitely stop by again next time if I get the chance. I was so happy to find another great coffee spot,though it’s a bit of a shame there aren’t really any seats to sit and enjoy it.

top_10.name: Doppio Coffee & Brunch
top_10.address: 1551 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I visited Doppio Coffee & Brunch today and had a great experience. They offer delicious vegetarian breakfast options, and the coffee was excellent — they use Lavazza beans, which made the coffee really smooth and flavorful. The café was very clean, calm, and relaxing, with beautiful Turkish music playing in the background. It’s a perfect place for chatting and spending time with friends. The staff were also very friendly and welcoming.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: New favorite breakfast spot. The tomato mozzarella toast is hands-down one of the best I’ve ever had. Fresh, perfectly balanced, and so satisfying. Paired it with a matcha and it was the perfect start to the day. Highly recommend

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I've been here twice, their coffee is very good!
I ordered their egg&cheese crepe. The crepe had the perfect chewy texture you expect and had a lovely sprinkle fo fresh basil on top. However, the crepe was just warm when it came to the table (I was the only customer ordering food at the time).
I'd come back as it's a nice place with friendly staff, solid coffee and food in this neighborhood.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and professional. My friend got a Soma bagel, and he said it was delicious. I think the exterior sign needs to be redesigned.  The interior decor was modern and the layout was nice. Most importantly for me, the restroom was clean.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Doppio is a lovely brunch spot.  Well presented food at reasonable cost.  Great food options for kids including crepes.  A lot of seating.  Friendly and patient servers who waited for my kids to make up their mind. Highly recommended.

top_10.name: Haraz Coffee House
top_10.address: 1452 Franklin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Early January 2025 Authentic Yemeni cafe that serves up a delectable menu of regional Middle Eastern drinks and selective or fusion style pastries 🍰.

For the pastries sweetness levels are well managed while savory items are very limited in choice

Drin options particularly coffee ☕️ are numerous and varied with distinct aroma and taste. Special consideration also given to presentation.

Service is only via counter and self service tabling.

Cafe decor is also contemporary and a hybrid of modern Western styles mixed with slight Middle Eastern touches

The place is commonly frequented by remote workers and seating can get pretty limited

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I tried the Iced Mufawar and a samosa. I appreciate the unique items on the menu and the variety of pastries. The coffee was definitely stronger than I expected, so I would recommend sweetening it if you get it! The samosa was really good, too.

Plenty of space to work from the cafe or read.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love this place! Fantastic rich coffees in a swanky modern retail space. What a hidden gem. We ordered a Cortado and a latte. Both perfect with great flavor. And they got the milk just right for both drinks. And the staff are super friendly. I love locally owned and operated businesses. And coffee is my favorite vice!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Highlight, the workers behind the counter are patient and lovely 💞

I've tried most of the pastries/sweets. I wanted to love their take on the Dubai chocolate cake, but unfortunately since it sits in close proximity and in the same case as the items made with rose water, it's ruins the cake because it picks up the rose essence and you taste it 😔😫

The best item, im my opinion, is their baklava cheesecake. Its the star 😻 just get it, no doubt that you'll be happy you did.

Skip the beautiful pistachio croissant.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Staff are friendly.  Love the ambience. Perfect for socializing, relaxing, maybe working. We definitely enjoyed their Matcha Latte & Pistachio Latte. Their Mosaic Dubai was so delicious. Just the right amount of sweetness & very smooth.

top_10.name: Mellis Cafe
top_10.address: 154 Ellis St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Just had the best pastrami sandwich. After a very long day of travelling from Europe, this was heaven. All is fresly prepared. And also the pastries looked very tempting. Thank you, see you for coffee tomorrow ;-) kind regards from a Dutch flight attendant

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 6 months ago I tried a sandwich here, it was impossibly tasty. I live in an another place, so I couldn’t let go thoughts about the sandwich. Finally after all this time I’ve came back specifically to eat it again and again it was fabulous! Also the owner is so welcome and everyone is co nice! Strongly recommend!!! ❤️❤️❤️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Bagel sandwiches and coffee were good. Tons of pastry items and fresh fruits. Some convenience type stuff for sale. Nice little spot.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Was staying at the Hilton and noticed this place down the street amd stopped for breakfast to go. Love the options for bagels and got a cheese bagel with bacon, egg, and cheese. Still hot when I got back to the hotel and was delicious!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Mellis Cafe is a cozy gem tucked into the busy streets of SF with a few nicely laid tables to sit and enjoy your food. I had a latte and an almond croissant, both tasted great. The place offers fresh quality items perfect for a quick and satisfying stop.

testimonials: Just had the best pastrami sandwich. After a very long day of travelling from Europe, this was heaven. All is fresly prepared. And also the pastries looked very tempting. Thank you, see you for coffee tomorrow ;-) kind regards from a Dutch flight attendant

top_10.name: Four Barrel Coffee
top_10.address: 375 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I went here on a Friday morning. The place was busy and packed. The coffeeshop is spacious. There were ppl talking or people on their laptops.

They only serve coffee, meaning no specialty flavored drinks. My friend ordered our drinks while I saved our seats. The service seems great and the place is pretty big. You can see the staff roasting the beans in the back. My latte was good. I ordered oat milk but it tasted like either 1% milk or non fat milk. Luckily, I wasn’t allergic to dairy so I didn’t bother to bring it up to the staff. Also, I normally get flavored drinks but the latte was good. I would go back

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have been coming here for years and I love it! Favorite coffee cafe in SF for atmosphere and awesome coffee. Baked goods really good too especially the sweet scones when they have them… they go fast!!! If you live coffee cafes you’ll love Four Barrel. Grateful the owners founded and run this awesome SF institution which most often open on holidays too 🙏🙏

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had some tasty lattes here. They have good seasonal flavors during the fall months. I really enjoyed their coffee cups for dine in drinks.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Amazing coffee!! Had an oat milk cappuccino and it was very yummy and flavorful. The shop smells so good as there is a guy roasting beans in the back
When I went in there were no baked vegan goodies. Would request management to look into this.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best third wave coffees in the Bay Area, a consistent excellent medium roast espresso, as well as an interesting selection of pastries. The space is industrial chic, with the roasting machines in the back of the space. Not too busy in the early morning

Had some tasty lattes here. They have good seasonal flavors during the fall months. I really enjoyed their coffee cups for dine in drinks.

top_10.name: Saint Frank Coffee
top_10.address: 2340 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I luckily walked in at a time where there was no wait and empty tables, so yay for me. Ordered a pour over and an iced white, and both were lovely. My iced coffee was particularly satisfying, and they made it with non-dairy milk which was a win for me. The almond croissant was great, tasty filling and nice crispy edges. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came to try their coffee flight as per a friend’s recommendation and found it a tad underwhelming? Possibly just personal preference as they leaned quite sour/acidic. Overall still a great experience and service was friendly!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This review is for the subscription coffee service! I have been lucky enough to be the proud owner of an espresso machine. Saint Frank beans are truly the best anywhere. Every morning I pull an amazing shot of espresso and it's just so heavenly and delightful. The craftsmanship that goes into this coffee is wonderful. Don't hesitate to try their subscription service--truly incredible the value that Saint Frank offers for these exquisite blends!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Tried the competition cappuccino—probably the best espresso I’ve ever had. The overall sensory experience was incredible, from the coffee aroma to the vibe of the space. Definitely a spot I’d come back to.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
May 2025 Specialty craft coffee chain with a minamalist style layout.

Have tried their coffee in various other cities in CA and parts of SFO.   Coffee and brewing is very consistent.  Most beans are of Southern American single origin.  We often purchase beans here for personal consumption.

Layout is sparse and often for single or double diners.  Expect lots of remote workers on this branch and few indoor seats available.

A toilet is available.

top_10.name: Gusto Pinsa Romana
top_10.address: 1000 Bush St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic food! We were really struck by the quality of the ingredients. The crust was thick, yet light and crispy. The sauces and toppings were delicious and tasted so fresh. Lots of unique choices on the menu. The service was great as well. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Gusto Pinsa Romana in San Francisco is a hidden gem! Their pinsas are absolute perfection - the crust is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, with fresh ingredients and bold flavors. I went with the PATATA E SALCICCIAand it was 🔥! and my partner had the PROSCIUTTO E FICHI.

The cappuccino is one of the best I've had in the city, with a perfect balance of espresso and foam. And the cannoli dessert? OMG, the shell was crunchy and the ricotta filling was creamy and sweet - a match made in heaven 😋.

But what really makes Gusto stand out is the staff - they're super friendly, attentive. They'll make you feel like you're part of the family.

The restaurant is small and intimate with a relaxed atmosphere perfect for a casual dinner or take out.

If you're in San Francisco, Gusto Pinsa Romana is a must-visit spot. Trust me, you won't be disappointed! 5/5 stars.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Yummy vegan pizza made with REAL ingredients! The crust/bread is perfectly crunchy and soft. The flavor isn’t overwhelming, you can get a taste of every fresh ingredient. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a wonderful place! A small pizzeria with a very beautiful interior. Everything is spotless, and the staff are super friendly and welcoming. The pizza is amazing , the crust is perfect and the toppings are so flavorful. Definitely a spot I’ll be coming back to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great vegan pizza options and great atmosphere and service.  We always love their crust so much that we like to come here whenever we're in this part of town.

top_10.name: Golden Boy Pizza
top_10.address: 542 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really good to-go pizza! The flavors are minimalist but nevertheless very-very tasty. My favorites are pepperoni and clam&garlic. Love how fast they work on orders. So even if you get to wait it won’t be more than 10 minutes. And the second best thing about this one is - you got to enjoy it at the Washington park 💚

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The pizza here is amazing. I tried the pepperoni slice and it was genuinely delicious with a very authentic flavor. Even late at night the queue was surprisingly long, which says a lot about how popular the place is.

It’s just a small takeaway counter, so don’t expect a premium atmosphere, more of a classic, local vibe. During peak hours you’ll need to wait in line, and once you reach the front you place your order, pay, and give your name. After that there’s a short wait until they call you, and then you get your pizza.

Overall, great taste and totally worth the wait if you’re craving a quality slice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: That long line is so worth it. Reasonably priced. The clam and garlic pizza is incredibly flavourful. A combination I’ve never had before and I’ve been missing out. Hot and fresh. Delicious soft crust. Gooey cheese. Garlicky goodness

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Pretty good pizza a lil out of your ordinary flavors but for what it is really tasty and fresh.
Had a line but surprisingly moved pretty fast.
Had the clam and garlic didn't really taste clams.
Next time I'll try to others.
Was actually surprised on the price too.
Hot and hit the spot perfectly.
Super friendly service too.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’m not a huge fan of pizza, but this place was okay. The bread was thick and had a nice texture. We ordered the garlic pizza and the mushroom pizza with meat — both were decent. Not something I’d normally go out of my way for, but it was an overall fine experience.

top_10.name: Piccolo Forno
top_10.address: 725 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
After our trip to Alcatraz and an afternoon of shopping at the Wharf, we worked up quite an appetite and decided to try Piccolo Forno. The restaurant is small and cozy, and as many have mentioned, there was a bit of a wait since we arrived later in the evening, but we didn’t mind at all. The incredible aromas coming from the kitchen made it worth it.

Our table ordered a great variety of dishes including pizza col salame, lasagna classica, ravioli di zucca, pappardelle al ragù, and ravioli di aragosta. For dessert, my friend enjoyed the cannolo siciliano. Overall, the food was delicious, comforting, and clearly made with care.

Service was friendly overall. There was a small hiccup when I was initially served the wrong dish. When I mentioned it, there was some confusion as I was told it was what I had ordered. However, my group did hear my order, and as a vegetarian, the dish I received wasn’t something I could eat. That said, this didn’t negatively affect our experience. The rest of the staff were very accommodating, and the owner handled the situation
wonderfully, which we truly appreciated.

I don’t enjoy confrontation and never want to make an issue, but I felt the way the situation was resolved spoke volumes about their professionalism and care for guests. We left full, happy, and satisfied and would absolutely return.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was lucky to grab an outside table before the lunch rush fully hit. The restaurant quickly got busy but felt I still received good service. Food was delicious and staff was responsive. Would definitely stop by again when I’m in SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This restaurant instantly became one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is just like you’re somewhere in Italy. These guys serve you with the real Italian passion and the last but not least you MUST try their Tiramisu, it’s from a different planet!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place was fantastic. When there are so many solid options for Italian in this area, piccolo doesn’t disappoint.
My wife has a pine nut allergy and they were confident in making sure she didn’t get cross contamination.
We got pepperoni pizza, dough is amazing. Pizza sauce is top notch. Lasagna was so good. The bolognese was what dreams are made of.
Food was excellent service equally matched. Will totally visit again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place was such a delight. The service was amazing and everyone was so friendly and made us feel right at home. The Cesar salad was divine. We also got the mushroom and sausage pizza and it was soooo good! Highly recommend stopping by!

top_10.name: Outta Sight Pizza
top_10.address: 422 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: For a super cheap pizza, this place is pleasantly surprising - they have daily specials and unexpected add ons like anchovies or stracciatella. I tried the ruby (their vodka sauce) and a Vinny's special (onions, chives and creme fraiche). Both were ok in flavor (especially considering the price). I was a little concerned that a dog was allowed to sit at one of the tables, didn't feel very sanitary...

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great thin-crust slices and super clean spot. Tried the Ruby and Vinny’s Special — both tasty. The staff is very sweet! A bit pricey at ~$6 a slice, but I’m also spoiled by old NY $2 slice days 😅 Worth a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: On sight, my dream pizza. But the flavor is lacking a bit. I’ve tried the Madonna and Garlic White pies. The crust and weight of the pizza is great and it’s cooked perfectly. But I’ve been underwhelmed by the flavor both times. Willing to give them another try because this has the makings of being one of my favorite pizza spots.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was passing by this place and someone walking out had a pizza slice that caught my eye. Having just visited Chicago, I was craving for a thick slice like the Lunch Lady pizza brick. It’s not a triangle. It’s like a block so I don’t consider it a slice. At first sight, I thought maybe it’s going to be a little too doughy? After one bite, the flavors of the topping and the crunch of the crust were so satisfying. The shaved cheese gave it a nice finish. Will need to come back to try other pizzas next time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recently visited Outta Sight Pizza in San Francisco, and it truly lives up to the hype. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by the smell of fresh pizza and a visually striking interior. The experience was overwhelmingly positive, combining delicious food, quality ingredients, and a funky artistic decor that made the visit memorable. Yes, the price tag was a bit high (around $60 for our meal), but I left feeling it was absolutely worth it for the quality and overall experience. Here’s a breakdown of my visit:
- Pepperoni Pizza (Slice): Incredibly delicious, with a perfect thin crust that had a nice crunch on the outside and a chewy center. The pepperoni was savory and crispy around the edges, and you could taste the quality of the ingredients – from the tangy tomato sauce to the gooey, rich cheese. Each bite was bursting with flavor, and the slice was generous in size.
- Meatball Sub: A hearty sandwich overflowing with tender, flavorful meatballs and melted cheese. The bread was toasted just right – crunchy on the outside but soft inside, soaking up the savory marinara sauce. It’s the kind of comfort food that hits the spot; rich in flavor and clearly made with love and good ingredients.
Both items were freshly made to order and served hot. We could immediately tell the difference that quality ingredients make – nothing tasted processed or bland. For example, the tomato sauce on the pizza and sub had a homemade taste with herbs and natural sweetness, and the meats were lean and well-seasoned.

I was a little concerned that a dog was allowed to sit at one of the tables, didn't feel very sanitary...

top_10.name: Pizzetta 211
top_10.address: 211 23rd Ave, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was a really very good place. The pizzettas were fresh and made with high quality ingredients. We tried the hazelnut pizza and it was very delicious and interesting. They also offer homemade sausages, and the salads were creative and something different. The service was great. The place itself is quite tiny and small, but cozy.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Pizetta 21 is one of those neighborhood spots that instantly makes you feel like you’ve stumbled onto something special. The space is cozy with limited inside and outside seating, and the staff strikes that perfect balance of friendly, attentive, and genuinely welcoming.

The star, of course, is the pizza. The crust has that ideal mix of crisp edges and a soft, chewy center, and the toppings taste incredibly fresh—thoughtfully paired rather than just piled on. You can tell there’s real care behind every combination.

It’s the kind of place where you can come for a casual dinner, a date night, or a quick bite and walk out feeling like you got something memorable.

If you’re anywhere nearby, Pizetta 21 is absolutely worth the stop. A small spot with big heart and even bigger flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I can't hate this place. This is where my girlfriend and I had our first date two years ago. The pizza hits the spot and the ambiance in the small restaurant is so cozy. With just 6 tables, this small joint has a rotating menu with unique pizzas that will surprise you and keep you wanting more. Pro Tip: bring loved ones 9/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place definitely moves at its own pace, for better or worse. When we arrived, the host spent a couple of minutes finishing a personal conversation before acknowledging us, which felt unprofessional and set the wrong tone from the start. Service throughout the meal was very slow. Our party of four waited a long time for food, and the pizzas didn’t come out together. By the time mine finally arrived, my friends had already finished eating, so I ended up taking most of it to go.

Our server did seem attentive, and the food itself was decent, good, but not great. My pizza had quite a bit of yellowing arugula (see pic) that I had to pick through. If I were to try this place again, it would be strictly for takeout. Also worth noting: there’s a 4.5% flat fee added for employee health.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The service was amazing, rhe server is soo nice and attentive. The pizza was good, crispy thin crust, sauce had a soft taste pretty good, the ingredients were really fresh and tasty!

top_10.name: 'Napizza
top_10.address: 3258 Scott St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best napolitan style pizza in the entire city! We had a phenomenal experience overall, and really felt like in Italy. We ordered a bufalina and a salsiccia: the dough was just very soft, flavorful and slightly crounchy, the toppings were very authentic, and the olive oil was great. They also served us an outstanding tiramisù - the best tiramisù we had in the city. The waiter was also very nice, and the place is very quiet. Couldn't recommend it enough!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had an incredible experience here! The uplifting atmosphere and little details, like the beautiful ceramic plates, really add to the charm.

The food speaks for itself. You can tell they use top-quality, authentic ingredients and put real care into every dish. Everything we ordered was delicious, and it made me want to come back just to keep exploring the menu. If I lived in San Francisco, this would easily be one of my regular spots.

Prices are very fair for the quality you're getting, and it's absolutely worth it. If you love Italian food-or even if you're just visiting San Francisco-this is a must-visit. Don't hold back on trying a variety of dishes, you won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My absolute favorite pizza spot in SF. We come here atleast once a week😂😂. The pizza is really the best, authentic Italian dough and recipe. We usually have the Calzone, but open. We also love the salted caramel ice cream. The service is also always very fast. The pasta is also great and all the meals we had here were amazing. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Really good dough!
Very good Norma and Margherita.
Lovely atmosphere and very lively experience.
Sat at the comptoir, lively.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The pizza capricciosa was tasty and comes from a massive pizza oven. Bits of the crust were burned but this is normal, also in Italy. I can tell. The dough in the middle was a bit too thin for me. At some places almost not existing. Some of the toppings seemed to come from cans. The half boiled egg was just added later and not part of the oven cooking. The trofie with ragu which my wife had, was nice too. Our kids had two kids pizzas with cheese and Micky mouse ears, and like it. Also the fries were thin and crunchy. The vibe inside is chic, a bit hasty and many questions ‘how is the food?’. We were here on a Friday evening when it was full, so a bit noisy which is understandable. The prices were high, but common in SF nowadays.

top_10.name: Il Casaro Pizzeria
top_10.address: 348 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Girl math is Friday Night + North Beach = Pizza.  There's no better equation.

My friends and I had gone to see our friend and her band perform earlier in the evening.  Afterwards, we headed to Il Casaro for pizza.  After two sweet drinks, I was craving something spicy.  So I got the Diavola, which came with a spicy salami, Calabrian chili, and a spicy oil.  And it satisfied my craving!  It was spicy, but not so much where it masked all the flavors of the pizza.  The crust was nicely doughy with a good char from the oven.

I also got to try my friend's prosciutto pizza and that was also delicious.  It was perfectly salty and the bitterness from the arugula balanced it.

Service was great!  We got seated right away and our food came out quickly.  Since it was Friday night, the vibes inside were lively, but not so loud where you couldn't have a conversation at your table.

I'll need to come back to try the items under the Mozzarella Bar menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The pizza here was good — not amazing, but definitely enjoyable. To be fair, I’m from Berlin where there are a lot of excellent pizza places, so my standards might be a bit high. Compared to what I’m used to, this wasn’t better, but it was still a solid choice if you’re in the area and craving Italian food.

I had the Montepulciano wine, which was very good. I sat outside, and they had heaters, so it was comfortable even in cooler weather. The staff was very friendly as well.

Overall, a solid option for a casual Italian meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is one of my go-to spots in San Francisco. I’ve probably been here 20 times or more. There’s so much good pizza in North Beach, but this one really feels authentic. I usually get their marinara though their pasta is also excellent. I especially love the pesto pasta. The restaurant has cute outdoor seating, and while they don’t take reservations, I usually find a spot easily. It’s perfect for big groups or a romantic date night. For me, this is a reliable, safe bet that’s always a great experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: What a great place. Plenty of options for my vegetarian friend. She had the Margherita pizza and a salad. I had some of both. Salad was great. Pizza was fine, but I am not a fan of that type of pizza.  My friend liked it. I had one of there lasagna dishes. It was very good. Definitely want to go back and try more dishes.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We ate here on 11/8, we were looking for an authentic Italian meal in sf and stumbled upon this amazing restaurant! We ordered the classics: pizza margherita, pasta, salad and red wine. Everything was delicious and the service was great, I would highly recommend this place to any tourist passing by 👌🏻

top_10.name: Tony's Pizza Napoletana
top_10.address: 1570 Stockton St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: When I say this was the best Margherita ive ever had. I'm not even exaggerating.  The sauce was so delicious.  We had to try the royal Margherita as well. It came with a fresh basil plant and oil to put on. It's not as big as the Margherita but packs a punch. We can't wait to come back to the bay and eat here again. I highly recommend this place. Service was good even though busy. Prices were reasonable as well. Especially when its so delicious.  Thank you for such a great meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Man, I miss SF. The best city in the world. Walking through North Beach brought back so many memories and is even more magical that what I remember. A lot of San Francisco's charm is the array of restaurants and the neighborhoods they are in.

Just look at the picture...

Tony's pizza does not need my review, obviously. They have a firmly planted existence here and they are wholeheartedly deserving of all the praise and stellar reviews on their legendary pizza.

My review is for all the professional servers. They were very attentive and efficient. Casual observation showed they all worked together seamlessly and enmeshed into the vibe of this buzzing room belonging to the most pleasing pizza.

Much props to the Tony's team for an excellent experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The pizza here is delicious! There’s a huge variety to choose from, so everyone can find something they like. The calamari was one of the best we’ve ever had—crispy and full of flavor.

The restaurant has both indoor and outdoor seating, and the outdoor area is nicely heated. It’s a bit pricey, and parking was hard to find, but the food made it worth it. We visited on a Sunday afternoon, put our name in on Yelp, and the estimated wait time was about 35 minutes.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: North Beach/Little Italy 🇮🇹 wow, what a neighborhood. Tony's Pizza Napoletana, thank you for the great experience and the great food. What a dinner. Quail Eggs and Speck pizza did not disappoint (see photo #3!) The whole vibe of the restaurant was electric. I'd love to return for another visit next time I am in town.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Clearly what separates this establishment from other phenomenal pizza spots throughout the country is the way they nail such a variety of different pizza styles. Their Napoletana Margherita was phenomenal! It was fresh and simple (for crispy crust lovers be aware of it's "floppy crust") Their American classic pepperoni is a great counter balance if you want to try but crave that crunchy bite.

top_10.name: Montesacro SoMa
top_10.address: 510 Stevenson St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious pizza with a special recipe dough.  It's just a little bit different, but not blatantly obviously so.  Regardless it's delicious!  Great friendly knowledgeable service.  Wildly interesting eclectic decor, especially the washroom.  The neighbourhood is a little more gritty but not dangerous by my accounts, and there are neighbourhood ambassadors around as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We absolutely loved dining here! The pesto and the eggplant with red pepper pinsas were outstanding, and the cauliflower salad appetizer was bursting with flavor. The atmosphere has a charming vintage feel that makes the place so inviting, and the staff’s kindness made the experience even better. Can’t wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Super tasty Roman-style pizza (with a great selection of antipasti too) served in a cozy, gorgeous space. I stopped by Montesacro SoMa with a friend for a weekend dinner after receiving multiple recommendations for this spot from several coworkers / friends. I got there a few minutes early, so I was immediately struck by how cozy and intimate the store felt; the staff seemed relaxed but on top of their game, and I loved that you could somewhat (but not quite...to preserve the mystery of it all) see the kitchen work their magic with a partially visible container of prepared dough, slightly exposed assembly counter. I love the walls of wine bottles, random chandeliers, and deli counter -- it genuinely felt like I was back in Rome.

For food, we started with the Sottoli, a plate of beautifully EVOO-marinated vegetables (red bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, and eggplant), topped with a bit of chili and parsley. I loved the simplicity of this antipasti; the veggies were super flavorful and delicious. It's a great vegetarian or gluten-free choice, but you can also get an order of their bread if you'd like to bulk up this appetizer. The veggies were delicious on their own, but also went wonderfully with the main star of the show, the pizza. We got their margherita just so we could compare this classic vs. other pizza joints, and they certainly did not disappoint. The tomato sauce was flavorful, with just the right mix of herbaceous, savory, acidic, and sweet, and the pizza was topped with a generous portion of melty mozzarella and basil. I love that they fully lean into the Roman-ness of their restaurant by serving the more ovular pinsa, with a slightly thicker, chewier crust and highlighting local Roman ingredients. Now that I've confirmed their margherita pizza (or, rather, pinsa) is 10/10, I can't wait to go back and try their other options!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow! I've often walked past this place and seen people eating at the sidewalk tables. A friend suggested we have lunch there today and what a surprise! The pizza special was delicious. It's a cool spot, almost feels like you're in Italy. And the service is exceptional -- as good as you'll get in any restaurant. I look forward to going back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
After countless neighbors sang Montesacro’s praises, my partner and I arrived with sky‑high expectations. Sadly, the evening never climbed beyond middling, and a few missteps sent it tumbling well below average.

What we ordered

Porchetta 4 / 5	Nicely seasoned, juicy, good crackling—easily the best bite of the night.

Pinsa “Grottaferrata”	2 / 5	Arrived lukewarm and dripping oil; toppings felt flat.

Pinsa “Ponte Mammolo”	2 / 5	Same temperature and grease issues. Olive‑oil flavor absent, crust lacked the airy lightness pinsa is known for.

Strawberry Tiramisu (off‑menu “special”)	2 / 5	No espresso‑soaked ladyfingers, just strawberry cream with chocolate chips. Portion: one small square. Price: $20—hard to view as anything but a gouge.

(We both felt queasy after dinner.)

Service & Hygiene

Our server was friendly but repeatedly wiped tables with a bare hand, then handled plates and the POS screen without washing. That alone took the shine off the evening.

Most desserts fall between $6‑15, so the surprise $20 tiramisu stung. The pinsas, though generously sized, didn’t justify their mid‑$20s price tags given the execution.

Pro tip: Skip Stevenson Street between 5th & 6th on foot; the alley’s smell and hazards can sour an already mediocre evening.

Overall rating: ★★☆☆☆ (2 / 5)

top_10.name: Piccolo Italia
top_10.address: 799 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
HALAL rest
Ambiance - Low
Price - Low
Working hours - Open late night, solid to have late night snack
Staff - Mr. Mukhtar (owner) is very welcoming and humble person. Every staff is very kind and sweet.
Service - Excellent

Food:
Chicken pizza - fair
Meat pizza - excellent 😍

Highly recommend - to have halal pizza & late night options in the city.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The pizza at this location is, frankly, underwhelming, especially if you’ve experienced higher-quality pizza elsewhere. A single slice ranges around $6.40, depending on the variety, but the quality doesn’t justify the price. This is the type of pizza one might reach for late at night, perhaps after a night out, when taste isn’t a primary concern.

When fully sober, the pizza’s flavor reveals an unpleasant chemical undertone that’s difficult to overlook. It’s simply not enjoyable for those seeking a satisfying, well-crafted slice.

For a genuinely better experience, I recommend Out of Sight Pizza, just a block or two away. Their pizza is more affordable, higher quality, served with excellent customer service, and enjoyed in a clean, welcoming atmosphere. That said, this location serves as a convenient option for late-night cravings when other choices are limited.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We really loved this pizza place because the pizza was delicious and so was the dough. It was hot and very fresh and you could tell that it was homemade. I highly recommend this amazing pizza.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great late-night spot! I was really hungry, and the staff went out of their way to help — they started preparing my pizza while I was on the way, so it was ready when I arrived.

I requested less cheese, and they delivered exactly that. The pesto base was flavorful, and the pizza was loaded with veggie toppings. It seriously slapped.

If you’re looking for a solid late-night pizza place, this is it. Might be worth a visit during the day too!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Fantastic late-night find! I was starving, and the staff went above and beyond—they started making my pizza before I even got there, so it was ready right when I arrived.

I asked for less cheese, and they nailed it. The pesto base was super flavorful, and the pizza was piled high with fresh veggie toppings. Absolutely hit the spot.

If you’re searching for a reliable late-night pizza spot, this is the one. I might have to come back during the day too!

Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5

Recommended dishes: Pesto Veggie Pizza
Noise level: Quiet, easy to chat
Vegetarian options: Dedicated vegetarian menu/section

top_10.name: Mo's Grill
top_10.address: 1322 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had to wait a bit to get seated but it was worth it. Lucky enough to sit at the small counter instead of a table which gave us a great view of the kitchen activity. Burgers were delicious. We had the Aussie burger and the cheeseburger. Come with an appetite as the burgers are big and the fries are great.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Every time we come here, we feel completely satisfied!
My husband and I are always craving a really good burger and fries, but nowhere else has ever truly satisfied that craving—until we started coming here. Every dish is unbelievably delicious!

On top of that, the service is always so friendly. Our server recommended the apple pie milkshake and oh my goodness—it was out of this world! So, so good.

Highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 10/10 both on food and service. The waitress helped us with our choices, as everything looked so good! The amount of food you get is incredible, and everything was so fresh. Best burger we've ever had hands down.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We are visiting from Canada and wanted to enjoy a traditional American diner for breakfast so headed to Mo's this morning. We found a great little place serving lots of options.

I had two scrambled eggs with tomatoes and scallions. It came with fried potatoes and toast. Really huge portion! Potatoes were especially good and perfectly cooked.

Service was phenomenal. Very frequent coffee top-ups.

Thank you for being exactly what we were looking for.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Like they say, it tells a lot about a restaurant if they have an open kitchen. They do!! Not a very big place so you might have to wait. Loved the mushroom burger. The grilled chicken burger could be better as the grilled chicken patty felt dry. The French fries tasted extra crispy 👌🏼Would recommend giving a shot.

top_10.name: Beep's Burgers
top_10.address: 1051 Ocean Ave, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First time to be in the area so we had to try the famous beeps burgers. Super delicious! Burgers were made fresh and even just by looking at it you know that you and your burger will have a good time. Definitely worth the detour. Nothing negative. Just expect its a take out diner.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is good,  but the quality can change any given day.  I swear I have never had the same burger twice.  This last one being the worst.  Still try it out,  but if you prefer another place.... maybe go there.  Burger wasn't as juicy as the past.  Fries were fine,  shake was good

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This spot is an old school diner with hormone free burger meat and free range fried chicken patties. They also have fish and chips, and breakfast options! You can choose three sizes of patties for the burger. Everything is pretty good; fries could be better. Order at the counter, or order ahead of time for pick up: there are two separate windows; order at the left window and pick up at the right window. Quick and easy. At corner of Lee and Ocean

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I love going to Beep’s Burgers. I came here after going to Twin Peaks and last time I came here is when I was with my friend a few years ago. My friend recommended it and said that it’s good here. It doesn’t have an indoor area, but does have a counter seating where you can dine in.

My friend is right. The burgers here are really good and it’s one of the popular burger joints in SF. Not sure what type of beef is it, but they probably used one of the best ones here. I don’t recall having a shake here on my first visit, but could imagine that it’s good since my friend had one. I may want to come back here again for that.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We tried the half-pound burger with American cheese and lettuce, along with the 6-piece nuggets. The nuggets, unfortunately, were a bit of a letdown as the meat inside felt sparse and lacked that satisfying bite you’d expect. However, the burger completely made up for it. The patty was thick, juicy, and bursting with flavor and was perfectly seasoned and cooked just right so it stayed tender without being greasy. The melted American cheese added that creamy, salty richness that tied everything together, while the crisp lettuce gave a nice refreshing crunch. Each bite felt hearty and well-balanced. For the price point, it’s honestly one of the best burgers we’ve come across. Generous portions, great quality, and a taste that leaves you wanting another bite. We’ll definitely be coming back for more.

top_10.name: Pearl's Deluxe Burgers
top_10.address: 708 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Was very hungry after a +50k steps day around SF and craving for a proper large burger not too far from my hotel.
Lucky me, Pearl’s was just around the corner and following some online reviews I went for the Deluxe Bula Burger with extra mushroom and Kobe meat as replacement (buffalo not being available unfortunately) with a side of a mix French fries and onion rings.
Said sides were absolutely perfect, best French fries I had for quite a moment and onion rings crispy without being too dry.
Burger was massive and really comforting. Not the the absolute best I have ever had but very decent with a meat cooked to my desire (real “rare”).
Atmosphere was low key and very quiet, with fellow European travelers from Italy and France dining there too.
All in all a great no-frills comforting experience after a long and busy day with the best possible food to indulge in.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My Prized Pearl burger was cooked to perfection but was disappointed with the lack of flavor of the burger. Not seasoned whatsoever which left me tasting the overbearing blue cheese. The garlic fries were good and my peanut butter milkshake was delicious. Presentation was good and the service was great but lacks the space for seating comfortably.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: During my search for a quality burger establishment, I encountered this location.  While the cleanliness was commendable and the seating limited, the burger surprisingly lacked flavor, despite its preparation. The chili hot dog more closely resembled a chili plate with a hot dog included.  However, the accompanying fries and onion rings were excellent.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Went here for dinner while in town. I tried the mini burger and a mixed basket of sweet potato fries and onion rings. Overall I felt like the food was just ok. The burger seemed a bit undercooked and lacked flavor. The sweet potato fries were pretty good, probably the best part. The onion rings weren’t good. They lacked substance and flavor.

The restaurant is a small shop. Locally run. Overall it was clean but could use a refresh. Kinda had that old person house smell.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The ambiance at this place was warm and inviting, and the staff was exceptionally kind! The burger was larger than I anticipated, but it was delicious with a juicy and rich flavor that I thoroughly enjoyed. I highly recommend it! The fries were also outstanding - I couldn't get enough of them. Thank you for a wonderful experience:D

top_10.name: Sixth Street Burger
top_10.address: 235 E Santa Clara St #112, San Jose, CA 95113, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was on my list for sometime , finally tried their 1/2 pound Jalapeno Wagyu Double smash Burger with Fried Egg with Fries. It was exceptional. Very fresh and delicious meat. Bun was also not super thick. Jalapeno takes flavor to next level. I took all the sauces with Fries. Chiptole Ranch and Spicy sauce were good. Must try if are around.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: In my opinion this is the spot for a perfect smash Wagyu burger! Juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection, you can taste the quality in every bite. The prices are surprisingly reasonable for such premium beef, making it a great value and an absolute must-try for burger lovers.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I've got recommended this place by a coworker and decided to try it out. First, the presentation is neat and clean, services are friendly, place are bright and tidy. Next, i got the double smash ans nothing is special about it besides the “wagyu” meat, the jalapenos burger is better a little bit as more sauce and spicy taste. Next, the onion rings feel like it sit in the fryer longer than normal as the color isn’t bright and one of it looks like it almost burn, tastes so-so too. I would give credit for the mango lemonade, it is solid, balance.

Will I come back? No unless they improve on their stuffs.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Craving a good burger led me to @6thstreetburger in Downtown San Jose 🍔🔥 The double cheeseburger was juicy and packed with flavor, and those crispy, seasoned fries hit the spot. I washed food down with a refreshing mango lemonade. 😋 No wonder SJSU students love coming here for a quick bite!

📍 Sixth Street Burger - 235 E Santa Clara St #112, San Jose, CA 95113

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
So I went to this place with my mom while running errands. I had seen it before and I wanted to try it out so we stopped by one afternoon. The parking can be difficult depending on time of day, as its on the corner of Sixth and Santa Clara, but in the middle of the day there was a decent amount of (metered) parking nearby. The service was good, quick and the woman at the register helped us hone in on what we might enjoy as first timers. We both got smash burgers with their house "six sauce" and an order of tallow fries and onion rings to share. I also got a strawberry milkshake that was fantastic! made with Marianne's ice cream.
I found both the fries and onion rings to be enjoyable however my mother did not and wished for more Jack in the box-like fries (her favorite, take that however you want it). I found the rings to be good. a good crisp batter, a nice grilled onion inside with plenty of flavor on both and the tallow fries were crispy and tasty as well. The problem we both had was with the smash burger and sauce. In addition to the sauce we got lettuce and tomato on them and we both felt that the sauce and lettuce/tomato took away from the flavor of the burger itself. The six sauce is very mustard-forward and as someone who can take or leave mustard it was sort of off-putting and my mother who loves mustard still thought it tasted too much of it. We both tried pieces of the burger without anything on it and agreed it tasted really good by itself and i would suggest that anyone going get the burger plain or at least ask for the sauce on the side and make up your mind that way. Overall a positive experience and worth a shot if you're in the area craving a burger.

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 783 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It’s your standard Super Duper Burgers. If you’re unfamiliar with the experience, but love burgers this place is a hit. Never skip the pickles. Personally, I’m a big fan of their pints. Love a good draft beer with lunch. Affordable. This is my go to spot for a place to sit and have a break from the bustling city life.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Super Duper Burgers was absolutely amazing! The meat was incredibly fresh — you can really taste the quality in every bite. The milkshakes were rich, creamy, and just the right amount of sweet. Prices were totally reasonable for the quality of food and service. Honestly, nothing but positive things to say. If you’re visiting San Francisco, this spot is a must-try! You won’t be disappointed. 🍔🥤

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was a really great burger! To be honest the bun was a tad dry, but the flavor of the ingredients was awesome! It’s great that they have free homemade pickles!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Gluten free pasta straws?  What a great idea!  These are 100% better than paper straws especially for things like my strawberry shake. Got a shake, garlic fries, and a super duper cheese burger. All excellent. Thank you.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Chicken sandwich and Super Burger was delicious. Ciabatta roll nicely toasted just a little dark on the inside. Chicken and Beef was juicy. French Fries nice and crispy. Free pickles. Friendly and nice staff.

testimonials: It’s your standard Super Duper Burgers. If you’re unfamiliar with the experience, but love burgers this place is a hit. Never skip the pickles. Personally, I’m a big fan of their pints. Love a good draft beer with lunch. Affordable. This is my go to spot for a place to sit and have a break from the bustling city life.

Super Duper Burgers was absolutely amazing! The meat was incredibly fresh — you can really taste the quality in every bite. The milkshakes were rich, creamy, and just the right amount of sweet. Prices were totally reasonable for the quality of food and service. Honestly, nothing but positive things to say. If you’re visiting San Francisco, this spot is a must-try! You won’t be disappointed. 🍔🥤
This was a really great burger! To be honest the bun was a tad dry, but the flavor of the ingredients was awesome! It’s great that they have free homemade pickles!

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 2304 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Good quality burgers with reasonable wait times. Milk shakes were ok. Our garlic fries were an oily soggy mess. No table service, self-service sodas and free pickles. Seating is ok but not very comfortable, also the music is loud inside making it hard to have a conversation .

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I been here during late night when I was craving for a burger while I was very hungry. Upon arrival, there was a bit of a line, but I did not mind it since I needed some time to decide what to get since it was my first time here in general. Finally it was my turn to order and I was met with one of their welcoming, well trained and understanding staffs that made the process a quick and easy one. I decided to order to go since my friend was waiting in the car where parking was not the best option in the area due to the overall safety. Everything was made to order which is the way I like it and I never mind the wait since I am a very patient person. Luckily I still captured a photo of my order even though I conquered my burger in a minute or two due to hunger. I highly recommend this place to all burger enthusiasts, if you are looking to try something new or in need of a quick bite just like me. I definitely will be back to tryout the other delicious options they have to offer.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is the best super duper in the bay area, I've been to almost all of em. I think they season the burgers slightly more, or maybe put a lil more sauce. Idk what it is. Friendly staff. Good people watching sitting watching the world go by. My favorite super duper.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I think that the food was fine, it was just that it cost a lot of money for the price. We went here for my wife's birthday hoping it could become a special place, instead we had to go somewhere else after here to feel like we had got enough good. If I would have had an idea of how much food $20 would get you, I would have likely went elsewhere. I think there is better quality and more good elsewhere - as someone who spent $35 here and did not get full.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What's better than a bowl of piping hot ramen after a night of drinking? A good old greasy burger! Yeah!!!!

I was actually interested in locating a Habit Burger Grill, but they're not in the city. Thankfully our local friends knew of this SF startup.

ATMOSPHERE:
I walked by it numerous times but never noticed it due to its nostalgic look and signage. The inside has a few tables with more outside along the sidewalk. No drive thru.

MENU:
Burgers, milkshakes, soft serve, wine, beer.

FOOD:
Roasted Portobello Mushroom Cheeseburger
Like Five Guys, their stated "cheeseburgers" are double patties. Juicy, tender and full of flavor. Man, this was a damn good mushroom burger!

French Fries
No combos here, but these natural-cut shoestrings were affordable, crispy and tasty.

SERVICE:
It was Pride weekend so the place was pumping. Time from order to delivery was a quick 10 minutes or less.

OVERALL:
A little pricey but so worth it. This burger fan approves!

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 2201 Chestnut St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Super Duper Burgers delivers a well-executed fast-casual dining experience rooted in simplicity, transparency, and consistency. The open kitchen concept builds trust and adds an engaging element to the visit. Interior design is clean and functional, with warm materials that prevent the space from feeling sterile. While seating is compact, it’s thoughtfully arranged to maximize comfort and flow. The branding is clear and cohesive without feeling forced or overdone. The restaurant prioritizes efficiency while maintaining a welcoming atmosphere. Overall, this location succeeds as a reliable, well-designed spot for quality burgers in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Ordered a Mini burger and Oreo shake. You order at these electric kiosks.

Was surprised to see that the burger was a smash burger. The food came quickly and it tasted pretty good. The portions were okay, just enough to be filling.

Overall it’s a solid location for a quick lunch or dinner, not too expensive either.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’m a huge burger fan and in and out is by far my favorite for quality and being consistent with there meals. This is the first place I’d want more than in and out burger. The ingredients are fresh the meat was hot like burn your tastebuds kind of hot. It’s busy but able to keep up with demand. I’m glad I
Chose this new place over in and out burger.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The best burger I’ve EVER had. (Much better than in/out to settle the SF argument). The only thing that could make these burgers better is brioche buns. Fries are amazing here.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It's OK but I expected more based on the reviews. Burgers were dripping with fat and garlic fries had some rubbery cheese substitude one them. Ironically you have an option to leave out the parsley (which had no taste, it's just for looks) but not to leave out the cheese. Taste of the burgers was good though, that's what matters. Only one restroom in total makes for waits.

top_10.name: The Melt
top_10.address: 455 Market St at First, Suite #140, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch bite to go. This is a casual sandwich shop. Very minimal decor. White walls, concrete floor and a few tables and chairs. You could enter your order at the kiosk or directly with the cashier. I Ordered a tomato soup which was smooth and creamy and tasty. I also ordered the Italian Job which is a mushroom and cheese sandwich on a spicy garlic bread. Unfortunately the bread wasn't spicy nor garlic. I'd stop by again for the soup alone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was my first time trying their double meltburger, and it was really delicious! The beef patties were juicy and huge, I couldn't even finish them in one sitting, and ended up splitting them into three meals lol. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The Melt is a fantastic little find in a prime location right near Salesforce Tower. It's a small spot, but the food was absolutely delicious and makes it a place I'd happily visit again.

The only heads-up is that service can be a bit on the slow side, so it's best for when you're not in a major rush. When I visited, the wait was actually a plus, as I got to step outside and watch a street performance happening nearby.

If you're looking for a delicious meal in the area and have a little time to spare, The Melt is a solid and satisfying choice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I came to The Melt because coworkers wanted to meetup before the parade back in February. I thought food was  pretty good. Fresh and delicious.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: BOMB 🔥🔥🔥. got the fried chicken sando and added some bacon. i also got the chicken, bacon and garlic mac and cheese. added the breadcrumbs which gives each bite a nice crunch. i went in person and had a lovely meal. usually it's my go to doordash order when i've had too many beers 😇

top_10.name: Slider Buns | Burgers, Hotdogs, Philly Cheesesteak
top_10.address: 1202 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
In all honesty, I was staying in a hotel nearby to this place and I just really wanted a hot dog.

This place actually hit the spot on that. I'm used to a lot of these types of places grilling hot dogs and burning them, but Slider Buns made my hot dog perfectly!

It was really cool that they added a bit of dicing into the hot dog itself to make it easier to eat too, never seen anyone do with with a hot dog before but I thought it was a nice touch to mention.

Would definitely eat here again when I'm in town. Only really dropped it down a star because service is middling and it took a fair bit of time to get my food.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: While I'm tempted to give it five stars I think 4 is totally fair. The food was delicious, but doesn't have a distinct or extraordinary touch to warrant its price. We got a pastrami sandwich combo and a Philly cheese steak sandwich combo and some extra ranch. The sandwiches were meaty (not gristly), well seasoned and on a nice buttery bun. The condiment balance was nice, particularly the pickles and mustard on the pastrami. The fries were golden and crunchy with a pleasant seasoning that was a little light for my taste. The ranch was clearly freshly made and was given gratis by the lovely staff when I forgot to order it and tried to pay for them later in the meal. It was a really good meal that would be satisfying for someone looking for some classic American fare, but I wouldn't travel out of my way to visit Slider Buns. If we're in the neighborhood again like we were on this trip, it may be just the ticket. The space was large, clean, and ran by a couple real chill dudes.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious hamburgers, fries, shakes. The philly cheesestake needed more onions and peppers. Family fries was a whole plate of fries. House dressing is thousand island dressing. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I haven't eaten here for lunch but when I crave a good burger coming home from work, I always stop at this place on the way. Burgers made to order, clean shop with good service. I recommend

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My name is Omar and I’m a Uber driver. I go everywhere to try the different food so far this nice clean fantastic food restaurant the best taste so far. I thank them for keeping the restaurant clean good service and nice people. I will always come back here.

top_10.name: The Melt
top_10.address: 925 Market Street, 5th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Kiosk ordered Spicy Chicken, Sweet Potato Fires and Strawberry Shake! I personally don’t see anything special comparing to McDonald on a good day! The fries are too much salt but it’s hot and fresh. The Strawberry malt is fantastic with real strawberries!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great for a fast comfort food option. The Parm garlic fries were fantastic. Mac and cheese sandwich was exactly what I needed for a guilty pleasure kind of meal. Staff were friendly. My bf sandwich didn't have any meat on it (a patty melt that definitely should have had some), and when he told them they gave him a free cookie and remade it on the spot.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best burgers I’ve ever had. When I came to the states, this is how I imagined a burger should taste like! Fries are also delicious, and it’s honestly well priced for the quality. You can either self-serve or order from the counter. 10/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We stopped by this place for lunch yesterday. I ordered a BBQ bacon cheese burger. The burger was definitely good. With prices a bit high, I can't go too often but I will be back. Service and atmosphere was on point as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had an amazing experience here! From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel welcome and well taken care of. The food was absolutely delicious — everything was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. You can really taste the care that goes into every dish.
What truly stood out was the service. Our manager, EJ, went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. He checked in personally to see how we were doing and made us feel right at home. It’s rare these days to see that level of genuine hospitality, and it made the whole meal even better.
If you’re looking for a place with great food, friendly staff, and a manager who truly cares about his guests, this is the spot! I’ll definitely be coming back.
