top_10.name: Boochmania
top_10.address: 685 Harrison St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you’re wondering why this place has a 5.0 rating and hasn’t dipped all these years, step inside and prepare to be amazed. Boochmania is bringing some of the most unique, home cooked Turkish food to SF at a very unique price, with huge portions.

In short, this is a family run hidden gem serving exceptional food at an outstanding price. The mom, son and daughter are all cooking the food themselves. Everything is made in-house, the pillowy bread, vegetables, lamb, and it’s all seasoned so well without being salty at all. Every time is well thought out and executed to perfection and requires no modification.

They serve lunch and breakfast all day, and a wide range of house made kombucha, fermented foods, and no matter how much you eat you leave feeling light due to its high quality ingredients.

My favorite item is the pulled lamb burger. It’s a mountain of tandoori lamb, with a soft brioche bun, and a perfect light sauce, caramelized onions for sweetness and arugula to cut the richness. It’s truly one of the best bites you can have.

They also serve authentic Turkish coffee and tea which will leave you energized and ready for the day. I’ve come here multiple times over the years and it’s been always the exact same and each dish is served with passion.

They also have additional seating for larger parties upstairs as well so don’t let the charming front of house stop you from coming with a larger group.

This is one of the places you will feel good about supporting when you see how much care has gone into every item. Super charming, great homey feel, with exceptional food and drink, can’t go wrong.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The cutest vibe and most delicious food! ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS and would come back. Love the vegan options and how flavorful and healthy the food taste. So rare to find such delicious vegan options! YUM!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Some of the best food I’ve had. Everything was freshly made and you can tell they care for what they do. It was delicious.

They are super nice as well. I liked it so much I even ordered some to go. This will be my go-to place from now on whenever I’m in the area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Such a great experience. Our host was incredibly warm. The food was above par (had the pulled lamb on a burger and the home fries). And delightful Turkish coffee served at the end (complimentary). The currant w clove kombucha was very yummy too… even though it’s not usually my thing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve never had eggs this perfect, fluffy and delicious. Everything was so good, it felt like it was cooked with love 🥹 Not to mention the amazing kombucha. The atmosphere felt healing and cozy. This place deserves a solid 5 stars

top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
All vegan Japanese restaurant that has celiac-safe GF options - wow! Super excited to try this place so when I was in the area at 4:15 last Sunday, having missed lunch, thought I’d stop by. Was surprised to see there were already people waiting for it to open and the line was quite long when it opened at 4:30. Reservations are recommended but we were lucky enough to be accommodated. A charming dining area, albeit not a ton of elbow room. Seating options include tables up to four, up to two, and a small sushi bar.

The waitstaff were very friendly and responsive and helpful with recommendations.

Food wise, everything was good, including the miso soup and yuba salad, but the rolls are where the magic is. They’re all beautifully crafted and presented. We tried the California roll (great!), sweet tofu nigiri, Missing piece (made GF), and Boddy and Soul (recommended, and a winner by my dining partner, but not GF).

It was a real delight to enjoy such delicious food, carefully created, crafted, and presented, making it a multi sensory treat.

Wish there was a GF tempura option to make more of the rolls available to celiacs, but I loved what I had. Definitely recommend the fun, relaxed, down to earth atmosphere and uniquely Japanese vibe. Think stylish onsen, an indulgence where you leave feeling fulfilled, healthy, and happy!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Delicious vegan sushi that actually delivers on flavor! The Dynamite Roll (10/10) was the highlight, followed closely by the Roasted Bell Pepper Nigiri (9/10). The Shishito Peppers and Candlestick roll were also solid (8/10).

The price point feels high given the portion sizes, but the technique is impressive and it gives vegans a genuine sushi experience. Highly recommended for the execution, especially if you don't eat fish.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This vegan sushi restaurant is outstanding, offering an amazing experience. Everything was absolutely mind-blowingly delicious. I would love to eat here every day. The service was wonderful, and everything arrived impressively quickly considering the restaurant was full shortly after opening. Reservations are required, and we'll worth the wait. The menu, atmosphere, and interior design are A+, 10/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Such a hot spot for a reason! It’s an all-vegan menu that’s DELICIOUS. My vegan partner was overwhelmed by choice.

We got tea (small), shishito peppers (ok), green mango nigiri (amazing), three speciality rolls (yummm), and dessert (would pass on this and get another roll next time). Our entire order ended up a little over $100. And just FYI the habanero sauce is no joke.

Very sweet staff and clean bathrooms.

Would go back and would recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. Amazing plant-based, non processed, organic and locally sourced food, beautiful atmosphere, vibey ambiance, attentive and sweet staff. 11/10. Great for date night, a friend link up, or even a stop for dinner after work. Sitting at the bar vs the dining room is a different experience. Ask for the dessert menu! The red bean mochi donut is incredible.

top_10.name: Wildseed
top_10.address: 2000 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I love this restaurant! My friends treated me there for nice dinner after their engagement photoshoot. I’m not a vegan person but I must say, I’m super impressed.
We ordered the Italian sausage pizza because I was curious to know how close a plant based sausage could be to the real thing. Surprisingly, it was very close and delicious, but definitely didn’t taste artificial or processed! The pizza crust was crunchy, moderate thin (and with good texture) and doughy, and I love it. I they did a great job to let the customers know what ingredients were used (both through the menu and verbal), the service was excellent and the staff cared deeply if the customer had any food allergies.
What truly impressed me was my main course, the Thai curry. It is the most flavourful Thai curry I have ever had these days, and it was served black rice. I love how healthy it is and yet it is even better than meat-flavored curry.
Will definitely come back again to try more vegan food there.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Love this restaurant! This was our first visit during a recent trip to San Francisco. Absolutely wonderful experience at this plant-based gem! Daniel, our server, was top notch, and everything on the menu looked amazing. It was hard to decide what to choose and we are already looking forward to a return visit to try more. Highly recommend the curried cauliflower appetizer as well as the Fall Pie pizza. Heavenly. Ended the meal with the lemon cheesecake, which was very good, but next time I will need to try the chocolate cake. 10/10.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wildseed completely exceeded my expectations — the food was incredible! Every dish was packed with flavor and creativity, showcasing how amazing plant-based cooking can be. The ingredients were fresh, thoughtfully paired, and beautifully presented. The brunch menu is especially impressive — so many options that it was hard to choose just one!

The space itself is gorgeous: bright, tropical, and airy with an open layout that feels both relaxed and vibrant. It’s the kind of place where you can linger over brunch and still feel refreshed when you leave. There’s plenty of seating, but it gets very popular (for good reason!), so definitely make a reservation if you’re planning to go during peak hours.

If you’re vegan, vegetarian, or just love great food — Wildseed is a must-try in San Francisco. 🌿✨

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Most of the dishes we tried were underwhelming. The green pizza was overloaded with arugula and had a bland crust. The masala bowl lacked flavor despite the name - the tofu, chickpeas, and pickled vegetables didn’t come together well. The yellow curry bowl was spicy but not memorable, and again, heavy on rice with too little curry.

The cucumber drink tasted like straight juice, and was overpriced. The charcoal lemonade was better. The cashew cream birthday dessert was the standout - rich, nutty, and balanced.

Service was friendly, and the space is nice, but overall, not a meal we’d return for.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very busy restaurant, with lots of good food options. But the menu is hit and miss. The artichoke was a mess. The green pizza tasted off on account of eyes smelling fake cheese. The yellow curry was excellent. The whole restaurant has a weird funky cheese smell, which is sad because vegan cheese could be made to not be smelly.

testimonials:
I love this restaurant! My friends treated me there for nice dinner after their engagement photoshoot. I’m not a vegan person but I must say, I’m super impressed.
We ordered the Italian sausage pizza because I was curious to know how close a plant based sausage could be to the real thing. Surprisingly, it was very close and delicious, but definitely didn’t taste artificial or processed! The pizza crust was crunchy, moderate thin (and with good texture) and doughy, and I love it. I they did a great job to let the customers know what ingredients were used (both through the menu and verbal), the service was excellent and the staff cared deeply if the customer had any food allergies.
What truly impressed me was my main course, the Thai curry. It is the most flavourful Thai curry I have ever had these days, and it was served black rice. I love how healthy it is and yet it is even better than meat-flavored curry.
Will definitely come back again to try more vegan food there.

Love this restaurant! This was our first visit during a recent trip to San Francisco. Absolutely wonderful experience at this plant-based gem! Daniel, our server, was top notch, and everything on the menu looked amazing. It was hard to decide what to choose and we are already looking forward to a return visit to try more. Highly recommend the curried cauliflower appetizer as well as the Fall Pie pizza. Heavenly. Ended the meal with the lemon cheesecake, which was very good, but next time I will need to try the chocolate cake. 10/10.

Wildseed completely exceeded my expectations — the food was incredible! Every dish was packed with flavor and creativity, showcasing how amazing plant-based cooking can be. The ingredients were fresh, thoughtfully paired, and beautifully presented. The brunch menu is especially impressive — so many options that it was hard to choose just one!

The space itself is gorgeous: bright, tropical, and airy with an open layout that feels both relaxed and vibrant. It’s the kind of place where you can linger over brunch and still feel refreshed when you leave. There’s plenty of seating, but it gets very popular (for good reason!), so definitely make a reservation if you’re planning to go during peak hours.

If you’re vegan, vegetarian, or just love great food — Wildseed is a must-try in San Francisco. 🌿✨

top_10.name: Golden Era
top_10.address: 395 Golden Gate Ave, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Oh my! My favorite spot when I'm in SF. The best Asian Fusion Restaurant I've had. The Spicy Sweet Potato Curry and Quinoa Salad dishes were mouth watering. Great spices on the curry dish. The salad is out of this world.

For dessert, I had the Mango sticky rice. I was hooked. I wanted seconds.

I can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu. Reasonable prices. Great service. A few blocks away from City Hall. Parking is sometimes hard to find.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This Asian fusion restaurant is truly wonderful! I thoroughly enjoyed the best Bahn mi I have ever tasted, and the noodle dish was absolutely exceptional. The menu offers an amazing selection, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere is wonderful. The food was delicious and came in the perfect amount of time. I had a very lovely lunch date, thank you!

Update:  We came back again the next day, the staff remembered us and were so sweet. We got the same meals in addition to the Lemongrass Deluxe, mango smoothie, pumpkin cheesecake, flan, and carrot cake cupcake. The mango smoothie was AMAZING along with everything else. (Excellent carrot cake, perfectly balanced flavours and texture) I would order everything every day if I could. This has become my favourite restaurant in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I ordered DoorDash from this place when I was in town for a very short visit. The food arrived extraordinarily fast and it was excellent! I had the lemongrass deluxe. It was hot. It was flavorful. The broccoli was done just right.

I would absolutely order from this place again and try other dishes. Highly recommended based on one experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Golden Era, one of my go to places.
Not very busy for Saturday afternoon lunch
Chow fun, crispy noodles $15.95 plus $2. Love the crispy noodles, nice contrast with gravy soaked veggies: Bok choy, carrot, broccoli, seitan meats, zucchini, cabbage, onion, mushroom, tofu, celery. Super tasty. This boy was hungry and knocked off the whole serving meant to feed more than one! Best part of eating in, super hot off the wok and crispy noodles don't get soggy!
Nice ambience inside, outside the neighborhood not so much. Pretty safe during daylight hours. Close to the Asian Art museum

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Edit: we went back and had crispy cauliflower, Indian fried rice and lemongrass deluxe (again) Everything was delicious!

Great vegan food! Went on a solo date and got the Lemongrass Deluxe. It was delicious! The right amount of spice as well. Definitely recommend and would visit again next time I'm in town!

top_10.name: Firefly Restaurant
top_10.address: 4288 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious. Mostly gluten free menu and very accommodating for dairy free needs as well. Our waitress was so wonderful, too. A little chilly in the parklet but they had blankets for us. 10/10.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Goddamn this place is a gem. If you’re gluten-free, Firefly will become your favourite restaurant in the city. If you’re gluten-full, I reckon it still will too :)

For starters, the atmosphere here is very warm and cozy. Perfect for a fall evening. The art and eccentric ornaments/details don’t go unnoticed. I really appreciate how this doesn’t just feel like a restaurant — it’s almost like an extension of your own home (just with awe-striking gluten-free food.)

Which brings me to… the gluten-free food.

Fried chicken?! I mean… how?! This was my first fried chicken ever, and it did not disappoint. It also exceeded my boyfriend’s expectations (who loves the gluten) — so you know it’s good.

The squash dish was exceptional — so too were the sweet potatoes.

But the cherry on top of it all was the brownie with cornflakes and vanilla ice custard… I haven’t stopped thinking about it ever since.

It’s a 99.9% gluten free menu, asides from 1 side of bread which can be swapped for cornbread (if I’m recalling correctly) so BASICALLY it’s HEAVEN ON EARTH

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hands down, top food I’ve had and on top of it all was gluten free. I’m GF and the fact I had options outside of changing the bun, or just a burger is first win but I had fried chicken, gravy, Mac and cheese, bread and they weren’t subs it was just their menu. Sammy was an INCREDIBLE waitress and took care of us and added to the evening. It was all so filling and for the atmosphere and food it was fairly priced. We are visiting but would 100% go back, it was delish! You must go. And she brought a blanket out for us since we sat in their outdoor seating

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We really enjoy firefly. My wife is strict vegan, and they have many dishes which either are or can be made vegan. I am not vegan. We always get the seed loaf, really enjoy the rustic flavors. I enjoy the Pao de Queijo, and the onion jam that comes with it is my favorite. The Mexican street corn is mild and delightful.

My wife enjoys the daikon radish cakes and usually gets them as her main, supplemented with something else since they're a starter and a little small for a main. The choppy salad is excellent even in vegan form. The spring salad is also excellent as a vegan option. I've had both the fried chicken and the braised pork; both are excellent. The only quibble is that the "damn fine buttermilk biscuit" hasn't actually been that great on two occasions - it tends to be overcooked and not so tender. The cornbread is much better although it too tends to be overcooked. The Mac and cheese is fine but not spectacular.

For dessert, the chocolate peanut butter bar is excellent, but get the vanilla ice cream rather than the coffee cocoa nib vegan ice cream if you can. The dulce de leche pot de creme is excellent but very rich. And the key lime pie is also excellent, not too tart or too sweet - just right, but smaller than I would like.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a painful review to write because I wanted to love this place. The atmosphere is homey and welcoming, the staff was fantastic, and some of the food was delicious: every starter was amazing, and the sweet potatoes were a knockout. But then there were the misses. The fried chicken main arrived cold and greasy, and the brownie sundae was burnt to a crisp... Literally a crisp, as it was almost impossible to even cut it. The biscuits were also overbaked to the point of being painfully dry. And while the starters were good, it's mostly variations on carbs, with limited vegetable or other options. If the food was more evenly prepared and they added a little variety to the small plate options, this place would be amazing. Note their license is beer & wine only, no hard liquor.

testimonials: Absolutely delicious. Mostly gluten free menu and very accommodating for dairy free needs as well. Our waitress was so wonderful, too. A little chilly in the parklet but they had blankets for us. 10/10.

We are visiting but would 100% go back, it was delish! You must go. And she brought a blanket out for us since we sat in their outdoor seating

top_10.name: Good Karma Fine Ales Food & HiFi
top_10.address: 37 S 1st St, San Jose, CA 95113, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The owner Bob was very personable. We finished off a keg of barleywine and one of ours asked him if he had any chocolate stouts available. He said he'd go up and check, and five minutes later he showed up at the table to show off a keg he found, and ask us if we wanted him to to hook it up to the draft.

Of course we said yes, and then the good times flowed. Fantastic venue, fantastic selection, fantastic vibe. Say hi to Bob!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The main reason to go there is live music from local and upcoming bands, especially Jazz.  There is some exotic food choices such as Jerk (Caribbean) but not served well. We got food late on a Saturday night. Service was good and satisfactory.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you’re vegan you’ll be in heaven! Everything is vegan. The “chicken “ drumstick is delicious hands down my favorite item. The jerk “chicken “ and rice was pretty good the flavor of the rice was kind of bland. The jackfruit tacos were street sized tacos. It was hot inside so we eat outside which has a nice little setting.
Yes I’d return the waitress was really nice and friendly ready to talk.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I miss the old Good Karma, when back in the day it was green and charming. 🥺 Food still good though. Really enjoyed the Jamaican jerk chicken burrito!! Service ok.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Let me start by saying I’m not personally vegan but I would ABSOLUTELY come back here because the food was that great & I couldn’t even tell it was vegan! I got the 1 item plate with Jamaican Jerk with brown rice (pictured) & my friend got the Pulled “Pork” street tacos which were also spectacular. We also ordered a couple desserts, Mom’s Apple crisp & the Baklava, which was also super delicious! They also have a wide beer selection! I have to point out how rad & laid back the atmosphere is; all the art & vinyl records makes this place truly one of a kind! We went on a Saturday night & they had a live jazz band playing which made it even more special. If you’re vegan or not, you have to check this place out!

top_10.name: Rad Radish
top_10.address: 301 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had dinner at Rad Radish yesterday and was thoroughly impressed by this 100% plant-based gem in Hayes Valley. The restaurant immediately catches your eye with its vibrant, colorful signage and welcoming storefront that perfectly captures the energy of the neighborhood. I ordered the Impossible Burger with avocado and fries, and it absolutely delivered. The burger was expertly prepared with a great balance of flavors and textures - the Impossible patty was juicy and satisfying, complemented perfectly by fresh avocado and crisp lettuce on a sesame seed bun. The fries were golden and crispy, served alongside a delicious ketchup that tied the meal together beautifully. What really sets Rad Radish apart is the atmosphere. The space is stunning with its modern industrial design, featuring exposed ceilings, warm wood floors, and an abundance of lush greenery throughout. The hanging plants and natural elements create such a fresh, inviting environment that makes you want to linger. The lighting is perfect for both casual dining and catching up with friends.
The restaurant strikes that perfect balance of being trendy yet comfortable, with a layout that feels both spacious and intimate. It’s clear they’ve put thought into creating a space that’s as beautiful as their food is delicious. Rad Radish proves that plant-based dining can be both satisfying and stylish. I’ll definitely be back to explore more of their menu - this place is a real winner in the Hayes Valley dining scene!​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Rad Radish takes fast casual dining up a notch. Absolutely delicious, all-vegan menu. My husband and I went there twice on our most recent visit to the city. The chilaquiles and burgers were great.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Lunch treat
Healthy or fast food path?

Neatball Masala
Blueberry oat muffin
Coffee milkshake
Mix of "healthy" and not. Dessert treat
Very busy at 1pm Sunday afternoon which I expected. Pretty nice interior with varied seating capacity.
Three ways to order, easy QR ordering with my pre-existing Toast account at table destination. Easy menu navigation and ordering. Expected SF pricing. Noticed self served water and to go boxes well after seating and lucky it was visible to me. The poor one young server was working harder than others. That's why I hate giving tip before service.
Milkshake came a bit after food which came quickly. They group all drinks for multiple tables in one server trip.
Masala was enjoyable with the contrast of flavors. Not large but filling.
Would probably order again but much more of the menu to try for this first time.
Tasty muffin but not many blueberries.
Milkshake was good and dense.
Overall an enjoyable lunch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: All vegan here.  Good place to stay for the concert across Davies Symphony Hall.  Vibrant and cozy atmosphere.  So it’s not a very quiet place.  But it’s a relaxing place to work alone or spend time with friends.  Free WiFi. Scan QR code to order. So many varieties to choose from Salads, drinks, breakfast, brunch… The green juice is fresh.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really loved this place! Delicious vegan food, everything came out super fast. Ordering is easy — either from your phone or using the self-service kiosk. The atmosphere is pleasant, clean, and stylish. I’ll definitely be back! 💚

top_10.name: Judahlicious
top_10.address: 3906 Judah St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Judahlicious is a true standout in San Francisco’s Sunset District, especially for anyone seeking vibrant, plant-based cuisine. From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the welcoming vibe and earthy aesthetic that mirrored their commitment to conscious eating.

The flavors in every dish I tried were both bold and beautifully balanced. Whether you're vegan, plant-curious, or just love great food, Judahlicious is worth the visit. Fresh, flavorful, and ethical what more could you want

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We love Judahlicious! I am not a huge raw food fan, but my son adores their acai bowls and we have frequented the spot afterschool with friends 1-2x/week for months. The staff is always welcoming of our wild kiddos, the service is fast and the quality is great. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Judahlicious – San Francisco
Amid the clamor of Judah Street, Judahlicious stands firm—an unshaken outpost of nourishment and quiet benevolence.

We arrived early, seeking breakfast not just to fill the stomach, but to greet the day with intention. The Waffle Açaí was both hearty and refreshing, marrying the crisp warmth of waffles with the chilled vigor of açaí—a contrast that, like life, balances sweet with substance.

The Nekked Burrito reminded us that food need not be overcomplicated to be fulfilling. Unadorned yet complete, it offered grounding flavors wrapped in simplicity.

We shared the Velvet smoothie—banana, peanut butter, and oat milk—a drink that held the dignity of restraint, yet soothed like an old truth rediscovered.

While we dined, a man without a home asked for juice. It was granted without fuss or spectacle. In that quiet act, there was more nourishment than any menu could hold.

Judahlicious feeds body, mind, and, on occasion, spirit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
100% vegan!! This place is really really good!
Their Nekked Burrito is yum!
Waffles and Açaí Bowls are super yummy and healthy!
We tried their new menu item “burmosa” which is supposed to be a Samosa Burrito… however  don’t recommend eating that. It does not taste like Samosa at all .. I would stick to other items on their menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place was awesome. If you are vegan and want a good variety of healthy food, this place is great. Definitely recommend. It’s in a more quiet and residential location of San Francisco so parking is not too difficult to find. The service was good and friendly and the food seemed fresh. Good, filling portions as well.

top_10.name: Cha-Ya
top_10.address: 762 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Enjoyed and would come back, especially during happy hour! You can get 3 small dishes for $20 during happy hour. We got the 1/2 cha-ya roll, Sansai udon bowl, and agedashi tofu. All of it was great. My friend and I admired all the paper lanterns hanging around us. It was a quiet, small, calm atmosphere.
Edit: I have come back several times since my first visit, often bringing friends. Everything has been good!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food is exceptional!
I went with my husband two days in a row, and we tried five items from the happy hour menu, ordered two dishes from the regular menu, and tasted two of the desserts. I also tried both Japanese beers (Asahi is light, while Sapporo has more character).
Everything — absolutely everything — was delicious and worth it. Excellent experience, truly one of the best vegan restaurants in the Bay.
The service is friendly and attentive, and the place has a simple decor (it would be nice if it were a bit prettier; it’s not ugly, just simple).
The happy hour menu is really worth it!
The location is great. One day I sat at a regular table, but I actually preferred sitting at the bar-style counter facing the street.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very good for vegan fare. The udon was tasty, and the rolls were inventive. I could do with less of the seaweed salad inside the bigger roll though it was hard to eat. Otherwise great spot and will be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
In the bustling heart of San Francisco’s Mission District, where the clamor of modernity often drowns the whispers of tradition, I chanced upon a sanctuary of serenity and sustenance: Cha-Ya, a vegan Japanese eatery that beckons the weary traveler with promises of wholesome fare and tranquil ambiance.

Upon entering this modest establishment, one is greeted not by the ostentation of opulence, but by the humble elegance reminiscent of a Zen monk’s abode. The air is imbued with the subtle aromas of miso and sesame, evoking memories of distant Kyoto temples and the disciplined artistry of shōjin ryōri.

On my recent visit, I partook in a repast that commenced with a sushi ensemble, where golden daikon and an array of verdant vegetables were ensconced within delicate rice and nori. Each morsel was a testament to the chef’s devotion to purity and balance. Accompanying this was a sunomono salad—crisp cucumber slices mingled with a hint of cinnamon, presenting a dance of flavors both refreshing and unexpected. A bowl of miso soup, rich yet unassuming, provided warmth to the soul, while a chilled Sapporo lent a crisp counterpoint to the meal’s gentle nuances.

Though my appetite was sated, the menu’s offerings whispered temptations yet unexplored. The Cha-Ya Roll, a signature creation, boasts tempura-fried vegetables enveloped in sushi rice, drizzled with a soy-ginger glaze—a harmonious blend of texture and taste. The Kinoko Udon, with its medley of mushrooms in a savory broth, promises comfort on fog-laden evenings. For those seeking variety, the Cha-Ya Nabe presents a hearty hot pot brimming with tofu, vegetables, and delicate noodles, inviting communal indulgence.

In an age where the essence of Japanese cuisine is often overshadowed by the ubiquity of meat and fish, Cha-Ya stands as a beacon for those yearning for authenticity without compromise. It is a place where the principles of compassion and culinary excellence converge, offering nourishment that transcends the mere physical.

As I departed, the lingering flavors and the establishment’s quiet dignity left an indelible impression. Cha-Ya is not merely a restaurant; it is a haven—a reminder that amidst the cacophony of city life, one can still find pockets of peace and purity.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Pros: Menu is all vegetarian. Atmosphere is cozy. Service is super fast. Ordered arrived within minutes of placing the order. Run by old Japanese folks. Servers are super sweet old Japanese ladies. Loved the service. Food is delicious too with so much variety and flavor.
Cons : It’s just a little on the pricy side.

testimonials:
Enjoyed and would come back, especially during happy hour! You can get 3 small dishes for $20 during happy hour. We got the 1/2 cha-ya roll, Sansai udon bowl, and agedashi tofu. All of it was great. My friend and I admired all the paper lanterns hanging around us. It was a quiet, small, calm atmosphere.
Edit: I have come back several times since my first visit, often bringing friends. Everything has been good!

The food is exceptional!
I went with my husband two days in a row, and we tried five items from the happy hour menu, ordered two dishes from the regular menu, and tasted two of the desserts. I also tried both Japanese beers (Asahi is light, while Sapporo has more character).
Everything — absolutely everything — was delicious and worth it. Excellent experience, truly one of the best vegan restaurants in the Bay.
The service is friendly and attentive, and the place has a simple decor (it would be nice if it were a bit prettier; it’s not ugly, just simple).
The happy hour menu is really worth it!
The location is great. One day I sat at a regular table, but I actually preferred sitting at the bar-style counter facing the street.

Very good for vegan fare. The udon was tasty, and the rolls were inventive. I could do with less of the seaweed salad inside the bigger roll though it was hard to eat. Otherwise great spot and will be back!

top_10.name: Mensho Tokyo SF
top_10.address: 672 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We waited about an hour on a Saturday evening, but as always, it was well worth it. The food here is fantastic—my top picks are the Lamb Ramen, Enoki Spicy Chips, and the Miso Butter Ramen. Each dish is packed with flavor and never disappoints. Also, if you enjoy sake, their Mensho sake is incredibly smooth and pairs perfectly with the meal. Definitely a spot I’ll keep coming back to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Mensho Tokyo SF is truly one of the standout places in the city for anyone who loves ramen 🍜. It’s not just another noodle shop — it feels genuinely unique and deeply authentic, the kind of spot where you can tell the chefs care about craft, flavor, and experience 🎌. Because of its popularity, I ended up waiting in line for a little over an hour ⏳ before getting in. Honestly, the wait itself becomes part of the ritual; everyone in line knows they’re about to enjoy something special.

Once inside, the service moves quickly ⚡. After placing my order, the food arrived much faster than I expected, especially considering how busy the restaurant was. I ordered the spicy VGKO 🌶️, the spicy enoki mushroom 🍄, and a Japanese beer 🍺 to go with it. I usually have a pretty high tolerance for spicy and hot foods, but the heat level of the spicy VGKO caught me off guard. It’s intense — delicious, but definitely not for the faint of heart 🔥. If you’re thinking of ordering the super spicy level, just be prepared.

Overall, Mensho Tokyo SF delivers a memorable ramen experience with bold flavors, efficient service, and a vibe that makes the wait worthwhile ⭐. I’d absolutely return — though next time, I might think twice before going for the highest spice level.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Mensho Tokyo SF is my favorite go-to ramen restaurant ever since I first went in 2022! I take all my friends and family here, and they love it too! My favorites are the Spicy Garlic Knockout with Ajitama, and the Spicy Toripaitan with Ajitama. Everything about the ramen is very delicious: the broth, egg, noodle texture, and toppings! I also like the Enoki Chips appetizer. Service is great, extremely kind and attentive servers! Thank you Mensho for such a great ramen experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best ramens in the bay! We had the Spicy Signature Toripaitan and the super spicy G.K.O. Both were flavorful, however the duck chashu was a bit on the rare side and wasn’t the best. Except for that the creamy umami filled spicy broth and all the toppings work well together. We also ordered the spicy fired enoki chips(10/10) and spicy fried corn wings. All the portions are generous and the service on point.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Went to Mensho Tokyo SF for the first time on a Saturday. We were coming from out of town and were excited to try this place after seeing all the posts on social media. My group arrived around 3:51pm and we were around the 4th group inside. Service was surprisingly super quick. I ordered the Spicy Signature Toripaitan and it came out in less than 5 minutes. This started off being one of the best ramens I’ve ever had. But unfortunately, about a quarter of the way through my bowl, I found a hair in it. It was most definitely not my hair. I didn’t want to make a scene, so I didn’t mention it to the staff, but I immediately lost my appetite. A family member ended up eating the rest of my bowl. I do have a photo for reference. I understand that mistakes can happen, but it was disappointing and affected what had been an otherwise great experience.

top_10.name: Arsicault Bakery
top_10.address: 397 Arguello Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Of course the croissants are absolutely mind-blowing, but can we talk about the CCC? This has been elevated to my favorite chocolate chip cookie in SF (my previous #1 was Batter). The outer edges are ultra chewy and caramelized, while the inside is chewy, and there is a layer of bittersweet chocolate of the highest quality through the center. Truly perfection.

I tried the chocolate croissant and it’s an absolutely massive pillowy layered and buttery dream. The bittersweet chocolate inside was still a bit melted. I would share it unless you’re very hungry—it’s super large!

I went on a Wednesday morning around 9 AM and the line was about 6 deep but moved very quickly. I would happily wait longer and it would still be worth it!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious pastries! The chocolate croissant was generously filled and wonderfully tender on the inside. The kouign amann was incredible- beautifully laminated with the perfect, caramelized top. The morning bun was nothing special, but it’s tough to follow up a kouign amann that delicious. Service was quick and very friendly. Prices were very reasonable. I’ll be back! Thank you!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: There is definitely a wait but the pastries are worth it. The chocolate almond croissant was stuffed and the chocolate chip cookie was amazing! The kougin amann was flaky and not too sweet! So good! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wanted to come to this bakery since I heard they have the best almond croissants. I was so happy I finally made it, the chocolate almond croissants are the best. The line is not bad at all for a Sunday early afternoon. When I got the croissant, it felt heavy. I was worried it would be too heavy, but no, the filling is smooth and perfect, croissant is buttery and perfect layered, it literally melts in the mouth. The cranberry coconut scone is very good as well. The ones I enjoyed most is plain croissant, light, puffy, perfect.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I don’t like waiting in line because I’m a snarky New Yorker, but the croissants here were really good. I was in line listening to joggers boasting about their easy lives and also how good this place was, so I decided to wait and it didn’t disappoint. Gotta try the chocolate and regular croissants!

Sorry for the knock sfers, I couldn’t help myself!

top_10.name: b. patisserie
top_10.address: 2821 California St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Cute patisserie, the coffe is good the pastries wonderful. Rich flavors. Seating is tight. There was a lin to get in. The parking is difficult in the area but that the norm. Service was great and helpful. We would go back when we in town. The sign out front was a little hard to see to find the store. Cute place

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visited this place on Saturday
Nice decent place , Tried their famous Amann and croissant. The banana chocolate croissant was amazing. Coffee was great as well .
Very much recommend this place. Try it once.
Removed 1 star for service, did not find the service that great. May be employees were tired and stressed (We visited around 4PM)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Excellent Kouign Amann and delicious Almond Financiers.  They also make a great iced Mocha.  A wonderful local gem and really enticing and well curated display of artisanal pastries that delight the senses.

So lucky to have this pastry shop in our amazing city.  Also, a great spot for gifts for your favorite hostess and for dinner parties.

Thank you, B Patisserie!  ✨✨✨✨✨

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Been here a bajillion times. Usually first in line, sometimes waaaay in the back. Still amazed how the quality and service has not changed in recent years.
A long way from our hotel, love making the walk back (most of the trek is beautiful) with a big box. Almost 3000 reviews, obviously they do it right. I am obviously not objective in my review of b. patisserie because I love this place to the point I am blind with gluttonous excitement each visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I brought my neighbor here after our lunch. As usual, everything here is on-point. The pastries and my usual go-tos but this visit I also got a piece of pistachio opera cake that did not disappoint.

It is easy to get distracted with all the pastries but as you make your way to the register, there are small pieces specialty cakes, simple bread offerings (baguettes and sourdough loaves) to be had and what canoften be overlooked are the little cookies -chocolate, savory and plain sables-each are different and so delicious. The granola is addictive-evening you don't think you like granola.

They do offer sandwiches and an espresso bar-all counter service with the drinks and sandwiches delivered to your table.

I often rush in to grab pastries but it really is a treat to go here to sit and enjoy a coffee and dessert or small meal.

top_10.name: Neighbor Bakehouse
top_10.address: 2343 3rd St UNIT 100, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Bring on the seeds!!! The pumpkin seeds pop on this  delicious bread. Why no pictures of the country bread, it was eaten too quickly!!! Right??? This is the perfect neighborhood Bakehouse and if you are at UCSF Mission Bay for a procedure or the children’s hospital, this is a 6 minute walk and well worth the effort. Theo shared a morning bun with the family who enjoyed it. The coffee was equally hitting!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hard to find parking but the pastries are incredible!!! Big fan of the spicy potato burek, pistachio blackberry croissant (a bit sweet but still amazing), and their pull apart savoury bread. Service is always pretty quick considering there’s a line every time I’ve been.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Love Neighbor Bakehouse. The Ginger pull apart is amazing. It’s not too strong (Ginger-wise), and the layers of flaky chunks are perfection.
If you haven’t tried their sausage roll, definitely give it a go, it is *delicious.* The first time I tried it I was honestly in a state of awe- I didn’t know which flavors were coming from where, or how it was so good.  It’s super rich, not something I can eat very often, definitely a treat.
Their breads are also excellent. Well baked, good craftsmanship.
They also make some unique pastries, one with pork belly I think, which is also very rich. Pork belly on top of a croissant! I haven’t tried their curry pastry yet but it’s on my list.

They are also a company who contributes to the community - I believe they either donate leftover baked goods to a local charitable organization/nonprofit and or make extra for that organization. Companies who take the extra steps to donate leftovers always win extra points in my book. My guess is that it would be easier for them to simply throw things away, but they package things up and send them to other people who will enjoy them.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We came here on a weekend afternoon. There was still plenty of bread inside! The server is friendly! Once you walk in, you will smell the sweetness of the bread and it is amazing. I got the ginger pull apart, the raspberry pistachios croissant, mushroom tart and the cream. They are all unique and good! Recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We stopped by Neighbor Bakehouse on a Sunday at 8 am. There was plenty of street parking available. As we were walking to get in line (3 parties in front of us), 2 employees rudely pushed past us on the sidewalk. It was clear they were late as the bakery was supposed to open at 8 am but did not open until 8:15 am. We got the char siu croissant, ube croissant, pistachio blackberry croissant, and ginger pull apart. The char sui croissant is more like a Danish but a good alternative for people who like savory pastries. The ube croissant was ok - although the interior was pretty, I thought the ube flavor was lacking. The pistachio blackberry croissant has a nice tartness from the blackberry filling. The ginger pull apart was very unique and delicious - I really like ginger flavored things so I enjoyed it (this is more like real ginger flavor and not gingerbread). I would get all the pastries again except the ube croissant. Overall, I enjoyed the pastries but I think B Patisserie and Arsicault are still my favorite bakeries.

top_10.name: Schubert's Bakery
top_10.address: 521 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve been eyeing Schubert’s for a couple years now, so I probably had my expectations a little too high. Everything was good, fresh, tasty. Everything is beautifully prepared and packaged. I just wasn’t wowed, and I’m bakery spoiled. But the staff is helpful and they have an amazing selection! It really is a SF gem.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I enjoy their delicate flavors and attention to detail. Ordering a cake was a breeze and every part of it was delicious! Yes, including the macarons and white chocolate signage. They make the best princess cake in the area. I had their mango cake as well, but I prefer it contrasted with the saltiness of a touch of cream cheese. Lovely local spot!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Nice little bakery. They do run out of the smaller cakes as the day goes by, so keep that in mind if you want to walk in and get one of the top seller items. They have a couple tables inside, but this is mostly a "take out" type of bakery. Huge selection of cakes, good prices. Want to come back and try some more!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Avoid this place like the plague, but only if you’re seriously trying to lose weight. Otherwise, walk right in and accept your fate. There is absolutely no way you can step into Schubert’s Bakery and not feel tempted by at least one (and probably several) of their beautiful, perfectly made pastries. Everything behind the glass looks inviting, and the best part is that their desserts aren’t overloaded with sugar. You can actually taste the delicate flavors, the butter, the chocolate, and the care that goes into each item.

Schubert’s has been a Richmond District institution for decades, and they continue to do what they do best: classic European-style cakes, tortes, and pastries made with consistency and restraint. I won’t recommend a specific item because that would be unfair to everything else in the case. Pick anything to start with, enjoy it, and then come back another day to try something different. Just maybe don’t visit too often—because when you eventually step on the scale and see the results, you might find yourself coming back here to leave me a few choice words. Consider yourself warned.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Shubert's is a true SF classic. Their cakes are sweet, delicious, and beautifully made -- perfect for birthdays or any celebration. The flavors are balanced, never too heavy, and the presentation always feels special. You can taste the care and tradition in every bite. Definitely one of those local gems that makes San Francisco feel like home.

Everything is beautifully prepared and packaged. I just wasn’t wowed, and I’m bakery spoiled. But the staff is helpful and they have an amazing selection! It really is a SF gem.

top_10.name: Arizmendi Bakery
top_10.address: 1331 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
An absolute must-stop if you’re anywhere near Inner Sunset. Also totally worth it if you have go an hour out of your way.
Sourdough croissants! Brilliant. Flawless scones that are delightful crunchy and melt-away all at once. Memorable savory breadsticks and focaccia, perfect coffee-cake, cookies and exceptional bread loaves with daily changing variations that are, literally, all listed on a monthly calendar on the website.
Enjoy.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We love our local Inner Sunset Arizmendi Bakery...not just because it is worker owned, but also for the delicious baked goods and warm friendly atmosphere.

Howard and the rest of the baker/owners are super kind and are baking up some incredible daily and holiday treats! Try the ridiculous pear + cherry seasonal scone of the day or the Triple Mushroom Sour Dough Pizza with sesame, ginger garlic vinaigrette.
They serve TWO King Cakes for the Epiphany.
Galette des Rois, a puff pastry filled with a rich almond filling AND Rosca de Reyes, a brioche dough with a hint of orange filled with a sweet molasses and pecan filling, decorated cream cheese topping and dried fruit......5 Stars is truly not enough -JD

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Line out the door, very busy, and for a good reason! Absolutely delicious everything! Fresh out of the oven,  and selling like the hot commodities they literally were. 10/10 would go again and every day if I lived close enough!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We got the pumpkin muffins, the sourdough croissant, a pecan roll and a daily special pizza. The muffin was the only thing that was worth the wait in line. It was soft and sweet with little bits of sugar on top. The croissant had that bad sour chemical taste. The pecan roll had raises in it which threw off the taste and texture of what would have been a very tasty roll. The pizza was better than Costco but not more than double the price good.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: my new fav bakery! i love how many options they have without egg!!!! the scones were absolutely perfect, not too sweet and buttery. the handheld focaccias and breads were really good as well!! the only thing i wish they had done better was offer small sides of cheese, butter, or some topping for the items so we wouldn’t have to purchase a large jar of cream cheese for one small pastry. other than that, i love this place!!!

top_10.name: Jane The Bakery
top_10.address: 1881 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Warm, mouth savoring flaky croissants softly shattering with each bite, buttery buttery butter and buttery!, airy center that tastes freshly pulled from the oven. The coffee cake is rich and comforting, with that melts into a perfectly moist crumb. Every pastry feels thoughtfully made, indulgent without being heavy. Service was fast with no wait at all, and parking was easy and stress-free. Truly some of the best baked goods the city has to offer.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First time to try this bakery because of the reviews. We got the Asia Chicken Salad, chocolate croissant and vanilla sprinkle cookies. They were all ok, nothing to rave about. The dressing of the salad was good. If you want a quick breakfast, this place is ok. Prices are on the expensive though (spent about $33 for just 3 items).

We were not able to try their beverages because we brought our own. Maybe next time we can try their coffee.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Walked to this cute bakery from Japan town. There are so many pastries and they are all amazing. I had the pistachio olive twist and latte which was not too sweet. The matcha and banana bread were also amazing. We got there at 10 right before the line got crazy but it would be worth the wait. The service is fast and there is seating outside as well as a cute park across the street.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is second time go there but it was first time to try their sandwich I was surprised how the taste it was and I really love the sandwich, normally I don’t eat the sandwich I don’t know I got this sandwich forgot what is it call it was delicious I would go back again to get that, also I do like their chocolate croissant and brownie, the people that work there are fast and nice

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tried this place based on the high ratings but so disappointing. The pastry for he apple was thick and soggy, and the seasonal flan was terrible!  Over baked all the way through!  And it was a recommendation by the server too!
The only positive was the availability of outside seating for dogs.

top_10.name: Thorough Bread & Pastry
top_10.address: 248 Church St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We visited on a Saturday around 8 am. The bakery wasn't busy and we happened to find street parking right in front of the bakery. We got an almond croissant and apple almond streusel croissant. The croissants were warm and DIVINE. They were very affordable too - $4.85 and $5. The bakery has indoor seating and a back patio too. Definitely enjoyed the two croissants we had.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best if not the best spots in this area. Delicious croissants, pastries, coffee, salad and sandwiches.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We tried a lot of items. Very sweet spot- casual hidden gem. The pastries are good. Nothing WOW! However if you are in the neighborhood, stop by for a cup and pastries. We had the chocolate/banana/almond croissant, apple tart, kale/cheese quiche, ham/cheese potato quiche, ham&cheese croissant, corn cheddar scone, brown sugar chocolate chip cookie,flat white w/ soy, cappuccino. (Yes, we took  some home...)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
New to the neighborhood and could not have stumbled into a nicer shop. The employee, Aries, was SO friendly and helpful. I ended up getting the Ham and Cheese Croissant that was recommended to me and it was so probably one of the best croissants I’ve ever eaten, so I got another one to go for my lunch today.

The back patio was beautiful and everyone on the staff was friendly. The prices were also super reasonable, especially compared to the other cafes on the same street. I’m already excited to go back and this will definitely be my new favorite spot to go to before work in the mornings.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is amazing! The pastries are incredibly delicious, I would recommend the Apple Tart, but don't always take it from me. Service was great, the back is a lovely place to eat. Get here when they open, and you'll get a table immediately. Yum!

testimonials: We visited on a Saturday around 8 am. The bakery wasn't busy and we happened to find street parking right in front of the bakery. We got an almond croissant and apple almond streusel croissant. The croissants were warm and DIVINE. They were very affordable too - $4.85 and $5. The bakery has indoor seating and a back patio too. Definitely enjoyed the two croissants we had.
One of the best if not the best spots in this area. Delicious croissants, pastries, coffee, salad and sandwiches.

We tried a lot of items. Very sweet spot- casual hidden gem. The pastries are good. Nothing WOW! However if you are in the neighborhood, stop by for a cup and pastries. We had the chocolate/banana/almond croissant, apple tart, kale/cheese quiche, ham/cheese potato quiche, ham&cheese croissant, corn cheddar scone, brown sugar chocolate chip cookie,flat white w/ soy, cappuccino. (Yes, we took  some home...)

top_10.name: Arsicault Bakery
top_10.address: 87 McAllister St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We've tried 4 different pastries, my top choice was plain croissant, it was sooooo tasty! Highly recommended it to try. Also the apricot monkey bread  was delicious  too!
The atmosphere was okay!
The price was reasonable for croissants!
Have fun! :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had my doubts but so many friends rec’d this place and it did not disappoint! One of my fave pastry spots in SF - I actually liked the berry-filled croissant and ham/cheese croissant more than the kouign amann/veg galette which was a surprise. Maybe because they were warm? Cute seating outside and no wait when we went on a weekday around 11am. Will definitely be back :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I wanted to answer one, and one thing only when I went here - is this the best croissant in all of San Francisco Bay Area? Well, in my humble opinion, the answer is yes. I went very close to the closing time and there were only a bunch of items left, but I was able to snag a butter croissant. That is originally what I came for. I sat outside in a tiny table in the glorious SF sun and unpacked my treasure. It was sooo flaky and so unbelievably buttery. It left a mess everywhere as I was trying to eat it, but it was so worth it. Will definitely be back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I have been to all three locations of Arsicault, and here are my takeaways about this one:

1. More items on the menu as compared to the other locations.
2. Not sure if this is actually true, but I liked the croissants better from this location.
3. No free parking around, but UCSF garage nearby has $10 per day parking on Sundays.
4. Wait time when I visited (on a Sunday) was around 30-40mins.
5. There is seating inside.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Literally when you walk in you will get a whiff of that bakery aroma (the smell of bread and sweet goodness). I love all the pastries but my favorite ones are the almond croissant, plain, and the chocolate. I also like their morning bun. My absolute favorite is Kouign Aman!!! But they also have savory on the menu like ham and cheese croissants and quiches.

If you want a certain item come first thing in the morning because they run out of stuff. There is dining on the inside and outside if you want to sit, chat, and have coffee. The place is nice and clean but it can look better.
But it doesn’t stop me from coming in to get my croissants:).

The lines can get long but it moves fast. So you must decide what you want. The price is standard (meaning not too cheap not expensive). But it’s affordable and very good.

The atmosphere was okay!
The price was reasonable for croissants!
Have fun! :)

top_10.name: Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop
top_10.address: 1720 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
These donuts are not as spectacular as the reviews claim. But everyone likes a different donut. For me, a simple glazed krispy kreme has the perfect texture.

I tried the apple fritter and cream filled chocolate bar. The dough for these donuts is quite cakey, not light enough. The apple fritter tasted good but was a bit undercooked in the middle. And these donuts are not served warm sadly.

For the price, it is good, especially considering the size. I don't understand why they don't put up clear pricing. We paid $3.95 for the apple fritter and $3.75 for the chocolate bar.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place was quick, tasty and was a warm spot to sit. I got the maple donut ring and I rate it a 8.4/10. It was super fluffy, moist, and there wasn’t too much maple frosting. This donut was a good balance of all the flavors and it was very thick. It was different than other maple donuts I’ve had, less traditional maple flavor. There was a line out of the door when we got there but it moved very fast and we got our food within 10 minutes of waiting. Workers were efficient and got everyone’s order right. There was a good amount of seating and it was warm which made it a great spot for a cold night in the city. Would definitely go back and want to try the apple fritter. Fire🔥🔥

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I visited San Francisco for my birthday trip from Chicago, and one stop stood out above the rest—Bob’s Donuts on Polk Street. This legendary 24-hour shop has been serving fresh, handmade donuts since the 1960s, and it’s a true gem.

As a Chicagoan, I’ve had my fair share of great donuts (think Stan’s, Do-Rite, and Firecakes), but Bob’s has a nostalgic, no-frills vibe that makes it special. It’s the kind of place that works for both late-night cravings and early-morning sugar fixes.

The donuts are big, fresh, and packed with flavor. The classic glazed raised donut is perfect, but two of my personal favorites were the apple fritter and maple bar. And if you’re up for it, they even have the famous Texas Donut Challenge—a giant donut you try to finish in under three minutes for bragging rights.

My absolute favorite, though, was the Mango Malasada. Malasadas are Portuguese-style pastries popular in Hawaii, filled with tropical fruit flavors. I chose mango, and it was heaven—soft, fluffy, and bursting with sweetness. I honestly wish we had malasadas this good back in Chicago!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Bob’s Donuts is leaving 1621 Polk St. after almost 70 years! 😩😩😩
I have been going for more than 2 decades at this Bob’s location and the consistency is always at an all time high! My favorites are their original glazed and the best Crumb donut you can ever have! I miss it when you were able to sit at the counter or one of the tables but after pandemic it’s to-go only and I’m happy to say there is almost always a line outside which means I’m right…Bob’s is really good! On another positive note Bob’s I believe will keep their newer location just a block and a half away also on Polk St. See you there then! 🍩👍🏼😋

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Bob’s is a neighborhood 24-hour gem that just can’t be beat. They have all the best types - glazed, chocolate, maple, old fashioned, filled, donut holes, you name it. They’re fast, and you can watch them regularly put in fresh batches of donuts. Highly recommend for breakfast or that mid-afternoon sweet snack craving. Easy for grab and go or they have a few tables and chairs to sit at.

top_10.name: Tartine Bakery
top_10.address: 600 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visiting Tartine Bakery was honestly one of those “this is why people rave about it” moments for me. The moment I walked in, the smell of freshly baked bread and butter-heavy pastries was irresistible.

I tried their croissant and the famous Morning Bun, and both were absolutely worth the hype. The croissant was perfectly flaky on the outside and soft inside, while the Morning Bun had this beautiful balance of sweetness, cinnamon, and citrus that made it unforgettable. You can truly taste the craftsmanship in every bite.

Yes, there was a line—but it moved quickly, and the energy inside was lively and warm. It felt like a place where food is taken seriously, but without any pretension.

My takeaway:
Tartine Bakery is not just a bakery, it’s an experience. If you’re in San Francisco and love good bread and pastries, this place deserves a spot on your list. I’d happily wait in that line again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the famous bakeries in San Francisco, this shop prepares its pastries on-site. Although there was a line when we arrived in the morning, it moved fairly quickly. The store itself isn't very large, but it does offer limited inside seating.

The bakery boasts a variety of croissants, cakes, and other pastries. We ordered a croque monsieur, almond croissant, jalapeño ham croissant, chocolate croissant, and a morning bun. For drinks, we chose a vanilla latte, regular latte, tea, and dirty matcha.

While the pastries were delicious, the coffee and matcha left much to be desired. The lattes were particularly light, lacking a strong coffee flavor, and the matcha had a similar issue. Additionally, despite ordering to eat in, our lattes were served in to-go cups.

If I could suggest improvements to the shop, it would be to revisit the recipes for the lattes and matcha to enhance their flavors.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very busy spot but definitely worth it. We tried a croissant, the morning bun, and pan au chocolat - they were all extremely delicious, light and buttery. We also tried the bread and butter with jam, which was ok, nothing special. I would go back and highly recommend if you’re visiting San Francisco. I did find it to be expensive, coming from Canada, however it’s probably comparable to other spots in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Another chilly but gorgeous morning in San Francisco and I am hungry. So I whip out my iPhone and use Google Maps to search for breakfast spots near the Mission District. Fortunately for me, Tartine Bakery pops up and I decide to head over.

I actually find parking pretty quickly, and I know that I got lucky. I lock up my car and walk over and as soon as I cross walk in the door, I smell deliciousness. I check out the display case and I pick a yummy looking scone and order the breakfast sandwich. I take my number and sit by the window. The bakery is busy and happy patrons chat while enjoying their food. The vibe is busy, but relaxed, warm and friendly A few minutes later, my breakfast sandwich is hand delivered and it looks tasty.

The golden toasted crust of the bread mixed with the soft savory scrambled eggs is the perfect answer to my hunger. I try to eat slowly so as to thoroughly enjoy my meal, but the sandwich is gone too quickly.

What can I say. It was scrumptious! I will definitely eat there again the next time that I’m in the Mission District.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tartine Bakery is a cute shop with a great vibe, perfectly situated in a lively area near Mission Dolores Park. While everything on display looked delicious, the morning bun is an absolute standout. I was honestly amazed at how good it was - incredibly fresh, soft, and flavorful in a way you wouldn't expect.

A good tip is that while the seating is limited, it's generally sufficient for a cafe of its size and it wasn't overly crowded during my visit.

For anyone visiting San Francisco, I would highly recommend a stop here, especially for the morning buns. It’s a genuinely delightful experience.

top_10.name: Lapisara Eatery
top_10.address: 698 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First time visit as we were actually headed for a nearby establishment.  We walked by and saw the menu out front, the cheery interior and decided to give it a try.  We lucked out on a weekend (arrived early) and were seated without a wait.  The staff was warm and welcoming.  Food came fast.  The variety on the menu was impressive and I loved the Thai additions.  Other than my Thai sausage being a bit gristly, everything was great.  The flavor of the sausage added a nice variation on the regular breakfast fare found elsewhere.  The lattes were adorable and post worthy in themselves.  Agree with other reviewers that the ube latte is beyond cute, if sweet drinks are not for you, opt for a regular or matcha latte.  The proprietor (or Management?)came to our table to check in which is always a nice touch.  We are really happy with this serendipitous stop for breakfast.  Don’t think twice about it, just go.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My husband and I came here on a Saturday morning around 10:30 and got a table right away. The staff was so friendly and the lattes and food were amazing. I can’t think of anything I would change about this place and I hope we get to try it again next time we visit San Francisco. 10/10. I had the Thai Panang omelette and it was like a cup of beef curry wrapped in egg. It was just the right amount of spicy and sweet. Reminded me of Khao soi which is my favorite Thai dish. The dressing on the salad was perfection and the potatoes were just a little crispy and so light and airy. My husband got the chicken and waffles and it was by far the best we’ve ever tried. The chicken was perfectly crispy and juicy. And the drinks are so cute and delicious. Don’t hesitate to try this place out.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Cozy corner cafe offering excellent menu of traditional favorites BUT you come here for the Thai inspired menu items.   I had the Thai Panang omelette and was one of best omelettes I’ve ever eaten.  Flavorful. Colorful.  The beef was tender. The vegetables were crispy. The sauce was exquisite and the presentation was first rate.

I don’t have a critical thing to say about this dish.  If you like spicy and bursting flavors, it’s a must have.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Consistently really good. As a local, the brunch is one of my absolute favorites in the city. Think regular brunch items with a Thai influence. Must have items are the chicken & waffles, the panang omlette, and the tom yum burrito. Also, the ube latte is delicious and so cute.

The restaurant is family ran and the staff is incredibly nice and friendly. They also have bottomless mimosas.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: At first, we thought we would not get any seats because they said it gets busy after 11 am. But we did not wait too long, even after 11. The staff were very friendly. The food was as expected, very good. Might want a reservation a day in advance, just in case.

top_10.name: Doppio Coffee & Brunch
top_10.address: 1551 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I visited Doppio Coffee & Brunch today and had a great experience. They offer delicious vegetarian breakfast options, and the coffee was excellent — they use Lavazza beans, which made the coffee really smooth and flavorful. The café was very clean, calm, and relaxing, with beautiful Turkish music playing in the background. It’s a perfect place for chatting and spending time with friends. The staff were also very friendly and welcoming.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: New favorite breakfast spot. The tomato mozzarella toast is hands-down one of the best I’ve ever had. Fresh, perfectly balanced, and so satisfying. Paired it with a matcha and it was the perfect start to the day. Highly recommend

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I've been here twice, their coffee is very good!
I ordered their egg&cheese crepe. The crepe had the perfect chewy texture you expect and had a lovely sprinkle fo fresh basil on top. However, the crepe was just warm when it came to the table (I was the only customer ordering food at the time).
I'd come back as it's a nice place with friendly staff, solid coffee and food in this neighborhood.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and professional. My friend got a Soma bagel, and he said it was delicious. I think the exterior sign needs to be redesigned.  The interior decor was modern and the layout was nice. Most importantly for me, the restroom was clean.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Doppio is a lovely brunch spot.  Well presented food at reasonable cost.  Great food options for kids including crepes.  A lot of seating.  Friendly and patient servers who waited for my kids to make up their mind. Highly recommended.

top_10.name: Sweet Maple
top_10.address: 2101 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Well worth the wait. Came on a busy weekend and there was a line … ended up waiting about 30 minutes for a table so not too bad. They make a good cup of coffee, and the service is pretty fast. I ordered the eggs with tots, and upgraded to the millionaires bacon, which was fabulous. Totally lived up to the hype. The omelette was also great, loved the multi color home potatoes. Will definitely come back. Yum!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious food and friendly service! The line may look long but moves pretty quickly, especially if you’re willing to sit outside in cooler weather. The Bay Bottom Omelet is one of my favorites and comes with a generous serving of crab. Their bread is AMAZING. The fried french toast is good but tastes like dessert/fair food, so be prepared! The millionaire bacon is melt-in-your-mouth, sweet, and spicy. It’s worth trying at least once. The food is always quality!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: When we saw the line around the block we knew it was worth the wait! Lovely little brunch place! Because of the size of our group we were sat quite fast! Service was ok, food was delicious and tasty, portions were small, and atmosphere was great! My favorite was the citrus batter french toast!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A great brunch spot in San Francisco that’s absolutely worth the visit. Parking can be a bit difficult to find, but once you’re inside, it’s easy to forget about the hassle. The food is consistently excellent—especially the bacon, which is perfectly cooked and full of flavor. I highly recommend the hash omelette; it’s hearty, well-seasoned, and very satisfying. Whether you’re stopping by for breakfast or lunch, it’s a solid choice. Expect to spend around $30–$35 per person, which feels fair for the quality and portions.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Line was long, but were seated within 15 min of waiting. Was clean, decorated nicely and food came out quick! Staff were on point. Live an hour away and definitely will return. Crab, spinach omelete had crab in every bite! Bacon sampler is a must. No complaints.
