top_10.name: Wooden Spoon
top_10.address: 2172 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Got big spoon, potatoes were the best. Granola french toast was unique. Fresh orange juice was delicious and refreshing. Would not recommend the huevos. Portion sizes are decent. There was a waiting line but it moved quick. Service was quick too. Bar seating is more than table seating but bar seating is super cramped. Open kitchen and bar, good atmosphere.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came in without a reservation mid day on a weekend and was able to get a spot at the bar without a wait. The bartender/waiter was incredibly friendly and helpful. In fact, all the staff were almost joyful and seemed happy to be there, which made this experience so pleasant. I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup and my partner had the standard breakfast. We both got mimosas as well, which the bartender was quick to ask us if we wanted refills. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was very relaxed and made for a nice afternoon. All of the eclectic wooden spoons that decorate the interior add to a their vibe and brand. We absolutely will be coming back. I saw quite a few things on the menu I’d like to try.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Really solid brunch spot with an upscale, clean vibe and a menu full of interesting options. We tried the Dr Birch muesli, veggie bowl, salmon scramble, and Swedish pancakes. The muesli stood out — hearty, not overly sweet, and packed with nuts and fruit. The salmon scramble was also really well done and felt satisfying without being heavy.

We went around noon on a Sunday, and it was packed, but the wait wasn’t bad if you’re fine with bar seating.

I’d definitely go back and work my way through more of the menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I read some reviews about the about the waiters being lovely to customers and happy to be there and it’s true. The 3 ladies we met while lunching there were helpful, had a lovely smile everytime they reached any table and didn’t seem to be in a rush to attend other customers and that did it for us. Apart from the food being amazing, it’s the customer service that’ll bring us back very soon!
Tuna melt w arugula salad w a lovely mild dressing + the hot sauce for the sandwich were great. The big spoon brkfst for my partner was also great! Gracias! We shall be back :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Nice little breakfast spot near the Castro. Staff are very friendly and helpful during our meal. They had a decent selection of breakfast entrees. The ones we ordered were all delicious and good portion. We were nicely stuffed after our meal.

testimonials: Got big spoon, potatoes were the best. Granola french toast was unique. Fresh orange juice was delicious and refreshing. Would not recommend the huevos. Portion sizes are decent. There was a waiting line but it moved quick. Service was quick too. Bar seating is more than table seating but bar seating is super cramped. Open kitchen and bar, good atmosphere.

Came in without a reservation mid day on a weekend and was able to get a spot at the bar without a wait. The bartender/waiter was incredibly friendly and helpful. In fact, all the staff were almost joyful and seemed happy to be there, which made this experience so pleasant. I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup and my partner had the standard breakfast. We both got mimosas as well, which the bartender was quick to ask us if we wanted refills. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was very relaxed and made for a nice afternoon. All of the eclectic wooden spoons that decorate the interior add to a their vibe and brand. We absolutely will be coming back. I saw quite a few things on the menu I’d like to try.

Really solid brunch spot with an upscale, clean vibe and a menu full of interesting options. We tried the Dr Birch muesli, veggie bowl, salmon scramble, and Swedish pancakes. The muesli stood out — hearty, not overly sweet, and packed with nuts and fruit. The salmon scramble was also really well done and felt satisfying without being heavy.

We went around noon on a Sunday, and it was packed, but the wait wasn’t bad if you’re fine with bar seating.

I’d definitely go back and work my way through more of the menu.

top_10.name: Eight AM Brunch
top_10.address: 1323 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I stopped here around 10 AM on a Saturday. It was busy so we had to wait a few minutes for a table. The service here was great and very quick. I had the open faced bagel with avocado, egg and ham - it was a great combo. The fruit cup that came with it was very generous and fresh. I also had a crepe with peanut butter and banana. It was delicious. I would definitely recommend stopping here.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Eight AM is an absolute gem for breakfast in the heart of San Francisco’s tourist area. The food is beautifully plated and just as delicious as it looks — every dish feels fresh and made with care. Service is quick, and the whole team is super friendly, which really adds to the experience. It’s the kind of spot that makes you want to linger a little longer over your coffee and enjoy the vibe. For me, it was the perfect way to start the day, and I’d recommend it to anyone visiting the city. Definitely worth the stop and easily a 5-star breakfast spot.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This brunch restaurant has a comfortable atmosphere, uses fresh ingredients, maintains high hygiene standards, and provides excellent service. I'll definitely come back here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Breakfast at EightAM Brunch was a great experience. We had the pancakes and the avocado toast – both were delicious. The avocado toast, in particular, was very generous in size and really satisfying. The dishes were fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The menu offers a nice variety, and the cozy, welcoming atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for a relaxed start to the day. Definitely worth a visit if you’re in the area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Went to Eight AM for brunch based on their exceptional reviews (4.6 at the time), and honestly… it felt pretty overrated. The overall vibe was chill and the staff was friendly, but the food didn’t live up to the hype — very mediocre and definitely overpriced in my opinion.

We ordered the Egg Frittata, Nutella Crepes, Waffle, and the Avocado Toast Sampler. The frittata came with house fries and fruit, and while it was decent, it didn’t feel like it was worth $22. The avocado toast sampler was especially disappointing — $30 for what was basically plain avocado spread on toast, topped with tomato, mozzarella, and a balsamic drizzle. It had almost no flavor, and definitely didn’t justify the price tag.

The latte was just okay — nothing special — and same goes for the crepes and waffles. Not bad, but nothing memorable either.

One annoying surprise: they automatically added a 20% gratuity, which they claim is for parties over 4 — that’s fine, but it really should be clearly mentioned somewhere on the menu or told upfront. I always tip anyway, but it’s the lack of transparency that was frustrating.

Overall, it’s a cute spot with a relaxed atmosphere, but the food was underwhelming and overpriced. Giving 3 stars because it wasn’t bad, just really average and not worth the hype or cost. Wouldn’t go out of my way to return.

testimonials: I stopped here around 10 AM on a Saturday. It was busy so we had to wait a few minutes for a table. The service here was great and very quick. I had the open faced bagel with avocado, egg and ham - it was a great combo. The fruit cup that came with it was very generous and fresh. I also had a crepe with peanut butter and banana. It was delicious. I would definitely recommend stopping here.

For me, it was the perfect way to start the day, and I’d recommend it to anyone visiting the city. Definitely worth the stop and easily a 5-star breakfast spot.
This brunch restaurant has a comfortable atmosphere, uses fresh ingredients, maintains high hygiene standards, and provides excellent service. I'll definitely come back here again.

top_10.name: Sisterita
top_10.address: 669 Commercial St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Almost gave this place 5 stars. Seems to be pretty popular, stopped in without a reservation and there was quite a wait. It was about 11am. Service was fast, maybe too fast but I understand due to the line out the door. All 4 of our plates tasted great & were fresh. We decided to go back the next day and unfortunately we were disappointed. Stopped in earlier the next day around 820. Service was again fast, but this time our food was cold and not as fresh as the day before. The steak was chewy & flavorless & the French fries were oily. Kind of wish we didn’t return and kept the satisfaction from the first day

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was late to my reservation due to a BART delay and they graciously moved my time for me. When I arrived, I had my bag and my backpack for my mini vacation. They didn't treat me like an inconvenience at all. Some restaurants are very lacking in their customer service, and they would have given me subpar service. The waiters were attentive and the food was great, except for one small piece of egg shell. I have done that before while cooking. And I was coming in with 40 minutes to spare for their operational hours, so, they were probably rushed. I totally understand. I also understand that when I get eggshell in my food it is because I am not professionally trained. The atmosphere was very pleasant, so was the decor. The matcha latte and tiger stripe latte were both delicious, and every bite of the florentine eggs benedict, except that last bite, was delicious. I was kinda disappointed, but everything in life can't be perfect. Solid 4 stars!

P.S. Be careful with the potatoes they're lava inside. My mouth is burned. Let them sit for like 5 minutes plus before eating them. They may look OK to eat, but no, they're literally lava.

I looked it up and restaurants are supposed to tell you the food is hot, especially if it isn't visible. I came to San Francisco for a 3 day feast, with reservations at various restaurants around the city, and this 1st restaurant ruined it for me. It's day 2 and I'm settling for anything on the menu that isn't hot at my second reservation this morning. Kinda upset about it. I'll have to visit again, but I will avoid Sisterita at all costs. Even if it were free, I don't appreciate negligence.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Super cute Café with friendly service.

We sat at the counter because the place was already packed, and that was our only option. Glad we did as we were served by the lovely April.

The coffee was amazing. So many other restaurants have incredibly strong and really bitter coffee and this was perfectly smooth and balanced. There are  lots of options for trying creative drinks and cocktails.

For breakfast I enjoyed the avocado toast with egg and tomatoes. My husband ordered the french onion soup which he gave thumbs up.

Will definitely return.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came in on a Saturday without a reservation and got a table in about 30 min. It was well worth the wait. Everything on the menu looked good, but we ended up going with the classic Benedict and the country scramble. Both very good. The drink and cocktail menu was also very good. My favorite being “the secret”, a lychee cocktail. The interior is very cute and art deco style with a library wall. I will absolutely be coming back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This breakfast and brunch spot was unbelievable! Service is excellent and the food was amazing. Lots of options and tons of different drinks. It looks like they serve sake infused drinks and not hard alcohol. Really cute spot! I got the French toast , eggs, and the spicy bacon was fantastic. Book a reservation!

top_10.name: Mymy
top_10.address: 1500 California St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: MyMy serves brunch with a level of precision that makes every dish feel engineered. The French toast is the standout: the salted butter is the key, and the bread has a texture close to bread pudding without collapsing. The burger is solid, but it’s better with the side salad instead of fries because the greens are fresher and pair well with the rest of the menu. The lobster eggs Benedict is best ordered with low mayo, which keeps the dish balanced, and the potato wedges are the strongest part of the plate. They’re cooked evenly, crisp on the outside, soft inside, and best with a little extra salt and Tapatía hot sauce.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This was the best brunch I’ve found so far in SF. I got the Baja California Benedict and it blew me away! It came with a very generous portion of dungeness crab. The hollandaise complimented the crab meat beautifully but didn’t overpower it. The pile of shrimp on the side was a pleasant, delicious surprise! And the crispy potatoes were everything you could ask for in a crispy potato. Perfect for scooping up the last bits of yolk and sauce.

Incredible meal and great service. I had no wait as a single diner on a Friday morning. Thank you so much! I can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely worth the wait! We spent almost 40 mins waiting in the line, but do not let that deter you.

The service was truly great. Despite the restaurant being completely packed, our server was attentive, friendly, and managed to check on us just often enough without hovering. She handled the high volume with incredible grace and a genuine smile.

​And the food? Oh my goodness! Everything we ordered was absolutely yummy! Fresh, perfectly cooked. The banana souffle pancakes were divine!

Will definitely come back :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great breakfast/brunch spot. We had the corn beef and a veggie scramble and both were delicious. Highly recommend! And the coffee is good too!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: happened across this little corner breakfast place and it just felt right to go in. homey feel, very much off the grill and onto your table vibes. just got some very simple sides today but the stuff on the menu looked really unique and i’d definitely go back to try them:) The fruit bowl had nicely cut oranges and blackberries which i appreciated, though it could have been less ripe. i liked the dishes they used too, it felt stylish but still homey. it’s an energy-filled, no-nonsense place where you know they’ll cook the eggs how you want them.

top_10.name: Son and Garden
top_10.address: 700 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Son & Garden is such a beautiful and dreamy spot! The interior is filled with flowers and pastel colors, making it perfect for photos. The food is not just pretty but also delicious. I loved corn pop and sticky rice tiger prawns– both were flavorful and well-presented. Service was friendly and fast. Great place for dinner with friends or a special date.

Highly recommend if you’re looking for a cute and cozy restaurant in the city!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The interior was nicely decorated and had a cozy vibe, but unfortunately the food was below average. The Benedict, omelet, and loco moco were all disappointing, and the customer service could definitely be improved. Overall, not a place I would return to or recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is the ultimate, it’s my second time and everything is so unique and interesting here. They have the best veggie burger I’ve ever had in my life! There is lots of cute flowers all over the place. It’s so unique and interesting. They have an area set up to take pictures. I definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is a 10 / 10 every time we go. I always recommend it to everyone who is visiting San Francisco.  It's beautiful, the food is beyond any exception you would have coming in. The decorations make you feel like you are in a fairy tale story.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Beautiful restaurant to visit and dine with your girls. The food was great and the bibe was excellent. We call ahead to get a table.

testimonials:

Highly recommend if you’re looking for a cute and cozy restaurant in the city!

top_10.name: Zazie
top_10.address: 941 Cole St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Overall, a decent experience.
Highlights: the Albert eggs benedict was delicious and the buttermilk pancake was very good (way better than the gingerbread and french toast in the Sarah Jane's flight.)

Low points: the hot chocolate was really watered down. Also, I really worry about the sanitary conditions of this place. The bathroom, the dishwashing, and the pass where the finished food sits before being served is all right next to each other and it's also the choke point where patrons walk through to get to the back area seating. The floor was also really slippery in this area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We ordered the pain de mie French toast with orange cinnamon batter and the Albert eggs benedict. Unfortunately, the French toast was underwhelming — it was essentially just a plain piece of bread with very little flavor or effort, lacking the richness or creativity you’d expect from a French restaurant. It didn’t feel like much was done to elevate the dish.

The eggs benedict, on the other hand, was fine and reliable. Nicely cooked eggs and a decent hollandaise, but nothing particularly memorable.

Overall, the experience was mixed. The savory option was satisfactory, but the French toast fell short of expectations.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Zazie is hands down one of our Top 5 favorite restaurants in the San Francisco Bay Area, and every visit reminds me exactly why.

As someone who’s a big, big meat eater, I rarely go for a meatless option—but the lemon ricotta ravioli here is in a league of its own. Bright, creamy, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, it’s one of the very few vegetarian dishes that leaves me totally satisfied without even thinking about meat. That says a lot.

Of course, when I do indulge my carnivorous side, the pork chop is absolutely divine—so tender it practically falls apart, and paired with buttery potatoes and the dreamiest mac and cheese. Rich, hearty, comforting. It’s the kind of dish you crave long after the meal is over.

The escargot deserves a special shoutout—it instantly transports me back to Paris. Delicately prepared, garlicky, and served with that unmistakable French flair. It’s the real deal.

And please, whatever you do, don’t skip dessert. The Chaud is an experience. Warm, gooey chocolate topped with toasted marshmallows—it’s like being wrapped in a hug that somehow takes you straight to Brussels. Yum, yum, YUM!

Zazie isn’t just a meal—it’s a mood, a memory, and a masterpiece every time. Whether you’re a die-hard meat lover or looking for something refined and soulful, this place delivers.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Lovely covered patio in the back. Excellent pate and very good pork chop with pears and coq au Vin. Will be back next time we're in SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I absolutely love this place! The food is incredible—fresh, flavorful, and thoughtfully made. We had the Un, Deux, Trois...and let me just say, upgrade to the chicken apple sausage and the Miracle Pancakes (sour cream and poppyseed)! They are absolutely next level—fluffy, rich, and totally unique. The Cannes Scrambled Eggs were also so delicious, perfectly cooked and full of flavor.

What really sets Zazie apart, though, is how they treat their staff. No tips are expected because their team is compensated fairly—and that just makes the whole experience feel even better. Every restaurant should operate this way. We left full, happy, and already planning our next visit.

top_10.name: Brenda's French Soul Food
top_10.address: 652 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had a wonderful breakfast here. The staff was friendly, warm, and on top of everything. Water service was great and I appreciated that they offered half orders for several items.

The Bananas Foster French toast was amazing, rich without being too sweet. The andouille sausage was fantastic and full of flavor, and the strawberry jam was truly heavenly. I also had an iced Grandma’s Coffee with black walnut and whipped cream, which was delicious and felt like such a fun treat.

We ordered the beignets too. They were a little dense, but the flavor was still very good.

Overall, a great breakfast spot with excellent service and food that really stands out. I would definitely go back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Favorite breakfast and brunch in San Francisco, it's popular for good reasons! My favorite spot everytime I come back stateside, it's the breakfast that gives me life after a 12 hour flight. It's a classic, and it stayed the same throughout the years.

Service is nice, place is lovely. The area around is not the safest but it's safe inside.

Food is awesome, their homemade watermelon sweet tea is my liquid IV. The beignets are delicious, the grits are buttery, the meat is tender and juicy. Their specials are always worth trying! They also have breakfast sandwiches that are cheap ($5-$6) and good to go, after 10 you get a free sando!

The place used to be packed every morning, now it's a little more sparse, things seem to have changed through the pandemic.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Echo all the great reviews here. Quick service at 10:00 am on a Saturday morning. Pork belly grits were delicious. Nice and hot. Great crisp on the pork. Lots of good cheese and poached egg too. Spicy onion jam was really good. Croque Monsieur and slaw was good. Got the 3 way (plain, apple, chocolate) beignets. My fave was the plain, just because I like a pure beignet, but the chocolate and apple were also good. Good place to go!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Honestly this place is perfect. I feel like it’s just the right size and that they’ve truly perfected the service speed, style,portions and recipes. I’d almost not want to see them expand it because they do it so well currently.  You know how like when you double a recipe sometimes it doesn’t come out quite right (or that could be just me 🤣).

Anyways I got the sampler platter which looking back at the menu looks more like it could’ve been the daily special and not always on the menu. The greens were good solid greens like just classic that you could eat continuously. The red beans and rice were definitely a hit my mom and aunt both make them like that. The gumbo is the most authentic gumbo I’ve had outside of my uncles. What do I mean by that? Normally if it has not been made by my uncle (from a line of Prudhommes out of Louisiana I think) the gumbos on the menus I’ve had are usually just a pretty good soup. Theres always something just off about them but this gumbo was heart warming and I could only imagine what the deluxe version tastes like. If I had more time here I would’ve tried it! My husband had the catfish de allemands and I think he said something along the lines of my God almighty when he tried it haha 😂. Safe to say he loved it. It was pretty good. Honestly we were both thrown off by the pecans in the rice but they were good but I’d never have them anywhere else. Only at Brenda’s now can you pecans in my rice I guess. Ok let’s talk about the pillow soft hot beignet that I will dream about as we make our way back to the east coast. Wow it was probably the best no I’m sure thee absolute best one I’ve ever had. I think that’s what princess Tiana’s must have been based off of for sure because they truly were amazing.

Overall the staff was friendly and efficient. They were not playing no games with us. If the came over and we weren’t ready they weren’t wasting no time. They quickly said “we’ll give you a few more minutes” and I appreciated that because they were just so many good things to bounce between hence why I got a sampler. But again we didn’t feel rushed or pushed off or like anyone was rude. Everything was efficient well done and felt like a well oiled machine. I hope to make it back one day!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We went on Christmas day, so of course it was super busy, without a reservation the wait was 45 minutes to an hour. Once we sat down, the food came out pretty fast and everything taste too good however it’s hard to appreciate considering the wait. The shrimp and grits were very flavorful however, with the smoothness of the grits, as well as the sauces added, it felt a bit soupy. The crawfish beignets were a little light on the crawfish however, the crab beignet was amazing and full. I’d recommend adding an egg or two or something else to the grits to give it some texture.

testimonials:
We had a wonderful breakfast here. The staff was friendly, warm, and on top of everything. Water service was great and I appreciated that they offered half orders for several items.

The Bananas Foster French toast was amazing, rich without being too sweet. The andouille sausage was fantastic and full of flavor, and the strawberry jam was truly heavenly. I also had an iced Grandma’s Coffee with black walnut and whipped cream, which was delicious and felt like such a fun treat.

We ordered the beignets too. They were a little dense, but the flavor was still very good.

Overall, a great breakfast spot with excellent service and food that really stands out. I would definitely go back.

Favorite breakfast and brunch in San Francisco, it's popular for good reasons! My favorite spot everytime I come back stateside, it's the breakfast that gives me life after a 12 hour flight. It's a classic, and it stayed the same throughout the years.

Service is nice, place is lovely. The area around is not the safest but it's safe inside.

Food is awesome, their homemade watermelon sweet tea is my liquid IV. The beignets are delicious, the grits are buttery, the meat is tender and juicy. Their specials are always worth trying! They also have breakfast sandwiches that are cheap ($5-$6) and good to go, after 10 you get a free sando!

The place used to be packed every morning, now it's a little more sparse, things seem to have changed through the pandemic.

Echo all the great reviews here. Quick service at 10:00 am on a Saturday morning. Pork belly grits were delicious. Nice and hot. Great crisp on the pork. Lots of good cheese and poached egg too. Spicy onion jam was really good. Croque Monsieur and slaw was good. Got the 3 way (plain, apple, chocolate) beignets. My fave was the plain, just because I like a pure beignet, but the chocolate and apple were also good. Good place to go!

top_10.name: Kuma Sushi + Sake
top_10.address: 1040 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: In San Francisco for one night and wanted some great sushi and we lucked out finding this gem of a place. We grabbed a reservation which I highly recommend since it was packed. We sat at the sushi bar with a great view to watch them work their magic. I got the jackalope which was recommended by our sever and it was so good and I also ordered the Fresco which was also really yummy. My husband got sashimi of all kinds and loved it all. We also got a seaweed salad which was great too.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Cute atmosphere, amazing, attentive service and great food! Def some of the best sushi my fiancé and I have had yet. We aren’t from the area but came from our engagement shoot over at city hall and we loveeee sushi- we decided what better place to get fresh sushi than sf- we couldn’t be more pleased with our pick! the cinch roll and the hey girl rolls were my personal fav, but everything was so tasty. And the sake🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟we even got the sweetest little surprise at the end as a congratulations to us on our upcoming wedding🥹🫶🏻 100000/10 food + experience and can’t wait to be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The chili sauce in the local tofu is truly soooo amazing!!! And all the fish is so fresh and tasty; favor combo is fantastic too!! I’m in love with this place

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Randomly stopped by this place. Just to get Miso and couldn’t stop ourselves and ordered some sushi.. Food and atmosphere were amazing!! I believe somebody heard that is my birthday and brought for me ice cream!! It’s was cherry on top! Definitely coming back!!!  💗💗💗💗💗🥳🌸

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’m a Japanese who started eating raw fish at the age of 7. I can proudly say that Kuma Sushi + Sake is an amazing sushi restaurant in every way!

It’s a popular sushi place so their fish is always fresh. Here, I had the freshest Santa Barbara uni that I have ever had in my life.

The flavors are innovative & creative.  I had an appetizer of “Katsuo Tataki”and the combination of the flavors was incredible.

Their rolls are fun to try and I love “Hey Girl” and “Jackalope.” I can eat them every day!

I love how they put the origins of each fish on the menu so we know where our fish came from.

Anyways, eating is believing. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Saru Sushi Bar
top_10.address: 3856 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you enjoy great, fresh quality sushi this is the place to go when in San Francisco. I tried many sushi where I'm from but this place is hands down the best that I have had. The Green Tea is Great! I recommend trying the White Out Roll, Baked Scallop Roll, Watermelon Roll and the Halibut Tartar. You will not be disappointed. I didn't get to try the Shrimp heads but will when I come back. Great Atmosphere and Staff.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is our favorite sushi spot in the city! The staff is incredibly friendly, the fish is always fresh, and there is always something new to try! We always love getting recommendations on what to order and have learned so much about different types of sushi from coming here! So lucky to have this spot in our neighborhood!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Our server was the best I’ve had in a while. She was fun and a delight to talk with concerning my sake and sushi choices. I’ll definitely be back again when I’m in SF

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Never disappoints and always consistent - definitely the best and most recommended place for anyone visiting San Francisco craving for nigiri, sushi and sashimi. Their 5 pieces of Salmon Omakase is absolutely heaven on earth!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is, by far, the best sushi between Noe, the Castro, and the Mission. Super tiny spot with delicious nigiri, wide sake selection, and interesting appetizers. There are no reservations so be sure to show up at open or be prepared to wait up to an hour for your table. I highly recommend the spicy cracker to start. The place isn't cheap, but you won't feel cheated.

testimonials: If you enjoy great, fresh quality sushi this is the place to go when in San Francisco. I tried many sushi where I'm from but this place is hands down the best that I have had. The Green Tea is Great! I recommend trying the White Out Roll, Baked Scallop Roll, Watermelon Roll and the Halibut Tartar. You will not be disappointed. I didn't get to try the Shrimp heads but will when I come back. Great Atmosphere and Staff.

This is our favorite sushi spot in the city! The staff is incredibly friendly, the fish is always fresh, and there is always something new to try! We always love getting recommendations on what to order and have learned so much about different types of sushi from coming here! So lucky to have this spot in our neighborhood!
Our server was the best I’ve had in a while. She was fun and a delight to talk with concerning my sake and sushi choices. I’ll definitely be back again when I’m in SF

top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
All vegan Japanese restaurant that has celiac-safe GF options - wow! Super excited to try this place so when I was in the area at 4:15 last Sunday, having missed lunch, thought I’d stop by. Was surprised to see there were already people waiting for it to open and the line was quite long when it opened at 4:30. Reservations are recommended but we were lucky enough to be accommodated. A charming dining area, albeit not a ton of elbow room. Seating options include tables up to four, up to two, and a small sushi bar.

The waitstaff were very friendly and responsive and helpful with recommendations.

Food wise, everything was good, including the miso soup and yuba salad, but the rolls are where the magic is. They’re all beautifully crafted and presented. We tried the California roll (great!), sweet tofu nigiri, Missing piece (made GF), and Boddy and Soul (recommended, and a winner by my dining partner, but not GF).

It was a real delight to enjoy such delicious food, carefully created, crafted, and presented, making it a multi sensory treat.

Wish there was a GF tempura option to make more of the rolls available to celiacs, but I loved what I had. Definitely recommend the fun, relaxed, down to earth atmosphere and uniquely Japanese vibe. Think stylish onsen, an indulgence where you leave feeling fulfilled, healthy, and happy!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Delicious vegan sushi that actually delivers on flavor! The Dynamite Roll (10/10) was the highlight, followed closely by the Roasted Bell Pepper Nigiri (9/10). The Shishito Peppers and Candlestick roll were also solid (8/10).

The price point feels high given the portion sizes, but the technique is impressive and it gives vegans a genuine sushi experience. Highly recommended for the execution, especially if you don't eat fish.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This vegan sushi restaurant is outstanding, offering an amazing experience. Everything was absolutely mind-blowingly delicious. I would love to eat here every day. The service was wonderful, and everything arrived impressively quickly considering the restaurant was full shortly after opening. Reservations are required, and we'll worth the wait. The menu, atmosphere, and interior design are A+, 10/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Such a hot spot for a reason! It’s an all-vegan menu that’s DELICIOUS. My vegan partner was overwhelmed by choice.

We got tea (small), shishito peppers (ok), green mango nigiri (amazing), three speciality rolls (yummm), and dessert (would pass on this and get another roll next time). Our entire order ended up a little over $100. And just FYI the habanero sauce is no joke.

Very sweet staff and clean bathrooms.

Would go back and would recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. Amazing plant-based, non processed, organic and locally sourced food, beautiful atmosphere, vibey ambiance, attentive and sweet staff. 11/10. Great for date night, a friend link up, or even a stop for dinner after work. Sitting at the bar vs the dining room is a different experience. Ask for the dessert menu! The red bean mochi donut is incredible.

top_10.name: KUSAKABE
top_10.address: 584 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Pretty good Omakase, although was disappointed by the communication in their service. I called earlier in the day to confirm my reservation was for the counter, to which they confirmed over the phone. When we arrived, they sat us a table when there was clearly space for 2 at the counter. I let the host know and it seemed like an inconvenience to him, yet he was able to move us to the counter. He let us know it would be an additional amount to sit there, which is fine, however the person on the phone failed to mention it whatsoever. Overall, the dinner was good.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ugh, really really wanted to love this place. This was my fifth omakase (not at this restaurant); the staff were super friendly and attentive but the sushi and flavors were lack luster to off. I also got very very sick as soon as I walked out….that has never happened to me before with sushi and like I said I have sushi from a wide range of places often (and I actually had sushi 3 times this very week already). The space is really small and it doesn’t feel like there’s any special effort to make it fit the price tag…just dim lights, wood chairs, not even a minimalist edge or anything chic. This would not be a place to dress up. The super high rating is a bit confusing. I paid $400/pp for the sushi and sake pairing, which I was happy to do but I do wish the sushi had been worth it . The sake pairing was excellently selected, the flavors went together very well. Altogether, a bit disappointed and very confused as to why I essentially threw up most of it up upon leaving. I’m typically an easy sell and I wish this had been great so I could come back often. I parked in a garage pretty close by, there were a few.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Took my sister for her birthday meal for an 8PM dinner seating!

Booking: book via tock...if you need to cancel, you can call them, I believe 1-2 days beforehand for a refund.

Requested for bar seating (did mention it would be $20/pp to guarantee) but seems like since i booked early enough and had a bday, so they were willing to accommodate without me needing to pay additional.

2 omakase $185/ea
asahi draft $9
genmai cha $8
sf mandate 5%

My sister thoroughly enjoyed the meal. I personally, probably because I wasn't that hungry, overall thought it was ok. In my opinion, the chefs here do put more sauce/extra flavors on the fish, which isn't my preference, as I like the fish to be the main highlight.

Chef Leo was friendly and attentive.

They deduct the tock deposit from the final bill. 20% auto gratuity.

Street parking only.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Beautiful restaurant for an evening's entertainment! The short Omakase tasting menu had 19 different items!!! They were all so varied and delicious! I especially loved the savory umami custard with tobiko fish eggs. The sushi was amazing and each had a different topping such as wasabi or shiso or ginger and chives. The sake and tea were also good. I loved the yuzu/shiso sorbet!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had the petite omakase with the sake pairing. Everything was amazing and the chef was very friendly and explained every serving well. Highly recommend the sake pairing. Definitely will be back.

top_10.name: Ju-Ni
top_10.address: 1335 Fulton St STE 101, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
ju-ni focuses on the fish with some delicious nigiri pieces, but overall the ambiance & service was distracting and overpriced for the number of pieces served. overall, glad I tried it and loved the standout pieces, but wouldn’t recommend.

service: our chef wasn’t bad but the difference of service between our seating and the one next to us was night and day. ended up listening to the other chef more since he explained each dish with detail while ours mumbled his way through.

standout dishes: fatty tuna, red snapper, salmon roe with monkfish pate

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 16-course omakase service in this tiny location. The fish was outstanding, half of the courses were interesting, memorable, and outstanding and only two courses were "just fine" but that's gonna come down to personal preferences. Limited drink options, and service was fine but nothing to write home about. Come for the fantastic fish and creative courses. Was pretty loud whole I was there for to a business dinner that was very boisterous, but seems like that's probably rare for this place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ju-Ni literally means “twelve” in Japanese, a nod to the original 12-seat counter and the tight, timed omakase format. Service is mostly nigiri, paced one piece at a time, with a lot of torch work at the counter.  ￼ Chef-owner Geoffrey Lee’s signature bite is the “ikura with ankimo”: salmon roe topped with shaved, deep-frozen ankimo (monkfish liver, often called “foie gras of the sea”). Lee has described it as “our dish at Ju-Ni,” and it’s a standout.  ￼

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The service was very disappointing. I had an 8pm reservation yet had to wait 25 minutes to be seated. While normally I do not mind waiting, it is frustrating that they are so strict about customers arriving on time but do not uphold the same standards for themselves. There was also a mandatory service fee, which should have been reflected in far better service.

The food itself was okay but not great compared to the price. You can get better sushi at similar prices elsewhere. Nothing special, and each nigiri was not very cohesive. Also the starting dish was just bad and doesn’t make sense.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Ju-Ni is a standout. ​Every component of the experience was flawless. The shari (sushi rice) was seasoned to perfection, providing the ideal foundation for the fish. The chef's application of sauces and glazes was subtle yet enhanced every bite without overpowering the star of the show: the fish.

​The quality of the neta (toppings) was exceptional, and for good reason -- I learned that everything, aside from the salmon, is imported directly from Japan just the day before service. You can truly taste the difference that level of freshness makes. From the delicate madai to uni, each piece was a testament to quality and skilled preparation.

It's been a long time since I've had high-end nigiri this satisfying in the Bay Area, especially post-pandemic. Highly recommended for any serious sushi lover.

top_10.name: Roka Akor - San Francisco
top_10.address: 801 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely an amazing experience.  Andrew was our server and he was great. His knowledge and helpfulness was great and made our night that much better . A5 Wagyu , uni and uni on bluefin as well as spotted prawns with uni and caviar.  Bone marrow and all. Absolutely an amazing experience. Would recommend it to anyone .
I’ve never bought a Japanese A5 steak before . I finally did it and it melted in my mouth . Worth it especially as Christmas gift to myself .

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Pros: the food was well prepared and promptly delivered. We sat in the downstairs area that was giving speakeasy vibes and I really enjoyed it. If you are sensitive to sound though, you may not like it during prime time because when it fills up, it is very loud in there. I didn’t mind it, but I know some people like a more peaceful surrounding in which case the upstairs would’ve probably been better.

As you can see from the photos, we had a good variety of food and I particularly like my dessert to come out with my supper and they delivered on that request properly.

The coffee machine was broken, which was a disappointment so I ended up having green tea with my dessert, but was still enjoyable.

The crispy Brussels were perfect, and the dessert was the perfect amount of rich and flavorful. I do believe the dessert was a bit overpriced, but it was a work dinner that a client paid for so I can’t complain too much.

Cons: nothing significant. Our server was great and even got us a complementary hot plate to try. We only got delayed slightly with my tea, but it didn’t ruin the experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The omakase tasting menu is really great. Highlight for the mushroom risotto that comes in one of the courses. The place is quite expensive, but it's a nice experience for a nice occasion.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great ambiance, great drinks and spectacular food. Every dish is rich in flavor leaving me eager to try more. They have 2 separate dining areas, upper level being bright and perfect for families with the lower level having their bar with dim lighting and plenty of seating; if you are interested in their Happy Hour then you must dine downstairs as it is not applicable to the upstairs dining room. Depending on when you go, there can be long wait times but overall food still seemed to come out fairly quickly after ordering. Of my times of dining, I do prefer getting multiple small dishes and sharing to really take advantage and enjoy more of the menu. Personal favorites of mine will be any Lychee cocktail of theirs, the dessert platter to endulge in a variety of sweets and their 6oz Wagyu Beef with Bone Marrow. My boyfriend and I will now make any excuse to come as it has climbed the list of one of our favorite spots in the city.
Parking in the area is very limited, alot extra time for it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Roka Akor absolutely delivers when it comes to food and atmosphere. The sushi was fresh, creative, and beautifully presented—easily some of the best I’ve had. The entire menu felt thoughtfully crafted, and the flavors were spot on. You can tell the chefs here really know what they’re doing. We ordered multiple appetizers and entrees to share as well as all the desserts.  I wouldn't choose any dessert again as they were pretty mediocre

The ambiance is also top-tier. Sleek, modern, and upscale, but still warm and comfortable. It's the kind of place that feels special without being stuffy. Add to that an excellent spirits list with rare whiskies, great sake options, and inventive cocktails—it’s a dream for anyone who appreciates a good drink with their meal.

Only downside? The timing between courses was off. The brought our food to soon, making our business party of 6 feel overly rushed which  threw off the rhythm of the evening. And unfortunately, the restroom was in poor shape—not what you'd expect from a restaurant of this caliber.

All in all, Roku Akor is still 100% worth a visit for the food and vibe alone. Just hoping they tighten up service timing and take better care of the facilities next time. If they do, it’s easily a 5-star spot!

top_10.name: Ebisu Restaurant
top_10.address: 1283 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is by far my favourite restaurant in SF! The quality of the fish, the service, the flavour! Everything was top notch. If you can, try to be seated at the bar so you can talk directly to the chef… it adds to the experience!

Expect to wait 30min before getting seated. The restaurant is packed on Friday or Saturday nights!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: You can't call to make a reservation here. You'll need to walk in and either be seated immediately or write your name on the list. Whatever happens as long as you get to sit down and eat at this establishment is your good fortune. I had the mackerel dinner, my son had the salmon dinner, and my partner had all types of sushi. I could barely speak because my tastebuds were too busy having a party in my mouth. Definitely worth any wait!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First when I come in they put me at the darkest corner in the restaurant and I asked to move to another table.

Second, no one ask for what I want to drink after 5 minutes I sat down. (For some reason all the staff including the chef were focusing on one specific table may be VIP I guess)

Should have more options on Omakase, I don't mind to pay more.
But if I ordered Omakase with only regular Salmon, Tuna, Albacore, Ikura and MASAGO without even 1 piece of UNI or Scallop why would I order deluxe sushi or Omakase.

Ankimo, first time ever with no sauce and I had to ask for ponzu sauce on the side .

Conclusion, way overrated for their stars.

去之前期望太高👀
食完之後食物和服務水準比預期差太遠！😔😔😔

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Sorry for not visiting sooner. Top sushi nigiri with such delicious soft sushi rice. No wonder there was a line for a seat. I will definitely be hitting this place up more often. No joke.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This was my first time being at Ebisu. I had a really wonderful time. I was there with my family. There were five of us. We all ordered stuff and ate family style. I really wish I had taken pictures of the food because it was beautiful and the service was really fast especially for being so crowded. On a Friday night. I will go back again and take photos of my food.
I will go back again!

testimonials:
This is by far my favourite restaurant in SF! The quality of the fish, the service, the flavour! Everything was top notch. If you can, try to be seated at the bar so you can talk directly to the chef… it adds to the experience!

Expect to wait 30min before getting seated. The restaurant is packed on Friday or Saturday nights!

You can't call to make a reservation here. You'll need to walk in and either be seated immediately or write your name on the list. Whatever happens as long as you get to sit down and eat at this establishment is your good fortune. I had the mackerel dinner, my son had the salmon dinner, and my partner had all types of sushi. I could barely speak because my tastebuds were too busy having a party in my mouth. Definitely worth any wait!!!

First when I come in they put me at the darkest corner in the restaurant and I asked to move to another table.

Second, no one ask for what I want to drink after 5 minutes I sat down. (For some reason all the staff including the chef were focusing on one specific table may be VIP I guess)

Should have more options on Omakase, I don't mind to pay more.
But if I ordered Omakase with only regular Salmon, Tuna, Albacore, Ikura and MASAGO without even 1 piece of UNI or Scallop why would I order deluxe sushi or Omakase.

Ankimo, first time ever with no sauce and I had to ask for ponzu sauce on the side .

Conclusion, way overrated for their stars.

去之前期望太高👀
食完之後食物和服務水準比預期差太遠！😔😔😔

top_10.name: AKIKOS
top_10.address: 430 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here recently to celebrate with work colleagues. Food and service were excellent as usual. Atmosphere is probably still my favorite part about Akikos. It’s modern and open versus a more traditional counter experience. Highly recommended for groups. A la carte menu ensures everyone is satisfied including providing an opportunity to order another bite of something particularly enjoyable on the menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolute delight and the best omakase and nigiri I have ever had. We sat at the bar. Each dish in the otsumami was incredible. I think my favorites were the Fuji Salmon, Sashimi, Robusuta, and Chawanmushi. I thought they had set the bar quite high with the otsumami but the nigiri did not disappoint at all. The rice is steamed very fresh and each piece was made in front of us. The fish intentionally at room temperature with the warm rice really made the flavors pop in a way I had never experienced before with nigiri. Just fantastic. Our chef was lovely to watch and everything she made was perfection. I think my favorites were Karei, Kanpachi, tokishirazu, and botan ebi. We liked all the items so much when they gave us the additional menu we ordered a few more pieces. Can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the most delicious meals I’ve had in a very long time. We had the Omakase and each course was unique and tasty. Service was impeccable and the ambience was perfect. Overall a great dining experience. Thank you!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Before going this time, I looked it up again and saw that the reviews were extremely polarized.
I honestly thought I’d end up on the good side of that divide… but nope.

It made me realize that maybe my taste back then just wasn’t that great.

Not a single dish was memorable or impressive.
And the service — honestly? It felt like if you weren’t actively watching the server, she’d roll her eyes at you behind your back, like you somehow owed her something. It was incredibly unpleasant.

The overall service vibe was bad, too.
And the music?? Straight-up pop music, like being in a bar — but isn’t this supposed to be a Japanese omakase? I genuinely don’t get it.

And then at the end, the bill had a 6% “mandate fee” added on???
My friend said it was only mentioned in tiny print somewhere on the menu.

In the end it came out to $300+ per person.
With that kind of money, there are so many better places I could eat at.
Why would I do this to myself again? 😡😡😡

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Recommended by our fav omakasein Virginia (Modan) we had an unforgettable omakase experience at AKIKOS (430 Folsom St, San Francisco’s East Cut). The meticulously prepared dishes were exquisite—pristine fish from Toyosu, innovative dry-aging, and standout touches like toro-caviar shokupan. Flavors were refined, fresh, and perfectly balanced.
Service was superior: attentive, knowledgeable, and warm, especially at the chef’s counter. The spacious interior and well-lit bar felt modern, elegant, and inviting.
Too bad another SF spot shares a similar name (Akiko’s Sushi Bar)—it’s nowhere near this level. Book the right one for top-tier Japanese cuisine. Highly recommended!

One of the most delicious meals I’ve had in a very long time. We had the Omakase and each course was unique and tasty. Service was impeccable and the ambience was perfect. Overall a great dining experience. Thank you!

top_10.name: Hinata
top_10.address: 810 Van Ness Ave, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
great service and really enjoyed the experience!!

the chefs and hosts were all extremely friendly and made sure to keep our waters full and fill our plates right when we finished eating

that atmosphere was intimate and a great place for a small birthday celebration!

the omakase itself was quiet filling and the ice cream was delicious. I have had omakase at similar price point that i enjoyed more, but overall still had a great experience due to the presentation and majority of the plates!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Food and service were excellent - some of the best nigiri I’ve had. However, we were very disappointed to not be able to sit at the bar as we drove 3 hrs for our first omakase experience. I am a sushi chef myself and was excited to watch the sushi being made and engage with the chefs.

We were seated at a table away from the bar. We made our reservation online through open table, and nowhere did it mention reserving the bar versus a table. There is only a section for “special requests” which I interpreted as a section to mention any food allergies, etc. As a result, we did not receive the full omakase experience we were expecting. This is something that should be clarified during the reservation process to avoid disappointing future customers. Maybe a specific question asking “bar” or “table” seating reservation.

We would be happy to return for another experience, and next time I will be sure to call the restaurant directly to make sure they have my reservation down to be seated at the bar.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Such a reasonably priced omakase! The corkage fee is only $35, which is a great deal. The taste, the portions—everything was excellent. It’s a hidden gem with no reason not to go. I’m definitely going every time I come to San Francisco. This is the second sushi spot opened in SF by the owner of Sushi Jin, and the quality is so good, it’s totally worth the money.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Worth the price! ~$100/person omakase before tax.  I’ve been here twice and both times were great — fresh seafood, good pace, great ambiance.  Get the Buckwheat tea, and try to get bar seats

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: In brief, pretty good omakase, especially for the value —18 pieces for a little over $120. None of the courses did I think were “not fresh.” Again, will recommend for the value. My only critique is the chef should give us new plates instead of wiping down our plates with the SAME cloth for each person.

top_10.name: Wako Japanese Restaurant
top_10.address: 211 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was the best sushi Omakase I've had. Period. It was worth all the decisions Ive made to get me into that seat eating the freshest and meatiest pieces with perfect preparation. This will haunt me until I come back a year later. I can only tell time by the anchor to this experience. What time is it? Oh just 3 days since I had the best sushi of my life. Chef was super friendly and even showed us his knife collection. Come hungry. Approx 2 hours for the full course.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We had a lovely anniversary dinner here. The omakase was very well constructed with a balance of hot and cold dishes that complemented each other really well. The sushi was clearly meticulously made and each dish was a delight to enjoy. Highly recommend the omakase and hot sake pairing!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My partner and I celebrated our 7-year anniversary at Wako and had an incredible experience - every bite we had was perfectly balanced and considered in the context of the meal. Everything was delicious but Chef Jin’s enthusiasm for the seasonal pike mackerel made me love it the most! Such obvious and deep respect for the food from everyone on staff, and the relaxed and cheerful vibe made it even better. We loved the staff and Chefs Jin and Ivan took care of us from the moment we stepped in the door - service was a true highlight. Friendly, funny, warm, and unpretentious, and everything you eat is explained super clearly and accessibly. Wako was the best meal I’ve had in several years, and we couldn’t have been happier to support a business run by such lovely people. Worth every penny. We’ll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First time trying omakase, so I don't have anythin to compare this to... but overall we really enjoyed the experience. Each piece was fresh and delicious. Everyone was very friendly and knowledgeable. There was lots of variety and flavors. I did lots of research based on friends' recommendations and local SF articles. Wako ranked highly for quality, value, and experience. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Such a wonderful wonderful meal. Well paced, well executed, nice service, tasty food and more.

Definitely the best omakase we've had in San Francisco this past year. The others were good, but this one was special, had the right amount of food and paced it nicely for 2 hours. Really loved hows they got the sushi two at a time, rather than too many pieces. They also noticed my wife not eating some of the rice, and reduced the amount of rice in the future pieces.

Would strongly recommend this place, go here now :)

top_10.name: Sriracha Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 1319 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Sriracha Thai is no frills, tasty Thai food with a cozy cafe like ambience.

The Thai fried rice was great with the sweet spicy and shrimpy.

The tom kha was mild and creamy. The green curry was very fragrant and on the thicker side.

The chicken wings were a tad sweet.

Service was great. And proximity to Golden gate park makes it a solid option for affordable tasty Thai food in SF.

Will be going back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is a really cute spot! Only had to wait 5 minutes for a table, but the area is filled. A very warm environment for a date night!

Food was amazing, we got a curry pan fried chicken pot sticker, grilled prawns, and pad se eww.

All the food tasted amazing, and I’ll definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here for a quick lunch. The food was good but not spectacular. I appreciated that they cooked my dish with fresh tofu vs fried per my request. The crispy chicken was the wrong choice for us. It was deep fried chicken skin so it was not a healthy choice. It was very busy and it seems like it has a loyal lunchtime crowd. The service was fast and efficient.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Our meal at Sriracha was fantastic! The rich, aromatic curry was bursting with flavor, perfectly complementing the savory and slightly sweet Pad Thai. Each dish was fresh and expertly prepared. The service was equally wonderful—attentive and friendly, making our dining experience truly delightful. We will definitely be returning soon for more

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We bumped into a couple that just exited the restaurant who told us that the food is awesome. So usually when that happens it's definitely great and the expectations were accordingly high.

What shall I say - It was mouthwateringly delicious! The Laab was one of the best I've ever had and the Ice tea is just absolutely awesome (I ordered 2!) For the main course I had the "south thai-style fried chicken" (I don't recall the asian name, I'm sorry)
It was the most tender and crispiest chicken I had in a long time. We'll definitely want to come back here and I can recommend this place without any hesitation!

top_10.name: New Thai Elephant
top_10.address: 393 Bay St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food is average. Red curry is too sweet. The roast pork was above average and the pork with basil was the best amongst the dishes ordered. Their take away portions were of decent size and hence pretty fair pricing for local standards. Restaurant size is big but service a little slow in terms of food prep. Staff were friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great Asian cuisine with a solid menu selection. The food was delicious, reasonably priced, and the portion sizes were just right. The décor really adds to the experience, with beautiful Thai artwork throughout the venue and an incredible elephant feature wall that really stands out.

However, the night I visited felt quite chaotic. The restaurant seemed short-staffed, and the waitress was clearly under the pump doing her best. Unfortunately, this meant long waits for meals, and even food delivery drivers were visibly frustrated by delays.

Overall, tasty food and a lovely setting, but the service experience would definitely improve with a few extra staff on shift.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great Thai spot close to Fisherman’s Wharf! Dishes are really good and at great prices. Got the Panang curry and it was delicious and perfectly seasoned! Relatively short wait and the environment is lively for meeting with friends. Free ice cream for reviews as well!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We visited New Thai Elephant (SF) for dinner and ordered roti for starters, Pad Kee Mao with chicken, green curry with veggies & tofu (no meat/fish sauce) that came with Jasmine rice and ordered Thai Tea.

The roti was just okay- we’ve had far better at Thai Spice at where it’s crispier and the sauce is more flavorful. The Pad Kee Mao was just okay—we’ve had much better elsewhere. The green curry, however, was a real letdown: the consistency was thin and watery, more like a soup than a curry and the jasmine rice was also a little burnt. The Thai tea was also disappointing, lacking the rich flavor and balance we usually enjoy. Just the presentation of the Thai tea looked a bit cute.

We’ve tried many other Thai spots in SF (Thai Spice, Farmhouse Thai, etc.) and they are far superior in both flavor and texture. Even photos of our past meals at Thai Spice show the difference in consistency.

Cleanliness was another concern. Plates and glasses had visible black marks and looked overused. We also ended up asking for to-go cups for our drinks instead of using their overused glasses.

Ambience was only average. Overall, we wouldn’t recommend New Thai Elephant when there are so many better options nearby.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Went her for dinner, didn’t have resos but was able to quickly get a table for 2.  Pad Kee Mao and Cashew Nut Chicken.   Quick service and large portions.   Lively environment

top_10.name: Zen Yai
top_10.address: 925 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Awesome food. And im picky about my Thai food  we ordered the green papaya salad, Silver noodle salad, the barbecued pork, and Tom Kah soup. Every single plate was excellent 👍 Service was great, lots of space and very open with large windows. The area is a little difficult for parking, Service is fast. Overall EXCELLENT food and VERY good prices....much less expensive than other restaurants. We were a large group of seven, but everything went smooth and fast.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The new location is 1 block away from the old location which is great!

The interior is very homey, spacious and great for large groups, families and kids!! Large menu that accommodates all palates.

I sampled the two poplar boat noodles (small sizes). They were so unique, punchful and super delicious!!!

To top it off, the service was inviting and welcoming!! Definitely an A++ eatery.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Zenyai has moved to a new location on O’Farrell Street, and it’s just as good as ever. Same delicious menu, same authentic flavors — and still the only place where you can get boat noodles served in a chicken ceramic bowl, just like in Thailand.

The prices are very affordable, the new space is clean, bright, and comfortable, and they’ve even added Thai snacks you can take home. So happy to see them in their new spot!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
They serve authentic thai food! I ordered boat noodles and it came just as what i had in Thailand! My friend also ordered Pad Kapao crispy pork and it tasted great (even though i prefer not to have the green beans in pad kapao). Price is great.

The servers seemed kind. My phone was running out of battery in their restaurant and the server lady charged it for me using their outlet!

The only con would be the location because this restaurant sits on where there are many homeless people. We were walking there and it was our first time walking in San Francisco so it was a little scary.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing Thai food. Very reasonable price for this area. We visited this restaurant 3 times in one week. The best part is they have small bowl so I can try several things. My favorite is ต้มยำหมูสับ tom yum and pad see ew. Service is always excellent and attentive. However, the surrounding area is not the best, full of homeless. Hard to find parking spot

top_10.name: Oraan Thai Eatery
top_10.address: 3750 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We visited the restaurant as a group of four, and the entire place was beautifully decorated with a fun Halloween theme. The staff wore creative makeup that perfectly matched the spooky yet festive atmosphere. Every dish we ordered was delicious, and the service was excellent. We enjoyed four savory dishes and two delightful desserts. It was such a happy and memorable day — a perfect spot to celebrate the Halloween season! 👻✨

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Some hits and some misses, but excellent spot overall for some unique Thai food.

I really enjoyed the Gai manow and Hoi jor. The papaya salad was good. I would pass on the moo pik kang though. The meat was hilariously bland for the amount of flavour that the sauce could have packed.

Service is fine, and the place was pretty quiet on a Sunday afternoon. Can recommend coming here!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Gai manow (chicken) and hoi jor (crab) were good appetizers. Very crispy and nice flavours. Yellow curry was a bit disappointing. Chicken was a little dry and tough and potato was large and a bit undercooked for me. The curry itself was decent, but rice is extra. Mango sticky rice was delicious, almost as good as in Thailand. Large portions all around

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very glad I tried this spot, would definitely go back again! Papaya salad was good and so was the pad Thai. I like how much veggies/greens they had in all the dishes. Pad Thai was a little sweet/lacking much other flavor and complexity but it was still good. Service was great. Looking forward to trying this spot again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: At lunch time the place was near empty. The place is super cute and the service was good. Had the Choo Chee Salmon, it was amazing! Truly, fantastic! Indulged into a Thai Pumpkin Custard, which was cute, very nicely presented, and not very sweet. Definitely want to come back here. Great spot for a romantic dinner as well.

testimonials: We visited the restaurant as a group of four, and the entire place was beautifully decorated with a fun Halloween theme. The staff wore creative makeup that perfectly matched the spooky yet festive atmosphere. Every dish we ordered was delicious, and the service was excellent. We enjoyed four savory dishes and two delightful desserts. It was such a happy and memorable day — a perfect spot to celebrate the Halloween season! 👻✨

top_10.name: Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 710 Florida St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This restaurant is hyped. The food is authentic and beautifully presented but if you are interested in authentic Thai food, there are less pricier ans less pretentious places you can go to. This restaurant is designed like a gaudy and over-the-top Thai wedding hall. The tables are too close to each other for comfort. If I am paying $50 approx for each dish, I would like some comfortable seating room where I am not within 1 foot of another table. The music is too loud. Add the cacaphony of conversations with tables too close to each other, you can barely have a decent conversation. While the presentation of the food is elegant, the service is rushed. The servers hover over you expecting you to finish your meal quickly and leave. If you want to savour good Thai food, go elsewhere. If you want drama with your food, visit this one.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Farmhouse Kitchen in the Mission District is a dependable option for a casual date night if you’re craving Thai food. We were able to walk in and get a table without a reservation on a weeknight. We shared the samosas with a dipping sauce, and I ordered my go-to Pad Thai with prawns. It satisfied the craving.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A wonderful place with amazing food! A bit pricey for Thai but you get more than your money's worth. We started with the coconut flavored soup added chicken - honestly that fish alone can feed two hungry people! The beef was absolutely tender fall off the bone. The egg rolls had such a unique flavor. And all the currys were great and generous proportions.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This was honestly the worst experience I’ve had here. The restaurant has gone downhill and I can no longer recommend it.

My partner and I came to celebrate a holiday and arrived around 4:30pm. The place was empty, and we chose to sit outside. Service started quickly, but the table was dirty and looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in a long time.

We ordered two iced Thai teas ($6.50 each). The flavor was just average. I also asked the server for two cups of water, but she completely ignored me. Later, someone just brought me a cup of ice instead—so frustrating, especially since it was really hot outside. The outdoor tables, tablecloths, and chairs all felt worn out and uncomfortable.

For food, we ordered two dishes. The first was their new Burmese Lobster Noodles. It came with half a lobster—but no claw, and the lobster itself was dry, tough, and definitely not fresh. It was honestly inedible. The second dish was the Beef Cup Noodles. It was spicy and tasted okay, but for $39, it felt like a rip-off.

In total, for just two dishes and two drinks, the bill came out to $115 before tip. They even added an extra “SF mandate tax.” Three years ago, I had good experiences here, but after this visit, I won’t be coming back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: this is definitely the best thai food that I’ve ever tried! The spicy noodles is really delicious and hot! The taste of Thai iced tea is super close to native one. We really have a good experience.

testimonials: This restaurant is hyped. The food is authentic and beautifully presented but if you are interested in authentic Thai food, there are less pricier ans less pretentious places you can go to. This restaurant is designed like a gaudy and over-the-top Thai wedding hall. The tables are too close to each other for comfort. If I am paying $50 approx for each dish, I would like some comfortable seating room where I am not within 1 foot of another table. The music is too loud. Add the cacaphony of conversations with tables too close to each other, you can barely have a decent conversation. While the presentation of the food is elegant, the service is rushed. The servers hover over you expecting you to finish your meal quickly and leave. If you want to savour good Thai food, go elsewhere. If you want drama with your food, visit this one.

Farmhouse Kitchen in the Mission District is a dependable option for a casual date night if you’re craving Thai food. We were able to walk in and get a table without a reservation on a weeknight. We shared the samosas with a dipping sauce, and I ordered my go-to Pad Thai with prawns. It satisfied the craving.

A wonderful place with amazing food! A bit pricey for Thai but you get more than your money's worth. We started with the coconut flavored soup added chicken - honestly that fish alone can feed two hungry people! The beef was absolutely tender fall off the bone. The egg rolls had such a unique flavor. And all the currys were great and generous proportions.

top_10.name: House of Thai
top_10.address: 901 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great vegan options, and more authentic than I ever had in the bay area. Large portions and cozy atmosphere. The servers are very nice and willing to help but sometimes seem a bit lost - took quite a while to pay and pack our leftovers. But it could just be that they're new. Other than that the service was great, the food arrived quickly.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was authentic but my rice dish was too salty for my taste . The veggies were fresh and the chicken was tender . The soup was large but I found it too expensive for coconut milk with mushrooms and chicken (18$) . I was hungry so I ordered it anyway . The area was filled with heroin addicts , I was a little concerned walking around . I did not expect it . It is just a few blocks from Union Square . I would go back but during the day only .

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A very cute and family oriented Thai spot in Sanfrans. Service is quick and very friendly. The food is exceptionally seasoned.Every dish was balanced and flavorful.  The food is well portioned with reasonable prices. Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Well worth stopping a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I stopped by for Dinner, I started with basil beauty drink it’s good it’s just a little too sweet, papaya salad is good. Fresh roll is good too it could be better with less mixed greens which over power the rest of the ingredients, for the red curry is good could be better with a little bit more portion. Service was great, restaurant had good ambiance it’s clean as well. Overall I recommend this place for Thai restaurants among the Thai restaurants if you’re visiting SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Ordered the pork Pad Thai and it's the best compare to ALL the Thai restaurants around here. Perfect amount of sauce (not dry unlike most), generous amount of pork and they gave us big serving for our order. This is now my new go to Thai restaurant.
_________________

10/21/2024
My grandson and I went to dine-in for brunch and they did not disappoint! We love everything that we ordered: fried egg rolls; green curry with tofu; crunchy pork belly with green beans and red bell peppers; sticky rice with coconut milk and fresh mango. The service was always with a smile! We enjoyed it.
