top_10.name: Khao Tiew
top_10.address: 272 Claremont Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Service was great with a kind and attentive team! Food was good with a particular shout out to the khao soi and duck curry (much debate as to which was a fav amongst friends). The Kaya toast was a clear winner out of everything. And pad see ew was a surprisingly good contender that one south bay area local said was the best they've had.

Tom yum was good but not the best I've ever had. Still a delicious dish on a cold, rainy winter day. The spicy wonton was decent, we enjoyed the sauce.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place is absolutely worth the wait. It’s unbelievably delicious, please please try it. You won’t regret it.
I had been craving the Khao Soi I fell in love with in Chiang Mai, and since it’s so hard to find a great one here, I came to try theirs. The Khao Soi was decent but pretty standard, nothing mind blowing.

But the Steak Fried Rice? OMG. It hits you in the best, most addictive way possible. Insane flavor bomb.

And the Kaya Toast? The combination of the warm toast, the kaya jam, and the coconut sticky ice cream is sooo good. Truly unforgettable. If there’s one place you absolutely cannot skip, it’s this one.
We showed up on Saturday at 3:30, about 30 minutes before they opened, and the first round filled up right in front of us. We ended up getting seated for the second round at 4:45. And honestly, I’d do it again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fair warning - this place is always busy. We had a 90 minute wait time for a party of 2 at 7pm on a Friday night. The great news is that this place is just around the corner from some great bars in West Portal (philosopher’s club, McCarthy’s) so you can just grab some drinks while you wait. The food was great and the dessert (burnt butter Kaya toast) was incredible and a very large portion. Overall, great food in a great neighborhood

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Like most people I came here from highly rated social media influencers who claim that this is a great Thai restaurant. Beware, it isn’t.

First it isn’t even real Thai food, it’s a form of Thai fusion, which should be a warning sign. Thai food tastes best just being simple Thai food. For instance, Tom Yum Soup had coconut cream when a real Thai Tom Yum soup doesn’t. It would taste better if they got rid of the coconut cream and actually cooked the soup with all the ingredients instead of just adding everything in the end. The seafood was also tuff and hard to chew. If not cooking seafood correctly, just don’t use it.

In addition, stay away from the Branzino. It isn’t fresh. It’s frozen and it’s redeep fried instead of being fresh fish in SF and it’s not stir fried, it looks and tastes redeep fried from frozen. Deep frying the frozen fried fish makes it smell, tuff, chewy, and hard to eat.

The most outrageous dish was their deep fried papaya salad. Papaya salad isn’t meant to be fried. It may get you likes on social media, but It doesn’t taste good. It supposed to be fresh papaya mixed with the papaya sauce instead of being separated and for me to mix it, what am I paying the cooks for???

Besides the low quality of food and taste, they like using sweet chili sauce for most their dishes. They restaurant is also over packed, stuffy, hot 🥵, and waited almost 3 hours for unsatisfactory, over priced, and over hyped food.

There are far more better and actual “authentic” Thai food and Thai deserts close by. This isn’t one of them. Don’t believe the hype, if you have taste buds and know what Thai food should be and taste like.

Save yourself a two to three hour wait to be highly disappointed, like I was and the many others that leave the place still hungry.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Khao Tiew San Francisco is a standout establishment, serving delicious, simple, and authentic local Thai dishes. They truly impress with creative and tasty twists on old favorites, such as their exceptional Khao Soi.
The baseline heat level is mild, which is perfect for most palates, but you can easily customize your spice level by adding the hot powder conveniently available on the table. Highly recommended!

top_10.name: The ThongLor SF - Thai Restaurant
top_10.address: 420 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Hands down, the best Pad Thai I've had in a long time! Loaded with chicken, tofu, and egg. The noodles were more of a garnish than a filler! This is how Pad Thai should be! I ordered takeout online and it was ready when I arrived about 15 minutes later. I love that you can see the kitchen working thru the front window!

Like many have said, the restaurant is small, but cozy inside. So you might have to wait for a seat, but takeout is easy. The prices are very reasonable too.

I'll be ordering again when I spend the night in the city!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Granted I only ordered for pick up but I’m very happy to say that the search for the best tom kha soup in San Francisco for me is over!!! It was bomb!!! The consistency of the coconut soup was just right (not too thick, not too runny) and the taste was divine!!! Hefty amount of chicken as well. Mild is spicy enough for me. The restaurant is tiny (hole in the wall-type) but decent seating. I cannot recommend The Thonglor SF enough located on Geary after Mason. Worth coming back for sure! 😋👌🏼

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Are two meals here in the week we were in SF - it was that good!

Simple and delicious food.

Affordable prices and generous portions.

Quick, efficient and helpful service.

We loved the yellow curry specifically! And also enjoyed everything else we tried!

Would definitely recommend if you’re in the area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Small but very characteristic place, with an open kitchen and friendly staff.
The food was delicious and the portions were very generous. I had the Pad See Ew J and would definitely come back to try more dishes.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: GET THE PADKEEMAO! There was a long line to get into this place but it was worth waiting every second. The serving size is pretty big and getting 3 dishes for 3 people was actually a lot of food. The curries were also great. True definition of a hole in the wall but it’s a gem. The mango sticky rice was interesting….

top_10.name: Nari
top_10.address: 1625 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Nari has a very nice ambiance, but unfortunately everything beyond that was a disappointment. While the space itself is polished and inviting, the overall dining experience fell far short of expectations.

Service was a major issue. Our server came across as rushed, unwelcoming, and disengaged. At first, I assumed it might have been an off moment, but after watching his interactions with nearby tables, it was clearly consistent. There was no warmth, no effort to explain dishes, and no sense of hospitality it felt as though he either didn’t want to be there or was overwhelmed with too many tables.

The menu itself is heavily pork-focused. If you are not a pork eater, I would strongly recommend skipping this restaurant, as the majority of the dishes include pork in some form, leaving very limited alternatives.

We ordered two beers, both of which were poorly poured, arriving with approximately three to four inches of foam more foam than beer. It looked like beer topped with whipped cream, which immediately set a negative tone for the meal.

For food, we ordered the Prik King Gai (crispy chicken stir-fried in sweet and spicy curry paste) and the Gaeng Bumbai Aubergine (crispy eggplant in spicy Bumbai curry). We were warned that the Prik King Gai was very spicy, so we planned to switch dishes if needed. When the food arrived, both dishes were equally and overwhelmingly spicy, with no depth of flavor beyond heat. The eggplant dish offered nothing but spice, and the chicken dish had the texture and taste of burnt crumbs tossed in dry chili no balance, no complexity, and no discernible flavors coming through.

Overall, this was not an experience I would return for or recommend to others. While the ambiance is nice, poor service, limited menu balance, poorly executed drinks, and flavorless, overly spicy food made this a very disappointing visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had dinner at Nari, and it was an incredible experience from start to finish. The restaurant has a beautiful, modern atmosphere that still feels warm and welcoming. Service was attentive, knowledgeable, and thoughtful throughout the evening.
The food was the real highlight—each dish was layered with bold, complex flavors that truly showcased the depth of Thai cuisine in a contemporary style. The presentation was elegant without feeling overdone, and every plate felt carefully balanced. Standouts included the creative small plates, the perfectly cooked proteins, and the way spices and herbs came together in harmony.
Nari is definitely on the higher end in terms of pricing, but the quality and experience make it well worth it. It’s a perfect spot for a special dinner in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I finally tried this Thai place after walking past it for ages, and I'm so glad I did! The food had an amazing, strong spicy flavor that really hit the spot. The service was also excellent, and the staff were very friendly and attentive. It's a nice spot to enjoy a delicious meal, especially since the area is great for a walk afterward. I would highly recommend it!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food was so good, it was one of the most memorable meals I’ve had! That’s why it deserves Michelin stars. I highly recommend squid and pork jowl, as well as miang pla

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere with a vibrant, stylish vibe. Service was warm and attentive, definitely a highlight of the experience.

That said, the food didn’t quite meet Michelin-level expectations. Most dishes felt overly oily and heavy, with the exception of one standout that was well-executed. Flavors lacked the balance and refinement I was hoping for.

The cocktails, however, were excellent, creative and well-crafted. I’d recommend stopping by for drinks and ambiance, but overall, the dining experience felt more average than exceptional.

top_10.name: Lers Ros
top_10.address: 730 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Quiet night for dinner.  Ample portions. Asked for medium spice and was pleased that the flavor and spice were perfect. Also got a young coconut which was fun. Fried banana with pistachio ice cream for dessert. Leftovers were packed up beautifully and tasted great the next day for lunch. Sweet servers. Recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Best Thai food in the area that I could find for delivery.
Everything I ordered hit the spot for me. I think dine-in will taste even better.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tried the place because of the recommendations and proximity.
Neither the surroundings nor the entrance seemed impressive. Simple decor and setup inside.
The crowd inside and continuous flow of the online delivery personnel does indicate its popularity.
Had a papaya salad with grilled prawns as a starter followed by Spicy Green Bean Chicken and Pineapple Fried Rice. All sumptuous though the salad was a bit spicier than what we are used to. Ample portions and we had to cancel another dish based on the serving size (which they cancelled without any issue).
Service was good but seemed understaffed.
Overall, a fulfilling experience. Definitely value for money.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had such a great experience at Lers Ros. Everything was perfect!
We had their iced tea which was super good. Then we ordered the crab pad Thai and the chicken peanut sauce, full of flavours and great value for money.
The service was also super sweet and kind.
Highly recommend this place which was quiet and calm to a Sunday lunch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Every time I come here the food and service are amazing literally never fails. Thank you for being consistent.

top_10.name: Dumpling Home
top_10.address: 298 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Steamed dumplings (Xiao long bao) are amazing. We ordered one spicy and one squash/shrimp.
Pan fired dumplings are not the best in Bay Area, I’ll give a 4.
A localized dumpling place in general. Good vibe and atmosphere.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was absolutely delicious and came out super fast. The staff were friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. The beer was really good too! It does get a little loud since the place stays busy, but that just shows how popular it is. You might not linger long, but every bite is worth it. I really enjoyed my visit!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Soupy Xiao Long Bao is very yummy! Pan fried buns are juicy too. Overall food quality and services are both good!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Hands down one of the best soup dumplings / xiaolongbaos and shengjianbaos in North America!! Better than DTF IMO. The egg and chive packets were also really good and authentic 😋😋

Be there before they open to beat the crowds.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We tried the pan fried pork bao, the pork and crab soup bao, shrimp with shrimp paste noodles, and cucumber in garlic sauce. Everything arrived quickly and was absolutely delicious. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive, making the whole experience even better. This place is a definite favorite for tasty and satisfying dishes!

top_10.name: 御食园 Z & Y Peking Duck
top_10.address: 606 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely delicious!

I came here for the Beijing Roast Duck and ended up falling in love with everything on the menu. You can really taste the chef’s care and skill in every dish — from the flavor, color, and aroma, everything feels beautifully balanced and thoughtfully prepared.

The tea service here is also amazing — their Kung Fu tea is smooth, fragrant, and served with such attention to detail. It really completes the whole dining experience.

The restaurant has a relaxing, elegant atmosphere, and it’s quite popular with locals and Americans alike. Whether you’re a fan of authentic Chinese food or trying roast duck for the first time, this place is a must-visit!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Restaurant didn't allow reservations for less than 4pax so hubby and I decided we shall be there 30 mins before opening time and we were number 2 in the Q and by opening time there were 20 pax behind us.

Once we were seated, we were served quickly.  We ordered avocado, Peking duck and grilled lamb.

Avocado was flavourful with sesame oil and I guess soya sauce.  Love the Peking duck which didn't have subcutaneous fat (unlike those we had in Beijing and Malaysia).  The tofu soup with cabbage was nice, unsalted. Grilled lamb was good too, tender and not gamey, but we'll like it more grilled.  I think there's no msg and yet food is great, something for Singapore/Malaysian Chinese chefs to think about....😁

Wish there were more in our party so we can order more food, everything looked good!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Reservations are recommended. We got seated promptly at our reservation time. The walk in wait list was over an hour.

The star of the show was the Peking duck, which had nice crispy skin texture and a light taste. But it needed a bit more seasoning. The pancake wrap along with the accoutrements overpowered the duck. I could only taste how good the duck is when eating it by itself. The second best dish was the sichuan cold meats, which had tender meat and aromatic spicy oil.

The rest of the dishes we tried were just average. Soup dumpling’s skin was too thick. The golden shrimp was fried perfectly, but too sweet. Eggplant dish was also too sweet. Beef roll came with no sauce and tasteless. Sea bass seemed slightly overcooked and did not have its characteristic savoriness.

We also ordered the taro swan pasties at the beginning of our meal, but the staff said we had to wait an additional 25 minutes after our last dish, so we declined.

Overall, looking at how busy the restaurant gets compared to the food, this restaurant isn’t worth the hassle

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came for the duck (shock!) and it did not disappoint. The skin was crispy and the meat perfectly cooked, succulent and juicy. The seasonings and bread bun enhanced the overall experience. Although not the best we ever tried, the honey walnut shrimp was also delicious and was plated exquisitely. For these two dishes, we paid approximately $100, including tax.

On the down side, although we ordered this restaurant’s supposedly main dish, our table waited an inordinate amount of time for it to come out. Additionally we noticed a neighboring table arriving 20 minutes later but receiving food 20 minutes earlier than us and we were all given checks at the same time (we did not request staff for checks, so it seemed as if they were rushing us).

Lastly, we noticed wait staff staring at and observing customers much too frequently that it borderline felt uncomfortable.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We arrived at Z&Y Peking Duck in San Francisco and were fortunate to get a table as walk ins, as the restaurant was busy. Once seated, our server welcomed us warmly and took our drinks order before returning shortly after to take our food order. We decided to go for the half portion of Peking duck with pancakes, which arrived beautifully prepared and tasted really good. From our table we were able to watch the chef prepare the duck, which added to the overall experience. One of the servers, Jenny, kindly guided us on the different ways to enjoy the duck and her advice made it even more enjoyable.

After finishing our appetiser, our main dishes arrived which included Mongolian beef and chicken fried rice. Both dishes were served fresh, full of flavour and very satisfying. The combination of the food quality and the attentive service made the evening a memorable one.

Overall, our experience at Z&Y Peking Duck was excellent and we would highly recommend a visit for great food and warm service from the team.

The restaurant has a relaxing, elegant atmosphere, and it’s quite popular with locals and Americans alike. Whether you’re a fan of authentic Chinese food or trying roast duck for the first time, this place is a must-visit!

Restaurant didn't allow reservations for less than 4pax so hubby and I decided we shall be there 30 mins before opening time and we were number 2 in the Q and by opening time there were 20 pax behind us.

Once we were seated, we were served quickly.  We ordered avocado, Peking duck and grilled lamb.

Avocado was flavourful with sesame oil and I guess soya sauce.  Love the Peking duck which didn't have subcutaneous fat (unlike those we had in Beijing and Malaysia).  The tofu soup with cabbage was nice, unsalted. Grilled lamb was good too, tender and not gamey, but we'll like it more grilled.  I think there's no msg and yet food is great, something for Singapore/Malaysian Chinese chefs to think about....😁

Wish there were more in our party so we can order more food, everything looked good!

Reservations are recommended. We got seated promptly at our reservation time. The walk in wait list was over an hour.

The star of the show was the Peking duck, which had nice crispy skin texture and a light taste. But it needed a bit more seasoning. The pancake wrap along with the accoutrements overpowered the duck. I could only taste how good the duck is when eating it by itself. The second best dish was the sichuan cold meats, which had tender meat and aromatic spicy oil.

The rest of the dishes we tried were just average. Soup dumpling’s skin was too thick. The golden shrimp was fried perfectly, but too sweet. Eggplant dish was also too sweet. Beef roll came with no sauce and tasteless. Sea bass seemed slightly overcooked and did not have its characteristic savoriness.

We also ordered the taro swan pasties at the beginning of our meal, but the staff said we had to wait an additional 25 minutes after our last dish, so we declined.

Overall, looking at how busy the restaurant gets compared to the food, this restaurant isn’t worth the hassle

top_10.name: Hong Kong Clay Pot Restaurant
top_10.address: 960 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: After closure of Oriental Pearl Restaurant, we are still searching for a near close joint… this place is on the first floor, just like Oriental Pearl, a bit difficult to carry a stroller upstairs… restaurant was 70% full when we arrived at around 6:30 pm, the soup was very standard, nothing exceptional though, had to add condiments to elevate taste…Potsticker was stuffed with chicken, crab Rangoon was good, Chow Mein and Chicken Entree was great…the house noodles was also very good, but limited prawns and chicken in it… the fried rice was again standard. It’s an all women run joint, very attentive and prompt in service.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My wife and I had dinner here last night while celebrating our Anniversary.

Parking is a little difficult to locate in this area, so we had to drive around for a bit.

The space is up a flight of stairs and there is no elevator. It us a family style restaurant so they have found tables with turntables in the middle for the sharing of food. They have about 10 tables. The restaurant itself is cute and very connected to the Asian culture

When my wife and I arrived, there were 2 free tables available. Yes, they are created for larger parties. However, many of them were. They placed us at a table to share with another 2 ppl party. We did not like this at all. As a guest at a restaurant, we deserved the right to have our own table. It was a totally inconvenience to the ppl that were already at the table. Btw.. one was a Trans. I keep wondering why they sat us at no other table with others that were also 2 ppl. Why this table?

We observed a YT couple walk in and placed at their own large table. We them observed 3 Asians walk in and they were placed at a vet large table.

My wife and I did not hold much of a conversation because it was weird!!

The service was accomodating until midway through even our waitress never came back up check on us or ask if we needed anything. Honestly.. we did not even receive water now that I think of it.

The food was hot when it came out. I was not a fan of the wonton soup. It lacked flavor. I enjoyed the House Noodles (shrimp, chicken and beef).. but it needed seasoning or more flavor. We ordered chicken wings. That was delicious. We also ordered fried string beans and pork. That was so good!!!

My wife had a Chinese beer and I had a cold Sake served in a bottle.

When we were ready to pack up the leftover food, it had to sit because or efforts to be seen by a waitress to receive a box and bag was ignored. When we finally got the attention of another one, they immediately brought the check. Did not even ask if we needed a box.

Oh.. prices are really good and cheap. You get alot of food.

I reccomend this place, with reservations depending on your race or appearing lifestyle.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was so happy to go to San Francisco for my birthday. My husband treated me to dinner in Chinatown at Hong Kong Clay Pot. Everything we ate was thoroughly enjoyed. From the salt and pepper chicken wings to the Chicken Clay Pot with chicken, sausage, mushrooms and onions.This is a no-frills restaurant, but all the food is bursting with flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: the interior is of course outdated, everything is old and not very clean. but this is almost in all establishments, so I will evaluate the quality of the food. the order was brought quickly. the eggplants, pork were cooked well. the shrimp tempura was excellent.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is a neat little walk up restaurant in Chinatown. It’s easy to miss the entrance because it’s only a door that leads up stairs, but it’s worth the search.

Service is friendly and the food is very good and reasonably priced.

I enjoyed the kung pao prawns. The dish was just spicy enough but not overdone.

top_10.name: NORTHERN CHINA BBQ
top_10.address: 294 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Decent Northern China style dishes — extensive selection of various barbecue skewers (meat, seafood, mushroom, veg) reminiscent of Mainland Chinese street food.

Lamb Skewer is slightly gamey, dusted with the classic cumin-paprika seasoning. Enjoy with cold side dishes such as the standard Smashed Cucumber. Sliced Beef in Chili Sauce is fragrant from Sichuan peppercorn and chilis.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Decent skewers. Good amount of seating. Service is quick. Wished they had the tray to keep the skewers warm.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 5/5 SO SO YUMMYYY!!! This hit the spot 😍😩 We actually came here after another meal that we weren’t satisfied with. The best were 1. Chicken skewers and 2. Taiwanese sausage skewers. The seaweed salad was also excellent. Next time we’ll come for a proper meal and get some much more!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I don’t normally post reviews unless I think the place is underrecognized or is overhyped. This place is the former. Skewers are all absolutely delicious, my favorite is the original pork sausage skewer, so juicy and fatty just like the sausages in Taiwan. The beef skewer was also so beefy, amazing. The chicken gristle is also my favorite, pair that with rice and that can be a meal in it of itself

I can’t wait to come back and try even more skewers.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great Chinese style charcoal barbecue, tasting exactly like I had before back in China.
Meat, seafood and tofu / veggie choices are all pretty good. We were particularly impressed by the lamb skewer and the tofu.
Fully supportive of a trendy new restaurant in the city! Thank you for doing this~ much needed

top_10.name: Sohunan of Henry's Hunan
top_10.address: 674 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great food and a lovely experience! We dined here on New Year’s Eve and were pleasantly surprised that it wasn’t too crowded. The staff was very friendly, attentive, and made us feel well taken care of. Would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Got DoorDash.  Was warm and fresh upon delivery.  Packaged well.

Dumplings were good but beef dish lacked depth of flavor.  Was just ok.   Not sad about my meal but wasn’t wonderful, just average.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’m a big fan of Chinese cuisine, but I’ve never had the chance to try Hunan-style food. So, I knew I had to give it a try.

We ordered the pork belly, which was absolutely delicious. It was well-seasoned and flavorful. However, I must admit that I could’ve gone a bit spicier. It was a bit on the milder side, and I was craving a bit more heat. But overall, it was perfectly savory and worth the price.

The dumplings were also very good, and they were definitely worth it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Terrible. Terrible.
The saltiest chili oil I’ve ever had.

The curry chicken had good texture but was so salty!

The dumplings were also so salty.

I asked for help.  Was shunned

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Sohunan of Henry's Hunan is the best of all the Hunans just ask Hunan!  I was downtown looking for Weasel Rimrubber when I spotted Hazel Hatfield go into Sohunan of Henry's Hunan with none other than Margo McCoy, and everyone knows those two don't get along!  So, I decided to go in grab a bowl of hot dumpling soup and some fried rice and wait for the fireworks!  Well...The fireworks never happened, but that dumpling soup was perhaps the best I've ever had, it was truly spectacular!  5 ☆☆☆☆☆

top_10.name: R & G Lounge
top_10.address: 631 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Definitely going back if I’m in SF. If you ever wondered what kind of Chinese restaurants are good and authentic this place is. You know it’s legit when a group of Chinese family  are waiting to be seated.
Food wise no brainer get the eggplant and shrimp. Only if you like eggplant. On a cold night get the beef winter melon soup. Warms  you up instantly. Dungeness crab may be a miss you dont mind dinging in for the meat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What a fabulous meal!
Incredibly delicious food, really efficient and caring service, and great vibe!

We loved the salt and pepper crab, the eggplant, the honey spare ribs, the cumin lamb and the Peking duck!

Everything we ate was great!! Not cheap, but really good food!!

We pounced on the food before we remembered to take pictures, but here are a few.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
R&G Lounge gets two stars from me because the Peking duck experience was really disappointing. For the price and the restaurant’s reputation, the way the dish came out felt careless.
What went wrong
•	The Peking duck arrived at the table with several pieces already missing, so it looked like a half-finished platter instead of a whole, impressive dish.
•	The duck was not deboned, which made it hard to eat and took away from the enjoyment, especially since Peking duck is usually served in neat, easy-to-wrap slices. Also, the duck arrived at our table as shown in the photo. There seems pieces were missing, I asked our server and was told that this is the way the duck is served. I have never been served a duck in such a way.
•	Given how well-known this place is for special dishes and banquet-style meals, the quality and presentation of the duck fell far below expectations.
Why it’s two stars, not one
•	The restaurant is a long-standing Chinatown spot with a big menu and a busy, lively dining room, so it clearly can do better than what we were served.
•	Service and other dishes may be fine for some guests, but the mishandled Peking duck turned what should have been a highlight into a letdown, and that’s hard to overlook.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It had been about 17 years since I last ate at R&G lounge, because I was kind of boycotting due to receiving poor service so so long ago. With so many other restaurants to try, I was never interested in coming back until a friend told us that he loves R&G lounge so much that he eats here almost once a month, and convinced us all to have dinner there, after we were turned away from 4 Kings. R&G has been around all this time, and lots of people seem to love it, and of course I can forgive poor service nearly 2 decades ago.
Has R&G always been so big? They put us in large table tucked away from the commotion. They have multiple floors and even have options for private dining. I can see why large parties plan events here so they can eat the usual Chinese banquet dishes.

$65 Salt & Pepper Dungeness Crab - whole crab battered, deep fried, sprinkled w/ salt & pepper seasoning:
great! fresh & succulent fresh crab meat piled high with crispy garlic

$50 Chilean Seabass (small) - marinated and baked in a glaze:
okay! nice and tender, but due to personal preference I don't love glazed fish that much. Our other friends loved it though.

$24 Roast Squab - whole squab roasted, crispy skin, w/ seasoning salt on the side
good! crispy skin indeed and quite juicy. Are we calling MSG = seasoning salt now? It does look quite like MSG, which I have nothing against. To me it's just another form of sodium. The tough thing about squab is it is not always easy to split up. Who gets the leg, the best part?

$26 Steamed Clams & Eggs - steamed with beaten eggs:
good! steamed to a silky consistency

$20 Eggplant w/ Garlic Sauce - eggplant, black fungus, bamboo shoots & scallions sauteed in hot garlic sauce:
good! silky, spicy and flavorful

$8 for 4 bowls of steamed rice, which we shared among 6 people, because we're too cheap to get one bowl of rice per person, but we never finish our rice anyway.

3% SF Mandate is annoying, but nothing new

I guess I am due to let go of the past and admit that R&G has some pretty good dishes. In fact, service this time around was pretty good. Who could remember that nearly 20 years ago, they took nearly an hour to return our credit card, so we can just conclude payment and leave, as if they were holding us hostage? Oops, I guess I do still remember. We're moving on!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
December 2025 Chinese restaurant mainly serving Cantonese style cuisine in banquet style menu as well as notable cocktail 🍸 items.

A fairly formal restaurant with a wide range and standard menu based of the common ingredients and components.  They are generally known for their seafood dishes which are cooked well and consistently.  Some dishes follow trends while others are traditional.   Cocktail drinks were well crafted and on the strong side.

Sampling the lauriat or banquet style, the food order came through not quite following the menu.  Highlights are the crab, special beef, and scallops dishes while the duck was standard.  The shrimp 🍤 version is not the crunchy type.  Serving sizes are a bit inconsistent with some dishes generous, generally ample, and some like the fish were a bit on the smallish side.

One issue they had was....as prescribed in the banquet menu, dessert was supposed to be included but when the meal was finally over the waiter said that it was not included 🤔🤔🤔🤔

Pricing in general was standard but also showed a number of inconsistencies: menu states Tsing Tao size is L but the standard bottle is the downsized one.  CORRECTION: Tsing Tao is now standard sized layer vs traditional Large bottle served before.  🫡🫡🫡

The final bill also has an automatic 20% service charge added.  No issue with the SC if only service was standard to industry. Service in general was not consistent and would need better attention to proper etiquette and rules.

The place is of three dining areas.  The ground is where the reception, bar, and a small area for small tables up to 3 or 4.  The lower floor is for larger groups and with 2 private rooms.  This section is pretty crowded and is typically loud and full much like a busy Chinese restaurant.

All in all, a good and relatively standard and a bit more well kept restaurant within  the busy Chinatown district of SFO.

Reservations are recommended.

top_10.name: Mister Jiu's
top_10.address: 28 Waverly Pl, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
# Culinary Heights, Service Lows, and a Deafening Beat

Mister Jiu’s, occupying an expansive and pleasant space in San Francisco’s Chinatown, is rightly renowned for its take on Chinese cuisine. The kitchen delivers a formidable array of thoughtful improvements on traditional dishes alongside new creations that use familiar techniques in fresh ways. In purely culinary terms, it rises well past many similarly priced restaurants in the U.S. and abroad.

Unfortunately, that excellence is significantly marred by both ambience and front-of-house execution. Start with the ambience: while the space is meticulously decorated, the tables are comfortably spaced, and the restrooms are sparkling clean, the dining room is overwhelmed by incredibly loud electronic dance music—music better suited to a nightclub or dive bar than to a high-end restaurant where people come to taste, talk, and linger. The volume, which we estimate at roughly 80–100 dB, eliminated any realistic chance of conversation and forced us into shouting exchanges, including with the staff.

The staff, unfortunately, matched the chaotic energy of the room rather than the precision of the kitchen. Basic operational issues kept recurring: calls to the restaurant went to voicemail with a message stating that “this mailbox is full and doesn’t accept new messages.” At the table, utensils and sauces arrived slowly and only after reminders. Plates were not reliably cleared or exchanged between courses without repeat requests. Even the dining table—visibly soiled—was not wiped before dessert was served. None of these are “small details” in a restaurant of this ambition and price point; they are core competencies.

The Michelin Guide reviewers would likely agree that excellence requires more than a great kitchen. It requires a functional, attentive front of the house and an environment that supports the dining experience. This is where Mister Jiu’s currently falls short.

As ordinary consumers, we are not paid or compensated in any way for this review. We hope management recognizes that the restaurant’s extraordinary food deserves equally competent service and a dining-room atmosphere that matches its reputation.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here almost by chance and left completely impressed. I didn’t even know it had a Michelin star, we came because my husband had seen a Spanish chef we love post about it on Instagram during his SF visit. What a find.

The place feels super hidden, right in the middle of Chinatown, and the second we sat down we both thought, “Okay, this place is different.” Everything we ordered was so good: lamb dumplings, sizzled petrale sole, fried rice, plus a cocktail for my husband, not a single miss.

Also, the service made the night even better. Big thanks to David and Jovi for being amazing.

1000% recommend. One of those spots you’re genuinely excited to tell people about.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great vibes and great food with generous portions. While a bit pricey, I think it was worth the experience. I’d definitely order everything again except maybe the eggplant.

Everything off the snacks/classics portion of the menu (milk bread, turnip cake, beef tendon) were delicious twists on more traditional versions of the dishes. Make sure to dip the milk bread in the beef tendon oil for a different flavor profile.

The uni cheong fun was expensive but definitely one of the best versions of the dish I’ve had.

The grilled pork chops were incredibly juicy but it’s not for everyone with its strong flavors and spicy bitter melons

The only thing I’d not get again is eggplant, which felt very average and nothing special.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
An exceptional experience from start to finish! Everything was handled with great care, professionalism, and attention to detail. The food and cocktails were absolutely incredible, beautifully presented, and full of flavor.

A special thank you to David and Jovi for their outstanding service, warmth, and dedication — they truly made the experience unforgettable. Highly recommend and would absolutely do it again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Service was good. But the good was not authentic Chinese food. Most of the food are you salty. The scallion pancake was not the traditional Chinese ones but looked rather like dinner rolls. The soup was so salty we didn't eat it at all. The lobster that we ordered came work noodles and they too were insanely salty to the point that we had to send it back to the kitchen to get remade... And it still came out really salty .. I don't think we will be coming back but I do hold they stop over seasoning(over salting) cream ingredients and cook more like a traditional Chinese restaurant

top_10.name: Chinatown San Francisco
top_10.address: 855 Stockton St # B, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Francisco’s Chinatown is one of the most vibrant and iconic neighborhoods in the city. Walking through its colorful streets feels like stepping into another world: full of lanterns, traditional shops, herbal stores, and amazing food spots. I loved exploring Grant Avenue and its lively atmosphere, and the Dragon Gate is a perfect photo stop. It’s busy, authentic, and full of culture. Definitely a must-visit if you’re in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had a nice time exploring San Francisco's Chinatown on our recent trip. As one of the oldest and largest Chinatowns in North America, it offered an immersive dive into Chinese culture right in the heart of the city. Walking around the bustling streets was a highlight – from the iconic Dragon Gate entrance to the colorful murals, lanterns, and historic architecture, every corner felt alive with history and energy. We loved popping into the authentic tea shops, dim sum spots, and markets selling everything from fresh herbs to intricate souvenirs. The mix of locals and tourists created a lively atmosphere that made us feel like we were in a different world.

That said, it can get quite crowded, especially on weekends, which made navigating the narrow sidewalks a bit challenging at times. Still, the cultural richness and the chance to try some amazing street food more than made up for it.

Overall, Chinatown is a must-visit for anyone wanting to experience San Francisco's diverse side.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Largest Chinese population outside of China itself.
A vibrant and busy area with lots of shops and restaurants.
Great to see all the Chinese culture on display.

San Francisco's Chinatown is the oldest in North America, the largest outside Asia, and a major San Francisco attraction known for its vibrant culture, historic architecture, and bustling streets. Visitors can explore through its iconic Dragon's Gate, dine at traditional eateries like those on Grant Avenue, and experience cultural sites such as temples, Portsmouth Square, and various museums. It is easily accessible via public transport or ride-sharing, though parking is difficult.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Chinatown in San Francisco is one of the most charming and surprisingly safe neighborhoods in the city! 🏮🇨🇳

It’s a place where you instantly feel the atmosphere — narrow streets filled with the smell of fresh dumplings and tea, red lanterns glowing above your head, and friendly locals opening their little shops at sunrise. Come early in the morning, when the streets are quiet and vendors are just setting up, or in the evening, when the lanterns light up and the whole area feels like a movie scene. 🎬✨

A few tips for travelers:
☕ Have breakfast here! Chinatown is a hidden gem for morning food — fresh pastries, buns, congee, or dim sum will be one of the best starts to your day in San Francisco.
🚶 Explore on foot — the best parts are hidden in side streets and small markets.
📸 Bring your camera — the morning light and colorful signs make it a dream for photography.

It’s cozy, full of character, and feels perfectly safe even early or late. If you want to see the soul of San Francisco — start your day in Chinatown. ❤️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I came here with my family during the open market in the evening. It was such a good time. All the little stands selling delicious foods, the shops to browse through, and the music and entertainment and the amazing murals all add payers to what makes Chinatown such a memorable experience. It was one of the highlights of visiting San Francisco. Everytime we come, its always on our list of things to do and never disappoints.

testimonials: Francisco’s Chinatown is one of the most vibrant and iconic neighborhoods in the city. Walking through its colorful streets feels like stepping into another world: full of lanterns, traditional shops, herbal stores, and amazing food spots. I loved exploring Grant Avenue and its lively atmosphere, and the Dragon Gate is a perfect photo stop. It’s busy, authentic, and full of culture. Definitely a must-visit if you’re in San Francisco.

We had a nice time exploring San Francisco's Chinatown on our recent trip. As one of the oldest and largest Chinatowns in North America, it offered an immersive dive into Chinese culture right in the heart of the city. Walking around the bustling streets was a highlight – from the iconic Dragon Gate entrance to the colorful murals, lanterns, and historic architecture, every corner felt alive with history and energy. We loved popping into the authentic tea shops, dim sum spots, and markets selling everything from fresh herbs to intricate souvenirs. The mix of locals and tourists created a lively atmosphere that made us feel like we were in a different world.

That said, it can get quite crowded, especially on weekends, which made navigating the narrow sidewalks a bit challenging at times. Still, the cultural richness and the chance to try some amazing street food more than made up for it.

Overall, Chinatown is a must-visit for anyone wanting to experience San Francisco's diverse side.

top_10.name: House of Nanking
top_10.address: 919 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
House of Nanking absolutely lived up to the hype. We ordered the mobu fish, five-spice fish, rice soup, tofu bao bun, cold sesame noodles, and apple prawn—and every single dish was exceptional. The flavors were an explosion in the best possible way: bold, layered, and perfectly balanced.

The rice soup was hands down the standout—number one. I honestly wasn’t expecting it to be that incredible, but it was unbelievably delicious and comforting, with so much depth. Second place goes to the cold sesame noodles, rich, nutty, and perfectly balanced. Third was the mobu fish, followed by the five-spice fish, and then the apple prawn, which rounded everything out beautifully.

The blend of flavors across all the dishes was exquisite—nothing felt one-note or overdone. The staff were very kind and efficient, and while everything is fast-paced and there’s often a line, they move people through quickly and smoothly.

Truly one of those meals where you leave thinking about it long after—absolutely worth it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
House of Nanking is a true San Francisco classic. The food was excellent—full of bold, comforting flavors that clearly come from decades of experience in the kitchen. Every dish felt thoughtfully prepared and well balanced. Blosome tea and deep fried pork rib was excellent and the fried rice!

The service was great as well: attentive, friendly, and efficient without feeling rushed. Even though the restaurant itself isn’t very large, it more than makes up for it with its rich history and character. You can really feel the legacy of this place the moment you walk in.

Overall, House of Nanking delivers outstanding food, warm service, and a timeless atmosphere that makes it well worth the visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Amazing American-style Chinese food! The honey crispy beef was insane. The cubed beef was so tender and rich- it paired perfectly with the acidity of the garlic bok choy. Absolutely delicious, though the portion of meat was a bit small in comparison to the veggies. The crispy pork belly bun was incredible, too. I’d love to do the chef’s recommendations one day but it felt like overkill for a single diner on a Wednesday morning.

I went right when they opened at 11am but they were still setting things up. I came back around 11:30 and was seated immediately. There were only a few other customers so I wasn’t rushed at all. Go during the week day if you can! It’s worth it!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Beautiful restaurant! The servers were very kind and the tasty food was served quickly. I wasn’t able to take much pictures because the food was soooo appealing. First off, the pork belly bun was cooked to perfection and the soup which we ordered had really smooth and fragrant broth. The dumplings which came after were tasty. The porky belly and sesame chicken were absolutely heavenly! The pork ribs were fried and seasoned to perfection also. Lastly, the fried rice really lived up to our expectations. Highly recommended and would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wow. Hands down an incredible experience and gonna be top 3 if not top 1 Chinese food. Calling it food feels like an understatement.

Family style dishes served pretty quick. This place can get crowded - and rightfully so.

We ordered fried pork potstickers with peanut sauce and my god. That sauce. Make sure you get at least one dish with the peanut sauce. We made short work of the potstickers.

Our friend said the tofu with peanut was incredible and she was correct. They cook the tofu to perfection. Best tofu ever.

Ok, the beef short rib is to die for. It’s mouth watering and perfectly cooked. Very unique and you gotta try it. The Bok Choi was so tasty as well.

The sesame chicken comes with delicious sweet potatoes. The sesame chicken rocks. I can’t believe how good it is.

Every dish we had was like better than the last. This place is a MUST GO TO.

Staff are friendly and clearly have been doing this a while. Very efficient too. Gonna have to go again and explore more dishes.

top_10.name: China Live
top_10.address: 644 Broadway, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fun spot to go with a group and sample all the fun food options on the menu. I loved the soup dumplings and the bao, oh and the green beans were great too! It can get a bit noisy, in case you’re looking for something quiet this is not your spot. Come here and get your hipster vibe on!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Fantastic food and the best service in SF! We had a great experience at China Live for a NYE dinner. Our waiter was even better than the food—he was so genuine and gave us perfect recommendations. We tried a huge variety: the Sheng Jian Bao (pan-fried dumplings), Xiao Long Bao (soup dumplings), Crushed Cucumber Skins, Yangzhou Fried Rice, Kung Pao Chicken, Wok Seared Filet Mignon, and Sichuan Blistered Green Beans.

The dumplings and the cucumber skins were absolute favorites, as was the Kung Pao chicken. The filet mignon was delicious, though the portion was a bit on the smaller side. Everything came out incredibly fast! We finished with Cindy’s pineapple walnut spice carrot cake and the Amaretto bread pudding, both of which were highlights of the night. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place is a busy institution with a very interesting origin story.Good food and an expensive market right on the edge of chinatown.It's definitely geared to the western palette. Traditional offerings, that were well plated, but a touch off. All of it was good, but a bit bland.

The space is massive and a visual feast. That said the acoustics in their main dining room are horrible for conversation. Don't come here to talk. Their duck was very well balanced and perfectly cooked.I would have liked to have had the skin a little crispier, but i'm not mad. Their water dumplings were noteworthy.I really enjoyed those, the  carmelization on the bottom was just barely over the line, but i loved them.  i'm pretty sure that's their most popular dish. Their soup dumplings were pretty, but the soup ratios were off almost nonexistent.I would have loved to have had chili crisp.Although I know that's not traditional they're dumpling wrappers were a little thin on the bottom, and thick on the top. Even if this dish wasn't relatively expensive, which it assuredly was the execution was a complete disappointment. Their tea selection is above average.

their service was super kind, very attentive, but I didn't like being rushed out of there  by the manager with five minutes notice due to their next table arriving (-1 star on service). Our server Michael was very attentive, but very busy.

I am kind of torn on whether or not to return. The duck was very good, but everything else just kind of fell out of memory.And it was just so loud.I could barely hear myself think. My favorite part about it was definitely all the visual cues coming in. If you go make a reservation

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: China Live is absolutely outstanding! The food is fresh, flavorful, and beautifully prepared — even my toddler loved it. The drinks are exceptional and the service is friendly and professional. Everything feels high-quality yet welcoming. One of the best dining experiences in San Francisco. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had an amazing lunch at China Live, the dumplings were amazing but our favorite dish was the bbq pork and bok Choi on rice.
I highly recommend visiting this place next time you’re in SF.

top_10.name: Nepa Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 507 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
When the power went out in SF Nepa was one of few places still open. We thought maybe it'll take awhile - but the the food still came very quickly and was delicious. They're Naan is also one of the best Ive ever had. It was like a croissant texture almost. Crispy and slightly flaky but still nice and buttery. They had candles so the tables had visibility and where somehow still serving mango lassis without power.
Huge thanks to Nepa for feeding us when everything else was closed. A true blackout hero.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Jd was the best server, the energy was great love the whole team! One of the best Pokora I’ve had in my life and the balls oh my God, one of the best desserts I’ve had in my Iife!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food is flavorful, fresh, and well-balanced - rich without being heavy or overly oily. The curries are aromatic, the naan is soft and perfectly cooked.

The service is warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere is relaxed, making it a great place for a casual meal or dining with family and friends.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Their naan breads are huge! Tasty!
The chicken korma is very good, with a lot of chicken.

The spicy level is higher than most Indian restaurants, I ordered super spicy and feel it is a bit too hot for me but I cannot complain 😅

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I went for a late lunch around 2pm and was seated immediately. They gave a free papad, and I ordered the butter chicken masala and garlic naan. The garlic naan was massive, so it makes sense that it was $5, and it was pretty good. The butter chicken masala was very creamy with a little spice. In terms of flavour, it wasn't my favourite but still quite good. Overall, I really enjoyed my meal and would return to try more dishes!

top_10.name: Himalayan Cuisine SF
top_10.address: 1412 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had the vegetable thali and a mango lassi. The food was delicious, only problem was my stomach wasnt big enough for all of it! I recommend the thali plates for sure as they give you a sample of different dishes. There are also flatbreads and sauces given when you sit down before your food comes out. The staff were very friendly and kind and the interior is really lovely, with beautiful paintings on the walls. Definitely worth checking out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Good taste, great portions. Had the vegetable samosas which were perfect. The biryani rice included bursts of flavor from chopped vegetables and very tender lamb chunks. Tandoori chicken was tender and juicy. Great mango lassie.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I ordered take out so can’t comment on the service but the person at the counter was super nice.
Food did not taste good. Chana masala was super tangy and almost inedible. I had to throw it away. Aloo gobhi description includes green peas but there were none in the dish. It did taste okay. Overall not a good experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Stumbled across this restaurant and I am glad I came. The food was very authentic and to say the least I am Nepali! The chicken choila was to die for—perfect spice and tang! Mango lassi was the perfect sweetness. Thali reminded me of home! And the service was first class!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recently had my first dining experience at Himalayan Cuisine SF, and I’m already planning my next visit. From the moment I walked in, the warm and friendly atmosphere made me feel welcome, setting the tone for a truly memorable meal.

The food was absolutely flavorful — each and every bite bursting with authentic spices and rich, comforting taste. There’s a wide variety of dishes to choose from, making it easy for anyone to find something they’ll love, whether you're a meat lover or prefer vegetarian options. I especially appreciated how affordable everything was, considering the generous portions and high quality of ingredients.

What really stood out was how deeply the experience immersed me in Nepali culture — from the traditional decor to the thoughtfully crafted menu. This is more than just a meal; it’s a cultural experience that transports you straight to the Himalayas.

The service was excellent, too. The staff was kind, attentive, and eager to explain dishes to a first-timer like me.

If you’re in San Francisco and want a delicious, authentic, and affordable culinary adventure, Himalayan Cuisine SF is a must-do.

Thanks to Bishow for taking us to the Himalayan Cuisine.

top_10.name: Sunset Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 642 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Sunset Indian Cuisine on Irving Street in San Francisco is a welcoming spot for authentic and flavorful Indian dishes. The food is freshly prepared, with well-balanced spices and generous portions that stand out for both taste and quality. The restaurant is clean and casual, the service attentive, and the menu offers a great variety—perfect for both dine-in and takeout. The waiter here doesn’t understand English well, make sure you ask them to repeat the order before confirming.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My family and I had an amazing experience at Sunset Indian Cuisine last night. We love trying new places and this was the one which didn't disappointed us. The ambiance was cozy for a relaxed dinner.
The food we had was so delicious. We started with the noodles, which was amazing with less oil. The Juicy Chicken Momo with chutney on the side was incredible. We also ordered Garlic naan, which was soft and warm, Tandoori chicken, Chicken curry, everything was perfect. The service was perfect with friendly and attentive waiter who was knowledgeable about the menu.
We'll definitely be back to try more of their Indian and Nepalese dishes, and we highly recommend this place to others !

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Garlic naan
Chicken biryani
Chicken curry

6 out of 5 stars! Excellent food and atmosphere. Completely authentic, 100% fresh and delicious. Great conversation with the staff as well. I have a food allergy and he reassured me that he took it very seriously and that my food was safe to eat, they even modified one of the dishes on the spot so I could still share it with everyone. If you’re in the area, don’t miss stopping by this location!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Been coming here for at least a couple months now. My partner and I are always cleaning our plates. Everything is always delicious. We often leave with full bellies and smiles on our faces! Thank you for always being so kind 🫶🏻

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you want to feel a family atmosphere with healthy authentic Indian food, this is your place! I ordered the lentil veggie soup with some Dahl. It’s simply delicious, healthy, comforting to my soul. Namaste

top_10.name: Trisara
top_10.address: 211 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food at Trisara Indo-Nepalese Restaurant was overall okay. The fried rice was good, but the noodles and Manchurian had a slightly sweet taste, which took away from the authentic flavor. The mango kulfi didn’t taste very fresh, which was a bit disappointing. On a positive note, the service was good and attentive. Overall, an average dining experience with room for improvement in authenticity and consistency.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was decent overall. The chicken fried rice was the best dish — flavorful, with a really good rice texture and a generous portion that two people can easily share. The chicken chow mein was also tasty and well-cooked. However, the chicken Manchurian wasn’t great — the tomato flavor was too strong and overpowered the dish. Overall, it’s an okay one-time dine-in experience — not bad, but not something I’d rush back for.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food is good but I asked for spicy and got a very mild curry. The tandoori chicken was a good portion but tasted a little old even when it clearly came on a hot sizzling plate.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We enjoyed a very good lunch. We split a two dishes- Aloo bhanta (eggplant and potato) and Dahl makani, as well as rice and naan.  Everything very flavorful. Service was very good.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Will not recommend this place if you’re looking for authentic Nepalese/Indian food. We ordered chow mein and chicken 65, both dishes completely lacked flavor. The chicken momos were okay, but the veg momos tasted stale. Overall, disappointing.

top_10.name: India Clay Oven
top_10.address: 2436 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Navi provided wonderful service. He was so kind and attentive. And gave us extra special treats.
The food was amazing. Chicken vindaloo was delicious and the Tandoori, chicken kebabs or perfect. Being light eaters, we brought our food home with us and we’ll have a wonderful dinner! Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Another great visit to this longtime restaurant in the Inner Richmond district. The atmosphere is always welcoming and Navi is very friendly, warm, and accommodating. The food is outstanding. Everything is excellent but if you are stuck trying to decide, try the delicious Thali dinner for 2 people. It comes with appetizers, main dishes, bread, rice, and dessert. Navi played music for us and offered us complimentary dessert and the chef gave us complimentary rice after seeing we could use more.  TRY IT, YOU'LL LEAVE SATISFIED

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: They are the best! Literally. I have a gluten allergy and they prepare my food with such care and give me extra portions. Their chicken tikka masala is the bomb. Chai tea is so satisfying. Atmosphere is relaxing and beautiful. Service is attentive and kind and music is fun :) take a look at the ice cream they gave us with extra portions! A beautiful night indeed.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing indian food in SF!! The service was amazing, we were celebrating a birthday and they dimmed the lights, sang happy birthday and added candles to our cake! The food was top tier and the ambiance was cozy.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was our second time here, and once again the food did not disappoint. We had the chicken curry, my favorite chicken tikka masala, and garlic naan — all delicious and very satisfying. The tikka masala was rich, creamy, and flavorful with tender chicken. The curry was great, and the garlic naan tied it all together perfectly. On top of that, the staff truly cares about their customers and is very kind and attentive. Simple atmosphere, but the food and service speak for themselves. Definitely coming back again!

testimonials:
Navi provided wonderful service. He was so kind and attentive. And gave us extra special treats.
The food was amazing. Chicken vindaloo was delicious and the Tandoori, chicken kebabs or perfect. Being light eaters, we brought our food home with us and we’ll have a wonderful dinner! Highly recommend.

Another great visit to this longtime restaurant in the Inner Richmond district. The atmosphere is always welcoming and Navi is very friendly, warm, and accommodating. The food is outstanding. Everything is excellent but if you are stuck trying to decide, try the delicious Thali dinner for 2 people. It comes with appetizers, main dishes, bread, rice, and dessert. Navi played music for us and offered us complimentary dessert and the chef gave us complimentary rice after seeing we could use more.  TRY IT, YOU'LL LEAVE SATISFIED

They are the best! Literally. I have a gluten allergy and they prepare my food with such care and give me extra portions. Their chicken tikka masala is the bomb. Chai tea is so satisfying. Atmosphere is relaxing and beautiful. Service is attentive and kind and music is fun :) take a look at the ice cream they gave us with extra portions! A beautiful night indeed.

top_10.name: Diwali Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1499 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We found this place on a whim and had the most incredible meal at Diwali! The menu showcases a variety of dishes with something for everyone — beautifully crisp dosas, tons of flavorful vegetarian options, and plenty of delicious meat dishes for the carnivores in our group.

The dosa was the star for me: paper-thin, perfectly crispy, and served with chutneys and sambar that tasted unbelievably fresh. Every dish we tried was layered with spice and aroma without ever being overwhelming.

Service is warm and welcoming, and the staff really cared about explaining dishes and helping us choose. Portions are generous, prices are fair, and the atmosphere is cozy without feeling crowded. The owner, who is incredibly passionate about sharing the flavors she loves, is so kind and attentive.

Whether you’re craving comfort food, exploring new flavors, or dining with a mixed group of dietary preferences, this place nails it. We enjoyed it so much that we came back for my husband‘s birthday and tried some new things which all were a hit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recently ordered catering from Diwali for our baby shower last Sunday afternoon, and it was absolutely amazing! We had food for about 50 guests, and every single dish was delicious and served hot. The quality and flavor were outstanding—truly the best Indian food I’ve had in a long time.

All of our guests kept asking where the food was from because they loved it so much. Everything arrived on time, perfectly prepared, and made the event feel extra special. Highly recommend Diwali for anyone looking for top-notch Indian catering!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
AMAZING food, even amazing service. The hosts are so friendly, sweet and welcoming. The chicken 65 and vijaywara chicken biryani is our favourite. We have been here 5 times in 3 weeks already!!
Also the music here is so beautiful, full old Indian songs - reminds me of home every time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was unbelievably delicious with plenty of options. My favorite was the Chettinad Chicken please eat that. And the naan was perfectly fluffy.
Also the rice was insanely good idk how they did that it's better than normal rice. I don't have the vocabulary To describe how delicious this was! The ambience of the restaurant was perfect. Dim lights and chatter, it feels like the perfect cozy dinner environment. Also amazing service!!! Go support this new wonderful restaurant

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Our new favorite Indian restaurant in SF! Best dosa we have had in the city. We also got the pani poori and biryani which were delicious. The staff is incredibly friendly and were very accommodating of a nut allergy. The space is bright and cheerful. Perfect for a date night out or a dinner with friends. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Noe Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 4166 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here without a reservation on a weekend for lunch. We were seated quickly. The samosas were really good. The breads were huge. The curries definitely packed heat. The ice cream cubes to top off the meal were cute, milky, and sweet.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was too good and the service was also great (Bibek)the server was doing his job so well, the environment in this restaurant is incredible and comfortable I’ll suggest you to go and check once I bet you gonn love their food , service and environment 🤟

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Visited on a weekday night with a friend. We had the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, papadum and the wings. I also got the mango lassi which was so so good. Everything was so delicious and we've tried a couple of Indian restaurants in SF already -- this was truly outstanding! It was pretty affordable, service was quick and friendly. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Nice place to stop and get a meal. Portions are huge and either plan for leftovers or come very hungry. :-)  They had such favorable food, and the spices were amazing.  WISH I could find a place in Florida like this to frequent.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here to dine on a Friday evening with some friends. The food tasted very good, especially the garlic naan bread which we thoroughly enjoyed. The starters and the choices of curries was also plentiful.

The only downside was an unpleasant smell originating from the bathroom and the pretty long wait for the food to arrive.

top_10.name: Taj Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 5701 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Finally giving this new(ish) spot in the neighborhood now that they have some time to settle in.  Went with a Chicken Tikka Masala, Rice and some Garlic Naan. Instead of my usual go to Mango Lassi I went with a Salted Lassi. The Salted Lassi was nice and a good balance to the Masala (just know it’s a salted plain yogurt drink and not sweet like a Mango Lassi is).  Overall impressions of the food and experience is decent. Great Masala Sauce, but unfortunately the chicken was a bit dry and chewy on the day I had it. The Garlic Naan was great and very tasty with the sauce.  Value was ok, but note you have to pay $4 for rice to go with a $16 entree as rice is not included with the entree.. All in all it was a bit of a pricy lunch for one at $32 before tip. My suggestion is to go with a group to share different dishes family style. Decor is pretty basic, but very clean and nice service by staff.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
8/20/2025- update:
Still as good as the first time!  The  chick pea veggie fritters were amazing!   So is the curry!  Super yummy!

First time here and I was pleasantly surprised!  Food is very good!   I was wondering why my tea took a bit to get, they brew it and it’s milk chai.  We had the tandoori salmon and the veggie basmati rice and it was amazing!  Service is good, they are  very nice and the prices are good!  Will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We were looking for a good Indian spot before heading home and Taj looked pretty solid so we gave it a shot. Had the lamb chops, Saag Paneer, coconut rice, and garlic Naan. Everything was great the lamb was cooked and seasoned to perfection! They asked about spice level for the Saag Paneer. Very tasty.  They also have a yummy Chai. Really good spot. Ill definitely come again. The service was awesome as well. Really attentive and the vibe and music is great. Loved the fresh flowers on the table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Today we wanted to eat out, but we wanted comfort food after a long day in the city and this restaurant hit the spot! The ambiance and food is amazing, we were so impressed by the amount of love you could taste in every bite, reminded our family of eating back home (punjab)! We thanked the chef for his service and will definitely be going back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great spot for affordable, flavorful Indian food! We ordered the Baingan bartha, saag paneer, malai kofta, chicken curry, and tandoori chicken - all were delicious! will definitely be coming back here

top_10.name: Ocean Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 6127 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A hidden gem in Richmond neighborhood.  Food is great and price is reasonable.  Service is superb and quick.

Highly recommend the lamb chops. 10/10

Samosa is a little tough.  8/10

They gave us complementary crisp thin Indian bread as appetizer and sweet soup as dessert.

Restaurant itself is very clean and nicely decorated.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is one incredible Indian restaurant. The seafood biryani I had was so good. I ate every bite. I didn’t go away hungry. I highly recommend people try this place out at least once if you are in San Francisco. The ambiance of the place is very fancy and the service was very friendly. I would like to give them 5 stars all around.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Ocean Indian is an absolute gem. The service is warm, attentive, and genuinely welcoming, making you feel taken care of from the moment you walk in. The restaurant itself is beautiful—elegant, comfortable, and the perfect setting for a great meal.

The food is truly authentic and incredibly delicious. Every dish is full of flavor, perfectly prepared, and clearly made with care and quality ingredients. Highly recommend for anyone looking for outstanding Indian cuisine and a wonderful dining experience. Our family also orders from them regularly for healthy dinners at home on work nights. Such a special neighborhood restaurant!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The new Chef is amazing! Garlic Naan and Chicken curry is best in San Francisco Bay Area

Interior Design, esp lights look great!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We order from Ocean Indian Cuisine often because they consistently deliver authentic flavors and delicious food. Our go-to dishes are the chicken momos, chicken korma, and saag paneer — all are excellent every time. The food and service are always great, and it’s one of the most authentic Indian spots I’ve had in the neighborhood. It’s so convenient to have them nearby for a quick take-out dinner, and the staff are always friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend!

top_10.address: 489a 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had an amazing dining experience at Copper Chimney Indian Restaurant. The flavors were deep, balanced, and incredibly satisfying. You can tell the chefs really know traditional Indian cuisine. The restaurant was clean, comfortable, and well-organized. This is now one of my favorite spots for Indian food in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First time visiting this establishment, to over the smell of spices when you walk in. Liked the decor and table set up.
We went for lunch and a friend left as he had an appointment and did not eat.
Naan bread as wonderful
Loved my momos
Butter chicken was good but found a big bone
Service was a bit slow but happy

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Phenomenal all around. Some of the best Indian food I have ever had, best food in general. The Samosas, butter chicken, and lamb curry were amazing. The service is also very wonderful. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Copper Chimney has quickly become one of my favorite Indian restaurants. The flavors are bold yet balanced, and every dish feels thoughtfully prepared. The service was excellent, and the staff genuinely seemed to care about our experience. It’s a perfect place for both locals and visitors.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow, what a delicious meal! I ended up next to this restaurant by chance and was hungry. I came in with zero expectations but left wanting to come back. The vegetables were fresh and perfectly cooked. They even offered to customize the creaminess of my dish to suit my preference. The food was flavorful, filling, and the right amount for me, with a little bit leftover for lunch. They also served a very generous portion of wine. If I find myself in this area again, I'll eat here.

top_10.name: Tacos El Patron
top_10.address: 1500 S Van Ness Ave #100, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’m born and raised in Boston, and I thought we had some pretty decent Mexican food here, but boy was I wrong. I was visiting SF and a coworker recommended Tacos El Patron to me. I’m glad I made the journey here because I think it’s the best Mexican food I’ve ever had. I think it’s ruined my enjoyment of Mexican food at home, because now I know what I’m missing out on…I will forever compare everything I eat in MA, to this restaurant in SF.

Of course, in MA we don’t have the same choice and variety as you do in CA, but still! Everything was 10x more flavorful than what I’ve had at home in Massachusetts. The portion sizes are also great - usually I’m used to having to order 2 or 3 tacos or a couple tamales to be satisfied. But just one taco or tamale here is a pretty big portion (for me at least!). The horchata was also incredible! The birria tamale is so cool - it’s a must try for sure! I also had a birria taco and a taco al pastor with carne asada - also very good choices. The salsa that comes with the chips is also very flavorful, and actually a bit spicy. Nothing too hot for me, but I was surprised because in Massachusetts the free salsa is always zero spice hahaha. What a great place - I can’t wait to come back here again on my next trip to SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: When I say these are the BEST birria tacos I have EVER had I am not exaggerating. The beef was cooked perfectly and was tender and juicy. Consomme had a lovely umami and rich flavor. The salsas were made in house, cold, and refreshing. My agua fresca was definitely a bit too sweet but that’s probably how it’s supposed to be. Will absolutely be back next time I’m in the Mission district.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here for the birria tacos, consomé, and ceviche and WOW. We were not ready for the flavor, in the best way possible. In a big city where spice and seasoning often get watered down to “appeal to everyone,” this place said nah🔥.

This is authentically Mexican, full of bold flavor, rich broth, and that homemade touch you don’t find everywhere. The birria was juicy, the consomé hit the soul, and the ceviche was fresh and perfectly balanced.

If you like real flavor, real spice, and food that doesn’t apologize for being good, this is your spot.
Muy auténtico. Mucho sabor. 100% recomendado. 🇲🇽

I’ll absolutely be back. 5/5 — vengan con hambre.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Loved the food and the vibe. They are generous with the amount of meat that goes onto the quesadilla birria tacos. Small location, but it held pur 15 people party and some. Definitely recommend stopping by.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It’s all about the food!!
Wide range of traditional Mexican food on the menu - one more delicious than the other 🤤
We did try only the Tacos, which were SUPER (I would suggest to take at least two - you also get a free side!) but also the burritos seemed quite tempting(and also were huuuuuge)
They bring you at the table a free side of Nachos with Salsa 🤩

100/10!! Definitely will be back 🙌🏽
