top_10.name: La Oaxaqueña
top_10.address: 2128 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I absolutely loved this place. I went there for lunch on a Saturday and when I got, I was able to find a a table, but just after 15 minutes, it got filled up completely, and there was a line to get a table.

The restaurant itself is pretty small and intimate, and it has a lot of very colourful decoration, which makes you feel like you in some carnival.

I want to try a bunch of things. Everything was fresh and they told me that it would take up to 20 minutes to make my food, which was such a refreshing change from places that pre-cook your food. I was more than happy to wait.

I got the tamales first. This was my first time having a actual tamale outside of the trader Joes frozen one, and it was so good. I was taken a bag by the beans and potatoes with the chicken filling, but it was so hot with the two salsas. Also, it was steaming hot.

I also got the quesa birra as that is one of my favourite things to get, and this one was honestly above average. The taco could be Chris up better, and the feeling could be a little more generous, but the taste was on point.

The last thing I got was the papusa and again, this was my first time trying one, so I am not sure if this was a good one, but it was very tasty. It was hot and hearty went well with the pickled vegetables.

The host was so nice and welcoming and made me feel really comfortable with the menu that I was largely unfamiliar with.

I will definitely be back and bring more people.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Delicious and authentic Oaxacan food with gracious service and cheerfully colorful decor too near 17th & Mission. Recommend!

During my friend’s and my lunch visit in early September 2025, crispy roasted Oaxacan grasshoppers (chapulines) were in season, and La Oaxaqueña’s were crunchy and tasty just like I remember from my trips to Oaxaca in years past. We tried both shrimp and chicken tacos as well as the traditional Oaxacan “tlayudas” (extra-large crispy corn tortillas topped with refried beans, meat, melted Oaxacan string cheese, and salsa, big enough to serve two, for about $20). I enjoyed them all!

For dessert, we tasted sweet fried plantains with the traditional sour cream as well as Mexican alfajores (cookies).

The space was comfortable for meeting my friend, a new professional connection, for a networking lunch. And the colorful decor definitely brought back memories of Oaxaca and made for a lively and upbeat vibe for our first meeting as well.

One member of the couple sharing lunch at the table next to us ordered the chicken with black chocolate mole sauce traditionally served at Oaxacan weddings (mole negro fandango), and that looked authentic, too, though I did not taste it this visit. During our time in Oaxaca, this was the signature dish that was served in fine-dining restaurants. I definitely will take my wife to try La Oaxaqueña’s version of that dish for date night sometime.

And I think this would be a suitable and fun place to meet someone new, not just in a professional networking setting, but also for a first or second date.

The person at the counter when we were there was friendly, helpful, and welcoming, and they cheerfully accommodated my hanging out on the Wi-Fi with my laptop after lunch until the beginning of the dinner service.

I’ll be back for more at La Oaxaqueña!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It’s a good thing I don’t live here because I’d never leave!! I got 4 tacos, a pupusa revuelta (not pictured), Jamaica agua fresca, and then my friend got some chips and guacamole and fried plantains for the table. Everything was exceptionally fresh and flavorful. I got a hot chocolate today and it was the perfect end to a perfect dinner. Service was also impeccable!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Solid burrito from La Oaxaqueña! I went with the grilled chicken and it definitely hit the spot — super savory, a little on the salty side, but in a way that made it really satisfying. The chicken was well-seasoned and nicely grilled, giving it a smoky depth that stood out against the rice and veggies. Big, hearty portions too — one of those burritos that feels like a meal and a half.

Only downside: I got it delivered and the bag arrived pretty soggy for some reason, which was a bit off-putting. Luckily, the food itself held up fine and still tasted great.

Food-wise, this place is strong — definitely worth checking out if you’re craving a bold, flavor-packed burrito.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent Jamaican Jerk Chicken Burrito with pineapple, salsa, plantains, rice, and beans for $14! Also enjoyed the steak quesadillas for $12.50 but not as great value wise as they are small. Would definitely go here again as they provide unique and delicious takes on Mexican food!

I enjoyed them all!

For dessert, we tasted sweet fried plantains with the traditional sour cream as well as Mexican alfajores (cookies).

The space was comfortable for meeting my friend, a new professional connection, for a networking lunch. And the colorful decor definitely brought back memories of Oaxaca and made for a lively and upbeat vibe for our first meeting as well.

One member of the couple sharing lunch at the table next to us ordered the chicken with black chocolate mole sauce traditionally served at Oaxacan weddings (mole negro fandango), and that looked authentic, too, though I did not taste it this visit. During our time in Oaxaca, this was the signature dish that was served in fine-dining restaurants. I definitely will take my wife to try La Oaxaqueña’s version of that dish for date night sometime.

And I think this would be a suitable and fun place to meet someone new, not just in a professional networking setting, but also for a first or second date.

The person at the counter when we were there was friendly, helpful, and welcoming, and they cheerfully accommodated my hanging out on the Wi-Fi with my laptop after lunch until the beginning of the dinner service.

I’ll be back for more at La Oaxaqueña!

It’s a good thing I don’t live here because I’d never leave!! I got 4 tacos, a pupusa revuelta (not pictured), Jamaica agua fresca, and then my friend got some chips and guacamole and fried plantains for the table. Everything was exceptionally fresh and flavorful. I got a hot chocolate today and it was the perfect end to a perfect dinner. Service was also impeccable!!

top_10.name: Loló
top_10.address: 974 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Their sauces and dressings are good. Fried avocado tacos are great with the habanero aioli. Young coconut appetizer was good if you like sour lemony sauce. Sweet Potato would have been better if it were baked or maybe bbqed - the dressing is good. Cauliflower tacos were good. Chiles Rellenos was okay - it felt too oily.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The tacos were great, especially the fish tacos. Was it worth $14 for 2 tacos? Maybe not. The chicken enchiladas was disappointing with a general lack of seasoning. The vibes are great and this is a good spot for date nights or intimate dinners with a small party.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Creative space that feels inviting.   We tried the guacamole, cauliflower tacos and the fried shrimp tacos.  The shrimp tacos were out favorite with a jicama tortilla.  The cauliflower tacos needed more flavor.  Still we loved the atmosphere and would definitely go back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What Cha Cha Cha used to be, reinvented with flair

Lolo delivers modern Latin tapas with vibrant flavors, playful plating, and a cocktail program that hits all the right notes. Think shareable bites, bright spices, and drinks that make you want to linger. It feels like a lively, updated version of what Cha Cha Cha once was, with its own fresh personality and plenty of Mission District charm.

We love the tacos tropical, the cabbage and jalepeno salad and are always amazed at their weekly specials.

Great for: lively nights out, tapas with friends, bold flavors, cocktail lovers, celebrating something fun.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best meals I’ve had in a long time. The service was prompt and attentive, the server provided detailed guidance on options we were curious about. We had a mix of starters and main dishes, the birrera tacos and empanadas were stand outs. Would definitely come back again.

testimonials: Their sauces and dressings are good. Fried avocado tacos are great with the habanero aioli. Young coconut appetizer was good if you like sour lemony sauce. Sweet Potato would have been better if it were baked or maybe bbqed - the dressing is good. Cauliflower tacos were good. Chiles Rellenos was okay - it felt too oily.

The tacos were great, especially the fish tacos. Was it worth $14 for 2 tacos? Maybe not. The chicken enchiladas was disappointing with a general lack of seasoning. The vibes are great and this is a good spot for date nights or intimate dinners with a small party.

Creative space that feels inviting.   We tried the guacamole, cauliflower tacos and the fried shrimp tacos.  The shrimp tacos were out favorite with a jicama tortilla.  The cauliflower tacos needed more flavor.  Still we loved the atmosphere and would definitely go back.

top_10.name: El Buen Comer
top_10.address: 3435 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My wife and I come here whenever we’re craving truly authentic Mexican food, the kind you’d find in Mexico City or Oaxaca. We usually split the Tacos de Tinga to start, then go for Mole con Pollo, Enchiladas, and/or Pozole Verde. We’ve tried plenty of other dishes, but these are the ones we always come back to. They are amazing!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Decided to give this corner eatery a try for a quick lunch pit stop. Lunch in my book is quick sit, refuel and go concept unless I'm on vacation.
I like the interior of the place. Very charming and inviting. I grabbed a table and ordered two tacos.  One fish and one shrimp, some chips and salsa and that was it.  I can really comment on the chips, you can equal or better in any taqueria, the salsa was alright but certainly not a home made version.  The tacos, mmmm for my taste the fish was over fried and so was the shrimp.  Nice presentation but average in taste and flavor.  Oh well maybe I have to see if dinner fare pans out better.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Our lunch was incredible! Highly recommend the torta and the huarache. Everyone who works there is great too. Cant wait to go back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We are lucky this place is just a short walk from our house. It’s as good as it gets. Mole and chile relleno are my favorites but never had a bad bite. This place deserves all the recognition it gets. Consistently great every time we go.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was walking to this place and wanted to eat there but it was near closing time. I was reading some reviews while walking for tips. Some people say they make great mole, so I walked faster because I love mole. I have been constantly disappointed with some mole experiences around here, so I was keen on trying this one.

I got the chicken with red mole to go. I used their restroom and when I finished, my order was just ready. As expected from an efficient, no-frill Mexican kitchen. That was a positive sign.

Got home after about 3 hours. Took a bite from the now-cold mole and, wow, this is exactly what I was looking for. A complex, well-balanced mole (not that easy to find). It was kinda addictive and I finished half of my dish cold. The chicken was fine and not very tender and the tortilla was ok, but as a whole, it was a very satisfying dish, especially when you mix a little bit of black beans with the mole and chicken and eat it with the tortilla. Buen comer, indeed.

top_10.name: El Farolito
top_10.address: 1230 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I ordered the shrimp super burrito and added carne asada. I had shrimp in every bite. Very generous portions and very delicious. My boyfriend and I downed the entire thing and left very happy. Staff is nice and food is very solid. I highly recommend

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great spot for some authentic Mexican food. The tacos were delicious. 😋 meat was tender and good flavor. Salsas did not disappoint. Not too spicy or too mild. Just right. Quesadilla was also good. I highly recommend this place if you’re a local or tourist. I’m a Texan and I know good Mexican food when I eat some. 😬
It’s also open late! Super convenient for late night dinners.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you're looking for a spot with a great local vibe that delivers on value, this is a perfect choice. It’s an unpretentious, no-frills kind of place that feels like a true neighborhood place.
The main draw here is the excellent value, especially for the burritos. While the flavors might be familiar, the food is dependably good, safe, and satisfying. The tacos were the same - not trying to be anything fancy, just solid, quality food.
This is the ideal spot when you just want a delicious, affordable meal without any fuss. It’s a solid, reliable choice that I'd happily visit again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Have had the bistec encebollado, Mexican Torta, SuperBurrito, and Super Nachos here.  All were pretty good (I skipped some sides due to dietary issues).  Prices are very reasonable.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We loved it! Our first time eating burritos and Quesadillas and the taste are fantastic. Hope we can try again next time. The price is really reasonable, the size was super. What an awesome experience 🥰

testimonials: I ordered the shrimp super burrito and added carne asada. I had shrimp in every bite. Very generous portions and very delicious. My boyfriend and I downed the entire thing and left very happy. Staff is nice and food is very solid. I highly recommend

top_10.name: Taqueria Los Mayas
top_10.address: 331 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This was our second time visiting Taquería Los Mayas, and we had a great experience. Lupita, who was working the cashier, greeted us with a big smile and made us feel very welcome from the moment we walked in. She was incredibly friendly and took the time to explain a few dishes we had never tried before, which really helped us know what to expect. She even let us sample the aguas frescas so we could choose our favorite—such a thoughtful touch.

We visited on a Tuesday, which happened to be Taco Tuesday, and we ordered four carne asada tacos, a burrito, and a panucho. Everything was absolutely delicious. We also ordered a michelada, and we highly recommend it—the mix was super tasty and well balanced.

We also appreciated how clean and well-maintained the restaurant was. Overall, we had a wonderful experience, thanks in large part to Lupita’s excellent customer service. We will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First time here, definitely not my last! Enjoyed a delicious super breakfest burrito with chips. Salsa bar provides variety and convenience. Reasonably priced, the burrito itself was $15! To top it off the staff is super friendly and respectful!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I admit I went looking for something not on the menu, and when I saw the place I chickened out at asking. It was busy...  normally a good sign, except when you're trying to bend the rules. My Google search suggested I could get chili relleno burritos there. They weren't on the menu. The chili relleno plate looked good, and reasonably priced, so I ordered that. The relleno was perfect. Sauce, consistency of the egg coating, charring of the chili: all perfect. But the beans that came with the order were creamed, which I dislike immensely. The rice was seasoned nicely, but was pretty unremarkable otherwise. Finally, the ambiance was sports bar, with tall, narrow tables and barstools.
So if that's what you're looking for: all sports bar with excellent Mexican food (except the creamed beans... I just can't) you might give Taqueria Los Mayas 5 stars. I would certainly eat there again, BUT I'll ask if they'll make me a chili relleno burritos first

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very good San Francisco, Mexican food, efficient friendly service, clean lots of space for eating inside, and reasonably priced, with a salsa bar.

Pro tip: this might be obvious to most, but just so you know do not place your order on the kiosk by the cash register and expect to pay for the order with cash. It only takes credit card, and you’ll need to start your order from scratch with the cashier if you want to pay with cash.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: They have good burritos and a large selection of salsas. I have been here multiple times and their quality is pretty good. Large vegetarian selection, soy chorizo, tofu, and beans sub.

top_10.name: Cantina Los Mayas
top_10.address: 431 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Enjoyed everything! We reserved the table in the back room which had a television playing old black and white Latin movies. We almost over ordered (because everything on the menu sounded so good), so great thing that our server guided us. We sampled all of the tacos which already can get quite filling. It was a group of us so we got the dessert platter to cap it all off.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a very nice restaurant with a beautiful design and a convenient location. The menu offers a good variety of dishes at reasonable prices, and overall the food was delicious. The orchata  wasn’t the best, but it was still okay. Our server was attentive, and the service made the experience even better. Overall, we had a very positive dining experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I came for brunch 10a- 1:30p Sat and Sun- wonderful food, everything is made in house.
Theyre open for dinner with a really nice quite extensive Mexican wine menu.  Come eat and enjoy.  5th Ave & balboa across from Cinderella

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We randomly stopped at this place looking for something to eat with my wife. The area is full of options, but they seemed to have the best vibe on a Sunday night. The staff was warm, courteous, and knowledgeable. The food was delicious, and we tried different wines while learning about them.
Juventino took the time to share insights about different wines and the Mexican wine industry, which was a big deal for us since we work in the industry. I’m extremely happy to see people who still genuinely care about service, what I like to call real hospitality.
Thank you, guys. We’ll definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ssshhh, let's keep this between us.  This small store front on an unassuming neighborhood business street is a hidden gem in the Richmond District of San Francisco.   Great service and pleasant atmosphere along with their excellent Mexican food, changes this neighborhood restaurant to a destination for great dining.  Enjoy!

top_10.name: Taquería El Farolito
top_10.address: 2779 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Burrito stuffed with goodness! The meat was hella good, and the balance between meat and everything else was legit. Not a very long line or wait, but for a burrito on Mission, I recommend this joint. There are only a few places like this that are worth the drive from San Jose, and it’s always a tasty treat. Orale!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Old school taqueria next to BART station at 25th street and Mission. Walk inside along the plexiglass covered kitchen to view the menu posted on the wall. Full menu of classic taqueria fare: burritos, tacos, plates and more. Cashier takes your order efficiently in a friendly tone. Choice of tortillas, beans and salsas. The kitchen cranks out the orders assembly line quick. Tired interior, but outside dining in the back. Maybe not a place to impress a first date. The food is the attraction: affordable and excellent quality.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: CASH ONLY! While in SF we had to get a mission burrito from the mission district! They are cash only. We each got the carnitas supreme burrito with rice, beans, sour cream and guacamole. Limited seating inside but we were able to secure a seat. We waited about 5 min for our meals to be cooked. The burritos were massive and lasted me about 3 meals. I think it even tasted better left over! Great place to come.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Quesadilla was nice. I like them more cheesy though. Carnita taco filling was good but the tortilla wasn't so great.
Big portions, fun vibe. Took a long time to order. Also a bit of a sketchy neighborhood at night.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Really great authentic burrito experience! Grab a burrito to go and walk around the streets of Mission or head over to Delores Park to relax.
Remember this is cash only! So make sure you have some notes, my carne asada burrito cost $9.95 plus tax.
This area is quite lively and some people may feel unsafe around here, but if you go with a small group & stay out of the way of locals you will be fine.

top_10.name: La Taqueria
top_10.address: 2889 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The hype is justified.  The best carne asada super burrito I have ever tasted.  Definitely get it toasted.  I wish it were spicier, but still.  Premium ingredients and cooked perfectly.  Strawberry aqua fresca was also very good.  At 3pm on Thursday, the wait in line was 16 minutes and 12 minutes to make the food.  No issues sitting a solo, if you don't mind sharing a table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here twice, two different times on a weekend. Always a long line. There is a long long wait. Average about an hour long. Easy set up. Pay for what you want and seat where they tell you. No seats if you ask for to go. Remember that!  You may sit with others if you are on a long table. There are some big group tables but might have to wait a bit. They do serve beer but no cocktails. Their portions are very generous. Had their regular taco carne asado. Can't image how big the super tacos are?? I love their burritos dorado style. No rice in their burritos so it doesn't make you super full. Love it! Crispy in the outside of the tortillas. Can't really ask to customize anything. Love their green spicy sauce and it's available on the table when you eat. You can buy the bottle as well. Very decent prices. Service is decent. Would come here again but can't come here when I am starving.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best burrito in the world nothing else compares and I’ve eaten a lot of burritos. I am not sure what it is but this place is just amazing. When my bf gets me from SFO I make him bring me this or if I’m visiting friends I always come here at least once. This place is always worth the wait and the amount of food they give for the price is a great deal too.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Famous burrito spot in Mission district. Long wait but the burrito is excellent. Taste of everything is superb. Really enjoyed the Super because it includes sour cream, cheese and avocado which just elevates the flavor. Vibe is authentic and there's nothing extra. You're just there for the good food! I would recommend a weekday as the line can be quite long and get there early!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I can’t even begin to describe how amazing the food is. I got the regular carne Asada burrito and oh my it was PACKED with flavor. The cut of meat was a nice and it was so smoky and had the perfect amount of char to it. Staff is very friendly the only thing that could improve was just the wait time. We got sat in under 15 min but once sat we waited about 35-40 min for just two burritos. The food was worth it though will stop by every time I’m in the city.

top_10.name: Taqueria Cancun
top_10.address: 2288 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food is hearty and affordable, but lacks flavor a bit for me. I was planning to try this place for a while as it’s a true SF staple but was disappointed by the quesadilla I picked. Just tons of cheese and bland chicken. Barely could finish a half of it. The wet burrito had more taste thanks to the sauce so that’s probably the safe choice if you can manage to eat that huge thing. The service was very friendly though and the ambiance of a lively Mexican spot was nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First time coming here and it was great. Service is fast and to the point. Its a little on the spendier side for a burrito but it's 2025 so im not mad. The chips are thicc bois and the salsa is too. Can't wait to come back and try more meat options. Also the tortillas are like... crazy good.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent tacos and quesadillas! The outside looks a bit like a hole in the wall but the inside is super colorful and lively, and the salsa is always a little bit more spicy than you think. The portion sizes are also pretty generous- a single taco is really heaped enough for two tacos

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We were told that anyone visiting San Francisco must try out a Mission burrito. Taqueria Cancun was one of the names that came up so we had high hopes going in.

Unfortunately, the experience was underwhelming. The chicken burrito tasted exactly like how you’d imagine it. It tasted like a burrito that you could get pretty much anywhere else in the United States. Maybe a little more authentic than that.

It was, however, quite sizable so you definitely get a good value out of the meal. The salsa was also delicious. It was spicy, but flavorful.

Overall, we were glad to experience it. Everyone working here was super nice and friendly as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Clean food, decent quantity. Taste could be better. Didn't like guacamole, came like a green fine paste. Tried Super Veggie Burrito. Limited seating.

testimonials: The food is hearty and affordable, but lacks flavor a bit for me. I was planning to try this place for a while as it’s a true SF staple but was disappointed by the quesadilla I picked. Just tons of cheese and bland chicken. Barely could finish a half of it. The wet burrito had more taste thanks to the sauce so that’s probably the safe choice if you can manage to eat that huge thing. The service was very friendly though and the ambiance of a lively Mexican spot was nice.

top_10.name: Cocobang
top_10.address: 550 Taylor St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Super tasty late night dinner place! No reservation so we waited around 30 minutes to get a table. Service and atmosphere was okay, very busy vibes around the time we ate (8PM).

Food was so delicious and filling for the price! The corn cheese was so good and cheesy, it went well with everything. The kimchi fried rice was also delicious and all the ingredients came together perfectly. The BBQ combo is the best deal for the price and the meat was flavorful and tender, with an extra bowl of white rice to go with it. I would recommend ordering any of these items because they were all so tasty! We still had leftovers too.

Overall, I would definitely recommend coming here for a cheap, tasty, late night dinner. I do wish there was some dessert on the menu though!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious food, amazing atmosphere and great service. Highly recommend. The food was sweet and spicy and savory just made you happy to be there and experience what Korean food can offer to your tastebuds.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was our 2nd dinner of the night. We had the chicken wings with green onion and the seafood pancake with makgeoli and beer. Fun spot for late night food during a bar hop!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We were hungry after a day of baseball and sight seeing ans I was craving hotpot. So we found this cute little place. The wait was about a 20 minute wait. The wait staff was super friendly. We had the army soup and the kimchi fried rice. It was so delicious. Would def. War here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Coco Bang might not look super fancy from the outside, but don’t let that fool you. This place is awesome! As soon as we walked in, the staff was super friendly and made us feel welcome. The vibe inside is really cool and relaxed. It’s a great place to hang out and enjoy a meal with friends or family.

We ordered six different dishes and shared them family-style. Every single one was delicious! The flavors were amazing, and you can tell the food is made with care. It’s hard to find a place where everything you try tastes this good.

If you’re looking for great Korean food and a fun atmosphere, Coco Bang is the place to go. We had a great time and can’t wait to come back!

testimonials:
Super tasty late night dinner place! No reservation so we waited around 30 minutes to get a table. Service and atmosphere was okay, very busy vibes around the time we ate (8PM).

Food was so delicious and filling for the price! The corn cheese was so good and cheesy, it went well with everything. The kimchi fried rice was also delicious and all the ingredients came together perfectly. The BBQ combo is the best deal for the price and the meat was flavorful and tender, with an extra bowl of white rice to go with it. I would recommend ordering any of these items because they were all so tasty! We still had leftovers too.

Overall, I would definitely recommend coming here for a cheap, tasty, late night dinner. I do wish there was some dessert on the menu though!

Delicious food, amazing atmosphere and great service. Highly recommend. The food was sweet and spicy and savory just made you happy to be there and experience what Korean food can offer to your tastebuds.
This was our 2nd dinner of the night. We had the chicken wings with green onion and the seafood pancake with makgeoli and beer. Fun spot for late night food during a bar hop!

top_10.name: Daeho Kalbijim & Beef Soup
top_10.address: 1620 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We went here on a Friday night at 7pm and waited roughly 1hr 15mins for a table of 2.

Ordered the Regular size premium Kalbijjim and it was amazing!  The portion was huge and they do not skimp out on the beef. We love that there was also stewed radish, potato, carrot and rice cakes inside. The flavour was delicious and very much worth the wait!
The banchan was good and free refill. Kimchi, radish not too spicy or salty. Service was fast and efficient give how busy they were.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious galbijjim with a modern twist and some showmanship. I always bring visitors here as it’s a great spot to have a family style meal. The galbijjim is delicious, keeping true to the classic dish while adding melted cheese on top for richness and a fire torch show for your IG story post. The banchans are good, and the other dishes are good too, but get the galbijjim to share between 2-4 people. It’s not the cheapest though so expect to spend $50 per person and potentially a wait during busy hours.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I know this might not be the most authentic Galbijjim, but it just tastes so good! It’s more of an LA-style version than a traditional Korean one, but it’s a great fusion that you can’t stop eating. The beef is incredibly tender, and the spice level is perfect. It’s a bit on the sweet side for my taste, but still totally enjoyable!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hands down best kalbijjim from a restaurant and I crave it from time to time. This second time we got the premium kalbijjim (large, mild, cheese) and it was intense, flavorful, unbelievably good. The short rib meat was so tender. Each bite was bursting with flavor. Whenever we come back to SF, we will come once again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
2025: One of the best meals we had on our trip here. Service is flawless, dishes are absolutely delicious and packed with flavour.
The Kalbijim / braised ribs is a massive dish that probably feeds four, sadly we didn't even come close to finishing it. Everything in it is so tender and resonates with the feeling of a home cooked meal.
Hot tip, don't load up on the entree dishes first.
*****

top_10.name: SAN HO WON
top_10.address: 2170 Bryant St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Overall worth the hype, definitely amongst the top KBBQ spots in the US, and the price reflects the food quality and good service. Definitely love to go back and try the very popular galbi and egg soufflé
+ Amazing food. I absolutely loved the tofu banchan, and the other 2 banchans were also quite nice. Jebi churi and kochi skewers were both flavorful and cooked to perfection. And the housemade samjang sauce was a great pairing with the grilled meat. Kimchi jjigae was tasty but a little too sour for me. And the black sesame soft serve was an incredible end to the dinner. The sundae looked simple but there were bits of chocolate, black sesame and huckleberry jam buried underneath the soft serve, making every bite super interesting and different (with minimal mess at that!)
- All the food was mostly fatty, salty and sweet forward. It’d be great to have something fresh and/or sour to cut through. I’d absolutely recommend ordering ssam/salad and more sour kimchi to eat with the grilled meat
+/- Decent service and atmosphere. They were quite busy so it might take a while to flag down a staff. Loved that they have hooks and cubicles to place belongings right next to your table
= Definitely try to make a reservation, or wait like 2+ hours for a table as they are very popular

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was amazing! We were celebrating my partner’s birthday, and the team made the experience even more special. We also have shellfish and dairy allergies, and they went above and beyond — they modified dishes and even provided us with a separate menu to fit our needs. Everything we ordered was delicious. We had the glazed short ribs, BBQ prime ribs, white rice, and the beef potstickers — all SO good! They also serve a lovely tea at the end, which was such a nice touch.

And I have to mention — the bathroom is insane. So beautiful and such a vibe.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Went for a prix fixe menu on Friday night. I didn't feel like the meat dishes are better than the avg you'd get at a good Korean restaurant. The only standout in my opinion was the seafood pancake.

Bulgoli was way too saucy. The beef neck is pretty juicy but not memorable. I didn't like the pork kimchi jiggae at all.

The walls of the restaurant are very echoey so it was difficult to have a conversation without yelling

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was outstanding. Easily top 10 meals lifetime. Possibly best ever. Every dish was spectacular while building on and complimenting the previous dishes. I started with the YUJU highball cocktail which was refreshing and delicious. We had the house menu and chose the ribeye bulgogi and pork jowl jjigae and the beef tartar & Asian pear add-on. As I said, everything was amazing and it's really hard to pick any standout. But I will say the egg souffle was next level and that beef neck fillet was excellent. The service was impeccable but the place is approachable and not pretentious at all. If you are in San Francisco and want an incredible dining experience that includes actual great food, I cannot recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
San ho won is perfection. They took classic korean flavours, preserved them and celebrated them, then adorned them.
Im obsessed with this restaurant
I can't get into the details of everything because everything was perfect and it would take too long😂. Get a reservation. Thats it.

Kalbi and rib cap are OUTSTANDING CUTS OF MEAT. I truly cant believe the way they balanced chewy and melty.
The soybean stew with clams is so nostalgic and made to perfection.
Soufflé egg is a must try at least once.
Beef tartare was unlike any I've ever had before, the beef was plush almost airy, and fresh.
The soft serve is the best soft serve I've ever had in my life both flavors are amazing but particularly loved the black sesame, the black sesame flavor is not overpowering and the huckleberry jam is balanced and interesting. Every flavor and sensation as well balanced and I love how the soft serve itself is almost icy, it is brilliantly refreshing after the flavor bombs of the night.
Need to go back ASAP.

EDIT:
Went back 5 days later and got beef neck filet (my new favourite cut) and the western mushrooms (make sure u squeeze that lemon and drench the ssam in it after u make a wrap)
Song yi jook is impeccable. Peak comfort food, do you think it's simple and with a higher price tag you may be apprehensive, but i truly think its worth it. Its some how wildly flavourful yet so comforting and light, i cant compare anything to it and i need it again so badly.

My perfect order:
Beef tartare
Beef neck filet
Kalbi
Ssam
Song yi jook
Extra kimchi

And the staff? I feel like im being welcomed home. They are the best, this is my safe space

😍😍😍🫰🫰🩵🩵 san how won is perfection

top_10.name: Surisan
top_10.address: 505 Beach St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Surisan is located right by Fisherman’s Wharf, with a great view and a cozy, stylish atmosphere that feels relaxed and inviting. The service was solid and professional — everything we needed was taken care of without being overly chatty or intrusive, which I personally appreciated. It made the whole experience feel comfortable and well-paced.

The food was mostly very enjoyable, with one absolute standout: the Poke Salad. It was genuinely outstanding — fresh, flavorful, and beautifully layered. The sweetness from the mango added a perfect contrast, and the poke was served inside a giant crispy shrimp cracker “bowl,” which was both creative and delicious. This dish alone is worth coming back for.

We also tried the stir-fried Shin ramen. The presentation was cute and playful, and flavor-wise it was exactly what you’d expect — a solid, comforting fried noodle dish. The raspberry lemonade was rich and refreshing, and the dessert (I unfortunately forgot the name) was nicely balanced and not overly sweet.

One dish I would strongly recommend skipping is the Loco Moco. It was overcooked, and the patty was extremely tough and dry — easily the weakest dish of the night.

Overall, Surisan is definitely worth a visit, especially if you’re already in the Fisherman’s Wharf area. It’s a chill, pleasant place with a great location and some genuinely excellent dishes — just be selective about what you order.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here right at 9 a.m. on a Monday for breakfast. The interior has a nice modern café and homey feel. Unfortunately, the service wasn’t the best. Our server forgot to order my food, so I had to wait until everyone else was finished eating before mine came out. They offered me a specialty fruit drink and 20% off my dish, which ended up being about $5 off. I appreciated the gesture, but considering the situation, I think comping the dish would’ve been more appropriate, especially since I don’t drink juice or soda, so the fruit drink went untouched.

As for the food, the French toast was definitely the highlight with a crispy outside and creamy center that was really well done. I ordered the Surisan Scramble, which was decent, though the bread that came with it was a bit burnt. Overall, the food was pretty good, but the service missed the mark and made the experience just okay.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visiting SF for four days .. went here TWICE! First time loved it so much so we had to go again!!!
Chicken cup bap was sooo good! Had the veggie scrambler w a side of beef patty.
Very yummy and satisfying.
Cute patio.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wow! Everything hit the perfect note

The Galbi-Jimm Benedict was succulent and melts in your mouth

The ricotta pancake might be the best pancakes I've tried in the city, and the Vermont maple syrup is chefs kiss

But mostly importantly, everyone is extremely friendly, amazing service

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Went here for brunch. Ordered millionaires bacon - nothing special, candied bacon. Beef short rib benedict, braised pork belly rice, 1 americano, 1 cappucino  - total 110 including tip. I enjoyed my meal, i found the experience overpriced.

top_10.name: Manna
top_10.address: 845 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great food, good for family style and decent portions. Overall I’d recommend the dumpling soup and soft tofu soup. Decently prices but it’s walk in only. Expect a wait! There’s indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
You may need to wait in line in the evenings, but it’s absolutely delicious.
I also recommend having classic soju with the food.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My daughter loves this place for takeout and I finally got to dine in for lunch.  We usually get japchae or bibimbap but I got to try the soft tofu soup today.  Yum!  It’s exciting presentation, great flavor.  The seafood has a lot of clams/mussels/squid so I wished I had chosen a different meat or veggie instead.  Filling and satisfying and at 4 pm no food coma!  Efficient service, a little cramped.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Tofu soup is bomb - so soft and soup is so soothing. Definitely my place for comfort food. Ordered their grilled beef too, it was nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Manna was outstanding. We came for dinner on a Wednesday night around 7 and the place was packed. We only had to wait about 5 minutes. Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend Manna.

I would rate everything 5/5 but the Seafood dol-sot bibimbap was probably my favorite.

Haven’t been to a restaurant that I have enjoyed this much in a long time.

top_10.name: Muguboka Restaurant
top_10.address: 401 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I started eating immediately because I couldn’t wait!  The pictures show the food missing a few bites!  Haha!  Delicious!  The sautéed spicy pork belly was rich and perfect with rice.  The cold noodles chewy and tasty.  Old school decor felt just right.   Nothing flashy. The food spoke for itself. I think the server is also the proprietor.  Friendly and asked if we needed to replenish our banchai.  I will be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place is it. If you’re looking for cozy Korean food with a solid array of soup options, look no further, this place is it.

I’ve been here once to try various soups (unpictured), and they were great. This time, I tried their bibimbap and tofu soup. Also fantastic. The bibimbap comes sizzling in its stone pot and gets crispy if you let it sit. Complementary banchan and fried mandoo.

Service is also very responsive and attentive. Clean tables.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everything was great! The food, staff, ambience. Its a cute little restaurant, perfect for families and friends. The staff was super accommodating and they altered the dishes for us since most of us don’t eat red meat. We tried the Soft Tofu, Duk Boki, Korean Kimchi Pancakes and Bibimbap. Each dish was great, the bibimbap was a little bland but the sides made up for that.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The seafood pancake was definitely the best, it had a chewy center and good amount of crust. But most importantly, they actually packed it with seafood unlike other restaurants. The tofu soup was good, not overly impressive, only had abit of beef.

You get a decently large amount of food for the price, but regardless it’s still expensive and NOT $20-30 per person.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is my probably thousand times coming here hahahaha I just love the food so much and I love to say hi to everyone there! They are all ones of the most wonderful people I have ever met; very friendly and very smiley 😊 We ordered the same things we usually ordered as well; Dok Bokki, Daeji Bulkoki, Jap Chae and Seafood tofu soup 🍜 They are all soooooo good and tasty as always!!!!! 😋😋😋 Thank you so much for always filling our stomach with good and tasty food. I really feel like mama’s home cooking ❤️❤️❤️ The ambiance is so cozy and comfy; really feel like home 🏡 Highly recommended this Korean place as I think it is the best one in SF we have ever tried. We have been living here for always 10 years now and we will come back for more!! 🥰🥰

top_10.name: Han Il Kwan
top_10.address: 1802 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was great—especially the Korean BBQ, which I really enjoyed. The service was good overall, but I wish we had a bit more attention from the waiter. At one point I wanted to order more food, but the waiter wasn’t around. I’d recommend ordering everything you want right away. Still, the food itself was very good and worth it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The best Korean food I had in the Bay Area. Great portion for the BBQ, every dish is so flavorful, I absolutely love everything including the free small dishes.

Just be aware it’s kind of hard to find parking in the residential area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have visited here many times, usually when I am in the area where I am craving for some good Korean food. Most of the times when I arrive there is a wait with multiple parties ahead of me, but I do not mind since I am a very patient person. The food and service is good here, so I understand why it is always busy and packed here. You can choose to have either their Korean barbecue dishes or their traditional authentic Korean items. Their menu consists of shareable items, soups, stir fry dishes, and much more delicious items. The staffs here are welcoming, well trained and understanding where I never encountered any issues during any of my visits. If you are not in the mood in waiting then I recommend you making a reservation if available. I highly recommend this place to all Korean food enthusiasts, to all Korean barbecue lovers, or if you just want to try something new. I definitely will be back to tryout the other delicious options they have to offer.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely phenomenal experience at Han Il Kwan. It's very busy, and will come with a wait, but it's absolutely worth it. It's best with a big group, as you can get a lot of variety that way.

The meats were all absolutely excellent, and the banchan was delicious. We also got the japchae which I loved. The service is also excellent despite them being very busy!

Hugely recommended, would for sure come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We were in the mood for Korean BBQ so we stopped by here. We caught them in the busiest time and had to wait a bit.
The meat for the grill is definitely overpriced considering the few options you get and the portion size they give you. All the kimchis are really good and I can say we had a good time.

top_10.name: 707 Sutter
top_10.address: 707 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Hellllll yea! This place is great. The food is delicious the service is very friendly and pleasant. Highlight for me was the seafood pancake and the soft tofu soup 🤤. Also the soy garlic wings we loved and the corn cheese! The banchans were great too!

We stumbled on this pace while on the area and hungry and we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Overall, the food was decent and the prices felt reasonable for what you get. The bibim mandu had a lot of vegetables, so it felt light and refreshing—almost like eating a salad, which I liked. The stir-fried squid was pretty good too. I ate half there and took the rest home to turn it into fried rice, and it actually tasted even better that way.

The gamjatang hot pot, however, was a bit disappointing. Instead of sigeumchi greens, it had kimchi in it, and the broth was oddly thick and gritty because there was way too much perilla powder. The pork also had a noticeable smell, probably because it seemed to have been pre-boiled and refrigerated before serving. It almost felt like they added extra perilla powder to cover that smell.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’m in town for a convention and came to 707 Sutter for some late night dinner. It’s a cozy little place with nice ambiance and great service. I got the Fried wings w/soy garlic and Beef dumplings. Everything was incredibly fresh and delicious, even an hour before closing. They brought this delightful appetizer platter out and it was ALL delicious! Then the dumplings were crispy but tender inside and the wings were crunchy and perfect. 10/10 loved it! 😋

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
707 is a great go-to Korean restaurant, especially if you’re in the Union Square area. It’s close to my office, so I like to stop by for dinner after work.

The food is consistently good — I’ve been here many times and it always hits the spot. Nothing mind-blowing, but definitely satisfying and dependable.

I’d give it a 3.5/5 overall. Great option if you’re craving Korean comfort food in the area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was traveling for work and was really craving korean food. This place was a saving grace! I went in for lunch on a Tuesday and it was completely empty, which initially made me worry, but I was completely wrong! The kimchi stew and rolled egg were super delicious. Even the side dishes (banchan) all tasted better than the any other korean restaurants i've been to.

Looking at the menu and the interior vibe, it seemed like a great place to go out for late dinner and drinking with friends.

testimonials:
Hellllll yea! This place is great. The food is delicious the service is very friendly and pleasant. Highlight for me was the seafood pancake and the soft tofu soup 🤤. Also the soy garlic wings we loved and the corn cheese! The banchans were great too!

We stumbled on this pace while on the area and hungry and we will definitely be back!

Overall, the food was decent and the prices felt reasonable for what you get. The bibim mandu had a lot of vegetables, so it felt light and refreshing—almost like eating a salad, which I liked. The stir-fried squid was pretty good too. I ate half there and took the rest home to turn it into fried rice, and it actually tasted even better that way.

The gamjatang hot pot, however, was a bit disappointing. Instead of sigeumchi greens, it had kimchi in it, and the broth was oddly thick and gritty because there was way too much perilla powder. The pork also had a noticeable smell, probably because it seemed to have been pre-boiled and refrigerated before serving. It almost felt like they added extra perilla powder to cover that smell.

I’m in town for a convention and came to 707 Sutter for some late night dinner. It’s a cozy little place with nice ambiance and great service. I got the Fried wings w/soy garlic and Beef dumplings. Everything was incredibly fresh and delicious, even an hour before closing. They brought this delightful appetizer platter out and it was ALL delicious! Then the dumplings were crispy but tender inside and the wings were crunchy and perfect. 10/10 loved it! 😋

top_10.name: um.ma
top_10.address: 1220 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: They have a large outdoor patio in the back. Food didn't take a long time. It was really good. The soft shell crab was good but decently spicy. Overall this was a really solid Korean restaurant I could for sure come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Not a bad price at all for the atmosphere and quality of food. I really enjoyed the patio, super cute and cozy. My sister loved the sesame soy chicken wings. The soft tofu stew was tasty. We are definitely coming back to try their Korean BBQ!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So glad to finally try Um.mas and definitely worth it! The sundubu-jjigae was everything you could want out of a soup on a cold day. It was incredibly fresh and well seasoned, like everything else we had. They had great portion sizes as well for the price. Staff were incredibly polite and the overall vibes of the restaurant were chill and such a relaxing, fun place to be.  I'd definitely go back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Having been here dozens of times over the years, Um Ma is an acceptable spot for patio Korean food with good vibes, especially on a warm day.

Whether you are in Golden Gate Park or strolling through the sunset, it's conveniently located. Again, the vibes are good and the patio is a plus as it makes it dog friendly. Doesn't really feel like an authentic Korean place and it's a bit like they are trying too hard to be hip but maybe that's what sells. I recommend making reservations as it can get busy during prime time.

The service is ... usually sub par. Even on our best visit, it was still lacking. I want to be charitable and assume they are just severely understaffed. You'll often have a hard time getting a hold of them and even if you do, expect to remind them multiple times for requests. They've made it so you can now order on your phone but for any special requests, it's the same issue.

The food is pricey but a few of the dishes are actually worth it. Haven't visited in a while but apparently now they charge for extra banchan (side dishes)... what? I know times are tough but damn.

While the patio atmosphere is nice and the location is convenient for many, there are better Korean spots even in SF (and much, much better in the Bay in general).

Overall, the place is good but not great and while the atmosphere is lovely, things like the insufficient level of service and the inconsistent quality of the dishes makes it hard to make this a must visit for anyone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here on a weeknight, never had trouble getting a table. The food is good but not great, partially due to the prices to portion ratio.

We ordered teokkboki, LA galbi, beef bulgogi, pork belly, kimchi fried rice, bibimbap. Everything was well cooked. Galbi wasn’t too fatty and was delish, bulgogi was slightly too sweet but still tasty, kimchi fried rice lacked seasoning or taste, bibimbap had a unique western take on it, pork belly was mid.

One disappointing thing - banchan (small side dish) isn’t free flow - it’s just season quails eggs, spiced broccoli, yellow pickled radish and kimchi. It’s disappointing considering these are inexpensive sides even from a restaurant owner perspective.

I’ve dined here on multiple occasions, I’d personally recommend: LA galbi, scallion pancake, soonduboo jjigae, rock n roe rice and charred gai lon.

Service staff were good! We enjoyed our food and service, just oddly underwhelmed by needing to pay for side dishes which are free flow in majority of the Korean joints I’ve been to. It’s not a big deal, just in principle?

Would come again if I’m in the area. Total came to about $50+ per person with tips.

testimonials: They have a large outdoor patio in the back. Food didn't take a long time. It was really good. The soft shell crab was good but decently spicy. Overall this was a really solid Korean restaurant I could for sure come back.

Not a bad price at all for the atmosphere and quality of food. I really enjoyed the patio, super cute and cozy. My sister loved the sesame soy chicken wings. The soft tofu stew was tasty. We are definitely coming back to try their Korean BBQ!

So glad to finally try Um.mas and definitely worth it! The sundubu-jjigae was everything you could want out of a soup on a cold day. It was incredibly fresh and well seasoned, like everything else we had. They had great portion sizes as well for the price. Staff were incredibly polite and the overall vibes of the restaurant were chill and such a relaxing, fun place to be.  I'd definitely go back.

top_10.name: SUNGHO
top_10.address: 250 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I saw this on the Michelin website as recommended.
Food: Menu was limited, likely focused on their specialties. I ordered the pork bone soup and kimchi pancake. The soup was hot and flavorful. Quite filling. This soup is good as a full meal. It comes with a side of white rice so you should think it through if you’re getting another dish in addition.
The fried kimchi was not memorable. The edges were a bit burnt. Probably ok as a street food, not so much as an appetizer.
Drinks: the drinks were priced at city prices. Their makgeolli drink was exorbitant at $16 for a 750 ml plastic bottle. Not recommended.
Service:  It was a slow Monday night. The dinner crowd was thin so I got a lot of attention. The server was helpful and pleasant.
Location and facilities: The restaurant was cozy with a modern vibe. The place was clean and you’re not overwhelmed by the odor of food or smoke from the cooking. That’s a plus. The staff were dressed professionally and looked quite competent.
That said, this restaurant is in the heart of the tenderloin. The immediate perimeter did not exude sophistication and cleanliness, let alone a feeling of safety. I don’t recommend lingering in this area late at night or do what I did, walking from Union Square to this restaurant. Not a good idea. Parking can also be a safety issue so probably best to do ride-share.

Overall: Flavorful Korean food, cozy venue, good enough for a night out. I would’ve added another star if there were more options and if you can ignore the surroundings.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very soothing soup! If you enjoy something light yet layered with flavor, this is the place to go.

I especially liked the beef soup, though the pork version is also quite good. The kimchi pancake is nice and crispy, but I wish the flavor were a bit bolder.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We ordered the beef short rib soup (갈비탕), spicy pork bone soup, and kimchi pancake. The 갈비탕 is the best I’ve had in the Bay Area and their kimchi pancake came out extra crispy.

The staff were incredibly kind despite having an issue with the WiFi this week and being cash only (temporarily). I hope people will continue to support this small business operating in a difficult area in the city. The food is absolutely delicious.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Walked in on a Friday night at 7:30 pm not expecting to get in but was pleasantly surprised when we were offered a seat at the counter. We ordered the kimchi pancake, bossam, and the pork bone broth soup. It was a total pork fest and I was full for hours after. Had I done it again I would have gotten the beef rib soup, just to mix it up. Kimchi pancake was thin and crispy. Bossam was super flavorful and very tender. The pork bone broth soup stole the show - so simple yet deeply satisfying and herbaceous. Service was great!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food is 10/10. I lowered my rating by a star due to service. Our order got lost and no one seemed to notice our empty table even after an hour. We eventually got our meal after I mentioned it. I think the waiters just need more training overall. Despite the hiccup, I would come back because the food is that good.

top_10.name: Piccolo Forno
top_10.address: 725 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
After our trip to Alcatraz and an afternoon of shopping at the Wharf, we worked up quite an appetite and decided to try Piccolo Forno. The restaurant is small and cozy, and as many have mentioned, there was a bit of a wait since we arrived later in the evening, but we didn’t mind at all. The incredible aromas coming from the kitchen made it worth it.

Our table ordered a great variety of dishes including pizza col salame, lasagna classica, ravioli di zucca, pappardelle al ragù, and ravioli di aragosta. For dessert, my friend enjoyed the cannolo siciliano. Overall, the food was delicious, comforting, and clearly made with care.

Service was friendly overall. There was a small hiccup when I was initially served the wrong dish. When I mentioned it, there was some confusion as I was told it was what I had ordered. However, my group did hear my order, and as a vegetarian, the dish I received wasn’t something I could eat. That said, this didn’t negatively affect our experience. The rest of the staff were very accommodating, and the owner handled the situation
wonderfully, which we truly appreciated.

I don’t enjoy confrontation and never want to make an issue, but I felt the way the situation was resolved spoke volumes about their professionalism and care for guests. We left full, happy, and satisfied and would absolutely return.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was lucky to grab an outside table before the lunch rush fully hit. The restaurant quickly got busy but felt I still received good service. Food was delicious and staff was responsive. Would definitely stop by again when I’m in SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This restaurant instantly became one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is just like you’re somewhere in Italy. These guys serve you with the real Italian passion and the last but not least you MUST try their Tiramisu, it’s from a different planet!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place was fantastic. When there are so many solid options for Italian in this area, piccolo doesn’t disappoint.
My wife has a pine nut allergy and they were confident in making sure she didn’t get cross contamination.
We got pepperoni pizza, dough is amazing. Pizza sauce is top notch. Lasagna was so good. The bolognese was what dreams are made of.
Food was excellent service equally matched. Will totally visit again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place was such a delight. The service was amazing and everyone was so friendly and made us feel right at home. The Cesar salad was divine. We also got the mushroom and sausage pizza and it was soooo good! Highly recommend stopping by!

top_10.name: Seven Hills
top_10.address: 1896 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This restaurant deserves five stars–and then some. Between the dim, intimate, lighting, attentive service, and truly fabulous food, there was nothing more we could have asked for. The complimentary bread arrived warm and pillowy soft. The autumn breeze mocktail was a beautiful study in balance, with ginger delicately offset by pomegranate. The agnolotti was playful and smart; when I punctured the cheerfully green pillows of pasta, the chicken filling revealed itself – creamy, inviting, and every bit as delicious as it looked. The market fish was earthy and impeccably cooked, fresh and silky with a gorgeous char. Its tender texture was perfectly balanced by the comforting starchiness of the rice. The squid ink lobster pasta was bold, unexpected, and deeply satisfying. The affogato seemed to evaporate on the tongue, leaving behind nothing but pure flavor. Our server, Kim Thi , was animated and graceful, adding warmth and ease to an already exceptional evening. This is a place that deserves to be lavishly praised!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
In writing this review, my only disappointment is that I can’t give them six stars! From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed as if we were old family friends from our hostess. She gently showed us into a waiting area and showed us the previews of the menus. Less than three minutes later on a very busy Saturday night,we were seated at a very comfortable table.

Once we are seated, our wait person Dereck brought us still and sparkling water. we ordered a bottle of bubbles to start our dinner adventure.

After reviewing the menu with us and explaining the specials, we moved onto the first course. To in our party shared the meatballs, which they raved about… My wife had the prosciutto salad, which was a very generous portion… And I had the raw fish crudo of amberjack from Hawaii. Marvelous!

Our main courses were an assortment of their housemaid pastas…one pappardelle, one tagliatelle, one maccheroncelli and The squid ink pasta with lobster special. These were prepared and presented with perfection. Dereck did a wonderful job in guiding us through our dining experience.

We did score a couple of delicious desserts, one of which being a chocolate budino and the other was the bread pudding.. I had a hard time sharing the budino..It was so good.

Thanks to Alexis For stopping by and greeting our table.

Comfortable atmosphere, attentive service, some of the best pasta we’ve had this side of Italy… It’s hard to beat this. Our family was thrilled and couldn’t stop talking about it.Thanks again to all the staff, and we look forward to coming back to sample more items of your menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My friend and I made a reservation for here, it was mid. Our waiter was nice. They informed me that I wasn’t able to modify my meal. I tried their food anyway. The presentation of the food was boring and the pasta my friend had was watery. Their lasagna has no unique flavor. How can you tell me I’m not able to modify my meal and your meal still lacks quality and flavor? If you like bland food with low vibrational energy this is the place for you. When you walk in the door you should leave an impression on your guest. This place needs to do better. How do you have an Italian restaurant with no Caesar salad?

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had an amazing dinner at this Italian restaurant! Everything tasted incredibly fresh — you can really tell they use high-quality ingredients. We especially loved the prosciutto with melon and the duck liver pâté — both were absolutely perfect. The atmosphere was cozy yet elegant, and our server Derek was great — super friendly and attentive. A truly memorable dining experience. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place did not disappoint. I travel to Italy a lot and always come back going ugh why is the food so bad in the US—this was the first prosciutto and melon plate I’ve had that actually reminded me of Florence. The Maccheroncelli was also a stand out  with the house-made ricotta being my favorite part of the dish. Definitely spendy, but I think worth it for the very authentic Italian dishes served. Service was honestly great too which is not something I usually find myself writing. Derek (hope I got that right) is awesome!!! Will definitely be back!

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 716 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came here in the late afternoon and were surprised to find that both the carbonara and the gnocchi were already sold out — two of the dishes we were most looking forward to. It felt a bit odd that some of the most popular items weren’t available so early in the day. Maybe the kitchen wasn’t fully prepped yet, but it was still disappointing.

The restaurant has “Homemade” in its name, so naturally you expect something truly special — fresh, well-crafted pasta and a homemade feel. But the experience didn’t quite live up to that expectation. It felt more like a small chain (there is at least one more location), and while the food wasn’t bad, it didn’t match what you’d imagine from a place emphasizing “homemade” in the branding.

We ordered the lasagna and the penne with pesto. The penne portion was very small — surprisingly small — and absolutely not justified for the price. The lasagna, on the other hand, was a very generous portion and tasted good. The pesto pasta was also tasty, but nothing exceptional.

I ordered a Spritz, but it wasn’t an Aperol Spritz. It tasted good, but it seemed like it was made with lemonade or something similar, so it wasn’t quite what you would expect.

The staff seemed very busy and focused on getting things prepared, probably because it was still early in the shift. They weren’t unfriendly, just quite occupied and not very attentive.

Overall, a mixed experience: the food was okay, but the limited menu availability, uneven portions, and the gap between the “homemade” promise and the actual quality make it hard to rate higher.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food is fast and delicious, and the prices are really good for homemade pasta. The sauces were tasty. I did not love the oven baked tomato salad, it was just okay, but the pasta for that price and quality is definitely worth it. There is limited seating inside, but outside there are plenty of shared tables.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Got vegetarian ravioli with pesto sauce and vegetarian lasagna. Both were super delicious and fresh.

The atmosphere was great, and the staff were nice.

You order inside and clean your own table.

The ravioli was a bit inconsistent in doneness and had less sauce than the non-vegetarian options.

The portions were okay.

The day we went, a parade was happening, which made it nice and lively.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Cozy restaurant. Can see the stove and the cooks making the pasta as it is made. Happy hour for house wine and beer is good. Was a little pricier than I thought it was gonna be (pay for pasta and sauce separately, closer to ~$20).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you’re looking for fresh pasta and authentic Italian cuisine, this spot in San Francisco is simply exceptional. On my first visit to the city, I had the chance to try it, and I was truly impressed. The quality of the dishes is outstanding: balanced flavors, fresh ingredients, and pasta with a texture that transports you straight to Italy.

I ordered the ravioli with tomato sauce, which were absolutely spectacular so good that I didn’t even manage to take a photo. The pesto pasta and the Bolognese are also remarkable for their authentic flavor and impeccable preparation. Portions are just right for one person and leave you fully satisfied.

The restaurant is often crowded a great sign of its popularity and they make the pasta in house, which you can watch while you wait for your order. Finding parking around North Beach (Little Italy) may take a bit of patience, but it’s completely worth it.

In summary, a delicious and authentic culinary experience. If you visit San Francisco, I highly recommend stopping by and trying their pasta. Especially the ravioli! 🍝

top_10.name: Trattoria Contadina
top_10.address: 1800 Mason St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had a great experience at this cozy Italian restaurant. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with a charmingly rustic feel, complete with a well-stocked bar and string lights that give it a homey, comfortable vibe. The service was friendly and attentive without being overbearing, and our waiter was helpful with the menu.

The real standout of the meal, and something you can tell from the photos, is the sheer size of the portions. They don't mess around! I ordered a pasta dish topped with a generous amount of fresh basil and what looked like burrata or a similar creamy cheese. My friend's spaghetti with a huge, impressive-looking meatball was also massive, and the clams in white wine sauce were abundant and delicious. You definitely get your money's worth here, and you'll likely have leftovers.

For dessert, we had a simple but delicious bowl of vanilla ice cream with chocolate syrup. It was the perfect way to cap off a very filling meal. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This spot  offers delicious pasta and decent service. The classic Italian dishes, particularly the pasta, are a definite highlight.However, I would strongly advise you to skip the cocktails. I tried three different cocktails, and all were disappointingly similar in taste. Stick to the wines. Given its popularity, reservations are highly recommended to secure a table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a very yummy dinner here. The service was good, the food was excellent. I enjoyed all the dishes I ordered. The affogato at the end was a great way to end my night.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Second time visiting, great service and excellent food.  If you’re craving Italian in the city, I highly recommend Trattoria Contadina!  Made my mom’s birthday celebration very beautiful, even provided a complimentary dessert for her!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The first time I came here I had an amazing pasta and great service. Came back with a friend for a second time and had a lack-luster experience. The pastas were fine, but nothing close to what it was before. My mom does a better pasta. Their tiramisu was good and the bartender was extremely nice and accommodating to our drink requests. Big props to him! I wish the waiter could learn a thing or two from him.

testimonials:
I had a great experience at this cozy Italian restaurant. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with a charmingly rustic feel, complete with a well-stocked bar and string lights that give it a homey, comfortable vibe. The service was friendly and attentive without being overbearing, and our waiter was helpful with the menu.

The real standout of the meal, and something you can tell from the photos, is the sheer size of the portions. They don't mess around! I ordered a pasta dish topped with a generous amount of fresh basil and what looked like burrata or a similar creamy cheese. My friend's spaghetti with a huge, impressive-looking meatball was also massive, and the clams in white wine sauce were abundant and delicious. You definitely get your money's worth here, and you'll likely have leftovers.

For dessert, we had a simple but delicious bowl of vanilla ice cream with chocolate syrup. It was the perfect way to cap off a very filling meal. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

This spot  offers delicious pasta and decent service. The classic Italian dishes, particularly the pasta, are a definite highlight.However, I would strongly advise you to skip the cocktails. I tried three different cocktails, and all were disappointingly similar in taste. Stick to the wines. Given its popularity, reservations are highly recommended to secure a table.
Had a very yummy dinner here. The service was good, the food was excellent. I enjoyed all the dishes I ordered. The affogato at the end was a great way to end my night.

top_10.name: Bella Trattoria
top_10.address: 3854 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Went later in the night since they close at 10pm. Nice ambiance with dim lighting. Service was pretty good.

Appetizers:  I thought the complimentary bread felt nice and soft, but the gf felt it was old and cold compared to hot & buttery bread served at other restaurants. Next, the Bruschetta ca' pummarola tasted the best out of all the orders.

Main: We went with the three course prix fixe meal:
1. Swordfish Carpaccio Antipasti tasted... interesting; like salty dried fish, maybe not our taste?
2. When the Squid Ink Fettuccine and Salmon Fettuccini came with "a lot of plate", the portion initially looked small, but there was actually a good amount of pasta there. But flavor for both was lacking and quite salty;  we could not finish it due to the sodium.
3. Panna cotta - it was okay.

Overall 3/5 for the food. I bookmarked this place awhile back and was glad to try it, but will likely not return.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First off, the food was absolutely incredible. Every dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully prepared, easily the best Italian restaurant I’ve been to.

The service was just as impressive, if not better. Our waiter delivered true five-star service, offering complimentary tastings, making thoughtful recommendations, and striking the perfect balance of attentiveness without being overbearing.

The ambiance was a perfect blend of classy and fun, with the charm of an upscale Italian restaurant and the energy of a lively bar. They even have a free pool table, which adds a playful touch.

Highly recommend. I’ll be making it a point to return to San Francisco just to dine here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We were a group of 6 adults and 1 toddler. Bella Trattoria had a table set up for us with a high chair, and they were very accommodating. The place is warm and cozy, and had an eclectic group of customers, some couples on date night at the bar and the front tables, and 3-4 tables had young families. I like that they didn't snub the couples with young babies.

The food we ordered was very good. We had a vegetarian minestrone that came out in pots for our whole table to share, along with some  fresh bread. Our entrees were pastas: creamy cheese ravioli with veggies added (our cousin loved), pesto (my husband's favorite), arrabbiata spaghetti (the baby's first time trying it, and she took it over - loved it), and a fettuccini dish that was made with an egg sauce, which was very tasty. Sorry I don't remember the official names of the dishes, we didn't take a pic of that day's menu. Their pastas were cooked to a perfect al dente.

We also ordered desserts (sorry, no pics, because we dug in so fast). The tiramisu was my favorite, a panacotta with berry compote was our cousin's fave (and also the toddler's), and baba Neapolitan (homemade rum cake), which the others loved.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Delicious! Be sure to make a reservation during peak dining hours because its popular and fills up. I ordered the Margherita pizza - cooked in a wood fired oven and topped with fresh Genovese basil leaves. Paired nicely with a glass of Barbera d'Alba. Also, in this review is the butternut squash fettuccini with roasted Brussel sprouts, Pecorino, shaved garlic and balsamic vinegar drizzle. Paired with a glass of Viognier, Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay blend. The restaurant is located in a residential neighborhood, so if you're a tourist your bus/rideshare will pass by this place on the way to or from the de Young museum. Oh, and don't forget housemade desserts - Yum :)
Great service and clean bathrooms too.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great service and great food! The menu was a little overwhelming at first to read but we both were able to find something we liked. The quality and quantity of food were perfect (and we were given some additional treats for free)! I wouldn’t say this gives typical Italian-American restaurant vibes (more authentic Italian) but in the afternoon it was quiet and exactly what we needed. Lots of gluten free options and pasta is very well made!
