top_10.name: La Ciccia
top_10.address: 291 30th St, San Francisco, CA 94131, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was an amazing place to get dinner! The gnocchi was to die for! Best gnocchi I have ever had! We also had the uni pasta, the calamari, the lamb, and some gelato and ricotta for dessert. After the gnocchi, my favorite was the calamari and from the gelato I loved the goat cheese and fig flavor. The team was also so so sweet, from the host to our amazing server Vadim, who had such great energy, to even the owner who came out to ask us about our dining experience. We had such a great time here with such friendly, warm service. Definitely recommend having dinner here. One of my favorite Italian restaurants now. We will definitely be back. Thanks to Vadim and the team!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent time. Service was nice - tried very hard to keep up, place was a little understaffed. Food was authentically Sardinian which was awesome. Delicious seafood. Great time overall. Loved the food

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
La Ciccia is one of our favorite restaurants in SF. We’ve been coming here a bunch over the past year and took our parents here whenever they are in town

It's a small family style restaurant with a cozy vibe, and the service is always friendly

We've tried pretty much everything on the menu at this point, and our favorite dishes are the roasted calamari, baby octopus stew, and oven roasted prawns. Everything is packed with flavor. This place is perfect if you like a little bit of spice in your dishes

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Such a charming, cozy restaurant. It was my second time dining at this establishment.
We started with melt in your mouth, not too salty, 30-month aged prosciutto platter and a superbly dressed burrata and arugula salad.
We shared the lamb dish which served two of us well. The flavor was deep and rich. It could have used a little more, "au jus"  so to speak, but was still quite good. Service was excellent.
Our wine choice,  Pinot Bianco A.A. “Schulthauser” San Michele Appiano, 2022    suited all the flavors on the table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: For the appetizer, we ordered Inzalaredda de Acciugasa e Arangiu, which paired perfectly with the bread. We also ordered Prupisceddu in Umidu cun Tomatiga, which was incredibly tender. Pasta Cruzza cun Arrizonis for the main course was very authentic, and eating it warm was a delightful experience. Pezza de Angioni a sa Saba was also very tender. The restaurant had a great ambiance, and the service was excellent!!!! ❤️

top_10.name: Sotto Mare
top_10.address: 552 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Such amazing Italian food!! Ordered a half dozen of east + west oysters. I personally prefer east cuz it’s sweater. Absolutely favorite is the seafood risotto, so much seafood and fresh. Same with their signature seafood soup(?) forgot the actual name of the dish. But it’s served with so much fresh seafood. Crab, shell, squid, mussel. Seasoning is absolutely spot on. Not too heavy or creamy. Such delicious food for amazing price! Def a 10/10!! Server was so nice. Just be aware they have added a 4% service fee. I didn’t take it out because I feel they deserve that and to better survive in sf as such an amazing Italian restaurant.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came here to try the famous Cioppino, and it absolutely lived up to its reputation. The portion is very generous — officially for two people, but honestly perfect for sharing between three. The stew was incredibly flavorful: a rich, garlicky tomato broth packed with crab and seafood. Truly delicious and a must-try.

We had the oysters as an appetizer. They were okay — fresh enough, but nothing special. Since there are so many great places in the city to eat amazing oysters, I wouldn’t necessarily recommend ordering them here.

The service was friendly and attentive. We were seated downstairs in the cellar area, which is thematically decorated and actually quite charming. The restaurant was very busy upstairs, but still well-managed.

Overall, highly recommended — especially for the Cioppino, which is absolutely worth coming here for.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A decent Italian cuisine. Good fish varieties (daily changes). They are famous with Cioppino (i find their tomato sauce less flavored) so didn’t favor it.  The prawn and scallop sauté is excellent; highly recommend it. Also oyster is great to start with. A couple of times, I tried their pasta dishes; especially the white sauce ones were better to me (again has less favor than usual but definitely not a heavy sauce).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
BEST FOOD IN SF.

The food was incredibly delicious. We went like a week ago and I still dream about it till
now. We got the smoked salmon pasta (which was recommended to us) and it did not disappoint, my favourite dish for sure.
We also got the Seared scallops, linguini with promodoro and shrimp and the main dish they’re know for which I forgot the name off atm haha.

The service is also so good. Our server was so nice and joked around with us. She was very very nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely stunning seafood bistro!!! Excellent service from hostess to Fabbie! Great recommendation on the white wine Fabbie and thank you for your lovely and welcoming ways!!! Bravo to you!! The food was scrumptious. We ordered starters of octopus salad and shrimp cocktail salad which was refreshing and light. Then we had amazing linguini and seafood in a fabulous red sauce and the others had lobster ravioli in rose sauce. Absolutely a place you must try in San Francisco!!! 5 ⭐️and more!!!!

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 1919 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Good service, really friendly staff. The food was alright, just ok...nothing special. Maybe just what we ordered was average.

The vibe is pretty relaxed, somewhat retro/European and welcoming, definitely loved that! We walked in for a dinner because the other places around had a 1ht+ wait.

We got their lasagna, a salad, and vegetarian cazzone.
All of them were just okay - we did ask for the house specialities. Maybe the 2nd time is better? Will give it another shot - definitely the kind staff and atmosphere, are awesome. Thank you folks - see you next time!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Looking for real-deal Italian food made from scratch? Look no further.

Amazing food with bountiful portions at a reasonable price. Especially for San Francisco.

We even got to watch the pasta being made. The prep station is right in the front of the establishment. It’s not running all the time, so we lucked out.

There were some vegetarian options.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Purchased fresh pesto with several pastas to take home. The pasta was good, but the pesto was quite bad. It was bitter. Maybe some of the ingredients, esp the basil, had gotten old. Had to throw out what we purchased, which was pricy. Try the pesto before buying to ensure you get a fresh batch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I always love coming back to The Italian Homemade Company for their amazing lasagna and excellent coffee. Every time I’m in San Francisco, this is my go-to place for a great meal. The food is consistently delicious, the atmosphere is warm, and the service is always friendly. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was quite, not a lot of people, nice atmosphere, nice customer service. Sandwiches were a little dry, some provided sauces would have been really nice, but we paid 4$ for a small amount of sauce. Tiramisu was so good, the cream was really fluffy and it was really moist. Overall pretty good

top_10.name: Luisa's Restaurant Wine Bar Since 1959
top_10.address: 1001 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is hands down my favorite Italian restaurant and I don’t see that ever changing. Ever since my first visit, it has never disappointed me. The lasagna, penne pasta, and gnocchi are absolutely mouthwatering. Every bite is rich, comforting, and full of flavor. You can truly taste the love in the food. I love this place so much and highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city. I guarantee you will fall in love. The owner is incredibly sweet and welcoming, which makes the experience even more special

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the best Italian restaurants in the city and probably the best value Italian spot in the city.

Gnocchi was some of the best I’ve had in a minute. Lobster ravioli was also really good. Pizza honestly didn’t look the most amazing but man it tasted great. Tiramisu was a little underwhelming but still tasty, just a tad bitter and wish they didn’t use Hershey’s.

Would come back for sure.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you want a true Italian restaurant this is one of the most amazing options in SF!
Amazing service, food and atmosphere. Good price!!
Luisa was there, and that was also incredible!
Will come back for sure!! LOVED IT

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hands down, this is my favorite Italian restaurant that I've been to in San Francisco so far. I thought I have had gnocchi before but omg when I tell you this gnocchi is so good, it's better than any that I've ever had. The pasta I had was delicious and fresh as well. The sauces were CRAZY delicious and truly I'm not one to obsess over Italian food usually but it was so so yummy and memorable. The service was so kind. She let us try a few wines before deciding on the one we were going to get checked on us regularly, but not too much and it was just really really good service. Luisa her self was there as well sitting in a booth and it was really cool to see her just hanging out while I was enjoying her and her family's delicious recipes. the ambience of the restaurant was so cute and quaint and I can't wait to come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Luisa's is an excellent Italian restaurant. This restaurant is a real jewel in the Mission. I loved my Lasagna Fiorentina, which bested a lot of lasagna I've had in Italy over the years. The bread is house baked and too tasty. The garlic bread was even better, made of course from that delicious bread.
Luisa was at the restaurant greeting customers and watching over everything. She runs a tight ship, and the employees seem to adore her. I remember Luisa's the restaurant when it was on Castro St. during the 80s. I always loved eating there. It was a joy to reminisce with her after all these years. And it's amazing she is still going strong at 96!

The owner is incredibly sweet and welcoming, which makes the experience even more special

top_10.name: Cotogna
top_10.address: 490 Pacific Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Cotogna is an absolute gem in San Francisco’s dining scene, a perfect balance of warmth, sophistication, and unforgettable flavor. Every dish we tried was a masterpiece, both in presentation and taste.

The prosciutto puff pastry was the perfect start, light, flaky, and beautifully balanced with the savory richness of the prosciutto. Then came the raviolo, which was pure heaven on a plate, delicate pasta filled with creamy perfection and that luscious egg yolk center that makes every bite feel indulgent.

The agnolotti pasta was another standout, with perfectly al dente pasta and a filling so flavorful and comforting it almost defies description. And the lamb pasta, wow. The depth of flavor, the tenderness of the lamb, and the subtle herbs made it one of the most memorable pasta dishes I’ve ever had.

Cotogna doesn’t just serve food, it creates an experience. The service was warm and professional, the atmosphere cozy yet refined, and every bite reminded us why this restaurant is so beloved.

If you love Italian cuisine done with heart, precision, and creativity, Cotogna is a must-visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: What an amazing place! Three of us had a beautiful lunch. We’ve traveled extensively in Italy and wanted to visit while vacationing.  Great Choice!  Service knew the menu, was helpful, friendly and professional and attentive. We had two different unique salads and both were delicious. I enjoyed my decadent ravioli / ricotta w brown butter and egg yolk center. I very much enjoyed my panna cotta with hazel nuts also. You owe it to yourselves to try Cotogna. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Did not plan to fine here and had no reservation. But Cotogna was able to accommodate a table of 1 outside seating. Ordered the 2 antipasti dishes: Bluefin Tuna Crudo, Sformata. Both were excellent. The bluefin crudo was fresh had perfectly balanced in taste & texture. Sformato was a tasty, light, savory flan. Then the meal ended with a delightful Cannoli, which was a perfect combination of the crispy pastry shell and the no-so-sweet creamy filling with chocoate bits and nuts sprinkled on the ends. They are made to order, and i was informed that the cannoli is not an everyday offering on the menu. So if you see it on the menu, order it!
Service was impeccable. Friendly and helpful with great suggestions. Highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Outstanding restaurant - absolutely beautiful inside and out. Service is 10/10!
Our server even knew five languages and spoke to us in Russian, haha. The dishes and the way everything was presented were also a 10/10.

We ordered:
- Mezze Maniche con Lamb Sugo
- Raviolo di Ricotta
- Marsala Panna Cotta with Hazelnut & Bartlett Pear
- Spritz alla Pesca

Everything was delicious and beautifully served.

P.S. The only thing I’d recommend improving is doubling the portion size of the Raviolo di Ricotta dish, lol!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Pro tip: Sit at the bar facing the hearth — it’s hands-down the best seat in the house. Watching the line work feels like dinner and a show.

The standout dish was the local, seasonal sand dabs — cooked to perfection. Bravo to the kitchen team. Another unexpected highlight? The tiny house rolls. I usually avoid carbs, but the chef (not to be confused with the head chef/owner) personally encouraged me to try them. I’m glad I did — they’re clearly a staple for a reason. Don’t skip them.

Service-wise, the real stars were the folks running the line. One in particular stood out: a young African-American woman who briefly took charge during my visit. She had total command of the team and interacted with guests — including me — with warmth and professionalism. A rising star, no doubt.

Coffee service also deserves a mention — an excellent Americano that wrapped the meal beautifully.

Why not five stars? A few things.
The front-of-house team felt a bit aggressive and not quite as polished as the kitchen staff. Not rude — just not operating at the same exceptional level.
Same goes for the $22 cucumber salad — nicely plated and refreshing, but it didn’t quite justify the price tag. Everything else on the menu felt worth it. This one left me scratching my head.

Overall: beautiful ambiance, top-tier kitchen talent, and memorable dishes. I’d absolutely return — and I suspect regulars may experience even better service over time.

The bluefin crudo was fresh had perfectly balanced in taste & texture. Sformato was a tasty, light, savory flan. Then the meal ended with a delightful Cannoli, which was a perfect combination of the crispy pastry shell and the no-so-sweet creamy filling with chocoate bits and nuts sprinkled on the ends. They are made to order, and i was informed that the cannoli is not an everyday offering on the menu. So if you see it on the menu, order it!
Service was impeccable. Friendly and helpful with great suggestions. Highly recommend this restaurant.

top_10.name: North Beach Gyros
top_10.address: 561 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
North Beach Gyro is a clean and cozy spot with a welcoming atmosphere. Tje dining area was well kept and clean. The staff were friendly and polite, and a special shout-out goes to our waiter, Jose, who was super friendly, kind, and genuinely attentive. His positive attitude made our experience more enjoyable and truly unforgettable.
We ordered several items and were very satisfied with the food quality. The feta fries were crispy and delicious, with great texture and flavor. The salmon wrap really stood out, juicy, well wrapped, and generously portioned, with no unnecessary spices overpowering the natural taste of the fish. The cilantro sauce served on the side added a fresh and flavorful touch that elevated the dish even more. The falafel wrap was also good, solid and satisfying.
Overall, North Beach Gyro is a nice casual spot for a flavorful and filling meal, especially if you enjoy wraps done right. A bit more attention to restroom cleanliness would make the experience even better.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely phenomenal! This was easily the best Mediterranean meal I’ve had in San Francisco and I’ve eaten at a lot of places. The flavors were fresh, rich, and perfectly balanced. I ordered the duck, and it was so good I didn’t leave a single crumb on the plate.

The owner was hilarious and genuinely friendly, which made the whole experience even better. You can tell he really cares about his food and his guests. The atmosphere was warm and relaxed, and the service was fast without feeling rushed.

If you’re anywhere near the area, this place is a must-try. It’s the kind of spot you leave already planning your next visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I absolutely love this place! Everything about it is perfect — from the delicious Middle Eastern flavors to the cozy atmosphere and friendly, amazing service. The food is always fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. It’s one of those spots you keep coming back to because everything just feels right. Highly recommend! 🌿🍢✨

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This restaurant is an absolute gem. From the moment you walk in, the atmosphere is warm, inviting, and effortlessly charming, paired with food that is genuinely outstanding. I originally found this spot while looking for a place to watch a 49ers game, and it completely exceeded expectations. Not only could I enjoy the game, but I also had a fantastic glass of wine and an unforgettable meal in such a beautiful setting. The host and wait staff are exceptional — welcoming, attentive, and clearly proud of the experience they provide. It’s the kind of place you’re excited to return to and recommend to everyone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This review is for Oct 4th 2025. We were visiting the city for my birthday and needed a place that could meet my vegan needs, and that the rest of the fam would like. We found North Beach Gyros, and I'm happy we did!
The service was amazing! The owner was so kind, talkative, and helped us decide what to order.
The food took a bit long, but I think it's because they make everything fresh.
An appetizer came out, I think it was Greek yogurt and then had veggie domas on top. The domas were good, I typically don't like them.
They had a couple vegan options on the menu as well as a number of vegetarian items. My family ordered a fish dish, lamb chop or flank, rice, gyro with chicken. It all looked really good. My family loved it, nothing got taken home, it was all finished.
My dish was an eggplant dish, it was delicious! The kids even loved it. One order of fries is large enough to share FYI.
I definitely want to go back.
The owner brought us decaffeinated warm tea and a baklava to share, it was DELICIOUS! It was a Saturday and they had live music, it was a nice atmosphere. The decor is nice, modern, very clean. Tables are set nicely. Very well priced, especially for what you get. We got lucky and got free street parking since it was after 6 p.m. we read there is a parking garage in walkable distance.

top_10.name: Kokkari Estiatorio
top_10.address: 200 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Kokkari Estiatorio has been a favorite of mine for over 20 years, and they never disappoint—whether it’s lunch, dinner, or a private event. This visit was for a private holiday luncheon, and everything was wonderful from start to finish. My go-to lunch favorites are the branzino and the lamb, both consistently excellent. Kokkari continues to deliver an exceptional experience every time. This place is in my top three SF restaurant recommendations.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
GET THE PITA it’s thick and chewy and buttery!

Cozy upscale dining. We sat at the bar. Bar seat is better than table seat. Better lighting and you can sit closer together.

Waiter said bar seats you can get by calling to reserve two days in advance. Table seats you can get by calling two weeks in advance. Unless you’re a party of one - we had a person walk in and sit next to us

Fried cheese - waiter drizzled lemon juice and it sizzled nicely. But it cooled too quickly and became boring to eat

Babaganoush - good but not the best in the city. I liked the pickled veggies that came with it though

Tzin spritz - ok, too much volume. I liked eating the berries. Waiter called them British boba 😂

Hibiscus mocktail - tart and delicious!

Squash - forgettable, did not taste the pistachio butter

Octopus - ok, did not come with tail

Chicken - yummy and enough to feed two people

We over ordered and could not finish the chicken. The waiter packed the chicken for us

Food not worth the $200 total, you are  paying for the ambience. Nice place to dress up for. Would be nice to just get drinks here also. There’s a fireplace with real fire and the overall volume is not too loud, you don’t have to strain to hear.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Kokkari has been my go to restaurant for special celebrations due to its delicious food and wonderful atmosphere. But what really stands out is the service you receive when dining here. Michele is the most hospitable, warm and kind manager. He always makes me and my group feel right at home and special. Every time we dine here, we leave talking about how wonderful of an experience it was. Thank you Michele for treating us like family and making such a lasting impression on every single friend I have ever dined with at Kokkari!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I saw other reviews recommending the appetizer lamb chops over the entrée version, and I did enjoy the appetizer one, they’re delicious, with a wonderfully crispy surface. The octopus dish is very tender, and both the whole fish and the zucchini cake are perfectly crisp on the outside. Overall, great textures and flavors!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Kokkari now lives in my dreams. One of the best places I’ve been in San Francisco. Everything from the atmosphere to the service is 10/10. The food is obviously the star—have not had such authentic Greek food since being in Greece. The pita is being talked about every day in our house and so is the baklava. The zucchini cakes are also living rent free in my head and the citrus salad with the dates?! So good. Kokkari is a must try in SF. Can’t wait to come back as soon as possible.

top_10.name: The Bite
top_10.address: 996 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Been a rough week and The Bite made sure I end it on a high note. I just ordered late night delivery for tonight's dinner, and next two days of meals. Entrées are high quality ingredients. Made fresh to order. Meat was not dried out. Lightly seasoned to enjoy the fresh natural flavor of the foods.

Bonus points for the careful packaging of my delivery order, especially the protective wrapping for the soups.

Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic restaurant with great service and fantastic food. If you are looking for fantastic Turkish | Mediterranean food, this should be your first choice. We will definitely be back soon and every time in San Francisco!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I ordered from The Bite through DoorDash and the food was absolutely amazing. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and well-prepared. The meat was tender, juicy, and seasoned perfectly. The portions were generous, and the sides like the rice, salad, fries, and naan complemented the meal really well.

We tried several items including the kebabs, gyro plate, and sides, and everything tasted authentic and delicious. The sauces were flavorful and added a great finishing touch. Honestly, every bite lived up to the name of the restaurant.

This place is a gem for Mediterranean food, and I will definitely be ordering again. Highly recommend if you want something fresh, satisfying, and full of flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Good food, resonably priced. Super clean dinning area. Good service. What else do you need.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious vegan options (clearly indicated) and friendly service. I ate this gyro so quickly bc of how good it was (see second pic)I’m definitely returning for more😌

Highly recommend!!!

top_10.name: Milos Meze
top_10.address: 3348 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Our first time at Milos Meze and we absolutely loved it! The staff was very kind, friendly, and attentive.

We tried the spicy hitipiti, saghanaki, horiatiki salad, beef souvlaki, and lavraki. The saghanaki stole the show - reminded me of an Argentine provoleta. Delicious melted cheese with lemon. We also loved the beef souvlaki - it was very tender, smoky, and perfectly cooked. For dessert we tried the baklavaki which was super yummy and very generous portion.

Very cozy, family feeling great for all ages and occasions. Cant wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely love Milos Meze!
This place is one of my favorites in San Francisco. The food is always fresh and absolutely delicious every dish is full of flavor and beautifully prepared. The staff is amazing so friendly, attentive, and helpful every single time I visit. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for a relaxing dinner or a night out with friends. Everything here feels genuine and full of heart. Highly recommend it to anyone who loves great Mediterranean food and great service!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Found Milos Meze on Yelp and decided to give it a shot after seeing all the great reviews. Totally worth it. The place has amazing food, great vibes, and top-notch service. We tried a bunch of different dishes and every single one was fresh and packed with flavor. Big shout-out to our server Ali — super friendly and really made the night special. Easily a 5-star spot and one I’ll be recommending to friends for sure.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This restaurant is fantastic! The dishes are so flavorful, fresh, and taste very authentic. Really good portion sizes, good variety to choose from, and welcoming atmosphere. The service was also great. Overall would highly recommend this restaurant for a nice night out.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had moussaka and chicken souvlaki and both were excellent.  They served complementary pita bread with a very tasty spread (lots of garlic!).  Save room for the baklava which is served warm with pistachio ice cream and strawberries soaked in honey with walnuts.  The service all round was very efficient.  Ali, our server, was very friendly and knowledgeable about the food and wine. We definitely plan to go back.
One bit of feedback I would give the manager is to lower the music when there are lots of people.  It was ok for us as we ate early before it got crowded.  But with lots of people it would be too loud.  (It's a pet peeve of mine.  Music in restaurants is almost always too loud and hinders conversation.)

top_10.name: Lokma
top_10.address: 1801 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Authentic Turkish Flavors with a Cozy Vibe!
Lokma is an amazing spot in San Francisco for authentic Turkish and Mediterranean food. The ambience is warm, modern, and inviting — perfect for brunch or dinner. The dishes are beautifully presented and full of flavor — from the juicy kebabs to the freshly baked bread and delicious mezes. The service is attentive and friendly, and everything tastes fresh and homemade. Their Turkish coffee and desserts are a must-try! A perfect blend of great food, great service, and great atmosphere — highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I've never seen so many headless turkeys in my life. Bless that one server that is singlehandedly carrying the entire restaurant.  She must be able to deadlift 1000 lbs without breaking a sweat. I've never had it so difficult to grab a waiter's attention. No one is working????

Service aside, food is comforting and simple. Nothing wild. Probably not worth the price tag.

Overall, my experience that day was horrible and I'm never coming back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Such a cute place. The food is mediocre. Started with a high note on appetizers, the kofta was on the dry side but it had all the right spices, the zucchini dolmas tasted delicious. The grilled chicken was also dry, the mousaka was rather bland and had not enough beef. But overall the food was gorgeously plated, the place was cute and the service was great.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I went here yesterday for an anniversary dinner with my partner and we really liked it overall :)) Our waitress was extremely kind and helpful. The sevice was excellent across the board. The food was also excellent. The chicken was extremely tender and well prepared and the freshness of the ingredients really shines through. I do wish I was able to see/understand Turkish influences a bit more clearly but we really liked this place and will be coming back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This Turkish restaurant is the best. Me and my friend stopped by for breakfast and that was the best decision we made. The service was excellent, the breakfast was superb and the atmosphere was amazing. It was Saturday morning but as soon as they opened around 9:30 am the place filled up really quickly. That speaks volume. The breakfast for two is more than enough food.

top_10.name: Dalida Restaurant
top_10.address: 101 Montgomery St Suite 100, San Francisco, CA 94129, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Oh my. We came here for brunch and we were pretty impressed by overall experiences including the quality of foods, service and architecture of the place.  I am not sure if this is Turkish or Greek and I am supposed to be cautious about this bc I can’t offend either one of them but regardless all of the dishes we had were delectable.

We came here for brunch and ordered Turkish flatbread, Octobus and Sujuk and baklava . I don’t think I had better baklava . It was so dreamy and melting inside of my mouth. It’s not the traditional baklava but it had perfect mixture of sweetness, texture with tanginess from raspberry.  We really loved Octopus and Sujuk as the spices with Sujuk were so unique and flavorful. My daughter loved flatbread .

I recommend also getting pistachio coffee if you love pistachio and coffee.

We will definitely come back for diner !

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I'm raving about the octopus dish here. The sauce was so tasty and the presentation was so beautiful! We also really loved the lamb chops which very tender. And make sure to get the pita bread and mezze platter too! Service was friendly and on point. Everything was really great!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great ambiance, friendly service. The food is imaginative and visually striking, but some of the flavors were divisive.

The octopus dish (see pic) looked super cool, but it was sliced so thin that the octopus texture was lost. The pork flavor was so strong that there was no octopus flavor either. The phylo/potato/mushroom dish also got mixed reviews from us. I thought the truffle flavor was too strong. The "breaking bread" dish was super tasty: pillowy warm bread and delicious, balanced dips. The manti were incredible: savory meaty filling in a cute al dente package topped with acidic tomato and yoghurt sauces.

I would recommend coming here with a few people so you can share many dishes.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had a couple hiccups during our visit here with our order, but I’ve worked in retail and food before and I understand how things can get confusing and mistakes can be made despite your best efforts. That being said, I’d confirm just to make sure they got it right when ordering.
Dalida has a great atmosphere and the location is bar none. The Presidio backdrop is honestly fantastic. The inside is gorgeous and the vibe is amazing as well.
The food is solidly good. It’s not the best I’ve ever had, but it’s a 3.75-4 star for me. The fries however are a 5 and we did enjoy the lamb dumplings. The Aleppo Chicken was okay—36$ I was expecting my mind to be blown—but I feel like I could have cooked it at home too. The Kalispera drink was a 10/10 for me. The Ottoman Coffee was fun as well. It was a good experience overall. Not sure if I’d go out of my way to go back, but not a waste of a dinner either. 3.75/5.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Dalida for me is definitely the best restaurant in the Bay Area. I have had dinner and brunch there more than 10 times and the experience has always been impecable: the food, the staff, the ambiance… everything is always on point.
Menu has changed a bit with time, but with every new dish I try I just get a reassurance on why this place is still my favorite.
Don’t leave without trying the breaking bread, that fluffy pita is to die for 🤤

top_10.name: La Mediterranee
top_10.address: 2210 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Was a must have meal on my list again this trip to San Francisco. Yum! Get the sampler platter and enjoy multiple options. It’s all so good! Ate it too fast to take pics! Enjoy FOUND A PIC!! My mouth is watering just looking at it!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I've walked past the restaurant front a few times, but this was my first time stopping in. All the decor made the dining area feel super laid-back and cozy. The restaurant has been run by the same family for decades and the staff did an amazing job. Everyone was friendly and were happy to chat more about the dishes and the restaurant history.

I enjoyed trying all the small bites with an iced Moroccan mint tea, which were perfect for a sunny 75 degree day in SF! The pomegranate chicken while sweet had a ton of flavor and I'd get it again next time I'm back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Just finished my dessert and OMG was it amazing! The tea comes in a large glass cup- exactly how my Eastern European heart likes it. I had the Trio dessert which is 3 smaller size desserts- bakhlava, chocolate mousse and a mindblowing creme thing with pistachios, I forgot how to say or spell it after I tasted it. Sooo delicious and refreshing! The place is small but cozy, every table and piece of decor is almost a piece of art. Very authentic Mediterannean vibe, and the staff is great. I highly recommend and will be back 💯👍🥰

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Indoor and outdoor seating available. Your typical greek dishes are available. We came on a saturday and had a 20 min. wait for our table (group of 6). Several options for vegetatians available. Tends to be real busy especially on weekends. Our orders got mixed. We ordered sparkling water but never got it and yet we were billed. Staff are friendly and accommodating.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of my new (to me) favorites!! Tried this place for the first time with a couple friends tonight, and we loved it! We got the salmon kebab entree plates and the pomegranate chicken entree plate. Both were great, and each entree came with pita and hummus and choice of soup or salad. I got the avolemono soup, which was delicious. The salmon was perfectly cooked, and I loved the flavor of the pomegranate chicken. The ambiance was equally as nice, with a small and cozy dining area with lots of unique decor on the walls, giving it a lot of personality. The waiters were both extremely friendly and helpful. This is ideal for a date or friends having good conversation. I can't wait to bring more friends and family here.

top_10.name: Souvla

top_10.name: Old Jerusalem Restaurant
top_10.address: 2966 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had an absolutely fantastic family meal here.
This place is a real gem.

We focused on the shareable plates and loved everything we tried - the flavors are truly authentic and delicious. Make sure you don't skip the complementary pickles; they're a standout! And the mint tea is the perfect, refreshing end to the meal.

What makes this place special is the service. The host and the entire staff are wonderful people who make you feel right at home. Great food, great people - we highly recommend Old Jerusalem for a top-notch dining experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Old Jerusalem is an absolute must-visit. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, but the food is the real star of the show.

Here’s what we had:
Chicken Shawarma Plate: The chicken was perfectly seasoned and tender. It paired perfectly with their fluffy rice and hummus.
Lamb Chops Plate: These were the highlight of the night! Cooked perfectly - juicy, and incredibly flavorful. You can tell they use high-quality meat.
Kunafa: You cannot leave without ordering this. It arrived warm, gooey, and sweet with that signature crunchy topping. It’s easily one of the best versions of this dessert I’ve ever had.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Got the beef shawarma, musakhan, and crispy kunafa and everything was good but the musakhan is such a stand out: well seasoned, tender fall off the bone chicken with lots of sumac and sweet onion, the bread underneath just soaking off all that juice. Will be thinking about it often! Everyone there is also so sweet and kind, will fs come back soon and often

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:

Good atmosphere and great service. Thanks!

top_10.name: Anchor Oyster Bar
top_10.address: 579 Castro St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We finally arrived at this cozy, welcoming, and authentic restaurant. There were a lot of people there, but we were the first. Everyone waited patiently, and it was worth it. The food was delicious, everything was fresh, and perfectly prepared. The oyster selection was excellent. The staff was incredibly polite and attentive. It was a great day.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best cioppino and garlic bread I’ve ever had. Everything we had here (oysters, mussels, panzanella, cioppino) was super fresh and delicious. I would definitely come here again. The service was great. the only down side is that there are no reservations so you might have to wait awhile for a table. It was worth the wait though.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 10/10 would recommend and return! Every dish was delicious, service was superb and atmosphere clean and quaint. I recommend arriving early to find parking and to put your name on the list posted outside the front door

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Heard about this place from word of mouth - it’s all true!! Come hungry - portions are nice sized. Great presentations, flavors are fresh & clean! Get there early because the seating is very limited and waitlist can be long, but well worth the wait! Had the Boston clam chowder, 1/2 order of Anchor Special, and the smaller portion of their Cioppino. It’s big enough to share!!

reviews.author: Anonymous

top_10.name: Scoma's Restaurant
top_10.address: 1965 Al Scoma Way, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Scoma’s Restaurant absolutely lives up to its reputation. From the moment you walk in, it feels like a true San Francisco classic warm, welcoming, and effortlessly charming. It’s the kind of place that reminds you why certain restaurants stand the test of time.

The food was outstanding. Everything tasted incredibly fresh, especially the seafood, which was prepared perfectly and full of flavor. You can tell quality and care go into every dish, and nothing felt rushed or overlooked. This is seafood done right simple, elevated, and memorable.

What truly set Scoma’s apart, though, was the service. Hands down, it was the best service I’ve experienced since moving to San Francisco. Attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable, and genuinely kind it made the entire dining experience feel special and relaxed.

The atmosphere adds to the magic. Classic yet comfortable, lively but never overwhelming, it’s an ideal spot whether you’re celebrating something special or just enjoying a great meal out. Everything flows seamlessly, which is a testament to how well this place is run.

I’ll definitely be back, and it’s a place I’ll happily recommend to anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had a really enjoyable experience at Scoma’s Restaurant, and I’d definitely recommend it if you’re looking for a special meal on the water in the San Francisco Bay Area. The location right on the bay gives you great views and a relaxing atmosphere, which sets the tone for a memorable dinner. The space feels open and inviting, perfect for sitting back with a drink and appreciating the scenery while you wait for your food.  ￼

We tried a few different dishes during our visit. The steak was excellent — cooked just right, flavorful, and rich. It’s the kind of dish you hope for at a waterfront restaurant, and it definitely delivered. The seafood soup was also very good, with generous portions and fresh ingredients that gave it depth and authenticity. The risotto was decent, creamy and satisfying, though not as standout as the steak. The pasta, on the other hand, was fairly ordinary — enjoyable but nothing compared to the other dishes we ordered. Overall the food quality leaned toward the higher side, especially considering the location.  ￼

One of the highlights of the evening was the drinks — both the wine and cocktails were tasty and nicely poured, which paired well with the food and setting. Be prepared that this place isn’t cheap; it’s definitely more on the upscale side in terms of pricing, but for a special night out or a celebratory dinner, it’s worth it.

The service was pretty good, attentive without being intrusive, and the staff seemed experienced and confident. They helped guide us through the menu and made solid suggestions based on our preferences, which made the ordering process smoother. In summary, if you’re looking for great steak, solid seafood options, good drinks, and a lovely waterfront environment, this restaurant is a strong choice — even if a few dishes like the pasta don’t quite reach the same level. Highly recommended for a scenic and satisfying meal in the Bay Area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was such a highlight of our trip to San Francisco. Every fish was superb and the service was impeccable. Each dish was well executed. The cioppino was the best. I loved the pacific snapper and mushroom spaetzel. The riff on the Rockefeller oysters was genius, and they had such great clam chowder. Everyone working was attentive and the atmosphere was great. This is definitely the seafood place to go to.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is an excellent, off-the-beaten-path restaurant serving fresh fish & seafood!! We grabbed an early dinner (being from a different time zone) and it wasn’t too busy. Our server, Heather, made our visit personal and memorable in the best way possible. We were early enough to catch the end of the lunch specials. While they were “lunch” specials, the portions were very generous! Truffle fries were our appetizers - BEST TRUFFLE FRIES EVER! Our group had a mix of starters, Caesar salad, beet salad, and  clam chowder, all were superb. The Red Snapper, ordered by all, was the best fish any of us have had! A lemon tart finished off the meal. It was a perfect ending. FIND THIS PLACE ON THE DOCK!! You’ll be sorry if you don’t.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary, and even though we arrived 30 minutes early, the staff welcomed us in with warmth and immediately offered us drinks. That’s not just good customer service—that’s genuine care for their guests. We were honestly blown away.

The seafood was incredibly fresh and exquisitely prepared, bursting with flavor in every bite. The drinks were expertly made and perfectly balanced. For our first visit, it was truly memorable in every way.

Highly recommend giving them a try—you won’t be disappointed!

top_10.name: Sotto Mare
top_10.address: 552 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Such amazing Italian food!! Ordered a half dozen of east + west oysters. I personally prefer east cuz it’s sweater. Absolutely favorite is the seafood risotto, so much seafood and fresh. Same with their signature seafood soup(?) forgot the actual name of the dish. But it’s served with so much fresh seafood. Crab, shell, squid, mussel. Seasoning is absolutely spot on. Not too heavy or creamy. Such delicious food for amazing price! Def a 10/10!! Server was so nice. Just be aware they have added a 4% service fee. I didn’t take it out because I feel they deserve that and to better survive in sf as such an amazing Italian restaurant.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came here to try the famous Cioppino, and it absolutely lived up to its reputation. The portion is very generous — officially for two people, but honestly perfect for sharing between three. The stew was incredibly flavorful: a rich, garlicky tomato broth packed with crab and seafood. Truly delicious and a must-try.

We had the oysters as an appetizer. They were okay — fresh enough, but nothing special. Since there are so many great places in the city to eat amazing oysters, I wouldn’t necessarily recommend ordering them here.

The service was friendly and attentive. We were seated downstairs in the cellar area, which is thematically decorated and actually quite charming. The restaurant was very busy upstairs, but still well-managed.

Overall, highly recommended — especially for the Cioppino, which is absolutely worth coming here for.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A decent Italian cuisine. Good fish varieties (daily changes). They are famous with Cioppino (i find their tomato sauce less flavored) so didn’t favor it.  The prawn and scallop sauté is excellent; highly recommend it. Also oyster is great to start with. A couple of times, I tried their pasta dishes; especially the white sauce ones were better to me (again has less favor than usual but definitely not a heavy sauce).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
BEST FOOD IN SF.

The food was incredibly delicious. We went like a week ago and I still dream about it till
now. We got the smoked salmon pasta (which was recommended to us) and it did not disappoint, my favourite dish for sure.
We also got the Seared scallops, linguini with promodoro and shrimp and the main dish they’re know for which I forgot the name off atm haha.

The service is also so good. Our server was so nice and joked around with us. She was very very nice.

top_10.name: Betty Lou's Seafood & Grill
top_10.address: 318 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This visit was unfortunately very disappointing.

We ordered two lemonades, but both were undrinkable from the first sip. They had a strong tap-water taste, along with what seemed like poorly filtered or contaminated ice, so we were unable to finish them.

The pasta and ravioli were noticeably overcooked and kept breaking apart on the plate, which made them unpleasant to eat. The biggest disappointment, however, was the cioppino, which is advertised as the restaurant’s signature dish. The broth had the same unusual watery taste, several clams were not properly cleaned, and the seafood overall did not taste fresh—especially disappointing for a seafood restaurant in San Francisco.

For two people, ordering two pasta dishes and drinks (without alcohol), the bill came to over $140. Given the quality of the food and drinks, this felt significantly overpriced.

We chose this restaurant because it is often recommended as a well-known spot in San Francisco and expected much better. However, despite it being a Saturday lunchtime, the restaurant was already quite empty. We also noticed that all nearby tables were filled with tourists and no locals, which gave us the impression that the restaurant’s quality may have declined over time—possibly due to changes in ownership or kitchen staff.

Overall, this experience did not meet expectations, and unfortunately, it is not a place we would choose to return to.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Cioppino is my favorite dish and I order it every chance I get. This one is hands down the BEST I've had in San Francisco. This place is consistent with their dishes and never fail. The calamari was not too greasy and perfect to the crisp. I always enjoy introducing friends to this spot!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wonderful clam chowder with plenty ingredients. Flavors is well seasoned. Oyster is ok and fresh. Creamy pasta is in good quality.
Service is nice. I arrived early lunch time. Plenty of seats available

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I like the eclectic decor. Sometimes breezy if someone leaves one of the doors open. Cioppino is definitely the way to go. I liked the large shrimp and scallops especially. Risotto was okay but a little under for the rice. Seafood was fresh. Bread was good. I could see why they charge for additional

reviews.text: Who’s the best? Betty Lou’s Seafood & Grill is the best. Exquisite in all respects, a deliciously tasteful  menu and wonderful staff who are very kind and attentive to the details. Thank you for always being consistently above and beyond excellent.

top_10.name: Hog Island Oyster Co.
top_10.address: Ferry Building, #11, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was little chilly outside on Saturday afternoon with tons of people, but waited & end up seating outside. Again it was little chilly, but we held on through the weather. We ordered 1 dozen oysters, high water type which had lots of meat on it and had the squid salad couldn't believe had so much squid in there, It was wonderful! Also the clam chowder with fresh Manila clams in there with side of French fries. They're all delicious and their service was great. The oysters were nice and clean without any shells, where the vinegar shallots was great! We would definitely come back again. You gotta check it out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We got in line 20mins after opening on Saturday morning and waited another 25 mins for a table of 2. There were tables of 4 but they don’t seat you there.

We ordered the fried Brussels sprouts and rustic seafood stew. Both were good. The Brussels sprouts were fried well and not burnt. It was sweet and paired well with the cheese and fried onion, only gripe is that there was a pool of oil at the end.
The stew had amazing flavour but a bit in the tangy side as it you can tell it was cooked with a lot of tomatoes. It was hearty with a very good variety of seafood such as lingcod, clam, squid, and shrimp.

The servers are very efficient and food comes very fast. Would come back but wouldn’t exactly wait in line for a table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My mom and I came to Hog Island Oyster Co. for a late Sunday lunch and had such a wonderful experience. Since it was just the two of us — and we arrived between lunch and dinner — we were seated quickly, which was a great start.

We were lucky enough to snag an outdoor table, and the setting could not have been better. The view of the bay was gorgeous, especially with the sun starting to set on a sunny afternoon. It was the perfect day to be sitting outside.

We both ordered the clam chowder with bacon, along with a side of bread to share, and everything came out incredibly fast — much appreciated since we were starving. The chowder was absolutely delicious: rich, comforting, and perfect for a winter day in San Francisco, especially enjoyed outside in the sunshine.

The service truly made the experience even better. Our server, Bolo, was fantastic — friendly, attentive without being overbearing, and checked in at just the right moments. He made sure we had everything we needed and brought such great energy and vibes to our table.

Overall, it was a lovely meal from start to finish. Great food, excellent service, and an unbeatable setting. We would absolutely come back, and I can’t recommend the clam chowder enough.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Incredibly fresh oysters at this bustling spot right in the ferry terminal. No reservations taken so at busy times you might need to wait a bit. But service is very fast (maybe too fast?) so you are in and out fairly quickly.

The oysters are the standouts. You feel like they have been plucked from the waters outside the window, which perhaps some were!

Oh, a nice and creative N-A drinks menu too. Always a good feature for those of us who don't drink and want more options than water or soda.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a fabulous light dinner after arriving from the UK. Sat at the counter as a lone businessman but, the staff were chatty, friendly  and polite. All the fish was very fresh, presented well and cooked just right. The green leaves salad was large for one but fresh and well dressed. All washed down with a couple of glasses of Riesling which complemented everything. It appeared hugely popular which is always a good sign but as you can't reserve a table allow plenty of time as there is only a queue system. I only had to wait about 10 minutes on a Saturday at 19:30. Well worth a visit.

The oysters were nice and clean without any shells, where the vinegar shallots was great! We would definitely come back again. You gotta check it out!

We got in line 20mins after opening on Saturday morning and waited another 25 mins for a table of 2. There were tables of 4 but they don’t seat you there.

We ordered the fried Brussels sprouts and rustic seafood stew. Both were good. The Brussels sprouts were fried well and not burnt. It was sweet and paired well with the cheese and fried onion, only gripe is that there was a pool of oil at the end.
The stew had amazing flavour but a bit in the tangy side as it you can tell it was cooked with a lot of tomatoes. It was hearty with a very good variety of seafood such as lingcod, clam, squid, and shrimp.

The servers are very efficient and food comes very fast. Would come back but wouldn’t exactly wait in line for a table.

My mom and I came to Hog Island Oyster Co. for a late Sunday lunch and had such a wonderful experience. Since it was just the two of us — and we arrived between lunch and dinner — we were seated quickly, which was a great start.

We were lucky enough to snag an outdoor table, and the setting could not have been better. The view of the bay was gorgeous, especially with the sun starting to set on a sunny afternoon. It was the perfect day to be sitting outside.

We both ordered the clam chowder with bacon, along with a side of bread to share, and everything came out incredibly fast — much appreciated since we were starving. The chowder was absolutely delicious: rich, comforting, and perfect for a winter day in San Francisco, especially enjoyed outside in the sunshine.

The service truly made the experience even better. Our server, Bolo, was fantastic — friendly, attentive without being overbearing, and checked in at just the right moments. He made sure we had everything we needed and brought such great energy and vibes to our table.

Overall, it was a lovely meal from start to finish. Great food, excellent service, and an unbeatable setting. We would absolutely come back, and I can’t recommend the clam chowder enough.

top_10.name: Hook Fish Co
top_10.address: 4542 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First time trying this place. Went there on a Monday early evening (5pm). Little wait, but there are couple of people enjoying their food.

I orderd Fish and Chips, and it was good! Crispy batter and juicy fish. The included chips are seasoned perfectly!

Overall, I want to try them again and enjoy the atmosphere :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hook Fish Co is a very good place to eat a good fish and chip with excellent fries that are well done and seasoned. The wating time is about 20-40 min on rush hours but is is worth it. There is limited parking in front of the restaurant so you will need to find street parking. There are only outside seating that is good. On the menu we highly recomend the fish and chips and the burrito. In conclusion we will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Hook Fish absolutely lives up to the hype. We ordered the ceviche and chips, poke and chips, poke tacos, and grilled fish tacos—and everything was sooooo fresh and incredibly delicious. This is the kind of seafood that tastes clean, bright, and straight from the ocean.
The restaurant is entirely outdoors and super charming, with quirky tables, tons of plants, and a laid-back neighborhood feel. It was a beautiful saturday, which made it the perfect setting to sit outside and enjoy fresh seafood for lunch. It’s counter service, but they do have beer and wine, which is a nice bonus.
That said, this place was absolutely slammed. Seating was tough to come by, and since it’s counter service, you’re on your own to find a spot. We ended up eating the ceviche and poke with chips while standing (no photo because we were starving), but honestly, it was still totally worth it. One small downside was that our food came out in chunks (20 mins apart) since my friend and I ordered separately, which was a bit of a bummer.
Still, the food is so good that it’s easy to see why this place is always packed. A little patience is required, but the freshness and flavor make it more than worth it. I’d happily go back—ideally with a little more time and luck snagging a table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Excellent fish and chips and many other seafood dishes served in a hole-in-the-wall place.

It’s hugely popular but the wait is not too bad.  You can see the ingredients refrigerated drawers if you stand close enough to the side counter.  The gentlemen working the fryer and the grill really know what they are doing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Long wait but worth it. We got the grilled fish plate and the grilled burrito. Habanero carrot sauce was tasty. Limited seating. We walked over to the bluffs and ate by a tree. Cute shop across the street while we waited

top_10.name: Swan Oyster Depot
top_10.address: 1517 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
There’s a reason this spot is Anthony Bourdain’s favorite spot in SF. It’s pretty straightforward good seafood spot that serves fresh catch! It can get a little pricey but the coziness of the place and the attentiveness of the staff makes it worthwhile.

I specifically liked the sashimi platter and the oysters they have are flavorful, briney and fresh — we had it for breakfast and didn’t have any tummy issues!

Note though they serve Boston style clam chowder so it’s runnier than the typical chowder you find in SF

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious seafood. We came around 10am and we had to wait 3 hours to be seated. The raw oysters, Sicilian sashimi and cracked crab are worth trying. Service was great!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Been wanting to try this place for over a year every time I visit SF and finally had a chance to check it out. We waited in line for around an hour to get seats. The vibe and atmosphere is great and OG! The food is great but nothing too special that would worth an hour wait. I understand this place is historic but I feel like it needs some deep cleaning :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We got the following:
$12 crab back
$20 combination cocktail (1 oyster, 2 prawns, 2 crab leg meat, bunch of shrimp, bunch of white crab meat)
$40 Sicilian sashimi (medium size)
$8 bowl of clam chowder
$40 "Crab-santhemum" (Leg meat only)
$17 smoked salmon with French bread (half size)
$40 three glasses of wine
(Dec 2025 prices)

NYE was really busy with takeout orders taking most of the counter space. So they had only 5 seats available from 8 to 1130am. I waited about 3 hours and got finally seated.

The food and service made up for the long wait.

The highlight was the crab-santhemum -- leg meat arranged like flower petals of a chrysanthemum. Very flavorful. I liked it with a bit of crab back + Louie sauce.

Another highlight was the smoked salmon. The bread is sliced thin, so you can fully enjoy the buttery smoked salmon.

Combination cocktail was great value as I got to have oyster, prawn, crab (2 leg + lots of white meat), AND shrimp. I liked mixing the white crab meat with crab back. With shrimp, I enjoyed making little sandwiches with bread, butter, Louie sauce.

Boston style clam chowder had good flavours. The chili sauce went perfectly with it. It's not as thick as new england chowder.

The Sicilian sashimi plate came with scallop, yellowtail, ahi tuna, and salmon. The scallop was outstanding, but the other fish were just fine. I don't think I would get it again. The flavours were not as impressive as how the dish looks.

Next time I want to try another off-menu item, scallops with ponzu and Sriracha sauce. Or the cherry stone clams.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tony told me to come, and I'm glad I did.
The food is divine. So fresh, so full of flavour. The service is kind, welcoming and professional. Good beer on tap.
The scallop ceviche was ridiculous - almost like butter melting in your mouth.
I will definitely go back one day.

top_10.name: Pier 45 Seafood
top_10.address: Pier 45 Shed, #11B, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Aside from docking the floating museums of the USS Panpanito submarine and SS Jeremiah O'Brien Liberty ship, this is our favorite area to look out onto the bay while enjoying a piping hot bowl of clam chowder. It offers a great view of Alcatraz, along with the sensory experiences I associate Fisherman's Wharf with: Cool ocean breezes, boat horns, the call of seagulls, and the smell of pier wood and oil. Love it!

OVERALL:
Not overly crowded, awesome views.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Vintage arcade , very impressive still running well. Fun for any age.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a fun eventful day. If wanna checkout a sub and beautiful scenery. This is the place. Can get packed during weekend. Tours are not bad in price but not cheap if have large family. Still enjoyed our day.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very educational!!! Nice scenery while you wait. Can also go into quarter arcade with a lot of old arcade games. It was a lot of fun. Great for a family outing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Pier 45 must be visited when you visit Fisherman’s Wharf area at San Francisco. A building with a lot of amazing, historical, fun, clever, intriguing, treasurable & memorable “arcade” machines from past decades. When everything was so simple & long lasting… Hours of fun playing & watching those vintage machines working to entertain you. Brought back precious memories of my grand parents. Thank you Team Pier 45! Stay Strong & Stay Safe!

top_10.name: Fog Harbor Fish House
top_10.address: 39 Pier, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great restaurant on pier 39, where you can see the sea lions just nearby.

The highlight was the scallop risotto. The scallops were seared to perfection, with a nice crust on the outside and almost a buttery flesh that just melted away.

The clam chowder was a classic and great to show guests who have never tried chowder. If the whole party has, I would probably order more from the menu.

The cioppino was nice, a good mix of seafood, but no overwhelming strong flavours. Good sharing plate.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food here is truly excellent. It's important that seafood be cooked well, and this was not even slightly overdone. Everything was salted gently, just enough to bring out the other flavors and not a bit more. The meal was also well paced. We got drinks, then complimentary warm rolls and butter, then my salad, and our entrees maybe 7 or 8 minutes later. We split a creme brulee for dessert and it was excellent. Smooth, rich, with a not-too- sweet custard, full of real vanilla bean flecks.

The atmosphere was great. Beautiful dining room and clean tables. Being seated next to the servers station isn't always the best, but it did get us very quick attention when we needed it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We stopped for dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House during our stay at Fisherman’s Wharf. The atmosphere and the views were amazing. The food was fresh and delicious—we especially loved the Caesar salad with avocado and crab meat. The staff were friendly and attentive, and we never felt rushed during our meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really good atmosphere,  food was good (although I prefer the chowder from the crab house) the shrimp appetizer was really good, spicy and savory. The pasta was phenomenal as well. The only thing that I would point out would be the service,  our server never gave us his name, and he seem like he didn't want to be there.. other than that food was great.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had such a great time on our 6th Anniversary at Fog Harbor! The food was soooo good! The service was top notch. We were welcomed by one of the Manager named Arif. He was very professional, very welcoming, very polite and very attentive. Our server's name is Jordan. He was very friendly and always checked in with us if everything was alright. He was very smiley too!

Thank you so much for making our 6th anniversary so special. We had such a wonderful time and it was also my mom's first time in the US and our first time at Fog Harbor! It was all worth it :))

The ambience was so great. We had a table with sea lion view :)) The ventilation was good. Although the tables are kinda close to each other, it does not feel like crampy.

I would recommend this place as well if you are looking for a place to celebrate your anniversary in a way that does not make you feel uncomfortable. I felt not being myself when I went to fine dining experience. This place not only can fill your stomach but also offer great experience. Recommended! top_10.name: Waterbar Restaurant
top_10.address: 399 The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This spot holds a special place for me. The team really knows their stuff, especially when it comes to oysters—they’re great at explaining flavors and helping you choose the perfect ones, even if you’re new to them. Whenever friends visit me in San Francisco, this is always a must-stop. Each area has its own charm: the patio is perfect during the day, the bar is ideal for happy hour, and the dining room feels elegant and cozy for a refined evening. It’s a memorable experience every time, and I can’t recommend it enough.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I walked into Waterbar on a Monday evening around 6pm, hoping for fresh seafood with a view. The dining room had open seats at the seafood bar and a distinctly 2000s vibe complete with aquariums lining the space. The Bay Bridge stretched across the windows, and it's a genuinely nice backdrop for dinner.

The seafood was hit or miss. The broiled oysters and crudo were decent, though nothing special. The crab cocktail missed the mark with that telltale frozen taste that you can't really hide. But the eggplant fries? Surprisingly great. Crispy, well-seasoned, and my favorite thing on the table.

I appreciated seeing detailed sourcing information on the menu, noting where and how each fish was caught. That level of transparency is refreshing. The service was attentive throughout, constantly checking in and keeping water glasses full.

Waterbar delivers on ambiance and views, which counts for something when you're dining on the waterfront. The food won't blow you away, but if you go in knowing it's more about the setting than the standout seafood, you'll have a pleasant enough evening. Worth it for the patio and bridge views, especially with a cocktail in hand

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We went to their happy hour for the $1.55 oyster. We ordered a dozen first to try if the oysters are fresh. YES. They are so fresh and tasty, so we ordered another dozen. The location is very good, you can see the bay bridge from the window. The aquarium in the restaurant is a plus. We also had reservation for dinner, they transferred us to dining tables with breathtaking views. We tried their   Seared tuna, beef and lamb. The food was very tasty, but personally I like lamb chops better. The service was excellent. We will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
October 23, 2025- Thursday.

Came to the Waterbar with my family for the first time during happy hour because we’d heard great things about their oyster special — and to be fair, the oysters were amazing. Super fresh, briny, and perfectly chilled. You could really taste the quality, and they were definitely the highlight of our visit. I’d honestly come back just for those.

Unfortunately, everything else we ordered was kind of a letdown. We tried a soup (can’t remember the name), but it was bitter and just didn’t taste right — not something I’d recommend at all. The fish and chips sounded promising but were greasy and bland, like the fish had no seasoning and the batter was too heavy. The milky bread was another miss — dry, dense, and didn’t really pair well with anything.

The service was also pretty inconsistent. When we first arrived, we were seated at the wrong table, and our first server seemed annoyed about it — definitely gave off “I don’t want to be here” vibes. It felt like he usually worked the non–happy hour section and wasn’t thrilled to have to reset a table for our larger group. Once we got moved to the correct happy hour section though, the vibe completely changed. The staff there were so much friendlier and more attentive, which helped make up for the rocky start.

Overall, I’d say Waterbar is worth it if you’re here for oysters during happy hour, but that’s about it. The oysters are fantastic, but the rest of the food and service didn’t live up to the same standard.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We both ended up getting the short ribs with risotto, mushrooms and leeks. The risotto was fantastic the short ribs were a 4/5 as you ate in they actually were a little dry and the leeks should have been cut down instead of the whole leak being placed in there. However as an absolute hater of mushrooms those weren’t terrible. I did hear that their menu is changed and printed daily which I thought was nice.

We made reservations earlier in the day and had to wait about a 10-15 mins past the reservation time so I definitely recommend making a reservation. However we waited near the bar and were asked multiple times if we needed anything wanted a cocktail while we waited and more so that was a nice touch.

The ambiance was really nice and we sat right next to one of the fish tanks which I  loved. It’s definitely perfect for a date night with intimate table seating. I am not sure about the outside because we quickly passed by it on our way in.
Overall it was nice to eat there and the vibe of the place was wonderful but it’s not some place I’d feel the need to frequent. However, I would like to come back and check out their happy hour.

top_10.name: Jake's Steaks
top_10.address: 581 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I ride my bike down Valencia weekly and have always wanted to give this place a try. For lunch, it was a one man show so it took like 25 minutes for my order to be ready. I got the cheese steak combo with fries and a drink. The cheese steak was severely underwhelming and bland. The roll itself also felt really small compared to other places in the city and especially for its price. The waffle fries were perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was just lacking salt and pepper but an easy fix. Overall, I don't think I would come back unless I was in the area wanting a sandwich. Maybe I'll try something else on the menu next time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Consistently high quality every time. Staff is friendly and location is good. Their chicken sandwich keeps me coming back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Jake's Steaks is renowned for its delicious, hearty steaks and classic American comfort food. The steaks are cooked to perfection, and the menu features a variety of flavorful sides and dishes that complement the main course. The friendly atmosphere makes it a great spot for a satisfying meal. Overall, a reliable choice for steak lovers.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My boyfriend and I had just got into SF, starving and ready to GRUB. We stumbled upon Jake’s steaks and were instantly intrigued— considering we love cheesesteaks. Greeted instantly by one of the staff members with a warm welcome, we got quick to ordering.

I got the classic cheeseteak with spicy peppers added and my boyfriend ordered the BBQ cheesesteak. Along with a side of curly fries. Everything came out HOT and melty.

The food is AMAZING, the staff is even better. This was a wonderful and random choice my boyfriend and I made and we will definitely be back again!!! Thank you guys!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Service was spectacular! The food amazing and great conversations. Thank you Jake’s Steaks we are also not from here was our first time! And definitely not our last 🥳
