top_10.name: Molinari Delicatessen
top_10.address: 373 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Authentic Italian delicacy Deli! Amazing sandwiches with a wide selection of deli meats and ham as well as cheese and pickled vegetables and salads. Very neatly organized and friendly service. Would definitely stop by again to grab a bite when exploring the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Vising SF and had to try the sandwich. I waited for 30-40 minutes. Good thing that I got to chat with a nice woman behind me so the wait felt quick. I got the Lucca Special. It was really delicious. For the price of $16.25, it is a huge sandwich and totally worth it. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Molinari Delicatessen is one of those places that defines North Beach. It’s been around forever, it’s usually busy, and it feels like it hasn’t tried to reinvent itself just to keep up with trends, and that’s a good thing. I’ve stopped here many times over the years to grab a sandwich to go, and it has always delivered. The atmosphere is classic old-school Italian deli, the staff keeps things moving, and even when there’s a line out the door, it goes faster than you’d expect.

Let’s be honest, though, the reason people come here is for the sandwiches. My top picks are the Molinari Special Italian Combo, the Luciano Special, and the Grilled Focaccia Special, in that order. If you’re getting the Italian Combo, do yourself a favor and ask for it on gutted, toasted hard sourdough. And unless you feel very strongly against something in the sandwich, just say “with everything on it.” They’ve been making these sandwiches for over a century; they know exactly how to balance the flavors. The bread, the meats, the cheese, the oil, the vinegar; it all works.

Beyond the sandwiches, Molinari also sells imported Italian goods, cheeses, salamis, pastas, olive oils, and wines, which adds to the experience and makes it feel like more than just a deli counter. But for me, it’s still all about grabbing a sandwich and walking out into North Beach with lunch in hand. It’s reliable, it’s satisfying, and it’s one of those places I’m always happy to recommend to visitors and locals alike.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This sandwich requires a full hour of patience before you even order. Once it lands, though, it’s huge- I ate it for two days, so the $20 price tag almost behaves.
One star off for the attitude toward delivery drivers. Feed people, not egos!!!💔
I’d be back… just emotionally prepared

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow, if you want to wait an hour go on a Saturday at 4! But after waiting an hour, the sandwiches we ordered were so worth it! The sandwich makers/meat slicers/deli professionals were super busy but still had time to help point out the wine I was looking for. I got the Luciano Special, I could only eat half, but the fresh focaccia and the salty prosciutto with the delicious mozzarella and hint of acid from the sun dried tomatoes and the lettuce helping to cut through the saltiness of the meat, I got one of the best sandwiches in my life. My husband ordered the sausage and pepper sandwich and devoured it, according to the noises he was making I had to assume he really enjoyed it. Im sure he mumbled something with a mouth full of sandwich declaring that the hour wait was worth it. Definitely a must stop if you are in Little Italy. It is San Fran, not the most budget friendly city but two sandwiches for $40 seems very reasonable especially for the quality that you get. If you love cheese they have a nice selection of those as well as other goodies available.

testimonials: Authentic Italian delicacy Deli! Amazing sandwiches with a wide selection of deli meats and ham as well as cheese and pickled vegetables and salads. Very neatly organized and friendly service. Would definitely stop by again to grab a bite when exploring the neighborhood.

Vising SF and had to try the sandwich. I waited for 30-40 minutes. Good thing that I got to chat with a nice woman behind me so the wait felt quick. I got the Lucca Special. It was really delicious. For the price of $16.25, it is a huge sandwich and totally worth it. Highly recommend!

Molinari Delicatessen is one of those places that defines North Beach. It’s been around forever, it’s usually busy, and it feels like it hasn’t tried to reinvent itself just to keep up with trends, and that’s a good thing. I’ve stopped here many times over the years to grab a sandwich to go, and it has always delivered. The atmosphere is classic old-school Italian deli, the staff keeps things moving, and even when there’s a line out the door, it goes faster than you’d expect.

Let’s be honest, though, the reason people come here is for the sandwiches. My top picks are the Molinari Special Italian Combo, the Luciano Special, and the Grilled Focaccia Special, in that order. If you’re getting the Italian Combo, do yourself a favor and ask for it on gutted, toasted hard sourdough. And unless you feel very strongly against something in the sandwich, just say “with everything on it.” They’ve been making these sandwiches for over a century; they know exactly how to balance the flavors. The bread, the meats, the cheese, the oil, the vinegar; it all works.

Beyond the sandwiches, Molinari also sells imported Italian goods, cheeses, salamis, pastas, olive oils, and wines, which adds to the experience and makes it feel like more than just a deli counter. But for me, it’s still all about grabbing a sandwich and walking out into North Beach with lunch in hand. It’s reliable, it’s satisfying, and it’s one of those places I’m always happy to recommend to visitors and locals alike.

top_10.name: Submarine Center
top_10.address: 820 Ulloa St, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was craving a pastrami and found this place was within biking distance so I went out and ordered ahead on doordash for pick up. It was ready by the time I got there.

The pastrami sandwich was good and juicy though it's not a traditional pastrami I had in mind, I'd still come back for this. But is a sandwich really $17 these days?

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My boyfriend was craving a sandwich, so I looked up a few spots and decided to give this place a try — and I’m so glad we did! It’s a small space but super efficient and well-run.

We ordered two subs, and they were absolutely amazing. I had the avocado with turkey, and my boyfriend went with the pastrami. Both were fresh, flavorful, and packed just right. We devoured our subs — definitely hit the spot!

Great little gem for a satisfying sandwich fix.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the best subs I’ve ever had! The pastrami, Swiss, bacon, and avocado is simply incredible. The staff recommended it as it was my first time there.
Sandwich was incredible. Perfectly cooked pastrami, delectable bacon, huge chunks of avocado, melting Swiss cheese, balanced mustard, and topped with a crispy bun toasted to perfection.
I want to go back and get this again.
A+ will be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The to go mighty sandwich shop! Such a great variety (and generous with Avo!). We split the Italian super sub, and it was great! Ratios were perfect, and bread was nice and crusty. There were plenty of staff here ready to make fast and fresh sandwiches during the lunch hour. Nowhere to eat or sit, so ger your order to go and enjoy!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: this is hands down the best sandwich i’ve ever had in my life. i got the avocado turkey swiss with everything and it was delicious. i plan to come back and order the roast beef (“everyone’s favorite”). we are at a nearby park and the vibe was immaculate. they don’t have indoor seating but there is a park and various benches located nearby where you can enjoy your decadent sub.

top_10.name: Sandy's
top_10.address: 1457 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Once in a while I crave a muffuletta and, of course, Sandy’s is just the place to go. I really enjoyed the combo meal with the 1/4 muffuletta, 8oz herby slaw, and a bag of chips. Wonderful lunch! Bit on the heavier side but that’s what you sign up for. The herby slaw was delicious, fresh, and has a balanced sweetness. They have parsley, chives, and dill mixed in there with a mustard dressing, and I found it to be superb with the sandwich. Staff were nice, and you order at the counter and bus your own table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: After spending the morning Slingshoting nonconformists out in the panhandle with One Eyed Jack and his son Little Peeper we walked up Haight to Sandy's for one of those world famous sandwiches.  Probably the most underrated sandwich joint in the city!   5 stars  ☆☆☆☆☆

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food was not bad...maybe i dont usually have this style...I think if you like more meaty tastes ..you will like it. I like a more balanced sandwich. Egg sandwich was a no frills type of sandwich. Service was nice and small eating area...we were treated well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: ABSOLUTE MUST-TRY! This was by far the best muffuletta I have ever had! While it is a little pricey, the combo makes it so worth it and it is well worth the price regardless! Cookie are also incredibly delicious too! The staff here were super friendly and attentive. This is a small business and is really pushing the neighborhood forward! I cannot think that I could recommend this place any stronger. Definitely a must-have when visiting San Francisco!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Didn't get their famous muffaletta but tried their egg sandwich and cookie. Cookie was amazing, kinda pricey at $5 but worth it for the size and quality. Egg sandwich, while good, didn't feel like it fully justified the $14 price tag. Not the most complex flavor and just put between two pieces of regular white bread.

Even with that though the customer service was great, and if I'm ever around there again I will stop by for a cookie.

top_10.name: Le Sandwich
top_10.address: 752 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
As the son of Chef Elias himself, I’ve long thought about writing a review for Le Sandwich—and struggled to fit everything I feel into a short blurb. But here it goes. I’d be surprised if there’s another person on the planet who has eaten as many "Le Sandwiches" as I have, or introduced as many friends to what quickly becomes their favorite lunch spot.

When I’m away at school, I find myself longing for a slow day when I can walk down to the shop, spend time with my dad, and enjoy the freshest, most loaded, and most delicious sandwich in the city. This summer, my favorite part of every workday was the hour I spent at Le Sandwich—catching up with Chef Elias and fueling up for the rest of the day. Some of my best memories with friends and family have been made at the cozy three-seat counter, and somehow Le Sandwich finds its way into our conversations almost daily. If I am home and seeing my friends, there is only one place we go to eat!

What impresses me most is that my dad, Chef Elias runs this five-star operation six days a week—entirely by himself. Name another person who can memorize seven consecutive orders, produce top-quality food, run the register, speak with customers in six languages, and genuinely make everyone’s day better. I’ll wait!

There’s truly no parallel to Le Sandwich when it comes to community, customer service, and taste. Stop by—you won’t regret it. Love you, Dada.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great sandwich. I have the Viking which is around $15 something after tax but it’s loaded. The sandwich is big so I have to save half of it for later. So worth the visit!

You can call and order by phone to pick up which I did and it saved me waiting time!

Will return to try other options!

Updated: I’m now an avid customer of this sandwich shop. The owner's thoughtful and funny personality also his creativity to make the best sandwich fill me with joy every time I swing by. This store is not close to my place but I’m willing to travel far for the owner’s creation! Not to mention with the sandwich is packed with fillings. My mom and I were so full after finishing only half of the sandwich!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: got the Viking to go; well-balanced flavours and generous portions! saw lots of regulars that’s a green flag right there; shop is small but cozy & playing vintage label music.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Chef Elias was extremely friendly and whipped up two absolutely delicious (and huge) Italian sandwiches for us. We’d been wanting to go for a while and it absolutely lived up to the hype. Order the Primo!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the best sandwich shops in SF. Owner is super goated, small little location and everything tastes fresh.

I got the Reuben this time, didn’t expect the corned beef to be cold but besides that the sandwich was great. Will have to go back and try other things on the menu.

top_10.name: Deli Board
top_10.address: 1058 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The 49er is the best sandwich I've had in SF. Sooo delicious! One caveat is that it's a 1/2 sandwich cut in half, pretty much 6 inches. All the photos make the sandwiches look like they're stuffed with meat, and they are stuffed in the middle, but the ends are basically bare. I would need two of these to be satisfied, so it ends up being a $60 lunch after a drink and a tip. Is it worth it? Absolutely. Would I do it regularly? Probably not, but the line is down the block so they can charge what they want!

I like that you have to show up - no online or phone orders, keeps it moving. Staff was friendly and efficient.

Also had the breakfast sandwich. Definitely one of the best around except for the Dutch crunch. Just a horrible bread choice. After a few bites I actually picked the bread off and ate the majority without bread. Next time will go with sweet french and omit the bacon. However, at $21 and no possibility of ordering before 11am, not sure I'd bother in the future.

I really like the counter service atmosphere, but wish they'd clear off the benches and standing tables in the windows so you could enjoy your sandwich on-site. Having to immediately leave and find a place to sit down nearby is difficult unless you don't mind the smell of urine while you eat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The Mick and the Rach are my solid go to's.   Never had a bad sandwhich and the line is worth the wait!     Beats Ike's , he even was there eating on my latest trip into the city for great food!

Another trip has me trying the Bradley! Amazing these guys dont miss!   Love this place!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you’re looking for the best sandwich shop in San Francisco, you’re in the right place! From the flavor packed tender pastrami, to the thin crispy bread that perfectly complements every aspect of the sandwich, Deli Board has it all. You can’t go wrong with anything you order—although we ordered the 555, the Leroy Brown and some waffle fries—Believe me when I say that these may very well be the best sandwiches I’ve ever had (and that says a lot coming from my family of foodies!) The cashiers and servers were about as friendly as they come but be prepared for a well worth it wait! Deli Board also lacked any forms of indoor seating. The overall aesthetic, however, was quite cute! They had dried flower bouquets upon the ceiling and hand drawn pictures framed across the wall! Our overall experience at Deli Board was 1000% enjoyed. I insist that anyone visiting San Francisco MUST go to Deli Board. Taking an hour out of your vacation for these sandwiches is well worth it. Do a favor for your taste buds and go to Deli Board!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I recently visited Daily Board with my dad, and our experience was a bit disappointing. Right from the start, the staff asked us to move away from a certain area in a rather impolite manner, even though others around us weren't asked to do the same. On top of that, the line was incredibly long, and the prices were outrageously high ($24 for a sandwich?). The sandwich itself was just average, with nothing special, just a basic combination of cold turkey and standard ingredients, some sauces on top and that's that. Overall, it didn't quite meet our expectations, especially compared to other sandwich places like Bite, or Saigon Sandwich for a super cheap and delicious banh mi. Wouldn't recommend this for anyone especially people who liked hyped places.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had to stop by to see what all the hype was about, and the food did not disappoint! Solid 8.9/10. Portions are generous as one order could easily satisfy two people with a normal appetite. We arrived around 11:30 and only waited about 20 minutes, which wasn’t bad at all. I tried the 49er and the Mick (their fancy take on a Big Mac); both were excellent. Bonus points for ample parking nearby!

top_10.name: Saigon Sandwich
top_10.address: 560 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Best Vietnamese sandwich in San Francisco! The sandwiches are not as good as the San Jose one, but in term of the prices, quality of bread and the portions, it’s worth to give it a try even though it’s located in Tenderloin. Combo and pork are just ok. Chicken is the best. The bread is fresh. I like how soft it’s, not too hard as others. Cash only. Open at 7am.
Be cautious to be there because there are many homeless around.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It's cash only, so make sure to have that before coming. There's a few ATMs that are nearby, if you didn't know like I did. This is probably one of my favorite banh mi sandwiches that I've ever had. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but it had a small line going outside of the restaurant, which is usually a pretty good sign the place has good food. Sort of a sketchy area. The line moved pretty quickly. I heard people ordering a  combination sandwich and was intrigued by that, but I decided to just keep with a pork sandwich. The bread was soft and crispy, and I think they made it right in the back! The ingredients were very fresh too. It had everything I look for in a banh mi sandwich. The ingredients were very fresh, and the jalapeños gave me a good punch across the face. The sauce really complimented the pork too, and crunchiness from the carrots is always great. Last but definitely not least, the value is crazy. It is such a good deal for a sandwich this good to be less than 8 dollars. I'd eat these far too often if I lived nearby. I see why the Infatuation holds this place in high praise.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
CASH ONLY. Stumbled upon this unassuming banh mi spot after staying at the Motel 6 around the corner for Santacon. WOW!!! The bread here is PHENOMENAL, baked fresh right behind the counter! The banh mi ranges from $5.50-$7. I ordered the Special Combination (thit cha pate, which has roast pork, Vietnamese ham, and pate) for $7 but added extra pate for an additional $1.

WHEN I SAY EXTRA PATE, THEY PUT EXTRA PATE!! There was the THICKEST LAYER of pate I've ever seen in my life here, probably a little more than half an inch thick, THIS IS WORTH $1 EXTRA!! The pate was savory, nicely seasoned, and just overall tasty. The roast pork was very tender and slightly sweet, definitely not your usual banh mi filling in America, but made the entire sandwich really savory. The cha lua (Vietnamese ham) was cut a bit too thin for me personally but the amount of pate they put really made up for everything.

The star of the show is absolutely the bread. Crispy on the outside but extremely soft and warm on the inside, the bread itself has a nice flavor just on its own. Its thicker than what I'm used to so there's more pillowy goodness inside. They make the perfect bread here!

Craving another banh mi with extra pate from here as I write this. Absolutely coming back

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The sandwiches were amazing! The cost of the portion sizes are insanely good. It’s a cash only place but definitely worth having. I had the pork sandwich & it was fantastic 😋

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Not only was my meatball pork sandwich delicious but the lady preparing the sandwich was lightning fast! I swear by the time I received my change the sandwich was done! The sandwich had a nice balance of crunch, sweetness and flavor of the pork. From the reviews I’ve seen I can’t wait to try the combination. The only cons are that it’s cash only and I couldn’t dine inside because the TL’s is not an ideal area to be eating outside if you know what I mean.

top_10.name: Bite
top_10.address: 912 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is the first time I've captured photos of all food items for a review. Normally, I don't hold out on the grub down. This was a late night order (after midnight) — so I wasn't expecting to receive their best work. I am blown away by the freshness, quality ingredients, and careful preparation of the food received. Let's keep it real, when ordering food so late I come across end-of-day stragglers that sat awhile, dried out, becoming stale, and quickly thrown together before closing. The food I received from Bite was made to order, and the rotisserie chicken was fresh (did I already mention this was after midnight!?). Bite won another customer for life! Thank you for serving hearty and nutritious food of this quality, especially for night owls. Keep these folks in business!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ordered a recommendation from the employee behind the counter, it was a good sandwich with plenty of fillings, slightly over sauced hence the 4 stars. Prices are in line with other deli sandwich shops. Whilst visiting the shop wasn’t busy and the sandwich didn’t take too long to make. Would recommend if you need a quick bite after touring SF

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was staying at Hotel Julian next door and fell in love with this place! The girls were so sweet and made the best sandwiches and wraps. The Cuban should be permanently on the menu! It was delicious. The California Hillbilly was phenomenal as well with a little kick. I had that with spinach tortilla. The cookie, pickle, potato salad, and humous were all amazing as well. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best tuna sandwich! It’s huge, reasonably priced, and always tastes amazing. The staff are super nice and serve some of the best sandwiches in the bay.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My favorite sandwich shop! ❤️

They're so many great options on the menu to choose from! So far, I'm really diggin' both the Firecracker(shown in picture) and the Sleeper sandwiches. They do not skimp out on the sandwiches and they are packed with flavor. So delicious! Bite also has a selection of beverages and chips to choose from, if you wish to do so. Also, the service is quick and friendly!

Overall, a 5/5! I highly recommend given this place a try.

Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Mason Street Deli
top_10.address: 39 Mason St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Lovely

testimonials: Lovely

top_10.name: Rhea's Deli & Market
top_10.address: 800 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Stopped by for a sandwich and was really impressed! They have a great deli tucked away inside this corner convenience store. They offer a large selection of sandwiches from their menu and also build your own sandwich.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’ve been coming to Rhea’s Sandwiches since 2012 and it still absolutely delivers. I’m a “make your own” person every time, and my go-to is turkey on a whole wheat roll — and honestly, their sweetened pickle is the little detail that seals it for me. It’s that perfect tangy/sweet bite that makes the whole sandwich pop.

The consistency here is unreal. Huge shoutout to the crew behind the counter making the magic happen — you’re the reason this place stays one of the best sandwich spots in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I'm on a mission to find a proper bodega in any city outside of Manhattan. And while Rhea's is not one, it is not entirely far off.

You've got some pantry staples, snacks, cold drinks, beer & liquor, and a deli counter. It's all of... Questionable quality, but the spirit is there.

The wood paneling and old bar decorations on the walls gives a sense of history too, which adds to the neighborhood charm.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Tucked away in the Mission, this hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop delivers way more than you’d expect. Fresh bread, big flavors, and generous portions make it a local treasure. The standout is the Valencia sandwich—savory, layered, and perfectly balanced. A true neighborhood classic.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Best sandwich in the city. Tons to select from, custom, and vegetarian meat options too!
Got the vegetarian bbq chicken medium spicy and added cheddar cheese. Incredible! The acme bread is sooo good. Similar to a French bread. Highly recommend!
The medium spicy had the perfect spicy level. I love spicy food and thought it was perfect.

Wait was about 25-35 minutes though.

top_10.name: Philmore Creamery
top_10.address: 1840 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really outstanding gelato that essentially taste like the European version I live. It’s very hard to find good gelato in the states but Philmore comes very close. The salted caramel is particularly wonderful as well as the pistachio. They are generous with their scoops and prices are reasonable unlike my experience with salt and straw where I paid for the “kitchen sink” for $16 and got three tiny half scoops of ice cream!! This is a hundred times better!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Quality ice cream and great flavors- signed up for their rewards program and will be coming back! They let you try samples. Run if you want the strawberry shortcake flavor bc I was told it’ll be gone soon. Went with a friend and we both got a small cup with half matcha blackberry and half strawberry shortcake. Surprisingly, I liked the strawberry shortcake the best though both were good.
The insides are small and though there’s some seating inside, there’s not much so be prepared to take your ice cream for a walk.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve been treating myself, and everyone who comes for a visit, to Philmore Creamery after warning them that they might not accept gelato, sorbetto or ice cream from anywhere else ever again. The seasonal fruit sorbetto is so creamy smooth and rich that I won’t bother with the icy crystals others sell as sorbetto no matter how tempted I might be to give it another try. It’s no wonder the fruit flavor comes through so strongly; I’ve seen boxes of beautiful freshly picked plums and peaches on the counter waiting to be turned into sorbetto. The gelato choices are so delicious I just go with the flight so I get to enjoy my 3 standard favorites and 3 new ones.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wonderful gelato! Reminds me of Italy. (Don't believe me? Just check my post history.) That said, we don't glaze and "Italy" is not the goal. This gelato is great in and of itself. Light, but still creamy in texture. Clean flavours, exactly as described by their names. My only disappointment is buying a small and not going for something larger.

Do stop by if you have a chance. Really good gelato, especially around SF bay area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place convinced me that Gelato can be as good, if not better, than ice cream. This place is Better than any gelato I had in Italy. I recommend the pistachio or almond toffee if they have it. Also coconut. Their signature flavor is Stratiatella. My wife loves it, I think it's ok. Try a sample because why not? you won't find Stratiatella gelato anywhere else.

top_10.name: Mitchell's Ice Cream
top_10.address: 688 San Jose Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I loved that they have parking in the back because that’s a huge deal in SF. Their flavors are very unique, I tried the Thai tea which was amazing as was the espresso toffee crunch. My wife really liked their chocolate caramel crunch flavor too. I was excited to try their ube but unfortunately I sampled it and tasted pretty much no ube flavor it was just purple lol. But I’d def recommend Mitchell’s for anybody that wants good ice cream in the area or wants to switch up from the usual flavors

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The best dipped chocolate ice cream EVER!!!!. I have not been able to find any other place with the same quality and quantity. If you are in town or around the area craving ice cream, stop by, you wont regret it. Let me tell you, their eggnog ice cream is AMAZING. Don't hesitate. Only problem, be prepared for the wait time, worth it though!.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A San Francisco institution for over 70 years. Old school to the core with traditional and tropical flavors, shakes, sundaes and splits. Grasshopper Pie and Peanut Butter Indulgence alongside Halo Halo. Made right there at the shop with sustainable quality ingredients. Take a number. The line moves fast. Or grab a half gallon tub and hit the express lane. Can even deliver. Along with See’s Candies, Pacific Cafe,  and the Golden Gate Bridge, life here would be miserable without them.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This local ice cream shop has real history behind it. The ice cream isn’t just delicious—the employees are also lovely and welcoming.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everyone comes to this place. Lines can be out the door sometimes.  While it's pricey, and no, I can't compare it to nowhere else because i don't buy ice cream elsewhere. They have a huge variety of flavors. I got coffee and tofee espresso, and it was really good. You also get to try any ice cream before you buy, which I find great. I got a double scoop of 2 different ice creams, and they charge an additional $2 for the scoop.. based on what we were told.

testimonials: I loved that they have parking in the back because that’s a huge deal in SF. Their flavors are very unique, I tried the Thai tea which was amazing as was the espresso toffee crunch. My wife really liked their chocolate caramel crunch flavor too. I was excited to try their ube but unfortunately I sampled it and tasted pretty much no ube flavor it was just purple lol. But I’d def recommend Mitchell’s for anybody that wants good ice cream in the area or wants to switch up from the usual flavors

top_10.name: Garden Creamery
top_10.address: 3566 20th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Whenever we’re in the mission area, this is the one place my friends and I always go to.

They have unique Asian flavors like ube, pandan, Japanese milk coffee, you name it. They have limited flavors that change pretty frequently and they’re all amazing, super rich and filled with flavor. There’s usually a line whenever we go but it’s so worth the wait.

Not to mention they allow you to sample up to 3 flavors and the employees are always so friendly!! I can’t recommend this place enough/ can’t wait to go back again!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Delicious ice cream.   When it comes to scoop generosity, at the least it's delicious.

Parking is non existent.   During the day or during the evening hours,  forget about finding a spot.   Scooter?  No parking problems.

Still one of my favorite ice cream spots in the City.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Me and my two kids saw some people on Valencia with delicious looking ice creams, followed their direction to Garden Creamery and were super impressed. They let us try a few and we enjoyed it all. Lil had had a sugar cone with ube and velvet chocolate on sugar cone, lil guy had cookies and cream with the strawberry ice cream and I had the salty Kaya and black sesame on a cake cone. When the guys strawberry started to fall they put in a cup for him. They were all super kind and it was a quick line. Yummy!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Garden Creamery easily ranks in my top five ice cream spots in San Francisco. My go-to order is the Ube ice cream with Mochi — and let me tell you, it’s the real deal. The Ube flavor is rich, creamy, and true to its roots. Add-ons like Mochi or a drizzle of condensed milk take it to the next level, making each bite a perfect balance of texture and sweetness. A must-visit for anyone chasing authentic, handcrafted ice cream in the city.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A true 10/10 ice cream shop. I’m honestly not usually the world’s biggest ice cream fan (a foodie crime, I know), but I occasionally find a spot with expertly crafted, unique flavors that changes my mind. Garden Creamery is one of those gems — they have a slew of outstanding Asian-inspired flavors, perfectly crafted to be super rich, smooth, and (critically) not overly sweet. Several flavors also have fun crunchy mix-ins, which offer a great flavor and texture contrast.

The store is super cute, with its cozy string lights and rows upon rows of doggo Polaroids, but it is quite small. The line frequently goes out the door and around the block, although it does move decently fast. Each guest is allowed to sample a max of four flavors, which helps keep the line moving but does make for hard decisions — every flavor looks drool-worthy!

I sampled the genmaicha, salty kaya, hojicha, and black sesame, all of which were outstanding. The tea-based scoops had a great earthiness from the tea, with slight floral notes. The hojicha was wonderfully roasty and the genmaicha had toasted rice mixed in that helped amp up the flavor. The black sesame and a similarly nutty and roasted flavor, and it wasn’t overly sweet. The salty kaya was a wonderful sweet and savory combo, perfect for pairing with a sweeter or fruitier scoop, but also delicious in its own. It was hard to choose just two for my standard cup, but I eventually settled on the genmaicha and then went out on a limb for the fifth flavor that I wanted to try but couldn’t fit in, their strawberry lychee yuzu sorbet. Similar to the ice cream, the sorbet was super smooth and didn’t have a single hint of ice crystals; it was fruity, sweet but not overwhelming, and quite refreshing. It went wonderfully with the genmaicha (matcha and strawberry is a classic pairing, after all), and I loved the combo. I can’t wait to come back to try all their other flavors!

top_10.name: Bi-Rite Creamery
top_10.address: 3692 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
🍦 Delicious Ice Cream:
The ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery is genuinely delicious. It's rich, creamy, and clearly made with high-quality ingredients, resulting in fantastic flavors that truly satisfy.

😊 Super Friendly Staff:
The staff here are incredibly friendly and welcoming. As first-time visitors, we especially appreciated how accommodating they were, allowing us to sample quite a few flavors before we settled on our choices. This made the experience even more enjoyable.

👍 First-Timer Friendly:
Their willingness to let us sample multiple flavors made our first visit a very positive and memorable one. It's great for discovering new favorites.

📍 Overall Impression:
Bi-Rite Creamery is a must-visit for ice cream lovers in San Francisco. The combination of delicious ice cream and wonderfully friendly service makes for a truly delightful experience. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Bi-Rite Creamery is a solid choice if you're in the area and looking for a dependable ice cream spot. There was nothing particularly wrong with the experience, but nothing that made it feel truly special either.

The ice cream was good and the prices were fair, making it a perfectly decent option. This is the ideal kind of place when you just want a reliable, no-frills scoop without having to think too much about it.

If you're nearby and in the mood for a simple and satisfying treat, Bi-Rite Creamery gets the job done.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the vegan offerings.Hippy sandwich, served hot. $13 Interesting preparation of sweet potato in very thin strands deep fried to crunchy texture. Micro greens and guacamole were great compliments.
Chips, had to have some kettle chips.
Sandwich took a little while even though there was no line.
Nice lunch in Dolores Park and a beautiful Saturday afternoon.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I visited this place on a Sunday afternoon and had to wait about 25 minutes in line—but it was absolutely worth it!
I went for the Make Your Own sundae, and it turned out to be the best choice ever. I picked Black Sesame, Salted Caramel, and Peanut Butter flavors, and topped it with spiced pecans, caramelized bananas, hot fudge, and, of course, whipped cream. It was incredibly delicious!
I totally recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This spot is bangin! After a burrito on Mission we drove a short distance to top off lunch with some ice cream….and this place it the mark. we ordered salted caramel ice cream, and I got a second scoop of the coffee toffee. The buddy I was with had his banana flamed… like a crème brûlée. Excellent texture very clean place super friendly gal who helped us. And indeed, a great way to treat yourself after a burrito on Mission.

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 586 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We love this ice cream place not just because of their delicious flavors. They always have, or because of the monthly new flavors that they cook up all the time. But we also love it because they always have vegan options. We don’t do well with dairy, so we’re always willing to take dairy pills to have these delicious flavors. But we also love that they are vegan flavors are also high-quality! It’s nothing fancy, it’s just ice cream. But they do it very well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Got two flavors split scoop: Cinnamon Snickerdoodle and Sea Salt w/ Caramel Ribbons. I think the value is decent and it was definitely a lot of ice cream for a me.

Got to sample a ton of flavors that were very interesting, including: Strawberry Honey Balsamic, Goat Cheese Marionberry Habanero, and pickled cucumber Sorbet.

It was kinda dirty in this area (streets/sidewalk) and also dirty inside (tables and floors). But it seemed clean behind the counter, so I wasn’t worried about the ice cream being contaminated.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had one scoop of the goat cheese berry habanero and the coffee and nuts (half half). They were good. Not overly sweet at all. I also tried (sample) olive oil and pear blue cheese. They were good but not distinct flavors for the names. Def come back. Love it. Have outdoor seating. Perfect for a warm sunny day.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Joey is so awesome thank you so much for his kind hospitality and for taking such good care of us. We got to try some amazing flavors and he was so patient with us. I’ve never had such a delightful experience before he is truly an asset to the business and we feel so beyond blessed after meeting and connecting with him!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very artificial tasting flavors, perhaps why they add so many ingredients to one ice cream flavor. Specifically, I tasted the strawberry/balsamic, and pear/blue cheese. Death by choclate cake, was a whole lot of ingredients that didn't quite come together favorably. They were happy to give out samples.

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 2201 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious ice cream with some unique flavours. I had the dark chocolate brownie and honey lavender single split, and both were amazing. Thick consistency and strong flavours. They're generous with their portions, so you may regret getting a double scoop like my friend did :D Only complaint was the number of flies around the entrance

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Good ice cream, concerned about cross-contamination

I saw the benches outside were both occupied as well as the seats inside, so I knew their ice cream was probably going to be good. I had a vanilla ice cream in their single size for about $7. It was really creamy and had specks of vanilla bean.

After having a few spoonfuls, I saw that there was another flavor mixed into the vanilla. It tasted like ube. This meant that the person who scooped my ice cream didn't clean the scoops between customers. While I don't have food allergies, I'm concerned for those who do.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So yummy every time. The ice cream is so interesting with it changing every month. I would recommend that you try all the OG flavors. Then do the monthly ones after you have your baseline for every other time that you go. My face is the snickerdoodle. In the photo I have the coffee stone fruit and the banana sherbet 8.5/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Im drooling just thinking about this ice cream again.

Got the gooey brownie and the salted, malted, cookie dough. The sizes were a good portion. Can definitely taste the salt in the cookie dough, which helps balance the other flavors. && brownies were gooey with a touch of fudge? Lovely.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I need to preface this review with a confession: I gained weight living down the block from Salt & Straw. I liked it too much. After discovering this place, I became convinced that heaven on earth does in fact exist—and it comes in a waffle cone.

I first heard about Salt & Straw at Alta Plaza Park, where a couple in love, lounging on a red-and-white gingham blanket, kindly pet my overly curious dog. “This is Salt & Straw,” they said. “Best ice cream in the city.” The next day I walked over, only to find a line stretching down the block. It took me months to build up the patience to wait it out.

When I finally reached the counter, I realized Salt & Straw isn’t your typical scoop shop. They’re known for wildly inventive flavors that sound improbable, even impossible—savory ingredients turned into ice cream. Seasonal menus have included pumpkin pie, Thanksgiving stuffing, and cranberry sauce. My first order was pear and blue cheese, and it was a revelation: a flavor explosion that made me rethink what ice cream could be.

But the true magic came when my son and I discovered what has since become our all-time favorite flavor—not just at Salt & Straw, but anywhere: **Strawberry Honey Balsamic Vinegar with Black Pepper.** It’s woven with homemade strawberry jam that is, quite simply, the most delicious jam in the world. After his first bite, my then 11-year-old son looked at me and said, “Mom, ice cream doesn’t get any better.” He was right. From that moment on, we stopped experimenting with other flavors. That one became our go-to, and thankfully, it’s available by the quart—meaning we can skip the line and still bring home perfection.

Salt & Straw is more than an ice cream shop. It’s a place where flavor becomes adventure, where patience is rewarded, and where one scoop can change your definition of dessert forever.

top_10.name: Marco Polo Italian Ice Cream
top_10.address: 3886 Noriega St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve heard of this place for a long time. The interior was very clean and bright with some space to sit. Their flavors were amazing. They’re definitely unique and tropical. The staff let us tried a couple flavors and all of them were really impressive. They were like juice burst in your mouth. The price was also very good. We were able to get three flavors with the medium cup and he gave us a decent amount. I would definitely recommend trying the pandan leaf and mangosteen. And I can’t wait to come back to try more.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We’ve been here about four times and everytime the staff is sooooo genuinely nice and helpful. I always love the black sesame, taro, pandan, and coffee. Tried the mangosteen for the first time and it was great after a heavy dinner!! Flavors are all good and made with fresh ingredients. The best part is their staff though, they always have a big smile from the moment you walk in and recommend flavors that you may like or want samples. When talking to friends they say the same thing about their customer service and how above and beyond they always go with such great energy. I wish i could rate them higher than 5 stars!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Been going to Marco Polo since it was on Taraval St for the last 20 plus years. The new location is nice. I usually order the mango and jack fruit but not I just resort to jack fruit. There are no words to describe the taste but delicious! Go and try the different flavors.

Tip: there is a Marco Polo in SJ too

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best ice cream in the Bay!! Delicious flavors and really large portions. My flavor favs are: jackfruit, guava, mocha chip, coconut, and soursop. The coconut was super fresh and had pieces inside of it: Nathan helped the whole family choose between options and made our first experience here wonderful!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Super yummy! They have so many Asian inspired flavors and this is now my favorite spot in all of San Fran! I went here in the dead of winter and it was so worth it, even sitting out in the cold. Can’t wait to go back, that durian ice cream has a GRIP on me.

testimonials: I’ve heard of this place for a long time. The interior was very clean and bright with some space to sit. Their flavors were amazing. They’re definitely unique and tropical. The staff let us tried a couple flavors and all of them were really impressive. They were like juice burst in your mouth. The price was also very good. We were able to get three flavors with the medium cup and he gave us a decent amount. I would definitely recommend trying the pandan leaf and mangosteen. And I can’t wait to come back to try more.

We’ve been here about four times and everytime the staff is sooooo genuinely nice and helpful. I always love the black sesame, taro, pandan, and coffee. Tried the mangosteen for the first time and it was great after a heavy dinner!! Flavors are all good and made with fresh ingredients. The best part is their staff though, they always have a big smile from the moment you walk in and recommend flavors that you may like or want samples. When talking to friends they say the same thing about their customer service and how above and beyond they always go with such great energy. I wish i could rate them higher than 5 stars!!!

Been going to Marco Polo since it was on Taraval St for the last 20 plus years. The new location is nice. I usually order the mango and jack fruit but not I just resort to jack fruit. There are no words to describe the taste but delicious! Go and try the different flavors.

Tip: there is a Marco Polo in SJ too

top_10.name: Lush Gelato
top_10.address: 520 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Some of the best Gelato we've ever had. That Dulce de Leche was so good we both went with that as our choice. We will dream of this place and be back immediately on our next visit. Loved the guy who took care of us. Excellent service.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Love the ice cream here! I come back all the time for new, fun flavors. Carlos was super helpful and welcoming tonight!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Visited SF out of town to celebrate a milestone birthday. Some of the best gelato I've ever had the dulce leche and black/white trio was creamy and delicious 😋!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Lush Gelato is absolutely fantastic! The selection of creative, fresh flavors is impressive – from timeless classics to surprising combinations that work perfectly together. The texture is wonderfully creamy, and you can taste the high-quality ingredients in every bite. I also loved the friendly and relaxed atmosphere in the shop. If you’re a gelato lover, this place is a must-visit – easily the best gelato in San Francisco!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Lush Gelato in Little Italy is a must-visit if you’re in SF and craving some of the best gelato around. They offer a range of unique and interesting flavors, from classic Italian favorites to fun, inventive combinations you won’t find anywhere else. Every scoop is smooth, creamy, and perfectly balanced, showcasing the quality of ingredients they use.

The shop is sweet and simple, making it a charming spot for a casual date or a fun outing with kids. And if you can’t get enough, they have to-go pints available, so you can bring a bit of that deliciousness home with you. Lush Gelato is an ideal stop for anyone looking to enjoy an authentic, refreshing treat in the heart of Little Italy.

testimonials: Some of the best Gelato we've ever had. That Dulce de Leche was so good we both went with that as our choice. We will dream of this place and be back immediately on our next visit. Loved the guy who took care of us. Excellent service.
Love the ice cream here! I come back all the time for new, fun flavors. Carlos was super helpful and welcoming tonight!
Visited SF out of town to celebrate a milestone birthday. Some of the best gelato I've ever had the dulce leche and black/white trio was creamy and delicious 😋!

top_10.name: San Francisco's Hometown Creamery
top_10.address: 1290 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Weekend visits(~9.30 pm):
A small place, limited seats and a warm story, next to a park and few foodtruck style options around. Decently priced for good ice cream, have multiple size options too👌🏼and locally sourced and made👏🏼

Ordered Chocolate Sorbet icecream, it’s good, the flavour was rich, kinda grew on me. It’s a little new for me, never had a chocolate sorbet before!

They had today’s menu, so probably things change a bit! I see a lot of holiday flavours and experimentation 👏🏼

Parking might be a problem.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Stopped in for an treat after I had a long walk through GGP. Great service, what these girls have to deal with is crazy. I hope they are making great $$$.
So the ice cream was good, not great, but good. I will go back and try another flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This ice cream shop is idyllic!The flavors are the most unique and naturally made I have ever tasted. The shop keeper Michael is a wonderful person who greets everyone with an eager smile and cool tasting opportunities.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very cute and welcoming shop that we found while walking from the park. Loved the smell and ambience inside and out - they produced all the ice cream in house and used specific good quality ingredients.

The peanut butter chocolate fudge is so good! We also tried the breakfast flavor - which tasted like french toast and cinnamon. Love that they have the ‘smidge’ size option which means we can sample more flavors. Opt for the cone - great taste. We also bought their chocolate fudge sauce for 50cents in a small cup and ended up scoping it while eating the ice cream to-go.

Great choice!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Walked by and saw this tiny place was super packed on a Sunday night. And now I know why. The ice cream felt like it was made to order, very creamy and didn't have the "icy" texture at all.

top_10.name: The Ice Cream Bar
top_10.address: 815 Cole St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
They have good quality ice cream with a rotating selection of interesting flavors. Decoration inside is retro and very cute. Service is pretty good, although lines can build up a bit here.

The snickerdoodle cookie I got for the sandwich wasn’t great though. Too hard to eat and just caused ice cream to smush out when biting on the sandwich. I was expecting a softer, much more cake-like cookie, and while I think it’s possible the cookie was over-baked, I still think the baseline recipe needs to be adjusted to softer.

Their waffle cone is more crumbly and similar to shortbread than most waffle cones I’ve had. I don’t have a preference between the 2 styles, but it’s noteworthy. I always get a waffle cone because that’s part of the experience, but the ice cream is definitely the star.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ice cream parlor with great ice cream. I was tempted by the ice cream sandwiches and had brown sugar buttermilk between peanut butter cookies. Excellent. I'll have to go back for milkshakes next. The inside is cozy with historic feel. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a fantastic ice cream shop that delivers both a wonderful experience and excellent ice cream. The retro atmosphere and high-quality, though not overly exotic, ice cream give it an elevated feel. The staff is friendly, helpful, and clearly takes pride in their work. You'll also appreciate their extensive selection of house-made products, from the ice cream itself to toppings and unique soda blends. Conveniently, they also offer water and a restroom. The main drawback is that street parking can be challenging to find.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Perfect ice cream shop off the main drag. Great service and flavor options. Very sweet set up. Waffle cone unique flavor and texture.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The chocolate malt was runny, and the chocolate ice cream cake wasn’t good. Pricey. On the bright side, the staff were very nice.

top_10.name: Smuggler's Cove
top_10.address: 650 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Have wanted to visit this iconic tiki bar for a long time and we finally made it.  They did not disappoint.  Staff was awesome with knowledge and recommendations and the drinks were amazing.  Went twice in three days to take it all in.  If you can get there when they open, you may get lucky enough to sit at one of the two bars.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I don’t understand what the 1-star reviews talking about. The service was amazing. After telling the barkeeper once my name he called me after my name. Our drinks were done under 10min. Very friendly stuff.
I can recommend to come before the rush like around 9pm. It’s easy to spent there 3-4h.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very fun place. Definitely my favorite stop for the night. Very crowded, but we got our drinks fast and they were delicious!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Worth dropping by for a drink, although not really designed to hang out. Strong drinks and limited seating kind of make you feel like you’re intended to move along. Drinks were really tasty and aesthetically presented, and the line outside moved pretty quickly, so I’d go again if in town, but wouldn’t be a regular. A worthwhile novelty to experience at least once.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It's definitely a tiki bar. The drinks were strong and delicious. The decor was great, though the "waterfall" was a bit underwhelming. The bartender was friendly and skilled and the clientele was respectful and pleasant.

Unsurprisingly, it got more overcrowded the later we stayed on a random Wednesday, so don't expect a quiet drink after happy hour, even on a weekday.

I'd probably go back, but it felt underwhelming somehow after all the hype when it opened.

Also, parking absolutely sucks in the neighborhood, so it's best to get there via transit or Lyft.

If you can get there when they open, you may get lucky enough to sit at one of the two bars.

Very fun place. Definitely my favorite stop for the night. Very crowded, but we got our drinks fast and they were delicious!!

top_10.name: The Buena Vista
top_10.address: 2765 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visited for breakfast with my family and really enjoyed the experience. The café has a cosy, welcoming feel with a menu that offers plenty of great options to choose from.
What really stood out was the staff, they seemed like they’d worked there forever, were genuinely proud of the place, and carried a real sense of tradition.
The food was delicious with generous portions and definitely didn’t disappoint. A memorable and charming spot for breakfast!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Popped in here for lunch after needing a caffeine fix after an early start. It seems like this spot is busy at all times, with some people having to share tables, so just keep that in mind if you are looking for a romantic meal.

We were seated quickly and I ordered the Irish coffee (my husband  just had a beer). Being from the UK originally we are used to Irish coffees but this was a very nice version (albeit small, especially for $16). For food we ordered the lobster roll and the club sandwich, which both arrived very quickly. The lobster roll was great, with a generous portion of lobster. My husbands club sandwich looked good as well, and he said it was very tasty. His food did come with fries, which weren't mentioned on the menu or asked for, which he was ultimately charged for. It wasn't a huge amount (something like $1.50) and I would like to think it was just a mistake, but something to be aware of.

We finished our food and our server recommended a Mexican coffee, so I had to give that a try. I actually think I preferred the Mexican coffee to the Irish coffee, so if you are a Kailua fan I recommend giving it a try). In total our bill came to $130 (including tax and tip) so is a little expensive for a lunch spot. The food is good though and I would recommend if you are in the area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you’re in San Francisco and love a good cocktail experience, The Buena Vista is an absolute must-see - especially for anyone craving an iconic Irish Coffee. This legendary spot has perfected the art of the drink, and watching the bartenders line up glasses and craft each Irish Coffee with precision is truly mesmerizing. Make sure to grab a spot near the bar so you can enjoy the show.

That said, don’t expect a quiet, cozy atmosphere. The Buena Vista is lively and often packed, especially on weekends and holidays. Be prepared to wait a while for a table or even a spot at the bar during peak times. The energy and buzz are part of the charm, though—it’s all part of the experience.

Bottom line: Come for the history, stay for the Irish Coffee, and soak in the vibrant vibe of this San Francisco classic.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a great place, full of life and usually busy. Had a BLT and 2 Irish coffees. The Irish coffees are about $15 each but they are really good and the food was amazing too. A great historical place to eat beside the wharf and the views are good too! 5/5, though a little pricey it's worth trying out atleast once.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The Irish coffee here totally lives up to the hype. Watching the bartenders line up the glasses and pour everything with perfect timing is half the fun—it’s like its own show. The cream floats perfectly, you get that kick of whiskey, and it’s super smooth and rich.

The place has that classic San Francisco bar vibe—old-school wood interior, bar stools, warm lighting. Yeah, it’s a tourist spot, but it’s got real character and history (it’s been around since 1916!).

Plus, the location is great—right by Fisherman’s Wharf and Ghirardelli Square—so it’s an easy stop while you’re walking around the area. Definitely worth it for the drink and the atmosphere.

Oh and don’t forget to ask for one Togo

top_10.name: Blackbird
top_10.address: 2124 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came in at 7pm on Saturday night - lively crowd. Great atmosphere and good service.  Even have a pool table in back. Eclectic design combined with cocktail lounge atmosphere. Drink menu are seasonal with interesting ingredients. The drinks are solid and flavorful.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of my favorite spots! Great happy hour and all the drinks are delicious. Friendly bartenders, quick service, good ambiance (lighting that’s moody but doesn’t make you feel like you need an eye exam), and plenty of seating. What’s not to love?

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everything is great, including the old newspaper wall. The cocktails are weak with barely any liquor in it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This Bar is really nice .
Cocktails are good .
I ‘ m not drinking alcohol at moment and the bartender made me his favorite drink ,
a mohito without alcohol .
The bartender who helped me ,
I can tell that he love what he does.
Looking at him making drinks it could be almost hypnotic.
The perfect timing , the way he poor and pick  items , herbs and etc
He know  what he does .
They host meet ups a few times a month
Wich is fun.
Lots of Gay people and the location is good.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Bartender Megan is a KILLER behind the bar. John Taffer himself would say this bar runs on Megan.

She made the best drinks and she was working the whole night without a break compared to her other coworkers. She knows a good cocktail and made sure to straw test every drink we ordered.

Every bar needs more Megan!

testimonials: Came in at 7pm on Saturday night - lively crowd. Great atmosphere and good service.  Even have a pool table in back. Eclectic design combined with cocktail lounge atmosphere. Drink menu are seasonal with interesting ingredients. The drinks are solid and flavorful.

Everything is great, including the old newspaper wall. The cocktails are weak with barely any liquor in it.

top_10.name: Bourbon & Branch
top_10.address: 501 Jones St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My husband and I have been coming here since we were dating and it is always the most perfect way to the end the night. Service is always fantastic. They have an extensive drink menu, and the staff know it well, offer recommendations and guide you through it. The cocktails are excellent, with classics on the menu, as well as very unique combinations. You can tell there is quite a bit of craftsmanship in each drink. The cocktails are also priced well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you're looking for a fun, immersive experience that transports you straight back to the 1920s Prohibition era, this speakeasy-style bar is a must-visit. From the moment you arrive, it feels like you are stepping into a secret world. There's no sign - just a mysterious door and a doorbell. Ring it, give the password, and you're in.

Reservations are required, and the exclusivity adds to the charm. Once inside, you're seated at a cozy table and handed an impressively large cocktail and spirits menu. My friend and I went on a Saturday night around 9:30pm and were surprised by how relaxed and uncrowded it was.

The seasonal drink menu is incredibly creative, ad the staff were fantastic - patient, knowledgeable, and happy to walk us through the options. The service was top-notch, and the ambiance was spot-on for the era. Dim lighting, vintage decor, and a vibe that makes you want to stay awhile.

I tried a few cocktails, but the standout for me was the Heavy Artillery - bold, balanced, and unforgettable. There are a few house rules that help preserve the experience: 1. Be discreet with cell phone usage 2. No flash photography and 3. Remain seated and enjoy the era.

Overall, we had a fantastic time and would absolutely go back. It's not just a bar - it's an experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the more well-known speakeasies in SF. you’ll need a password to get in (just make a reservation to get it). Cool concept, but honestly, I was expecting more.

The drinks were average, the decor didn’t stand out, and the service was just okay. It feels like the hype is mostly around the “secret” entrance, not the actual experience.

It’s a quiet spot, which makes it good for date nights, but there are definitely better bars in SF if you’re going for standout cocktails or atmosphere.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The entrance can be tricky — it’s not where the map shows. You’ll need to go around the corner near address 480, where a doorman will check your reservation password before letting you in.

Inside, the atmosphere is fantastic with an extensive cocktail menu and a true hidden-bar vibe. We really enjoyed the experience, and it feels like a perfect spot for a date night.

One thing to note: the area right outside has quite a few homeless people, as others have mentioned. Just be aware when arriving and leaving.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely amazing cocktails.

I didn't like my drink as much I'd have hoped for so the bartender himself came to our booth to ask me what I am looking for and made some custom drinks for us - twice! He was very kind and made absolutely amazing drinks. I am so glad I ended up finally making it to the speak easy.

Will definitely visit again.

Our server was an extremely helpful and kind lady who ended up guiding us to the library as well. :) good day.

top_10.name: Owl Tree
top_10.address: 601 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The bartender recommended the lychee martini & the cucumber mint gimlet. Both were absolutely delicious. Music was on point the whole time. I really liked this place! Walked here from the Hilton no problem.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The Owl Tree is such a hidden gem in San Francisco that I almost don’t want to share it! We hosted our wedding welcome party in their upstairs space, and it was perfect. Adrianna, the events manager, is wonderful—she’s incredibly responsive and so easy to work with. She and the entire team took such great care of us, and everything ran smoothly from start to finish.

The space itself is private (including a private bathroom), full of SF charm, and incredibly reasonably priced for what you get. Our guests had a great time, and we’re already thinking of excuses to host another event here in the future.

Pro tip: order the cucumber gimlet and the espresso martini—you won’t regret it.

Can’t recommend The Owl Tree enough!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I hosted an event here in the private upstairs venue. The upstairs is big enough for a mid sized group 30-50 people. Terrific coordination from Adrianna, and our bartender Dasha knocked it out of the park with the drinks. We had a fantastic time and would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: After spending my last 6 birthdays or so at this bar with my friends I decided to make a reservation and agree to their $200 minimum. My friends and I met the minimum but our drinks were very, very weak. I know this because one of my friends just turned 21 and she did not feel a thing after 4 martinis. We also visited this bar early October and had a few rounds before a concert and we had a GOOD time then so I was convinced we were shorted. We proceeded to close out and visit a few more bars and after 2 drinks we were ready to go back to our hotels. After booking this months in advance and after being treated this way, it’s safe to say I will never be back. I truly felt taken advantage of and my friends left very unhappy too.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great bar on the corner of Taylor and Post.  Cute little neighborhood bar.  Excellent cocktails (especially the Cucumber Mint Gimlet).  Bartender was on his game and friendly!  Can't wait to go back !

top_10.name: Cityscape
top_10.address: 333 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Best rooftop of SF, and don’t say this lightly, I have been here for 10 years.! It is really the only one with real 360 degree views. It’s spacious and really well set up. Decor section is a bit old but I’ll say that’s part of the charm.
Service is great. Max was hilarious and super helpful. Made us remember what good American service used to be.
Good drink selection (very reasonable prices for SF, specially if you go by the bottle!) and not crowded
Will be back and really enjoyed it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Attended a private event here sponsored by SF Pride and it was an amazing experience. The bar is on the top floor of the Hilton Union Square and you see amazing almost 360 views of the city and Bay! The drinks were great and the appetizers we had were delicious, especially the truffle chips and the beef empanadas. Service was friendly and professional.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: General vibe isn’t bad for a first time experience. They did play random hip hop music that didn’t seem very fitting for this kind of setting. Only got 2 things and for $60 in total, isn’t worth it. The drink didn’t hit at all, not even a buzz and I’m a lightweight. $35 for 3 slices of cheese and meat and stiff bread is crazy work. Mind you, in my photo we had barely started picking at it. I’m looking back at another person’s photo of the charcuterie board in previous reviews, and it definitely did not look the same as what I received. No one was attentive the entire time we were at our table. We had to ask some random worker, not even sure if he was a server, to give us our bill which he also had the audacity to ask for us to leave a tip. But why tip when the bare minimum and expectations weren’t met and literally no one worked for it. There was minimal interaction with any employees so I’m not sure what’s there to tip for. I would only recommend to stop by just for the view cause that’s the only selling point. Other than that, don’t bother wasting your money on food or drinks.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Extremely beautiful views with delicious drink and (limited) food options. The service is great! Bartender Tommy was wonderful. He knows the area well, and is extremely helpful with travel tips. The atmosphere has a relaxed vibe. Highly recommend visiting right before sunset.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a beautiful rooftop bar with beautiful views of San Francisco. I ordered a drink and it was really good. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere felt calm and comfortable. The chips were a bit overpriced but the dip was good.

testimonials:
Best rooftop of SF, and don’t say this lightly, I have been here for 10 years.! It is really the only one with real 360 degree views. It’s spacious and really well set up. Decor section is a bit old but I’ll say that’s part of the charm.
Service is great. Max was hilarious and super helpful. Made us remember what good American service used to be.
Good drink selection (very reasonable prices for SF, specially if you go by the bottle!) and not crowded
Will be back and really enjoyed it.

top_10.name: Last Rites
top_10.address: 718 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My husband and I had a great time at last rites! The interior is so cool - the theme is you’ve crash landed on an island, the bar seats are plane seats, and you can see the plane windows behind the bar. They also have some fun effects every now and then. We sat at the bar and had a few drinks, our favorite was actually a dealer’s choice. Shout out to Gabe and Tasha at the bar, they were awesome and made our night!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The vibe of this place is so fun! I feel like I’m in line for an amusement park ride haha

We ordered death & ruin and the long goodbye. The death & ruin was my favorite (it was definitely stronger), the long goodbye was a heavy milk base

Cocktails here are all about $16. They do a really cool fire show for a special drink set that’s fun!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you’re happy to pay $14 plus charges for an extremely small non-alcoholic drink which was mostly ice, then this will suit you. I felt ripped off. Normal cocktails on the happy hour menu were $12 but no AF options on happy hour. Felt conned and it tarnished the experience.

Further more at the end, they tried to charge us a non happy hour rate on all the other cocktails “because we didn’t specify” which ones we wanted. The drinks we ordered weren’t on the main menu so not sure why there was confusion.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’ve never felt so disrespected in a bar before. The manager at Last Rites was rude, short, and completely uninviting. Their attitude made me feel unwelcome and uncomfortable, almost like I was not wanted there at all. It went beyond bad customer service and felt personal.

The main bartender was the only good part of the visit. They were polite and professional, clearly trying to make the best of a bad situation. Unfortunately, the manager’s behavior ruined everything. The place was dead too, which says a lot about the kind of environment they have created.

No customer should ever be treated that way. It was an unpleasant experience that bordered on discrimination. I will never go back and would strongly suggest others stay away.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I cannot recommend this place enough. Second time here and it never disappoints. The drinks and place making are top notch, transformative, and set such a high bar for every other tiki bars in the world.

top_10.name: The House Of Shields
top_10.address: 39 New Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Their Chandelier, the drink, not the light fixture, is amazing. I saw a liqueur i was unfamiliar with, Cynar, and the bartender told me all about it. Sebastian introduced me to two incredible cocktails made with it. It's rare to find a bartender that is so willing to share their love of their craft with an ignorant beer guy like me without being snobby. I can't wait to go here next time I'm in SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the oldest bars in SF, very interesting drinks and good vibes.
Much smaller than I expected.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great place to grab a drink after work or after a visit to SFMOMA.
Classic San Francisco vibe that takes you back to post 1906 earthquake San Francisco when the city was rebuilding.
You wouldn’t be surprised to see Sam Spade and a bunch of guys in fedoras nursing their drinks here.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ver cool old-school bar. It was very quiet at 3pm on a Thursday. I had a Manhattan, which was delicious. Recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This bar lives up to its reputation. The cocktails are modern twists on classics. My biggest beef nowadays with so many cocktail lounges is a poorly balanced cocktails. This staple of SF maintains a reputation for quality and craftsmanship. The cocktails were well balanced and flavorful. Great walk back in time with this gem.

Sebastian introduced me to two incredible cocktails made with it. It's rare to find a bartender that is so willing to share their love of their craft with an ignorant beer guy like me without being snobby. I can't wait to go here next time I'm in SF.

top_10.name: Trick Dog
top_10.address: 3010 20th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Trick Dog is such a fun and creative spot! It’s a themed bar that switches things up every six months — last time I went, it was a poetry theme, and yesterday they had a space  theme. The menu is always super inventive, with cocktail names that match the theme perfectly. Drinks are delicious, the vibe is lively, and the music adds to the energy without being too loud. Definitely one of those places that keeps things fresh and makes you want to come back just to see what they’ll dream up next.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Between my cousin and I, we tried 8 cocktails 🫣and all were SOOOOO good. The bartender KB was also fantastic. We also got the fries which were divine! The only thing is that after 4 cocktails you’d think I’d be hammered and I was barely buzzed.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: There’s something magical about this bar and I just kept going back to it in the 2 months I stayed in SF. Def my fav bar in the area. They have such creative menu of cocktails and update the menu every 6 months. Super busy on Friday and weekend nights but bartenders make sure you’re taken care of. Just need a little time for them to get to you. Fun vibe and just so good drinks. Outdoor seating is pretty nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 3.5/4 A dark ambiance bar known for creative, themed, and seasonal menus. The cocktails were fun and playful but taste wise, they were just ok. The decor leans casual and relaxed - good for both friend groups and dates. Honestly I don't remember too much bc I was busy canoodling so safe to say it was dark enough, vibey enough and I had great company:'). A fun place, not too packed on Sat past midnight, would recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
March was seriously packed, and my editing speed turned into turtle mode 🐢🥲
I finally checked out Trick Dog, a spot that’s been sitting on my Google Maps forever!

We arrived pretty late, but it was still packed!
The space has two levels — upstairs looked more like a dining area and closed early. The downstairs bar is much smaller and super packed (a little loud too), so finding a seat wasn’t easy haha.

The menu was SO cute!
We blindly chose High Flyers and (I think) Sword Swallower. Both were really unique and surprisingly smooth! Sword Swallower was refreshing, while High Flyers was sweet but not heavy at all!

We also ordered fries and chicken nuggets — the sauces were amazing and everything was freshly fried, super crispy and juicy!
Highly recommend grabbing a snack with your drink.

This is one of those places where I’d totally come back regularly to try their new menu themes. Loved it — totally recommend!
