top_10.name: The View Lounge
top_10.address: 780 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here to grab a drink and some apps before going out, the view is nice. Beautiful windows. We sat and waited for a few minutes before our server approached us.. she took our drink order (never told us her name) and disappeared. I was watching the bartender from our seat and about 20 minutes later when he was making our drinks I saw him not use the correct tequila. Finally the server dropped off our drinks and ran.. didn’t hear me when I asked her about the drinks I guess because she took off. Which was also extremely annoying seeing as how we had been waiting for over 20 minutes now not only for our drinks but to place our order for food. I ended up bringing the cocktails to the bar and the bartender was extremely nice and admitted that was his mistake and he remade the drinks. Which I also had to go get from the bar myself. The server eventually came by to take our food order and left- she made it very known that she was too busy. Once the apps arrived she never touched the table to make sure our food came out correctly. Overall, the food was okay but the service was terrible. The view was nice but not worth the experience or the price.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What a view! There not much I can say about it except come early because the good tables by the window get taken quickly. We got there 18 min after they opened and we got the last table next to the window.

We just had drinks and no food, just enjoyed the sunset over the concrete jungle. The pictures and videos don’t do it justice, especially on the clear San Francisco day we had.

First time we came here the service was okay but the most recent time, it was top tier. I will always make it a point to come here whenever I’m on the area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Atmosphere is so private and intimate there are limited seating for the window view but it's so worth it I highly recommend for sunset to go early and just advise to go from the elevator and sit on the left. It is so beautiful

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Definitely a great spot! It’s certainly not guaranteed that you’ll have a spot, but our group of 4 managed to get seats. Our server, Don was a great host and made us feel comfortable and not rushed at all. You’re much more likely to find seats as a smaller group, but it’s worth checking it out.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Excellent place to be at if you are in Mariott Marquis in SFO. The atmosphere was really good, crowded most of the days , it opens till midnight so a good place to hangout
The food quality was good. I ordered mushroom dish and it was fantastic. The presentatiin and taste was awes8me.
The quantity/size of the dishes are not fulsome so you would need to order at least 2 items if you are hungry . Each irem costs 20-30 dollars so on an average a bill if 50-60$ per person if one dish and one drink

top_10.name: Prime BBQ
top_10.address: 33 W 25th Ave, San Mateo, CA 94403, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Had such a great time at Prime BBQ in San Mateo! We ordered the veggie fried rice, cucumber salad, mentaiko stir-fried udon with shrimp, vermicelli scallop with garlic, grilled oyster with garlic, and a bunch of skewers - shishito pepper, wagyu steak with uni, beef tongue, and chicken meatball. We also tried the Thai tea (with the cutest bear on top ) and a bottle of Kubota “Senjyu.”

Everything was tasty, but my absolute favorite was the mentaiko udon, the beef tongue skewers, and the chicken meatball.
Also, don’t miss their $2 lunch specials (Fri–Sun) for oysters, abalone, and scallops.  Super cute space with Labubu decor and a big sake selection.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Vibe and atmosphere  of this place is great. Food is very good. I will definitely recommend this place to everyone. Such a great yakitori restaurant in San Mateo. This is just an another restaurant added in my favorite list.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
They offer free ice cream if you leave a 5-star review on Google. But the food was actually terrible! We ordered the skewers, and most of them were burned, with visible black char marks. They also provided free kimchi, but it wasn’t fresh — it was dried out.

The grilled beef tripe was not only burnt, but also sliced so thin that it was almost impossible to chew! On top of that, the prices were extremely high. Maybe this is just the Bay Area culture!

A very disappointing experience traveling in SF

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The gyudon (beef with rice) has the same flavor & portion as the yoshinoya froze pack ($4) and it was sale as $17!? Then I doubt how the other dishes were made. The lamb skewer was awful, doesn’t tastes like lamb. The chick skin tastes good but it was clearly made by frying instead of grilled as its dish name suggested.

The chive was surprisingly good with reasonable $2 price.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place has potential to be a great spot, but it has a strong, unpleasant odor reminiscent of a bathroom. The food was delicious, but it arrived cold on the second round. The service was decent, but it was slow. Considering the high prices and numerous service flaws, I’m not sure if I’d return.

top_10.name: Capelo's Barbecue
top_10.address: 2655 Middlefield Rd, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Fantastic service, food and venue! Five stars all the way!
Brisket was phenomenal with perfect rendering, perfect fat layer and bark. Cheddar&Jalapeño sausage and chicken (dark meat) was also 5/5 - easy!
No doubt I will be coming back and anyone who love Texas BBQ needs to pay them a visit!🤠

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is serious about barbecue. You can see just from the wood pile to smoke the meat. The food is fantastic! We got various meats and everything is smoky and tender. I am particularly amazed with pulled pork. The meat is chunky rather than stringy, yet it is super tender and, to my preference, not sweet. The mac and cheese is thick, so as sauces. The slaw is refreshing as well. Oh pickles and macerated onions are free to grab!  Capelo is now become a place when I think of barbecue in Peninsula if not the whole bay area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wow! What a great place!? Super nice servers, especially the lady at the counter (so warm and wonderful), great beef brisket, delicious baked beans and scary good kale slaw (we were so hungry that we forgot to take photos..)
And the place is CLEAN. Every table was pristine and a staff member was regularly working on keeping it that way.
Highly recommend!
The atmosphere is also really nice, relaxed and cute with lots of potted plants that someone cares for very well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food was amazing,  they have 4 sauces available along with free jalapeños, pickles &pickled red onions. Got the Brisket, Ribs & jalapeño / cheese sausage. It's a little pricey but well worth the treat. This was $40

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ordered some hot links and brisket with a side of coleslaw. The brisket was really dry and didn’t have any flavor. The hot links were okay as well as the coleslaw.

top_10.name: Baby Blues BBQ
top_10.address: 3149 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I'm not typically going for a BBQ joint but I think the warm weather or the moon position sort gave me the feeling of trying Baby Blues.  Honestly I'm happy I went and it for sure didn't give me the blues.  Yes the place is rustic some might call it funky but it works.  I like the big L shaped bar in the middle on which you can sit from both sides. That somehow gives you the opportunity to strike up conversations with random other guests or just enjoy the moment by yourself.
I tried their Cesar salad Mac and Cheese and pulled pork shoulder sandwich.  I like that the pork wasn't smothered in sauce .  Sauces came on the side so to each its own.  You can bathe in them, simply dip or forgo them.

The presentation is rather smartly done.  The Caesar , oh well it's a Caesar not much to say about it.  The mac and cheese was rather tasty but could have stayed in the oven a bit longer to make it a bit less saucy.  The pulled pork was tasty. I didn't care for the brioche as it loses its texture too quickly.   I'd love to try it on a French baguette or a sourdough roll with a crust and id add gruyere.  Again the sandwich was good it just gave me ideas on how I'd try to enhance it.

Well done thanks chef

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Solid lunch option for this region of SF ~ Good, not great BBQ in SF. Very clean and inviting bbq joint with TV's.  One of the few places around open at noon for lunch. The fries are thick cut and overflowing. The Brisket sandwich itself is solid but not impressive, good quality BBQ sauces. Staff is friendly; A great place with a good value. $21 for the Brisket Sando and fries. They also serve a diverse selection of Craft beer. Friendly staff, great beer selection all in cans and therefore overpriced. $9 pint cans of craft SF beers. The brisket combo plate was good, the sauces carried the meal.. for SF solid BBQ, relatively appropriately priced. Not s place that will impress you by any means. But a Solid option

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Being from Austin, TX, I know good BBQ—and I’ll admit, I was skeptical about trying it away from home. But the craving hit hard, so I ordered ¼ lb pulled pork, ½ lb brisket, the Texas beef rib, and their mac & cheese. Everything was delicious!

The brisket stole the show: smoky, flavorful, and so tender I regretted not ordering a full pound. The Texas beef rib was a fun adventure—huge, meaty, and nicely smoked. I don’t usually eat beef ribs back home, but the Texan in me had to try it. Leftovers even made the perfect breakfast with eggs.

Pulled pork was flavorful and juicy—I skipped the sandwich so I could taste the meat on its own. (Pro tip: it’s just as good the next day in a quick sandwich.) And the mac & cheese? Creamy, cheesy perfection; true to the South. It could have been my #1, but I didn’t want to overshadow the BBQ. Leftovers from this meal fed me two more times—I basically walked out feeling like I got away with a steal.

A special shoutout to Jackie, the manager that night. She had the kind of warmth and hospitality that makes you feel like you’ve known her forever. She even indulged my Texan request for pickles with my BBQ (no judgment here!) and walked me through their sauces—each one worth trying, especially if you mix them for fun flavor combos.

Bottom line: I’ll be back. Next time I’ll try more of their menu (and fingers crossed for peach cobbler!). If you’re anywhere nearby, it’s worth the trip. They blend Southern BBQ beautifully—and yes, this Texas girl gives it a thumbs up.

Also, the atmosphere/ambiance of the restaurant is through and through a Southern vibe! IYKYK

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What a surprise , stumble upon this quirky restaurant. So happy we did the food was amazing and service was fantastic. Very interesting layout and design. The root beer was the best I’ve had .
Have to order pig candy bacon .
If you in San Francisco you have give this place a go.
Thank you chef and waitress 🙏🏻.
If this review has been a help let me know ❤️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So I finally decided to try this place. I tried out the sausage plate with a chile verde cheddar pork sausage that comes with rice & beans and cornbread. The flavor of the sausage was delicious but some of my beans were undercooked and hard. I thought the cornbread was horrible and lacked that cornbread texture and flavor. For a $27.16 price tag with a drink I was highly disappointed with only two small sausages. That was definitely not $30 worth of food or service when the guy played dominoes the whole time I was there with a customer. I highly doubt I will try anything else from here again!

The presentation is rather smartly done.  The Caesar , oh well it's a Caesar not much to say about it.  The mac and cheese was rather tasty but could have stayed in the oven a bit longer to make it a bit less saucy.  The pulled pork was tasty. I didn't care for the brioche as it loses its texture too quickly.   I'd love to try it on a French baguette or a sourdough roll with a crust and id add gruyere.  Again the sandwich was good it just gave me ideas on how I'd try to enhance it.

Well done thanks chef

Solid lunch option for this region of SF ~ Good, not great BBQ in SF. Very clean and inviting bbq joint with TV's.  One of the few places around open at noon for lunch. The fries are thick cut and overflowing. The Brisket sandwich itself is solid but not impressive, good quality BBQ sauces. Staff is friendly; A great place with a good value. $21 for the Brisket Sando and fries. They also serve a diverse selection of Craft beer. Friendly staff, great beer selection all in cans and therefore overpriced. $9 pint cans of craft SF beers. The brisket combo plate was good, the sauces carried the meal.. for SF solid BBQ, relatively appropriately priced. Not s place that will impress you by any means. But a Solid option

Being from Austin, TX, I know good BBQ—and I’ll admit, I was skeptical about trying it away from home. But the craving hit hard, so I ordered ¼ lb pulled pork, ½ lb brisket, the Texas beef rib, and their mac & cheese. Everything was delicious!

The brisket stole the show: smoky, flavorful, and so tender I regretted not ordering a full pound. The Texas beef rib was a fun adventure—huge, meaty, and nicely smoked. I don’t usually eat beef ribs back home, but the Texan in me had to try it. Leftovers even made the perfect breakfast with eggs.

Pulled pork was flavorful and juicy—I skipped the sandwich so I could taste the meat on its own. (Pro tip: it’s just as good the next day in a quick sandwich.) And the mac & cheese? Creamy, cheesy perfection; true to the South. It could have been my #1, but I didn’t want to overshadow the BBQ. Leftovers from this meal fed me two more times—I basically walked out feeling like I got away with a steal.

A special shoutout to Jackie, the manager that night. She had the kind of warmth and hospitality that makes you feel like you’ve known her forever. She even indulged my Texan request for pickles with my BBQ (no judgment here!) and walked me through their sauces—each one worth trying, especially if you mix them for fun flavor combos.

Bottom line: I’ll be back. Next time I’ll try more of their menu (and fingers crossed for peach cobbler!). If you’re anywhere nearby, it’s worth the trip. They blend Southern BBQ beautifully—and yes, this Texas girl gives it a thumbs up.

Also, the atmosphere/ambiance of the restaurant is through and through a Southern vibe! IYKYK

top_10.name: Slow Hand BBQ
top_10.address: 1941 Oak Park Blvd Suite #5, Pleasant Hill, CA 94523, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic brisket and pork ribs! I’ve been trying out local BBQ spots around Concord and Walnut Creek, but Slow Hand BBQ in Pleasant Hill really blows the competition away. The meat is smoky, tender, and full of flavor. The brisket melts in your mouth, and the ribs have the perfect balance of seasoning and juiciness. The casual vibe and friendly service make it even better. A must-try spot if you’re craving real BBQ in the Bay Area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
🔥 5 Stars!
Absolutely loved this spot! The brisket was melt-in-your-mouth tender, the ribs had a perfect smoky bark, and the tri tip was on point. You can tell they put real care into every plate. Super friendly staff, fast service, and chill atmosphere. This is exactly the kind of local gem you want to keep coming back to. Can’t wait for the next round!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I usually get the brisket sandwich which is fantastic. This time we tried the burger and the brisket Philly. Both are incredibly delicious! Also, SO happy the sweet potato tots are back. Mac&cheese is yum too!
Great people, chill atmosphere, tasty beer selection. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best place in the area for BBQ hands down. We had the brisket and the ribs and both were very tender and juicy. Meat fell off the bone so easily for the ribs! The Mac and cheese was nice and creamy. Fries were crispy. Must try!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I hadn't visited Slow Hand BBQ in over four years, but I'm pleased to report that the food remains exceptional. I travel from Richmond specifically to indulge in top-quality barbecue. My preferred meal consists of St. Louis Spare Ribs, picnic potato salad, BBQ baked beans, and rolls.

Super friendly staff, fast service, and chill atmosphere. This is exactly the kind of local gem you want to keep coming back to. Can’t wait for the next round!

I usually get the brisket sandwich which is fantastic. This time we tried the burger and the brisket Philly. Both are incredibly delicious! Also, SO happy the sweet potato tots are back. Mac&cheese is yum too!
Great people, chill atmosphere, tasty beer selection. Highly recommend.

top_10.name: Smokin D’s BBQ SF
top_10.address: 2181 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I just moved to Hollister California about 10 months ago from San Antonio Texas. I had been missing all the great food from back home especially some brisket, it seems California only serves tri-tip. I heard about this place and decided to make a trip to SF. When we pulled up I saw the sign "Texas Style" and was hoping to get exactly that. When we walked up to the restaurant it definitely smelled like home, something about that Texas Style BBQ that just hits you different. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and asked if we had any questions. We looked at the menu for a few moments and decided to order brisket, ribs, Mac n cheese, cornbread, hot link, and potato salad. They were sold out of hot links and potato salad, that was the third sign we were in the right place for some delicious food. We got our food and it was definitely more generous than what we ordered, no complaints there! We started to dive into the brisket and ribs and as soon as that brisket hit my taste buds I felt like I was home! The brisket was cooked perfectly and seasoned well, bark was on point too! The ribs were also amazing no sauce needed for either the brisket or ribs, they do give you some but its not needed even though the sauce was delicious too it only got used one time then it was just back to the meat by itself. The cornbread definitely was Texas style too with the small pieces of jalapeno in it, very good and not dry like most cornbread. The Mac n cheese was good too! The owners run the place and do most the work themselves so you know there is a lot of care put into what comes out of that kitchen! I didn't realize how homesick I was until we got there and well after I felt rejuvenated and like there was some piece of home here in California. Turns out the owner is from Houston Texas and thats why its so good. They said they started out just as pop up selling here and there but then people got a hold of their food and well now they habe this great location locked down a few minutes drive from Peir 39. What a wonderful place to eat and enjoy a great family owned restaurant! We will definitely be back here soon, the 1 1/2+ drive from Hollister is definitely worth this experience, yes the food is definitely an experience that you need in your life. Good food makes me happy and this did more than that being so far from home! Oh sorry I was day dreaming about that brisket and ribs.....don't forget to order your banana brulee bliss we almost did but we did get one and it was amazing too! Definitely a must have, my girlfriend doesn't even like bananas and she loved this dessert!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really damn good I must say.  The brisket was perfectly cooked.  The St Louis Ribs were well seasoned, tender, and went wonderfully with the bread and butter pickled onions and cucumbers they provide.  The hot link sausages are also delicious and a nice touch for the Texans out there.  The staff was super cool and nice and he gave us extra cookies and brownies for free just out of their own kindness.  I strongly recommend getting BBQ from this place.  I know I’ll be back to try the beef ribs!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This food is AMAZING!!!! I am a huge bbq girl, and there is NOTHING in the city that even comes remotely close to how great this food is. The beef ribs were OUTSTANDING with the perfect, flavorful char and tenderness. It just fell off the bone. The brisket had the perfect ring, great flavor that really packs a punch, and simply tasty. We also waited an extra 45 min for the brisket bao. That was absolutely worth the treat

The max and cheese was FRESH. It was right out of the oven and didn’t disappoint in the slightest.

We also got the banana pudding because, well, you have to! What a great treat

The owners definitely add to the experience. Both were so sweet and you can genuinely tell they take pride in what they serve.

Overall, there’s nothing in the city like this. If you want to catch it before it sells out, BE EARLY

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So I saw this place on TikTok and the food looked so good so I just had to give a try. So I came by with my mom and we were super excited, especially considering we came on the weekend where the Dino rib was available. My mom spent about $200 worth of stuff! We ended up ordering six bao buns half-and-half(9/10) the Dino rib(2/10) the smoked brisket (3/10), smoked brisket grilled cheese sandwich,(7/10) and the regular brisket sandwich(6/10) and the mac & cheese(4/10)To be honest, the food was a major disappointment. The Dino rib was the way smaller than the one they showed on TikTok and it had absolutely zero flavor. It tasted like I was eating air. The beef brisket was two pieces for $20 outrageous pricing and it also had no flavor. I feel like this restaurant relies on barbecue sauce for flavor and not salt/ seasonings. The mac & cheese had zero seasoning and was so bland and the macaroni noodles were like five minutes overcooked super mushy. The regular brisket sandwich was dry according to my mom however, the brisket grilled cheese was pretty good however I feel like they were over relying on barbecue sauce once again, but I will give that sandwich a seven out of 10. The best thing we had was the spicy bao bun and we would give that a nine out of 10. overall, I think this place is overhyped and I probably will not come back. also, the lady at the register was very passive aggressive and it just made the whole experience worse. She was so extra about 50 cents for barbecue sauce . We were also like the only people really there and our food took what felt like forever. And they kept saying that the wait it would be worth it, but it wasn’t.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place was a little hard for me to find.   It didn't really smell like BBQ was being made here.   I was just happy to get parking pretty close to the place and it wasn't too crazy busy yet.   The place wasn't too big but had enough space to order and look at the menus to find a huge variety of eats.
This was my first time here and I didn't want to go too crazy with my order.   I'm sure I'll be back soon enough to try more items.   Michelle was super nice and helped me choose.

I ordered:
1.  O.G. Brisky Bao - I saw so many videos of how big and meaty this was.  Many said it was worth the price.  This was definitely meaty and juicy.   I was full after eating 1/2.

2.  Korean Cowboy - Michelle said this wasn't too spicy and had a little kick.   I'm sorry that was a lie for me at least,  I'm not really one to handle the heat.  It was meaty but you definitely get the kick from the kimchi with the first bite.

3.  Brisket sandwich  - This was a good first sandwich to start with.   The chunks of brisket were so tender and abundant.

4. Mrs. D's Cornbread - Tasty and had a little kick from the jalapeños.  It was a little dry for my liking.

5.  Banana brulee bliss - This surprising for me was the star of the show.  The banana pudding was on point for me and the creme brulee topping that stuck to the lid just put it on a whole other level.

6. Daybreak Vietnamese coffee- Surprisingly good.   I saved it for the next morning since it didn't really go with the food.

This place was solid and I can't wait to come back.  I do have the mac n cheese and the dino rib to come back for..among a few other itwms.

top_10.name: NORTHERN CHINA BBQ
top_10.address: 294 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Decent Northern China style dishes — extensive selection of various barbecue skewers (meat, seafood, mushroom, veg) reminiscent of Mainland Chinese street food.

Lamb Skewer is slightly gamey, dusted with the classic cumin-paprika seasoning. Enjoy with cold side dishes such as the standard Smashed Cucumber. Sliced Beef in Chili Sauce is fragrant from Sichuan peppercorn and chilis.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Decent skewers. Good amount of seating. Service is quick. Wished they had the tray to keep the skewers warm.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 5/5 SO SO YUMMYYY!!! This hit the spot 😍😩 We actually came here after another meal that we weren’t satisfied with. The best were 1. Chicken skewers and 2. Taiwanese sausage skewers. The seaweed salad was also excellent. Next time we’ll come for a proper meal and get some much more!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I don’t normally post reviews unless I think the place is underrecognized or is overhyped. This place is the former. Skewers are all absolutely delicious, my favorite is the original pork sausage skewer, so juicy and fatty just like the sausages in Taiwan. The beef skewer was also so beefy, amazing. The chicken gristle is also my favorite, pair that with rice and that can be a meal in it of itself

I can’t wait to come back and try even more skewers.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great Chinese style charcoal barbecue, tasting exactly like I had before back in China.
Meat, seafood and tofu / veggie choices are all pretty good. We were particularly impressed by the lamb skewer and the tofu.
Fully supportive of a trendy new restaurant in the city! Thank you for doing this~ much needed

top_10.name: Zajang Grill
top_10.address: 852 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Zajang Grill on Clement is honestly one of my new favorite spots. Their food is so good — every single item on the menu hits. The sauces are on another level, especially their ranch sauce and the corn cheese… unreal. You can tell they put a lot of care into their flavors because everything tastes fresh and well-seasoned.

The employees here are super attentive and friendly too. They check in just the right amount and make sure you have everything you need without you even asking. Overall, amazing food, amazing service — definitely a place I’ll keep coming back to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hard to find a KBBQ place that allows single dining but glad I stumbled on Zajang Grill. It was perfect for me to eat as a single diner as there was a 2 person table with grill available. I went on a weekday at 5:30pm and was seated immediately. Service was quick and staff was very helpful. Food was great too and it was very convenient to use a QR code to order food and drinks.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: $240 for unlimited for 4 people including tax + tip 😋 we were seated right away at 5pm on a Saturday and it was sooo good. I loved that you could just keep ordering off your phone from the QR code and they'd bring it to you fast!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is one of the best BBQ restaurants I’ve ever been to! I absolutely loved it. The meat was fragrant, tender, and perfectly cooked. The staff were friendly, service was fast, and we didn’t have to wait long at all — our food came out shortly after we ordered

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you're craving Korean BBQ in San Francisco, Zajang is a must-try.  From the moment you walk in, the aroma of grilling meats sets the stage for a delicious meal.  The selection of meats was impressive, and the quality was top-notch.  The banchan were also a highlight – a wide variety of flavorful sides that perfectly complemented the BBQ.  The service was attentive, and the atmosphere was lively and fun.  Highly recommended for a great KBBQ experience.

top_10.name: 4505 Burgers & BBQ
top_10.address: 705 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We ordered the beef brisket plate with spicy fries and beans. The beans were the surprise standout—rich and delicious. The fries had a nice kick, but the brisket itself was just okay—chewy and a bit tough, not something I’d rush back for.
The outdoor seating with wooden benches is dog-friendly, though it can get noisy with kids running around and dogs barking. I did appreciate the convenience of having a QR code with the table number to order anything extra once seated. On the bright side, the service was friendly and attentive.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So I’ve been here before and always loved the brisket, but today was the first time I tried the lunch taco happy hour, and WOW it blew my mind. The brisket tacos are so flavorful, the salsa so fresh, and the corn tortillas delicious. This place is a little pricey, and the tacos are definitely small for the cost, but they make up for it in flavor and quality!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visited with a friend on a weekday. They definitely delivered on the meat with volume.

But surprised that most of the meat options were not plates/meals by default. You have to order sides separately. This gets expensive, fast. Felt like I was being nickel-and-dimed.

Pricing is high. Full rack of ribs was like $55.
Half brisket, $20, no sides included.

Staff were attentive, friendly.

Most of the meat lacks a lot of flavor, so you’re expected to add sauces while eating as necessary. But I feel this should be a better experience.

There are no wet towels at the table, so after you eat your ribs, your fingers are all sticky. Nothing but regular napkins to wipe off with. Would have appreciated some wet towels.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tony told me to come...
The brisket plate was delicious. Lovely sides of slaw and hot fries. The vanilla milkshake was delicious.
The outdoor seating was less comfortable in late November, but you just need to bring a big coat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Our taxi/uber driver lives in this neighborhood and grew up here. They recommended this place and it did not disappoint.
Excellent customer service: the person who we ordered from was friendly and gave great recommendations.
Food was on point: we ordered brisket, ribs, potato salad, and baked beans. Delicious. Just the right about of heat and lots of flavor.
Very chill vibe: dog friendly, easy going, casual. Outdoor seating.

top_10.name: Hardwood Bar & Smokery
top_10.address: 680 8th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Perfect casual spot for ribs. Everything we had was great: beer, ribs, brisket “chilli” cheese fries. It didn’t really taste like chilli perse but still phenomenal. The bbq sauce is the perfect balance of sweet and tangy! Must try!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
That burger was fire . BBQ was good too.
They have a very solid spirits menu. Ive already told a couple of people about this place

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came on a very busy day with it being Folsom street fair weekend, but the staff was rushing around to make sure everyone was taken care of. Their food, and especially their blackened catfish - fantastic!!! Was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of BBQ here, especially being in SF. 100% will return

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ordered brisket and hot fried chicken sandwich. Sandwich was really good but its not BBQ so I got a 1/2 pound of brisket, it was dry no flavor I could taste the old stale bitterness that's inside the smoker pit. Service is great atmosphere is great but food came up short.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A Texas BBQ Enthusiast's Take
​My recent dinner at Hardwood Bar & Smokery, consisting of the Smoked Spare Ribs with sides of Mac Salad and Seasoned Curly Fries, was a perfectly adequate meal—but sadly, that's where the praise stops. For anyone accustomed to the genuine article, especially the gold standard of Texas barbecue,

testimonials: Perfect casual spot for ribs. Everything we had was great: beer, ribs, brisket “chilli” cheese fries. It didn’t really taste like chilli perse but still phenomenal. The bbq sauce is the perfect balance of sweet and tangy! Must try!

That burger was fire . BBQ was good too.
They have a very solid spirits menu. Ive already told a couple of people about this place

Came on a very busy day with it being Folsom street fair weekend, but the staff was rushing around to make sure everyone was taken care of. Their food, and especially their blackened catfish - fantastic!!! Was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of BBQ here, especially being in SF. 100% will return

top_10.name: Smoking Pig BBQ
top_10.address: 1144 N 4th St, San Jose, CA 95112, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The real deal is Smoking Pig BBQ that features flavors and huge smokers!

Let’s begin with the service which was quick, friendly conversation, and overall ok. It was a little interesting walking in you think you would order at the register then we were asked to sit first then someone came to serve us.

The atmosphere is rough, rugged, bbq style feel, and diner type of look as well. The restaurant wasn’t as clean as I would like it. You can see the bbq bottles are worn.

Now onto the Main Event: the Food! The burnt ends were full flavor and good sauce 8.5/10. The pulled pork could have been warmer but the flavors and seasoning were on point 8/10. Fries were solid as they should be 8.5/10. The bbq chicken was good but could be improved on flavors 6.5/10. The cornbread and butter spread was really good 9/10. Overall this place is worth a try, places that smoke they have long cool times were can hinder flavors an heat depending on when you come so I always suggest multiple meats. Cheers!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
wow, a great no-nonsense Texas BBQ place. slow smoked ribs where the meat falls off the bone, potato salad, cornbread, brisket, four kinds of sauce, and a roll of paper towel on your table. we also got a plate of Wolf Turds as an appetizer: crazy name for three jalapeño peppers, stuffed with sausage and cheese, wrapped in bacon, and roasted. very delicious.

we got the large combo ribs with brisket and extra sides. more than enough for two, plus leftovers.

Lots of booths, super friendly service, mellow blues music, very laid back in a casual place, with lots of parking.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Honest review by a BBQ lover.

I came here for lunch at 12pm and got the brisket, pulled pork and pork ribs. I get to BBQ places early in case they sell out of what I want.  There was no line, and only a handful of people on a Saturday.
Staff were awesome.  Very attentive, very nice, great people.

Did I eat it all... Yes.  Was it good, yes.

But I was looking for a Texas style BBQ experience, and this was not it.

The brisket was good, not great.  A little dryer than desired.  A little firmer than you would expect from professional.  The bark was not noticeable.  A common theme.

The pulled pork was much dryer than it should be and the smoke flavor was not present.  There was no bark.

The pork ribs had no bark as well, much firmer than desired.

I'm sure the meat would be much better as a sandwich.  That seems to be the #1 seller there.

The good stuff was the Mac and cheese which was great. The BBQ sauces were fantastic!  Each one has a different flavor. It's a good thing The sauces are so good because they are necessary to accompany the meat.  My expectation on great bbq would be not needing the sauce to be flavorful.
The corn bread was also well done.  No nonsense corn bread is my preference.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place offers it all of your a BBQ fan! The brisket, beans, corn bread and side Cesar salad was my choice today and Carla was my waitress. Very friendly and tentative. If you want Cheap BBQ, don't come here because good BBQ ain't Cheap and and Cheap BBQ ain't good.
$40 for the LG brisket plate with mixed fat/lean with the premium side. Worth it!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great BBQ spot. Very casual. Plenty of parking (dedicated lot, some street parking). Great place to have lunch and enjoy some ribs, brisket and soda. Meat combo platters are reasonable and they include cornbread and a side. The sides are delicious. I had the potato salad today.

testimonials:
The real deal is Smoking Pig BBQ that features flavors and huge smokers!

Let’s begin with the service which was quick, friendly conversation, and overall ok. It was a little interesting walking in you think you would order at the register then we were asked to sit first then someone came to serve us.

The atmosphere is rough, rugged, bbq style feel, and diner type of look as well. The restaurant wasn’t as clean as I would like it. You can see the bbq bottles are worn.

Now onto the Main Event: the Food! The burnt ends were full flavor and good sauce 8.5/10. The pulled pork could have been warmer but the flavors and seasoning were on point 8/10. Fries were solid as they should be 8.5/10. The bbq chicken was good but could be improved on flavors 6.5/10. The cornbread and butter spread was really good 9/10. Overall this place is worth a try, places that smoke they have long cool times were can hinder flavors an heat depending on when you come so I always suggest multiple meats. Cheers!!!

wow, a great no-nonsense Texas BBQ place. slow smoked ribs where the meat falls off the bone, potato salad, cornbread, brisket, four kinds of sauce, and a roll of paper towel on your table. we also got a plate of Wolf Turds as an appetizer: crazy name for three jalapeño peppers, stuffed with sausage and cheese, wrapped in bacon, and roasted. very delicious.

we got the large combo ribs with brisket and extra sides. more than enough for two, plus leftovers.

Lots of booths, super friendly service, mellow blues music, very laid back in a casual place, with lots of parking.

Honest review by a BBQ lover.

I came here for lunch at 12pm and got the brisket, pulled pork and pork ribs. I get to BBQ places early in case they sell out of what I want.  There was no line, and only a handful of people on a Saturday.
Staff were awesome.  Very attentive, very nice, great people.

Did I eat it all... Yes.  Was it good, yes.

But I was looking for a Texas style BBQ experience, and this was not it.

The brisket was good, not great.  A little dryer than desired.  A little firmer than you would expect from professional.  The bark was not noticeable.  A common theme.

The pulled pork was much dryer than it should be and the smoke flavor was not present.  There was no bark.

The pork ribs had no bark as well, much firmer than desired.

I'm sure the meat would be much better as a sandwich.  That seems to be the #1 seller there.

The good stuff was the Mac and cheese which was great. The BBQ sauces were fantastic!  Each one has a different flavor. It's a good thing The sauces are so good because they are necessary to accompany the meat.  My expectation on great bbq would be not needing the sauce to be flavorful.
The corn bread was also well done.  No nonsense corn bread is my preference.

top_10.name: MENSHO
top_10.address: 4258 Piedmont Ave, Oakland, CA 94611, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First time here and I got to try their new Spicy Hotate Ramen! Honestly my favorite one :)! The broth was super flavorful but not too heavy. And the flavors get deeper as you mix all the ground beef and spice together. Would definitely get it again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Outstanding noodles. Outstanding broths. Outstanding uni/wagyu handrolls. Signature chicken ramen was rich and frothy. Reminded us of Hakata Ippai in Japan. It almost tasted like cream of mushroom (???) it was that umami! And the crab ramen, YUM! Tho I fished out most of the red onions. Will be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came in - after multiple recommendations - on a Monday at 6:30pm and got seated immediately. The space is modern and fun with ample seating (mostly shared tables for pairs/individuals).

We ordered the spicy garlic chicken karaage, signature smoked toripaitan ramen, and garlic knockout ramen. The broth is by far the most flavorful we've had, and we eat a lot of ramen! The noodles were also exceptional - chewy and bouncy - and the toppings are so good. The karaage was also perfectly crispy with light breading and so much flavor, although next time we might opt for the non-spicy.

Service was pretty fast and attentive from the start; took a bit longer for the bill, but we didn't mind sitting and digesting. For two people, the total came out to around 80$ including tip - not the cheapest, but worth it. Acoustics make it a bit hard to hear. Parking was not hard to find on side streets.

We're already planning our next visit back to try more of the menu!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
An outstanding high-end ramen experience. Every dish is thoughtfully executed, from the refined flavors to the attentive service and comfortable dining space.
🍜 The Signature Smoked Toripaitan delivers a rich yet smooth chicken paitan broth with impressive depth. The mix of smoked pork chashu, A5 wagyu, duck, and truffle sauce creates an elegant, aromatic bowl, with chewy noodles that absorb the broth perfectly.
🍜 The Japanese A5 Wagyu Shoyu Ramen is clean, balanced, and deeply flavorful. The shoyu is savory without being salty, and the melt-in-your-mouth wagyu pairs beautifully with tomato, yuzu, daikon, and fried burdock.
🍄 Crispy Enoki Chips with chili powder and lemon are light and addictive, and the Japanese Uni A5 Wagyu Nigiri Sushi is a must—fresh, sweet uni with buttery wagyu that melts instantly.
Pricey, but absolutely worth it. Would happily return.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
**update-ended up profusely vomiting and going to the ER.  This is not how I respond to MSG (usually get a migraine)- something was spoiled, and I cant find a phone number to report the issue! Moral- only get sushi/waygu tartar at sushi places.  The health department did report visiting the restaurant and finding violations that needed to be remedied immediately- and I still have not found a way to contact the restaurant myself.

 Everything has MSG, even the rice.  The scallops (or green onion?) were really sandy. I got the waygu tartar (was the best plate I got), scallop hotate and tuna garlic hand roll because they had "low msg."  Tuna was super fishy, would not get again . Staff was nice, sour beer really good, and presentation was pretty.  I ate it all and am not a big eater, bill was $70.  Funny cause they have this huge wall display about how they get their umami flavor, when in reality its a canned soup base with msg.

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen & Bar Chestnut
top_10.address: 3340 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: An very nice place to eat, the back has a more open feel while the front has more of a Japanese bar kind of feel. We spent about $100 on two appetizers, sake, a beer, a soda, and two entrees so meh on that. But the food was delicious and the atmosphere was great too. We went on Christmas, surprisingly, and it was packed. The service was practical, we enjoyed ourselves and stayed for about an hour. We got the spicy chicken, house ramen, some calamari and gyogi. The bento boxes are actually pretty big and my wife's ramen was great too. I'd come here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great spicy miso ramen. The broth is very rich and the noodles had a good chew. Overall a decent price and a nice atmosphere. There’s indoor and outdoor seating. Very quick as well!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I got spicy miso ramen and the flavor was SO RICH. The first sip of soup literally is like a bomb on your tongue and the soft boiled egg was so creamy (I got extra egg!).

I also got matcha green tea, the matcha taste was very smooth and soft with a little bit bitterness.

Def 5 stars. ⭐️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Slow service throughout our experience from check-in to ordering. The food did come quickly after that.

The noodles were cooked very well today and I actually really enjoyed my Spicy Miso ($19). It is barely spicy which was fine because I also ordered shishito pepper ($9). I really liked the peppers, they're not too spicy and I like the soy sesame sauce. The meat gyozas $8 (5 pc) were also pretty good.

For anyone wondering, the only difference for the butter corn version of Spicy Miso $21 is that it has butter and corn.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had the creamy vegan ramen with rice noodles— it was waaay overpriced for the limited ingredients. The dish mainly consisted of noodles and deep-fried kale. The other toppings included two pieces of mushroom, three pieces of tofu, and a small slice of red bell pepper. The sauce was enjoyable initially, but it quickly became too oily and creamy to eat.
Despite the food, they did have nice outdoor dog friendly seating!

I also got matcha green tea, the matcha taste was very smooth and soft with a little bit bitterness.

top_10.name: Torraku Ramen - Lombard
top_10.address: 1449 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ramen noodles done great!!!! I have tried this place in my trip the food was superb. At the end I got a courtesy ice cream to finish the night out. Mango flavor ice cream so good. The Atmosphere is very simple but great with soft music in the background was easy to listen to it while enjoying the ramen soup. The beer the didn’t have bottle only tap but it was ok. Most places I tried tab beer usually is flat (I am guessing no service to their equipment) it was ok. The only thing I didn’t like it was the SERVICE DINE IN FEE (18%) which it is a force tip embedded in your bill. Also, the fact that you have to pay at front before even trying the food I think is too much. When I asked Benny about the extra charge he said “ we charge the dine-in fee so we don’t ask tips from customers” however, I think I dine out several times and this was a forced tip at front before you even get your food. I didn’t like it. Restaurant that they do this things under different labels I think they shooting themselves in the foot, cause according to the service I can even tip 30%. However it’s just me.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food is awesome! Great ramen and very tasty! We are just thankful so much to the Indonesian Server who was very patient with us from dropping our chopsticks to spilling glass of water. That man deserves a raise. Kudos. Recommended for Ramen

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Veg ramen was really comforting! Only thing I'd change would be the spice level -- wish there was a spicy option. Other than that, food was delicious and service was incredible. Our waiter was so quick & kind.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing ramen!!! Some of the best I’ve ever had and I cannot wait to go back. The 18% service I did not mind and it was so easy to just get up and leave without waiting for the bill. Ramen was so fresh and just absolutely delicious. Plus they give you a little mango ice cream at the end of your meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food is so good! Our kids loved the ramen. The kids also got free ice cream which is so appreciated!  We were able to take advantage of happy hour which was awesome. Will try to come back!

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen Union Square
top_10.address: 219 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Decent ramen and there are lunch and dinner sets which are quite good value. Not too crowded even for a holiday weekend. Ramen is pretty good and there’s a few choices of soup base. Their fried items are however a little oily. Staff are attentive and quite helpful. Worth a visit if you’re in the area and other restaurants are busy.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had to come into the city for an early morning appointment tomorrow and was looking for a good dinner spot the night before. Right across from my hotel was a ramen place that looked busy, so we put our name in and decided to give it a try. I am so glad we did because it is now easily in my top five ramen spots ever. I ordered the Sukiyaki Ramen, which was outstanding, a solid 9.5, and my daughter had the Spicy Miso Corn, which somehow might have been even better. Nick was our server and he was absolutely delightful. This has officially become my new go to ramen spot whenever I am in the city.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had a really good experience at Hindoeya. The food was excellent — the spicy ramen was flavorful with just the right amount of heat, and the calamari was crispy and well-seasoned. Everything came out fresh and nicely presented.

The service was friendly and attentive at the start, and even though it slowed down a little toward the end, the place was packed, so it was understandable. The staff still did their best to check in when they could, which we appreciated.

The overall atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and we enjoyed taking our time over the meal. It felt like a lively spot where people were clearly enjoying themselves. We left feeling full and satisfied, and we’d definitely come back again to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great ramen spot! We got the house ramen and a tonkatsu app. The tonkatsu was incredible- it was tender, the sauce was flavorful, and the green onions just took it over the top. The ramen was also great! My husband didn’t love the noodles but I thought they were fine. The scallop broth is fabulous and I love me a jammy egg.

Inside was PACKED but we lucked out and got a table for two right away. Staff was friendly and welcoming. Such a great little spot!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It is a cozy but busy spot in downtown San Francisco, their was a wait that went from 10-20 minutes. There was different seating options! However you had to check in andif you didn’t see it you would just stand outside. While we were waiting a person walked in with a bike into the kitchen! When we came in our table was still dirty and had sticky stuff on the table. They then made up for that with good fast and friendly service!

top_10.name: Hinodeya Ramen & Bar 680 Clay Downtown
top_10.address: 680 Clay St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is one of the most delicious ramen I’ve ever had, perhaps the best ever. I got the house “Hinodeya” ramen, and it checks all the boxes: decent price, good portion, and full of umami deliciousness. The wheat noodles are tender and, despite being mildly on the al dente side on arrival, softened up nicely over the course of my meal. Service was fast and the atmosphere is relaxing. I highly recommend stopping by for a bowl.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Paloma is a great server at Hinodeya. She is quick to greet and very hospitable with her friendly personality. Paloma is the main reason we dine here :) She is prompt and efficient, making sure we are served quickly and with orders to our liking. The financial district location is vastly different from Japantown--its much more high end with elegant decor and high ceilings. Plenty of tables as well to accommodate small to large parties. It's however oddly located in the middle of a nondescript alley by the Transamerica, making foot traffic a bit questionable. I appreciate the lunch specials offered here and will definitely look forward to returning again soon. The house ramen was absolutely delicious, generously packed with fresh ingredients and full complex flavors. Thanks Paloma, see you later!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very nice place to eat at, Japanese music, they hit the drum everytime someone comes in, service was great and friendly.

The House ramen which was I got was good, the broth was flavorful, light but was rich in flavor. Every bite had me craving for me. The only disappointment was as the draft super dry asahi was a bit warm and the level 10 spice was more like a level 2-3. I probably would've enjoyed it more with a cup of the hot sauce.

I definitely recommend this place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love the vegan creamy ramen. The inari tofu is so good. The kale is crispy and salty. It’s my favorite vegan ramen. I also like the green gyoza. My non-vegan friend got the lunch special. He said the katsu was really good. The lunch special ramens are simpler, just noodle with broth and light veggie. Overall, a San Fransisco favorite.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very nice interior, great service, but was not super impressed by the ramen. It was good, but I guess I was expecting better from everything I had heard. We really enjoyed the karaage with the sweet and spicy sauce (forgot the name), but the ramen broth just wasn’t my favorite compared to others I’ve had elsewhere. I got the house ramen and husband got the spicy miso, I think I liked his better.

top_10.name: Marufuku Ramen
top_10.address: 1581 Webster St #235, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: They’ve expanded the restaurant and took over the space next door. Basically there’s no waiting like it used to be. We were there around 1:30 pm on a Monday and was immediately seated (for two)! No waiting at all. Service was friendly and very very quick! Probably about 4-5 minutes after our order we got our food which was deceptively served in small bowls. But there was a lot of food and noodles. The broth was sublime as expected, the noodles perfectly al dente (small thin) with really tender pieces of pork. It was delicious and service was excellent but it was sooo noisy inside? It was hard to talk but for this incredible ramen, it’s worth it!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’ve heard about this place for a while and finally had the unexpected opportunity on Christmas Eve. A friend and I decided to meet at Japantown for dinner. We walked around and I remembered this place. We decided to eat here. We didn’t even have to wait 5 mins and we were called to our table! Our waitress was SO nice! She was above & beyond! Gave us recommendations and answered our questions; and staff was so attentive!
I ordered the vegan creamy broth ramen. It was good; however, I liked Hinodeya’s better as theirs was more creamy and I liked the taste better. Marufuku’s was still good though.
My friend had the Hankata Tonkatsu DX (The DX just means it has extra toppings). Apparently, this is one of the popular dishes. He said it was really good. We both finished our ramen so highly recommend.
We ordered the chicken Karaage as well. I have to say this was SO good!!! For those wondering, I know I ordered the vegan ramen but it’s because I don’t eat that much meat (obviously not 100% vegan or vegetarian).
Street parking can be tough but you if you’re lucky, you can find free residential parking or metered parking. Otherwise, there is an underground paid parking garage. If you take public transportation, the 38-Geary or 22-Fillmore (you’ll have to walk a few blocks, not bad as there’s plenty of shops & restaurants along the way).
I highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Marufuku Ramen SF absolutely delivers! The tonkotsu broth is rich and silky, the noodles have that perfect bite, and the chashu melts in your mouth. Even when the place is busy, the staff is friendly and efficient, making the whole experience smooth and enjoyable. The karaage chicken is a must‑order side, and portions are generous enough to leave you satisfied but wanting to come back. Easily one of the better ramen spots in San Francisco!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Upscale, very busy ramen spot with classic options and inventive specialities, boasting handmade fare. I prefer the thicker egg noddles served with the spicy (ground) chicken ramen compared to the thinner noodles in the standard chicken (breast) ramen. The broth is rich and creamy. The kid's plate comes with noodles, fries, veggies and karage. They offer Sapporro on tap and Asahi in bottles, and also have fun Japanese inspired lemonades like the Sakura lemonade.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Food 8/10
Service 10/10
Waiting time 1/10

2h wait for a okay ramen is beyond absurd. Ramen is really good but would never go back to that wait line. I would recommend if you can get there before opening. Otherwise there are plenty of better options

top_10.name: Mensho Tokyo SF
top_10.address: 672 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We waited about an hour on a Saturday evening, but as always, it was well worth it. The food here is fantastic—my top picks are the Lamb Ramen, Enoki Spicy Chips, and the Miso Butter Ramen. Each dish is packed with flavor and never disappoints. Also, if you enjoy sake, their Mensho sake is incredibly smooth and pairs perfectly with the meal. Definitely a spot I’ll keep coming back to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Mensho Tokyo SF is truly one of the standout places in the city for anyone who loves ramen 🍜. It’s not just another noodle shop — it feels genuinely unique and deeply authentic, the kind of spot where you can tell the chefs care about craft, flavor, and experience 🎌. Because of its popularity, I ended up waiting in line for a little over an hour ⏳ before getting in. Honestly, the wait itself becomes part of the ritual; everyone in line knows they’re about to enjoy something special.

Once inside, the service moves quickly ⚡. After placing my order, the food arrived much faster than I expected, especially considering how busy the restaurant was. I ordered the spicy VGKO 🌶️, the spicy enoki mushroom 🍄, and a Japanese beer 🍺 to go with it. I usually have a pretty high tolerance for spicy and hot foods, but the heat level of the spicy VGKO caught me off guard. It’s intense — delicious, but definitely not for the faint of heart 🔥. If you’re thinking of ordering the super spicy level, just be prepared.

Overall, Mensho Tokyo SF delivers a memorable ramen experience with bold flavors, efficient service, and a vibe that makes the wait worthwhile ⭐. I’d absolutely return — though next time, I might think twice before going for the highest spice level.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Mensho Tokyo SF is my favorite go-to ramen restaurant ever since I first went in 2022! I take all my friends and family here, and they love it too! My favorites are the Spicy Garlic Knockout with Ajitama, and the Spicy Toripaitan with Ajitama. Everything about the ramen is very delicious: the broth, egg, noodle texture, and toppings! I also like the Enoki Chips appetizer. Service is great, extremely kind and attentive servers! Thank you Mensho for such a great ramen experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best ramens in the bay! We had the Spicy Signature Toripaitan and the super spicy G.K.O. Both were flavorful, however the duck chashu was a bit on the rare side and wasn’t the best. Except for that the creamy umami filled spicy broth and all the toppings work well together. We also ordered the spicy fired enoki chips(10/10) and spicy fried corn wings. All the portions are generous and the service on point.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Went to Mensho Tokyo SF for the first time on a Saturday. We were coming from out of town and were excited to try this place after seeing all the posts on social media. My group arrived around 3:51pm and we were around the 4th group inside. Service was surprisingly super quick. I ordered the Spicy Signature Toripaitan and it came out in less than 5 minutes. This started off being one of the best ramens I’ve ever had. But unfortunately, about a quarter of the way through my bowl, I found a hair in it. It was most definitely not my hair. I didn’t want to make a scene, so I didn’t mention it to the staff, but I immediately lost my appetite. A family member ended up eating the rest of my bowl. I do have a photo for reference. I understand that mistakes can happen, but it was disappointing and affected what had been an otherwise great experience.

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen Japantown
top_10.address: 1737 Buchanan St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place never disappoints. Generally, there is a line to get in. The atmosphere is lively when it’s busy. The place is about medium size, not too cozy and not that big. There is outside seating. The service is great. I’ve been here several times & always get the Creamy vegan ramen. It’s really good and tasty. My friends loved their ramen bowls and raved about the shishito peppers. I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Guy next to us had his folding chair collapse. He fell to the ground and seemed ok. I prefer to eat without worrying about the structural integrity of the chairs. Nice to sit outside though.

House ramen was good, subbed wheat noodles with spinach noodles, al dente. Vegan ramen was ok, strange to drink savory soy milk. Fried garlic and onion toppings were delicious.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had dinner here with my friends, and overall it was a great experience.
Our server Isaac, along with all the other staff, was super friendly and made us feel very welcome.
The atmosphere was lively and really felt like being in Japan, which made the experience even better.
The food was amazing, and even the desserts were delicious. Definitely a place I’d love to come back to.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I ordered the hinodeya house ramen and a matcha beer. Broth and noodles for the ramen were both great, very flavorful. It was very crowded when I arrived and decided to sit outside where it was a little calmer and there were plenty of heaters. Matcha beer was also really good, will definitely have again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is our new favorite ramen restaurant. Didn’t know this place existed but happy to share what we experienced. Food and services were excellent. We will come back for more.

top_10.name: Nojo Ramen Tavern
top_10.address: 231 Franklin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Not too many ramen choices on the menu.  The chicken leg in the signature Soy Sauce Tori Paitan was tender and well-seasoned, the ramen broth was rich and delicious but salty.  The texture of ramen noodles was a bit tough.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Best ramen experience I’ve had in SF!
The chicken thigh was packed with flavor, even inside the meat (you know when it’s seasoned just right 👌). The broth was so rich and creamy, but perfectly balanced, not too salty and not too plain either. Everything came together so well, from the texture of the noodles to the depth of the broth. I left super satisfied and already craving it again. Definitely a spot I’ll come back to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Overall disappointing. Seemed like a limited set of ramen options for a restaurant with ramen in its name. Nothing with beef. Ordered the Tokyo Ramen. Included pork slices were thin and exceptionally lean and dry. Broth wasn’t very flavorful. Only QR code ordering available seemed unnecessarily impersonal. $5 for hot tea and they apparently out of green and jasmine options. Wouldn’t think that would be difficult to source in SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Got seated right away as a group of 4 at 6 pm on a Friday. Assume a 15-20 minute wait though. The signature ramen with the chicken leg is delicious! Split a spice ball on the side with someone. Creamy chicken broth and a nice flavor with the spice ball addition!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Oisii Ramen.😋

It was my first visit at Nojo Tavern and I had this Tan Tan Spicy Ramen. It hit the spot. I travel around and have different kinds of Ramen but Nojo’s Tan Tan is a really good one.
The broth, thick noodles and Cilantro toppings was the best. It was my first time having ramen without Chasyu-Pork instead they have this Grounded chicken mixed with the broth which is more flavorful and delicious.
This Ramen is the recommendation to people who love spicy flavor Ramen noodles.
-Gochisousama Deshita🍜🍥

top_10.name: Ramenwell
top_10.address: 3378 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We tried the mushroom lovers ramen. Very large portion size, cute izakaya style vibe

The taste and umami was good but not mind-blowing.

Will still go back when we are in the area but not seek it out

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️☆

I recently visited RamenWell in the Mission, and let me tell you — the food did not disappoint! 🍜✨

⸻

Neighborhood / First Impressions 🏙️
Walking up, the area looks a little rough around the edges, but trust me — once the food hits your table, you’ll forget about everything outside.

⸻

Appetizers 🥟
•	Edamame: Perfect balance of salt and softness.
•	Bao Bao Fried Chicken: Generous portion, crispy, and paired beautifully with the kimchi.

⸻

Entrée 🍲
I ordered the Gluten-Free Ramen Bowl. At first glance, the noodles didn’t wow me visually — but one bite changed everything. The flavor was incredible, and the slow-cooked meat (20+ hours!) took the dish to a whole new level. Absolutely delicious. 🤤

⸻

Customer Service 👩‍🍳
This is the one area that could use improvement.
•	The host/food runner spoke so softly it was difficult to hear.
•	The waiter wasn’t very attentive, even though the restaurant wasn’t busy.

Nothing major — but tightening this up would make the experience perfect.

⸻

Atmosphere & Crowd 👥
What I loved was the mix of people:
•	Friends catching up
•	Families enjoying dinner
•	Couples on dates

It felt warm, welcoming, and diverse.

⸻

✅ Final Thoughts
If you’re in San Francisco and craving ramen, make sure RamenWell is on your list. You won’t regret it. 🌟

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Their ramen could be more chewy but hands down the best pork bellies and spiciest ramen in the city (choose the Souper one if you dare). Their edamame and karaage are excellent, but the spam musubi is decent. Always paired my ramen with the ramune soda - Loved coming back here every month!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Ramenwell in San Francisco's Mission district offers a convenient option for a ramen fix, but be aware of a few things before you go.

First, online reservations come with a $5 charge per person. This charge gets applied to your final bill, so double-check it to avoid paying extra. They also have a strict policy of not seating incomplete parties, so make sure your whole group arrives before you get hangry. The good news is that you can chill at their bar with a drink while you wait (given that they have the bar seating available)

The service itself is fast, and our server was friendly and helpful. However, the appetizers were a bit of a letdown. Both the chicken katsu and the takoyaki were lukewarm, which definitely affected the enjoyment factor. The katsu itself was decent, with one good sauce and one overly sour one. The takoyaki, on the other hand, were a bit too doughy for our liking.

Their signature pork ramen was a bit on the pricey side, and overall, it was just okay. The noodles were firm and flavorful, but customization seems limited. If you prefer softer noodles, you might be disappointed.  The pork slices were thicker than the usual chashu cuts and a bit dry on the edges. The normal spice level was barely there, so spice lovers should definitely go for level 5 or higher.
The broth was quite flavorful for what it's worth.

The constant flow of customers coming in and out created a busy atmosphere, but it wasn't overly loud or chaotic.

Ramenwell offers a decent ramen experience with friendly service and a convenient location.  However, the lukewarm appetizers, limited customization options, and slightly higher price point prevent it from being a standout.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here for a friend catchup and we got seated and had a reservation beforehand.

Good:
- The ramen came out very quickly - I got the classic ramen bowl
- The portion size was good - I was very full by the end
- A nice place to catch up - it's got japanese izakaya vibes and more dimly lit

Bad:
- The soup was really salty so it felt like it was unhealthy to drink too much of it

Overall this was a solid place to have an extended catch up and the ramen was quick and tasty.

testimonials:
We tried the mushroom lovers ramen. Very large portion size, cute izakaya style vibe

The taste and umami was good but not mind-blowing.

Will still go back when we are in the area but not seek it out
